verses.text: Lift up thine eyes round about and behold; all these gather themselves together, and they shall come to thee. And as I live, saith the Lord, thou shalt surely clothe thee with them all, as with an ornament, and bind them on even as a bride.
verses.plainText: Look around you and see; all these people are gathering together and will come to you. As surely as I live, says the Lord, you will clothe yourself with them all like an ornament and wear them like a bride.

verses.text: For thy waste and thy desolate places, and the land of thy destruction, shall even now be too narrow by reason of the inhabitants; and they that swallowed thee up shall be far away.
verses.plainText: Your ruined and deserted places, and the land that was destroyed, will now be too small because of the number of people living there, and those who once conquered you will be far away.

verses.text: The children whom thou shalt have, after thou hast lost the first, shall again in thine ears say: The place is too strait for me; give place to me that I may dwell.
verses.plainText: The children you have after losing the first will say to you, "This place is too small for me; give me space so I can live here.

verses.text: Then shalt thou say in thine heart: Who hath begotten me these, seeing I have lost my children, and am desolate, a captive, and removing to and fro? And who hath brought up these? Behold, I was left alone; these, where have they been?
verses.plainText: You will say in your heart, “Who gave me these children, since I have lost my own and am desolate, a captive, wandering back and forth? Who raised these for me? I was left alone—where did these come from? ”

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord God: Behold, I will lift up mine hand to the Gentiles, and set up my standard to the people; and they shall bring thy sons in their arms, and thy daughters shall be carried upon their shoulders.
verses.plainText: The Lord God says: I will raise my hand to the Gentiles and set up my standard for the people; they will bring your sons in their arms, and your daughters will be carried on their shoulders.

verses.text: And kings shall be thy nursing fathers, and their queens thy nursing mothers; they shall bow down to thee with their face towards the earth, and lick up the dust of thy feet; and thou shalt know that I am the Lord; for they shall not be ashamed that wait for me.
verses.plainText: Kings will be your guardians, and their queens will care for you. They will bow down to you with their faces to the ground and show deep respect at your feet. Then you will know that I am the Lord, and those who wait for me will not be ashamed.

verses.text: For shall the prey be taken from the mighty, or the lawful captives delivered?
verses.plainText: Can the prey be taken from the mighty, or can lawful captives be set free?

verses.text: But thus saith the Lord, even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, and the prey of the terrible shall be delivered; for I will contend with him that contendeth with thee, and I will save thy children.
verses.plainText: The Lord says: Even the captives of the mighty will be taken away, and the prey of the terrible will be delivered. I will fight against those who fight against you, and I will save your children.

verses.text: And I will feed them that oppress thee with their own flesh; they shall be drunken with their own blood as with sweet wine; and all flesh shall know that I, the Lord, am thy Savior and thy Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.
verses.plainText: I will make those who oppress you eat their own flesh; they will be drunk on their own blood as if it were sweet wine. Then everyone will know that I, the Lord, am your Savior and Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that after I, Nephi, had read these things which were engraven upon the plates of brass, my brethren came unto me and said unto me: What meaneth these things which ye have read? Behold, are they to be understood according to things which are spiritual, which shall come to pass according to the spirit and not the flesh?
verses.plainText: After I, Nephi, had read these things engraved on the brass plates, my brothers came to me and asked, “What do these things you have read mean? Are they meant to be understood spiritually, as things that will happen by the spirit and not in a physical way? ”

verses.text: And I, Nephi, said unto them: Behold they were manifest unto the prophet by the voice of the Spirit; for by the Spirit are all things made known unto the prophets, which shall come upon the children of men according to the flesh.
verses.plainText: And I, Nephi, said to them: They were shown to the prophet by the voice of the Spirit, because the Spirit makes all things known to the prophets that will happen to the children of men in the flesh.

verses.text: Wherefore, the things of which I have read are things pertaining to things both temporal and spiritual; for it appears that the house of Israel, sooner or later, will be scattered upon all the face of the earth, and also among all nations.
verses.plainText: The things I have read are about both temporal and spiritual matters, because it seems that the house of Israel will eventually be scattered across the entire earth and among all nations.

verses.text: And behold, there are many who are already lost from the knowledge of those who are at Jerusalem. Yea, the more part of all the tribes have been led away; and they are scattered to and fro upon the isles of the sea; and whither they are none of us knoweth, save that we know that they have been led away.
verses.plainText: There are many who are already lost from the knowledge of those in Jerusalem. Most of the tribes have been taken away and are scattered across the islands of the sea. None of us knows where they are, except that we know they have been led away.

verses.text: And since they have been led away, these things have been prophesied concerning them, and also concerning all those who shall hereafter be scattered and be confounded, because of the Holy One of Israel; for against him will they harden their hearts; wherefore, they shall be scattered among all nations and shall be hated of all men.
verses.plainText: Since they have been led away, these things have been prophesied about them, and also about all those who will later be scattered and confused because of the Holy One of Israel; for they will harden their hearts against him, so they will be scattered among all nations and will be hated by everyone.

verses.text: Nevertheless, after they shall be nursed by the Gentiles, and the Lord has lifted up his hand upon the Gentiles and set them up for a standard, and their children have been carried in their arms, and their daughters have been carried upon their shoulders, behold these things of which are spoken are temporal; for thus are the covenants of the Lord with our fathers; and it meaneth us in the days to come, and also all our brethren who are of the house of Israel.
verses.plainText: After they are cared for by the Gentiles, and the Lord has lifted his hand over the Gentiles and made them a standard, and their children have been carried in their arms and their daughters on their shoulders, these things being spoken of are physical; because the Lord’s covenants with our fathers apply to us in the future, as well as to all our brothers who are of the house of Israel.

verses.text: And it meaneth that the time cometh that after all the house of Israel have been scattered and confounded, that the Lord God will raise up a mighty nation among the Gentiles, yea, even upon the face of this land; and by them shall our seed be scattered.
verses.plainText: It means that after all the house of Israel has been scattered and confused, the Lord God will raise up a mighty nation among the Gentiles, even on this land; and through them our descendants will be scattered.

verses.text: And after our seed is scattered the Lord God will proceed to do a marvelous work among the Gentiles, which shall be of great worth unto our seed; wherefore, it is likened unto their being nourished by the Gentiles and being carried in their arms and upon their shoulders.
verses.plainText: After our descendants are scattered, the Lord God will begin a marvelous work among the Gentiles, which will be of great value to our descendants. It is compared to them being nourished by the Gentiles and carried in their arms and on their shoulders.

verses.text: And it shall also be of worth unto the Gentiles; and not only unto the Gentiles but unto all the house of Israel, unto the making known of the covenants of the Father of heaven unto Abraham, saying: In thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.
verses.plainText: It will also be valuable to the Gentiles, and not only to them but to all the house of Israel, to make known the covenants of the Father in heaven to Abraham, saying: Through your descendants all the families of the earth will be blessed.

verses.text: And I would, my brethren, that ye should know that all the kindreds of the earth cannot be blessed unless he shall make bare his arm in the eyes of the nations.
verses.plainText: I want you to know, my brothers, that all the families of the earth cannot be blessed unless he reveals his power to the nations.

verses.text: Wherefore, the Lord God will proceed to make bare his arm in the eyes of all the nations, in bringing about his covenants and his gospel unto those who are of the house of Israel.
verses.plainText: So the Lord God will show his power to all nations by fulfilling his covenants and bringing his gospel to those who are of the house of Israel.

verses.text: Wherefore, he will bring them again out of captivity, and they shall be gathered together to the lands of their inheritance; and they shall be brought out of obscurity and out of darkness; and they shall know that the Lord is their Savior and their Redeemer, the Mighty One of Israel.
verses.plainText: He will bring them out of captivity, and they will be gathered to the lands of their inheritance; they will be brought out of obscurity and darkness, and they will know that the Lord is their Savior and Redeemer, the Mighty One of Israel.

verses.text: And the blood of that great and abominable church, which is the whore of all the earth, shall turn upon their own heads; for they shall war among themselves, and the sword of their own hands shall fall upon their own heads, and they shall be drunken with their own blood.
verses.plainText: The blood of that great and abominable church, which is the whore of all the earth, will come back on their own heads. They will fight among themselves, and their own swords will turn against them. They will be drunk with their own blood.

verses.text: And every nation which shall war against thee, O house of Israel, shall be turned one against another, and they shall fall into the pit which they digged to ensnare the people of the Lord. And all that fight against Zion shall be destroyed, and that great whore, who hath perverted the right ways of the Lord, yea, that great and abominable church, shall tumble to the dust and great shall be the fall of it.
verses.plainText: Every nation that goes to war against you, O house of Israel, will turn against each other, and they will fall into the pit they dug to trap the people of the Lord. All who fight against Zion will be destroyed, and that great whore who has corrupted the right ways of the Lord, that great and abominable church, will collapse to the dust, and its fall will be great.

verses.text: For behold, saith the prophet, the time cometh speedily that Satan shall have no more power over the hearts of the children of men; for the day soon cometh that all the proud and they who do wickedly shall be as stubble; and the day cometh that they must be burned.
verses.plainText: The prophet says that the time is coming soon when Satan will no longer have power over the hearts of people. The day is approaching when all the proud and those who do wicked things will be like stubble, and they will have to be burned.

verses.text: For the time soon cometh that the fulness of the wrath of God shall be poured out upon all the children of men; for he will not suffer that the wicked shall destroy the righteous.
verses.plainText: The time is coming soon when the full wrath of God will be poured out on all people, because he will not allow the wicked to destroy the righteous.

verses.text: Wherefore, he will preserve the righteous by his power, even if it so be that the fulness of his wrath must come, and the righteous be preserved, even unto the destruction of their enemies by fire. Wherefore, the righteous need not fear; for thus saith the prophet, they shall be saved, even if it so be as by fire.
verses.plainText: He will preserve the righteous by his power, even if the fullness of his wrath must come and the righteous are preserved, even to the destruction of their enemies by fire. The righteous do not need to be afraid, for the prophet says they will be saved, even if it is as by fire.

verses.text: Behold, my brethren, I say unto you, that these things must shortly come; yea, even blood, and fire, and vapor of smoke must come; and it must needs be upon the face of this earth; and it cometh unto men according to the flesh if it so be that they will harden their hearts against the Holy One of Israel.
verses.plainText: My brothers, I tell you that these things must happen soon—blood, fire, and vapor of smoke will come upon the face of this earth. These things will come to people in the flesh if they harden their hearts against the Holy One of Israel.

verses.text: For behold, the righteous shall not perish; for the time surely must come that all they who fight against Zion shall be cut off.
verses.plainText: The righteous will not be destroyed, because the time will surely come when everyone who fights against Zion will be cut off.

verses.text: And the Lord will surely prepare a way for his people, unto the fulfilling of the words of Moses, which he spake, saying: A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you, like unto me; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you. And it shall come to pass that all those who will not hear that prophet shall be cut off from among the people.
verses.plainText: The Lord will definitely prepare a way for his people to fulfill the words of Moses, who said, “The Lord your God will raise up a prophet for you, like me; you must listen to everything he tells you. Anyone who does not listen to that prophet will be separated from the people. ”

verses.text: And now I, Nephi, declare unto you, that this prophet of whom Moses spake was the Holy One of Israel; wherefore, he shall execute judgment in righteousness.
verses.plainText: Now I, Nephi, tell you that the prophet Moses spoke about was the Holy One of Israel; he will judge with righteousness.

verses.text: And the righteous need not fear, for they are those who shall not be confounded. But it is the kingdom of the devil, which shall be built up among the children of men, which kingdom is established among them which are in the flesh—
verses.plainText: The righteous don’t need to be afraid, because they won’t be put to shame. But the kingdom of the devil will be built up among the children of men, and that kingdom is established among those who are in the flesh—

verses.text: For the time speedily shall come that all churches which are built up to get gain, and all those who are built up to get power over the flesh, and those who are built up to become popular in the eyes of the world, and those who seek the lusts of the flesh and the things of the world, and to do all manner of iniquity; yea, in fine, all those who belong to the kingdom of the devil are they who need fear, and tremble, and quake; they are those who must be brought low in the dust; they are those who must be consumed as stubble; and this is according to the words of the prophet.
verses.plainText: The time will soon come when all churches that are built to make money, those built to gain power over others, those built to become popular in the eyes of the world, and those who seek the desires of the flesh and worldly things and do all kinds of evil—everyone who belongs to the kingdom of the devil—are the ones who need to fear, tremble, and shake. They will be brought low to the dust and will be consumed like stubble. This is according to the words of the prophet.

verses.text: And the time cometh speedily that the righteous must be led up as calves of the stall, and the Holy One of Israel must reign in dominion, and might, and power, and great glory.
verses.plainText: Very soon, the righteous will be cared for like calves in a stall, and the Holy One of Israel will reign with dominion, might, power, and great glory.

verses.text: And he gathereth his children from the four quarters of the earth; and he numbereth his sheep, and they know him; and there shall be one fold and one shepherd; and he shall feed his sheep, and in him they shall find pasture.
verses.plainText: He gathers his children from the four corners of the earth; he counts his sheep, and they know him. There will be one fold and one shepherd. He will feed his sheep, and they will find pasture in him.

verses.text: And because of the righteousness of his people, Satan has no power; wherefore, he cannot be loosed for the space of many years; for he hath no power over the hearts of the people, for they dwell in righteousness, and the Holy One of Israel reigneth.
verses.plainText: Because his people are righteous, Satan has no power; he cannot be released for many years, because he has no power over their hearts. They live righteously, and the Holy One of Israel reigns.

verses.text: And now behold, I, Nephi, say unto you that all these things must come according to the flesh.
verses.plainText: Now I, Nephi, tell you that all these things must happen in this life.

verses.text: But, behold, all nations, kindreds, tongues, and people shall dwell safely in the Holy One of Israel if it so be that they will repent.
verses.plainText: All nations, families, languages, and people will live safely in the Holy One of Israel if they are willing to repent.

verses.text: And now I, Nephi, make an end; for I durst not speak further as yet concerning these things.
verses.plainText: Now I, Nephi, will stop here, because I do not dare to say more about these things right now.

verses.text: Wherefore, my brethren, I would that ye should consider that the things which have been written upon the plates of brass are true; and they testify that a man must be obedient to the commandments of God.
verses.plainText: My brothers, I want you to consider that the things written on the brass plates are true, and they testify that a person must be obedient to God's commandments.

verses.text: Wherefore, ye need not suppose that I and my father are the only ones that have testified, and also taught them. Wherefore, if ye shall be obedient to the commandments, and endure to the end, ye shall be saved at the last day. And thus it is. Amen.
verses.plainText: You don’t need to think that my father and I are the only ones who have testified and taught them. If you obey the commandments and endure to the end, you will be saved on the last day. That’s how it is. Amen.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that after I, Nephi, had made an end of teaching my brethren, our father, Lehi, also spake many things unto them, and rehearsed unto them, how great things the Lord had done for them in bringing them out of the land of Jerusalem.
verses.plainText: After I, Nephi, finished teaching my brothers, our father Lehi also spoke to them and reminded them of the great things the Lord had done for them in bringing them out of Jerusalem.

verses.text: And he spake unto them concerning their rebellions upon the waters, and the mercies of God in sparing their lives, that they were not swallowed up in the sea.
verses.plainText: He spoke to them about their rebellions while they were on the water, and about God's mercy in saving their lives so they were not swallowed up by the sea.

verses.text: And he also spake unto them concerning the land of promise, which they had obtained—how merciful the Lord had been in warning us that we should flee out of the land of Jerusalem.
verses.plainText: He also spoke to them about the promised land they had received, and how merciful the Lord had been in warning them to leave Jerusalem.

verses.text: For, behold, said he, I have seen a vision, in which I know that Jerusalem is destroyed; and had we remained in Jerusalem we should also have perished.
verses.plainText: He said, “I have seen a vision, and I know that Jerusalem is destroyed. If we had stayed in Jerusalem, we would have died too. ”

verses.text: But, said he, notwithstanding our afflictions, we have obtained a land of promise, a land which is choice above all other lands; a land which the Lord God hath covenanted with me should be a land for the inheritance of my seed. Yea, the Lord hath covenanted this land unto me, and to my children forever, and also all those who should be led out of other countries by the hand of the Lord.
verses.plainText: He said that despite our hardships, we have received a promised land—a land that is better than any other. The Lord God has promised me that this land will be an inheritance for my descendants. The Lord has made this covenant with me and my children forever, and also with all those who are brought here from other countries by the Lord’s guidance.

verses.text: Wherefore, I, Lehi, prophesy according to the workings of the Spirit which is in me, that there shall none come into this land save they shall be brought by the hand of the Lord.
verses.plainText: I, Lehi, prophesy by the power of the Spirit within me that no one will come to this land unless they are brought by the hand of the Lord.

verses.text: Wherefore, this land is consecrated unto him whom he shall bring. And if it so be that they shall serve him according to the commandments which he hath given, it shall be a land of liberty unto them; wherefore, they shall never be brought down into captivity; if so, it shall be because of iniquity; for if iniquity shall abound cursed shall be the land for their sakes, but unto the righteous it shall be blessed forever.
verses.plainText: This land is set apart for those whom God brings here. If they serve Him according to the commandments He has given, it will be a land of freedom for them, and they will never be brought into captivity. If they are, it will be because of their wickedness; for if wickedness becomes widespread, the land will be cursed for their sake, but it will always be blessed for the righteous.

verses.text: And behold, it is wisdom that this land should be kept as yet from the knowledge of other nations; for behold, many nations would overrun the land, that there would be no place for an inheritance.
verses.plainText: It is wise that this land should still be kept unknown to other nations, because many nations would overrun it and there would be no place left for an inheritance.

verses.text: Wherefore, I, Lehi, have obtained a promise, that inasmuch as those whom the Lord God shall bring out of the land of Jerusalem shall keep his commandments, they shall prosper upon the face of this land; and they shall be kept from all other nations, that they may possess this land unto themselves. And if it so be that they shall keep his commandments they shall be blessed upon the face of this land, and there shall be none to molest them, nor to take away the land of their inheritance; and they shall dwell safely forever.
verses.plainText: I, Lehi, have received a promise that as long as those whom the Lord God brings out of Jerusalem keep His commandments, they will prosper in this land. They will be kept separate from all other nations so they can possess this land for themselves. If they keep His commandments, they will be blessed in this land, and no one will bother them or take away their inheritance; they will live here in safety forever.

verses.text: But behold, when the time cometh that they shall dwindle in unbelief, after they have received so great blessings from the hand of the Lord—having a knowledge of the creation of the earth, and all men, knowing the great and marvelous works of the Lord from the creation of the world; having power given them to do all things by faith; having all the commandments from the beginning, and having been brought by his infinite goodness into this precious land of promise—behold, I say, if the day shall come that they will reject the Holy One of Israel, the true Messiah, their Redeemer and their God, behold, the judgments of him that is just shall rest upon them.
verses.plainText: When the time comes that they fall into unbelief, after receiving such great blessings from the Lord—having knowledge of the creation of the earth and all people, knowing the great and marvelous works of the Lord from the beginning; having been given power to do all things by faith; having all the commandments from the start, and being brought by his infinite goodness into this precious promised land—if the day comes that they reject the Holy One of Israel, the true Messiah, their Redeemer and their God, then the judgments of the just God will come upon them.

verses.text: Yea, he will bring other nations unto them, and he will give unto them power, and he will take away from them the lands of their possessions, and he will cause them to be scattered and smitten.
verses.plainText: He will bring other nations to them, give those nations power, take away their lands, and cause them to be scattered and struck.

verses.text: Yea, as one generation passeth to another there shall be bloodsheds, and great visitations among them; wherefore, my sons, I would that ye would remember; yea, I would that ye would hearken unto my words.
verses.plainText: As one generation passes to another, there will be bloodshed and great calamities among them. My sons, I want you to remember and listen to my words.

verses.text: O that ye would awake; awake from a deep sleep, yea, even from the sleep of hell, and shake off the awful chains by which ye are bound, which are the chains which bind the children of men, that they are carried away captive down to the eternal gulf of misery and woe.
verses.plainText: I wish you would wake up—wake up from a deep sleep, even from the sleep of hell, and shake off the terrible chains that hold you, the chains that bind people and drag them away captive to the endless depths of misery and sorrow.

verses.text: Awake! and arise from the dust, and hear the words of a trembling parent, whose limbs ye must soon lay down in the cold and silent grave, from whence no traveler can return; a few more days and I go the way of all the earth.
verses.plainText: Wake up and get up from the dust, and listen to the words of a trembling parent, whose body you will soon lay down in the cold and silent grave, from which no one can return; in just a few more days I will go the way of all the earth.

verses.text: But behold, the Lord hath redeemed my soul from hell; I have beheld his glory, and I am encircled about eternally in the arms of his love.
verses.plainText: The Lord has redeemed my soul from hell; I have seen his glory, and I am surrounded forever by the arms of his love.

verses.text: And I desire that ye should remember to observe the statutes and the judgments of the Lord; behold, this hath been the anxiety of my soul from the beginning.
verses.plainText: I want you to remember to follow the statutes and judgments of the Lord; this has been the concern of my soul from the beginning.

verses.text: My heart hath been weighed down with sorrow from time to time, for I have feared, lest for the hardness of your hearts the Lord your God should come out in the fulness of his wrath upon you, that ye be cut off and destroyed forever;
verses.plainText: My heart has been weighed down with sorrow at times, because I have feared that, because of the hardness of your hearts, the Lord your God might come in the fullness of his wrath upon you, and you could be cut off and destroyed forever.

verses.text: Or, that a cursing should come upon you for the space of many generations; and ye are visited by sword, and by famine, and are hated, and are led according to the will and captivity of the devil.
verses.plainText: Or, that a curse should come upon you for many generations; and you are afflicted by war and famine, are hated, and are led by the will and captivity of the devil.

verses.text: O my sons, that these things might not come upon you, but that ye might be a choice and a favored people of the Lord. But behold, his will be done; for his ways are righteousness forever.
verses.plainText: My sons, I hope these things won't happen to you, but that you will be a chosen and favored people of the Lord. Let his will be done, because his ways are righteous forever.

verses.text: And he hath said that: Inasmuch as ye shall keep my commandments ye shall prosper in the land; but inasmuch as ye will not keep my commandments ye shall be cut off from my presence.
verses.plainText: And he has said that as long as you keep my commandments, you will prosper in the land; but if you do not keep my commandments, you will be cut off from my presence.

verses.text: And now that my soul might have joy in you, and that my heart might leave this world with gladness because of you, that I might not be brought down with grief and sorrow to the grave, arise from the dust, my sons, and be men, and be determined in one mind and in one heart, united in all things, that ye may not come down into captivity;
verses.plainText: Now, so that I can have joy in you and leave this world with a glad heart because of you, and not go down to the grave with grief and sorrow, get up from the dust, my sons, and be men. Be determined, united in mind and heart in everything, so you won't be brought into captivity.

verses.text: That ye may not be cursed with a sore cursing; and also, that ye may not incur the displeasure of a just God upon you, unto the destruction, yea, the eternal destruction of both soul and body.
verses.plainText: So that you won’t be cursed with a severe curse, and so you won’t bring the anger of a just God upon yourselves, leading to destruction—even the eternal destruction of both soul and body.

verses.text: Awake, my sons; put on the armor of righteousness. Shake off the chains with which ye are bound, and come forth out of obscurity, and arise from the dust.
verses.plainText: Wake up, my sons; put on the armor of righteousness. Shake off the chains that bind you, come out of obscurity, and rise from the dust.

verses.text: Rebel no more against your brother, whose views have been glorious, and who hath kept the commandments from the time that we left Jerusalem; and who hath been an instrument in the hands of God, in bringing us forth into the land of promise; for were it not for him, we must have perished with hunger in the wilderness; nevertheless, ye sought to take away his life; yea, and he hath suffered much sorrow because of you.
verses.plainText: Don’t rebel anymore against your brother, whose insights have been inspired, and who has kept the commandments since we left Jerusalem. He has been an instrument in God’s hands in leading us to the promised land. If it weren’t for him, we would have died of hunger in the wilderness. Still, you tried to take his life, and he has suffered much sorrow because of you.

verses.text: And I exceedingly fear and tremble because of you, lest he shall suffer again; for behold, ye have accused him that he sought power and authority over you; but I know that he hath not sought for power nor authority over you, but he hath sought the glory of God, and your own eternal welfare.
verses.plainText: I am extremely afraid and trembling because of you, worried that he might suffer again; you have accused him of seeking power and authority over you, but I know he has not sought power or authority over you. He has sought the glory of God and your eternal well-being.

verses.text: And ye have murmured because he hath been plain unto you. Ye say that he hath used sharpness; ye say that he hath been angry with you; but behold, his sharpness was the sharpness of the power of the word of God, which was in him; and that which ye call anger was the truth, according to that which is in God, which he could not restrain, manifesting boldly concerning your iniquities.
verses.plainText: You have complained because he has spoken plainly to you. You say that he has been harsh; you say that he has been angry with you. But his sharpness was the power of the word of God that was in him, and what you call anger was the truth, according to what is in God, which he could not hold back, speaking boldly about your sins.

verses.text: And it must needs be that the power of God must be with him, even unto his commanding you that ye must obey. But behold, it was not he, but it was the Spirit of the Lord which was in him, which opened his mouth to utterance that he could not shut it.
verses.plainText: The power of God had to be with him, even to the point that he commanded you to obey. But it wasn’t really him—it was the Spirit of the Lord in him that opened his mouth, so he couldn’t keep silent.

verses.text: And now my son, Laman, and also Lemuel and Sam, and also my sons who are the sons of Ishmael, behold, if ye will hearken unto the voice of Nephi ye shall not perish. And if ye will hearken unto him I leave unto you a blessing, yea, even my first blessing.
verses.plainText: Now my son Laman, and also Lemuel and Sam, and my sons who are the sons of Ishmael, if you will listen to Nephi’s voice you will not perish. If you listen to him, I leave you a blessing, even my first blessing.

verses.text: But if ye will not hearken unto him I take away my first blessing, yea, even my blessing, and it shall rest upon him.
verses.plainText: But if you will not listen to him, I will take away my first blessing, even my blessing, and it will rest upon him.

verses.text: And now Zoram, I speak unto you: Behold, thou art the servant of Laban; nevertheless, thou hast been brought out of the land of Jerusalem, and I know that thou art a true friend unto my son, Nephi, forever.
verses.plainText: Now Zoram, I speak to you. You were the servant of Laban; nevertheless, you have been brought out of the land of Jerusalem, and I know that you are a true friend to my son Nephi, forever.

verses.text: Wherefore, because thou hast been faithful thy seed shall be blessed with his seed, that they dwell in prosperity long upon the face of this land; and nothing, save it shall be iniquity among them, shall harm or disturb their prosperity upon the face of this land forever.
verses.plainText: Because you have been faithful, your descendants will be blessed along with his descendants, so they will live in prosperity on this land for a long time. Nothing will harm or disturb their prosperity here, unless there is wickedness among them.

verses.text: Wherefore, if ye shall keep the commandments of the Lord, the Lord hath consecrated this land for the security of thy seed with the seed of my son.
verses.plainText: If you keep the commandments of the Lord, the Lord has set apart this land to ensure the safety of your descendants along with the descendants of my son.

verses.text: And now, Jacob, I speak unto you: Thou art my first-born in the days of my tribulation in the wilderness. And behold, in thy childhood thou hast suffered afflictions and much sorrow, because of the rudeness of thy brethren.
verses.plainText: Jacob, I’m speaking to you. You are my firstborn during my trials in the wilderness. In your childhood, you have suffered afflictions and much sorrow because of the harshness of your brothers.

verses.text: Nevertheless, Jacob, my first-born in the wilderness, thou knowest the greatness of God; and he shall consecrate thine afflictions for thy gain.
verses.plainText: Jacob, my firstborn in the wilderness, you know the greatness of God, and he will turn your afflictions to your benefit.

verses.text: Wherefore, thy soul shall be blessed, and thou shalt dwell safely with thy brother, Nephi; and thy days shall be spent in the service of thy God. Wherefore, I know that thou art redeemed, because of the righteousness of thy Redeemer; for thou hast beheld that in the fulness of time he cometh to bring salvation unto men.
verses.plainText: Your soul will be blessed, and you will live safely with your brother Nephi. Your days will be spent serving your God. I know that you are redeemed because of the righteousness of your Redeemer, for you have seen that in the fullness of time he will come to bring salvation to people.

verses.text: And thou hast beheld in thy youth his glory; wherefore, thou art blessed even as they unto whom he shall minister in the flesh; for the Spirit is the same, yesterday, today, and forever. And the way is prepared from the fall of man, and salvation is free.
verses.plainText: You have seen his glory in your youth; you are blessed just like those to whom he will minister in person, because the Spirit is the same yesterday, today, and forever. The way has been prepared since the fall of man, and salvation is free.

verses.text: And men are instructed sufficiently that they know good from evil. And the law is given unto men. And by the law no flesh is justified; or, by the law men are cut off. Yea, by the temporal law they were cut off; and also, by the spiritual law they perish from that which is good, and become miserable forever.
verses.plainText: People are taught enough to know good from evil. The law is given to them, but no one is justified by the law; instead, people are condemned by it. By the temporal law, they are cut off, and by the spiritual law, they lose what is good and become miserable forever.

verses.text: Wherefore, redemption cometh in and through the Holy Messiah; for he is full of grace and truth.
verses.plainText: Redemption comes through the Holy Messiah, because he is full of grace and truth.

verses.text: Behold, he offereth himself a sacrifice for sin, to answer the ends of the law, unto all those who have a broken heart and a contrite spirit; and unto none else can the ends of the law be answered.
verses.plainText: He offers himself as a sacrifice for sin to fulfill the law for all who have a broken heart and a contrite spirit; and for no one else can the ends of the law be fulfilled.

verses.text: Wherefore, how great the importance to make these things known unto the inhabitants of the earth, that they may know that there is no flesh that can dwell in the presence of God, save it be through the merits, and mercy, and grace of the Holy Messiah, who layeth down his life according to the flesh, and taketh it again by the power of the Spirit, that he may bring to pass the resurrection of the dead, being the first that should rise.
verses.plainText: It is so important to make these things known to the people of the earth, so they understand that no one can live in God’s presence except through the merits, mercy, and grace of the Holy Messiah, who gives up his life in the flesh and takes it up again by the power of the Spirit, so he can bring about the resurrection of the dead, being the first to rise.

verses.text: Wherefore, he is the first-fruits unto God, inasmuch as he shall make intercession for all the children of men; and they that believe in him shall be saved.
verses.plainText: He is the first-fruits to God, because he will intercede for all the children of men; and those who believe in him will be saved.

verses.text: And because of the intercession for all, all men come unto God; wherefore, they stand in the presence of him to be judged of him according to the truth and holiness which is in him. Wherefore, the ends of the law which the Holy One hath given, unto the inflicting of the punishment which is affixed, which punishment that is affixed is in opposition to that of the happiness which is affixed, to answer the ends of the atonement—
verses.plainText: Because of the intercession made for everyone, all people come to God and stand in his presence to be judged by him according to the truth and holiness that are in him. The purposes of the law given by the Holy One lead to the punishment that is set, and that punishment is in opposition to the happiness that is also set, to fulfill the purposes of the atonement.

verses.text: For it must needs be, that there is an opposition in all things. If not so, my first-born in the wilderness, righteousness could not be brought to pass, neither wickedness, neither holiness nor misery, neither good nor bad. Wherefore, all things must needs be a compound in one; wherefore, if it should be one body it must needs remain as dead, having no life neither death, nor corruption nor incorruption, happiness nor misery, neither sense nor insensibility.
verses.plainText: There has to be opposition in all things. If not, my firstborn in the wilderness, righteousness couldn’t happen, nor wickedness, nor holiness or misery, nor good or bad. So, everything would have to be combined into one; and if it were all one thing, it would remain dead, having no life or death, no corruption or incorruption, no happiness or misery, no feeling or lack of feeling.

verses.text: Wherefore, it must needs have been created for a thing of naught; wherefore there would have been no purpose in the end of its creation. Wherefore, this thing must needs destroy the wisdom of God and his eternal purposes, and also the power, and the mercy, and the justice of God.
verses.plainText: So, it would have been created for nothing; there would have been no purpose in its creation. This would destroy the wisdom of God, his eternal purposes, and also his power, mercy, and justice.

verses.text: And if ye shall say there is no law, ye shall also say there is no sin. If ye shall say there is no sin, ye shall also say there is no righteousness. And if there be no righteousness there be no happiness. And if there be no righteousness nor happiness there be no punishment nor misery. And if these things are not there is no God. And if there is no God we are not, neither the earth; for there could have been no creation of things, neither to act nor to be acted upon; wherefore, all things must have vanished away.
verses.plainText: If you say there is no law, you must also say there is no sin. If you say there is no sin, you must also say there is no righteousness. If there is no righteousness, there is no happiness. If there is no righteousness or happiness, there is no punishment or misery. If these things don’t exist, there is no God. If there is no God, we do not exist, nor does the earth, because there could have been no creation—nothing to act or to be acted upon. So, everything would have disappeared.

verses.text: And now, my sons, I speak unto you these things for your profit and learning; for there is a God, and he hath created all things, both the heavens and the earth, and all things that in them are, both things to act and things to be acted upon.
verses.plainText: Now, my sons, I am telling you these things for your benefit and learning; because there is a God, and he has created everything—the heavens and the earth, and everything in them, both things that act and things that are acted upon.

verses.text: And to bring about his eternal purposes in the end of man, after he had created our first parents, and the beasts of the field and the fowls of the air, and in fine, all things which are created, it must needs be that there was an opposition; even the forbidden fruit in opposition to the tree of life; the one being sweet and the other bitter.
verses.plainText: To accomplish his eternal purposes for humanity, after he created our first parents, the animals of the field, the birds of the air, and everything else that was created, there had to be opposition—such as the forbidden fruit in opposition to the tree of life, one being sweet and the other bitter.

verses.text: Wherefore, the Lord God gave unto man that he should act for himself. Wherefore, man could not act for himself save it should be that he was enticed by the one or the other.
verses.plainText: So the Lord God gave people the ability to act for themselves. People couldn’t act for themselves unless they were influenced by one side or the other.

verses.text: And I, Lehi, according to the things which I have read, must needs suppose that an angel of God, according to that which is written, had fallen from heaven; wherefore, he became a devil, having sought that which was evil before God.
verses.plainText: I, Lehi, based on what I have read, believe that an angel of God, as it is written, fell from heaven and became a devil because he sought what was evil before God.

verses.text: And because he had fallen from heaven, and had become miserable forever, he sought also the misery of all mankind. Wherefore, he said unto Eve, yea, even that old serpent, who is the devil, who is the father of all lies, wherefore he said: Partake of the forbidden fruit, and ye shall not die, but ye shall be as God, knowing good and evil.
verses.plainText: Because he had fallen from heaven and had become miserable forever, he also wanted all people to be miserable. So he spoke to Eve—the same serpent, who is the devil and the father of all lies—and said, "Eat the forbidden fruit, and you will not die, but you will be like God, knowing good and evil.

verses.text: And after Adam and Eve had partaken of the forbidden fruit they were driven out of the garden of Eden, to till the earth.
verses.plainText: After Adam and Eve ate the forbidden fruit, they were sent out of the Garden of Eden to work the land.

verses.text: And they have brought forth children; yea, even the family of all the earth.
verses.plainText: They have had children—the family of the entire earth.

verses.text: And the days of the children of men were prolonged, according to the will of God, that they might repent while in the flesh; wherefore, their state became a state of probation, and their time was lengthened, according to the commandments which the Lord God gave unto the children of men. For he gave commandment that all men must repent; for he showed unto all men that they were lost, because of the transgression of their parents.
verses.plainText: The days of the children of men were extended according to God's will so they could repent while in the flesh. Their condition became a time of probation, and their lives were lengthened according to the commandments the Lord God gave to them. He commanded that everyone must repent, because He showed everyone that they were lost due to the transgression of their parents.

verses.text: And now, behold, if Adam had not transgressed he would not have fallen, but he would have remained in the garden of Eden. And all things which were created must have remained in the same state in which they were after they were created; and they must have remained forever, and had no end.
verses.plainText: If Adam had not sinned, he would not have fallen and would have stayed in the garden of Eden. Everything that was created would have stayed in the same state as when it was first made; they would have remained like that forever, without end.

verses.text: And they would have had no children; wherefore they would have remained in a state of innocence, having no joy, for they knew no misery; doing no good, for they knew no sin.
verses.plainText: And they would have had no children; they would have remained in a state of innocence, having no joy because they knew no misery, doing no good because they knew no sin.

verses.text: But behold, all things have been done in the wisdom of him who knoweth all things.
verses.plainText: All things have been done in the wisdom of the one who knows everything.

verses.text: Adam fell that men might be; and men are, that they might have joy.
verses.plainText: Adam fell so that people could exist, and people exist so they can have joy.

verses.text: And the Messiah cometh in the fulness of time, that he may redeem the children of men from the fall. And because that they are redeemed from the fall they have become free forever, knowing good from evil; to act for themselves and not to be acted upon, save it be by the punishment of the law at the great and last day, according to the commandments which God hath given.
verses.plainText: The Messiah comes in the fullness of time to redeem the children of men from the fall. Because they are redeemed from the fall, they have become free forever, knowing good from evil, to act for themselves and not to be acted upon, except by the punishment of the law at the great and last day, according to the commandments God has given.

verses.text: Wherefore, men are free according to the flesh; and all things are given them which are expedient unto man. And they are free to choose liberty and eternal life, through the great Mediator of all men, or to choose captivity and death, according to the captivity and power of the devil; for he seeketh that all men might be miserable like unto himself.
verses.plainText: People are free in their physical lives, and everything necessary for them has been given to them. They are free to choose liberty and eternal life through the great Mediator of all people, or to choose captivity and death according to the captivity and power of the devil, because he seeks to make everyone as miserable as he is.

verses.text: And now, my sons, I would that ye should look to the great Mediator, and hearken unto his great commandments; and be faithful unto his words, and choose eternal life, according to the will of his Holy Spirit;
verses.plainText: Now, my sons, I want you to look to the great Mediator, listen to his great commandments, be faithful to his words, and choose eternal life according to the will of his Holy Spirit.

verses.text: And not choose eternal death, according to the will of the flesh and the evil which is therein, which giveth the spirit of the devil power to captivate, to bring you down to hell, that he may reign over you in his own kingdom.
verses.plainText: And do not choose eternal death, following the desires of the flesh and the evil within it, which gives the spirit of the devil power to capture you, to bring you down to hell, so that he can rule over you in his own kingdom.

verses.text: I have spoken these few words unto you all, my sons, in the last days of my probation; and I have chosen the good part, according to the words of the prophet. And I have none other object save it be the everlasting welfare of your souls. Amen.
verses.plainText: I have spoken these few words to all of you, my sons, in the last days of my life; and I have chosen the better part, as the prophet said. My only purpose is your everlasting well-being. Amen.

verses.text: And now I speak unto you, Joseph, my last-born. Thou wast born in the wilderness of mine afflictions; yea, in the days of my greatest sorrow did thy mother bear thee.
verses.plainText: Now I speak to you, Joseph, my youngest son. You were born in the wilderness during my hardships; during the time of my greatest sorrow, your mother gave birth to you.

verses.text: And may the Lord consecrate also unto thee this land, which is a most precious land, for thine inheritance and the inheritance of thy seed with thy brethren, for thy security forever, if it so be that ye shall keep the commandments of the Holy One of Israel.
verses.plainText: May the Lord also dedicate this land to you, which is a very precious land, for your inheritance and the inheritance of your descendants with your brothers, for your security forever, if you keep the commandments of the Holy One of Israel.

verses.text: And now, Joseph, my last-born, whom I have brought out of the wilderness of mine afflictions, may the Lord bless thee forever, for thy seed shall not utterly be destroyed.
verses.plainText: Joseph, my youngest son, whom I brought out of the wilderness of my hardships, may the Lord bless you forever, for your descendants will not be completely destroyed.

verses.text: For behold, thou art the fruit of my loins; and I am a descendant of Joseph who was carried captive into Egypt. And great were the covenants of the Lord which he made unto Joseph.
verses.plainText: You are the fruit of my lineage, and I am a descendant of Joseph, who was taken captive into Egypt. The Lord made great covenants with Joseph.

verses.text: Wherefore, Joseph truly saw our day. And he obtained a promise of the Lord, that out of the fruit of his loins the Lord God would raise up a righteous branch unto the house of Israel; not the Messiah, but a branch which was to be broken off, nevertheless, to be remembered in the covenants of the Lord that the Messiah should be made manifest unto them in the latter days, in the spirit of power, unto the bringing of them out of darkness unto light—yea, out of hidden darkness and out of captivity unto freedom.
verses.plainText: Joseph truly saw our day. He received a promise from the Lord that from his descendants, the Lord God would raise up a righteous branch for the house of Israel—not the Messiah, but a branch that would be separated, yet still remembered in the Lord’s covenants so that the Messiah would be revealed to them in the last days, with power, to bring them out of darkness into light, out of hidden darkness and captivity into freedom.

verses.text: For Joseph truly testified, saying: A seer shall the Lord my God raise up, who shall be a choice seer unto the fruit of my loins.
verses.plainText: Joseph truly testified, saying: The Lord my God will raise up a seer, who will be a choice seer for the descendants of my family.

verses.text: Yea, Joseph truly said: Thus saith the Lord unto me: A choice seer will I raise up out of the fruit of thy loins; and he shall be esteemed highly among the fruit of thy loins. And unto him will I give commandment that he shall do a work for the fruit of thy loins, his brethren, which shall be of great worth unto them, even to the bringing of them to the knowledge of the covenants which I have made with thy fathers.
verses.plainText: Joseph truly said: The Lord said to me, "I will raise up a choice seer from your descendants, and he will be highly esteemed among them. I will give him a commandment to do a work for your descendants, his brothers, which will be of great value to them, bringing them to the knowledge of the covenants I have made with your fathers.

verses.text: And I will give unto him a commandment that he shall do none other work, save the work which I shall command him. And I will make him great in mine eyes; for he shall do my work.
verses.plainText: I will give him a commandment that he will do no other work except the work I command him to do. I will make him great in my eyes, because he will do my work.

verses.text: And he shall be great like unto Moses, whom I have said I would raise up unto you, to deliver my people, O house of Israel.
verses.plainText: He will be great like Moses, whom I said I would raise up to deliver my people, O house of Israel.

verses.text: And Moses will I raise up, to deliver thy people out of the land of Egypt.
verses.plainText: I will raise up Moses to deliver your people out of the land of Egypt.

verses.text: But a seer will I raise up out of the fruit of thy loins; and unto him will I give power to bring forth my word unto the seed of thy loins—and not to the bringing forth my word only, saith the Lord, but to the convincing them of my word, which shall have already gone forth among them.
verses.plainText: I will raise up a seer from your descendants, and I will give him power to bring my word to your descendants—not only to bring forth my word, says the Lord, but also to convince them of my word, which will have already gone out among them.

verses.text: Wherefore, the fruit of thy loins shall write; and the fruit of the loins of Judah shall write; and that which shall be written by the fruit of thy loins, and also that which shall be written by the fruit of the loins of Judah, shall grow together, unto the confounding of false doctrines and laying down of contentions, and establishing peace among the fruit of thy loins, and bringing them to the knowledge of their fathers in the latter days, and also to the knowledge of my covenants, saith the Lord.
verses.plainText: The descendants of your family will write, and the descendants of Judah will write. What is written by your descendants and what is written by the descendants of Judah will come together to confound false doctrines, end arguments, establish peace among your descendants, and bring them to the knowledge of their ancestors in the last days, as well as to the knowledge of my covenants, says the Lord.

verses.text: And out of weakness he shall be made strong, in that day when my work shall commence among all my people, unto the restoring thee, O house of Israel, saith the Lord.
verses.plainText: He will be made strong out of weakness in the day when my work begins among all my people, to restore you, O house of Israel, says the Lord.

verses.text: And thus prophesied Joseph, saying: Behold, that seer will the Lord bless; and they that seek to destroy him shall be confounded; for this promise, which I have obtained of the Lord, of the fruit of my loins, shall be fulfilled. Behold, I am sure of the fulfilling of this promise;
verses.plainText: Joseph prophesied, saying: The Lord will bless that seer, and those who try to destroy him will be confused; because this promise, which I have received from the Lord about my descendants, will be fulfilled. I am certain this promise will come to pass.

verses.text: And his name shall be called after me; and it shall be after the name of his father. And he shall be like unto me; for the thing, which the Lord shall bring forth by his hand, by the power of the Lord shall bring my people unto salvation.
verses.plainText: His name will be called after mine, and it will also be after his father’s name. He will be like me, because the work that the Lord will accomplish through him, by the power of the Lord, will bring my people to salvation.

verses.text: Yea, thus prophesied Joseph: I am sure of this thing, even as I am sure of the promise of Moses; for the Lord hath said unto me, I will preserve thy seed forever.
verses.plainText: Joseph prophesied: I am as certain of this as I am of the promise given to Moses, because the Lord has told me, "I will preserve your descendants forever.

verses.text: And the Lord hath said: I will raise up a Moses; and I will give power unto him in a rod; and I will give judgment unto him in writing. Yet I will not loose his tongue, that he shall speak much, for I will not make him mighty in speaking. But I will write unto him my law, by the finger of mine own hand; and I will make a spokesman for him.
verses.plainText: And the Lord has said: I will raise up a Moses, and I will give him power with a rod, and I will give him judgment in writing. But I will not loosen his tongue so that he will speak much, because I will not make him powerful in speaking. Instead, I will write my law to him with my own hand, and I will provide a spokesman for him.

verses.text: And the Lord said unto me also: I will raise up unto the fruit of thy loins; and I will make for him a spokesman. And I, behold, I will give unto him that he shall write the writing of the fruit of thy loins, unto the fruit of thy loins; and the spokesman of thy loins shall declare it.
verses.plainText: And the Lord also said to me: I will raise up someone from your descendants, and I will make a spokesman for him. I will give him the ability to write the record of your descendants for your descendants, and the spokesman from your descendants will declare it.

verses.text: And the words which he shall write shall be the words which are expedient in my wisdom should go forth unto the fruit of thy loins. And it shall be as if the fruit of thy loins had cried unto them from the dust; for I know their faith.
verses.plainText: The words he writes will be the ones that, in my wisdom, should be given to your descendants. It will be as if your descendants are calling to them from the dust, because I know their faith.

verses.text: And they shall cry from the dust; yea, even repentance unto their brethren, even after many generations have gone by them. And it shall come to pass that their cry shall go, even according to the simpleness of their words.
verses.plainText: They will cry from the dust, calling their brothers to repentance, even after many generations have passed. Their message will go out, expressed in simple words.

verses.text: Because of their faith their words shall proceed forth out of my mouth unto their brethren who are the fruit of thy loins; and the weakness of their words will I make strong in their faith, unto the remembering of my covenant which I made unto thy fathers.
verses.plainText: Because of their faith, their words will come from me to their brothers, who are your descendants; and I will make the weakness of their words strong in their faith, so they will remember the covenant I made with your fathers.

verses.text: And now, behold, my son Joseph, after this manner did my father of old prophesy.
verses.plainText: And now, my son Joseph, this is how my father long ago prophesied.

verses.text: Wherefore, because of this covenant thou art blessed; for thy seed shall not be destroyed, for they shall hearken unto the words of the book.
verses.plainText: Because of this covenant, you are blessed; your descendants will not be destroyed, for they will listen to the words of the book.

verses.text: And there shall rise up one mighty among them, who shall do much good, both in word and in deed, being an instrument in the hands of God, with exceeding faith, to work mighty wonders, and do that thing which is great in the sight of God, unto the bringing to pass much restoration unto the house of Israel, and unto the seed of thy brethren.
verses.plainText: One mighty person will rise among them, who will do much good through both words and actions, serving as an instrument in God's hands with great faith to perform mighty miracles and accomplish what is great in God's eyes, bringing about much restoration for the house of Israel and for your brothers’ descendants.

verses.text: And now, blessed art thou, Joseph. Behold, thou art little; wherefore hearken unto the words of thy brother, Nephi, and it shall be done unto thee even according to the words which I have spoken. Remember the words of thy dying father. Amen.
verses.plainText: Now, you are blessed, Joseph. You are young, so listen to the words of your brother Nephi, and what I have said will happen to you. Remember the words of your dying father. Amen.

verses.text: And now, I, Nephi, speak concerning the prophecies of which my father hath spoken, concerning Joseph, who was carried into Egypt.
verses.plainText: Now I, Nephi, am speaking about the prophecies my father has spoken, concerning Joseph, who was taken into Egypt.

verses.text: For behold, he truly prophesied concerning all his seed. And the prophecies which he wrote, there are not many greater. And he prophesied concerning us, and our future generations; and they are written upon the plates of brass.
verses.plainText: He truly prophesied about all his descendants. The prophecies he wrote are among the greatest. He prophesied about us and our future generations, and these are written on the plates of brass.

verses.text: Wherefore, after my father had made an end of speaking concerning the prophecies of Joseph, he called the children of Laman, his sons, and his daughters, and said unto them: Behold, my sons, and my daughters, who are the sons and the daughters of my first-born, I would that ye should give ear unto my words.
verses.plainText: After my father finished speaking about the prophecies of Joseph, he called the children of Laman—his sons and daughters—and said to them, "My sons and daughters, who are the children of my firstborn, I want you to listen to my words.

verses.text: For the Lord God hath said that: Inasmuch as ye shall keep my commandments ye shall prosper in the land; and inasmuch as ye will not keep my commandments ye shall be cut off from my presence.
verses.plainText: The Lord God has said: As long as you keep my commandments, you will prosper in the land; but if you do not keep my commandments, you will be cut off from my presence.

verses.text: But behold, my sons and my daughters, I cannot go down to my grave save I should leave a blessing upon you; for behold, I know that if ye are brought up in the way ye should go ye will not depart from it.
verses.plainText: My sons and my daughters, I cannot go to my grave without leaving a blessing on you; because I know that if you are raised in the way you should go, you will not turn away from it.

verses.text: Wherefore, if ye are cursed, behold, I leave my blessing upon you, that the cursing may be taken from you and be answered upon the heads of your parents.
verses.plainText: If you are cursed, I leave my blessing with you so that the curse can be taken from you and placed on your parents instead.

verses.text: Wherefore, because of my blessing the Lord God will not suffer that ye shall perish; wherefore, he will be merciful unto you and unto your seed forever.
verses.plainText: Because of my blessing, the Lord God will not allow you to perish; he will be merciful to you and to your descendants forever.

verses.text: And it came to pass that after my father had made an end of speaking to the sons and daughters of Laman, he caused the sons and daughters of Lemuel to be brought before him.
verses.plainText: After my father finished speaking to the sons and daughters of Laman, he had the sons and daughters of Lemuel brought before him.

verses.text: And he spake unto them, saying: Behold, my sons and my daughters, who are the sons and the daughters of my second son; behold I leave unto you the same blessing which I left unto the sons and daughters of Laman; wherefore, thou shalt not utterly be destroyed; but in the end thy seed shall be blessed.
verses.plainText: He spoke to them, saying: My sons and my daughters, who are the children of my second son, I give you the same blessing that I gave to the sons and daughters of Laman. You will not be completely destroyed, but in the end your descendants will be blessed.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when my father had made an end of speaking unto them, behold, he spake unto the sons of Ishmael, yea, and even all his household.
verses.plainText: When my father finished speaking to them, he spoke to the sons of Ishmael and to all his household.

verses.text: And after he had made an end of speaking unto them, he spake unto Sam, saying: Blessed art thou, and thy seed; for thou shall inherit the land like unto thy brother Nephi. And thy seed shall be numbered with his seed; and thou shalt be even like unto thy brother, and thy seed like unto his seed; and thou shalt be blessed in all thy days.
verses.plainText: After he finished speaking to them, he spoke to Sam, saying: You and your descendants are blessed, for you will inherit the land just like your brother Nephi. Your descendants will be counted with his descendants; you will be like your brother, and your descendants will be like his descendants; and you will be blessed all your days.

verses.text: And it came to pass after my father, Lehi, had spoken unto all his household, according to the feelings of his heart and the Spirit of the Lord which was in him, he waxed old. And it came to pass that he died, and was buried.
verses.plainText: After my father, Lehi, spoke to all his household according to the feelings of his heart and the Spirit of the Lord that was in him, he grew old. He died and was buried.

verses.text: And it came to pass that not many days after his death, Laman and Lemuel and the sons of Ishmael were angry with me because of the admonitions of the Lord.
verses.plainText: Not many days after his death, Laman, Lemuel, and the sons of Ishmael were angry with me because of the Lord’s warnings.

verses.text: For I, Nephi, was constrained to speak unto them, according to his word; for I had spoken many things unto them, and also my father, before his death; many of which sayings are written upon mine other plates; for a more history part are written upon mine other plates.
verses.plainText: I, Nephi, was compelled to speak to them according to his word. I had already said many things to them, as had my father before he died. Many of those things are written on my other plates, which contain a more detailed history.

verses.text: And upon these I write the things of my soul, and many of the scriptures which are engraven upon the plates of brass. For my soul delighteth in the scriptures, and my heart pondereth them, and writeth them for the learning and the profit of my children.
verses.plainText: I write the feelings of my soul on these, along with many of the scriptures engraved on the brass plates. My soul delights in the scriptures, and my heart thinks about them and writes them for the learning and benefit of my children.

verses.text: Behold, my soul delighteth in the things of the Lord; and my heart pondereth continually upon the things which I have seen and heard.
verses.plainText: My soul delights in the things of the Lord, and my heart continually thinks about the things I have seen and heard.

verses.text: Nevertheless, notwithstanding the great goodness of the Lord, in showing me his great and marvelous works, my heart exclaimeth: O wretched man that I am! Yea, my heart sorroweth because of my flesh; my soul grieveth because of mine iniquities.
verses.plainText: Even though the Lord has been so good to me and has shown me his great and marvelous works, my heart cries out, "O wretched man that I am! " My heart is sorrowful because of my weaknesses, and my soul is troubled because of my sins.

verses.text: I am encompassed about, because of the temptations and the sins which do so easily beset me.
verses.plainText: I feel surrounded because of the temptations and sins that so easily trouble me.

verses.text: And when I desire to rejoice, my heart groaneth because of my sins; nevertheless, I know in whom I have trusted.
verses.plainText: When I want to rejoice, my heart groans because of my sins; but I know whom I have trusted.

verses.text: My God hath been my support; he hath led me through mine afflictions in the wilderness; and he hath preserved me upon the waters of the great deep.
verses.plainText: My God has been my support; he has led me through my afflictions in the wilderness, and he has preserved me on the waters of the great deep.

verses.text: He hath filled me with his love, even unto the consuming of my flesh.
verses.plainText: He has filled me with his love, even to the point that it consumes my whole being.

verses.text: He hath confounded mine enemies, unto the causing of them to quake before me.
verses.plainText: He has confused my enemies and made them tremble before me.

verses.text: Behold, he hath heard my cry by day, and he hath given me knowledge by visions in the nighttime.
verses.plainText: He has heard my cry during the day, and he has given me knowledge through visions at night.

verses.text: And by day have I waxed bold in mighty prayer before him; yea, my voice have I sent up on high; and angels came down and ministered unto me.
verses.plainText: During the day I have become bold in powerful prayer before Him; I have lifted my voice to heaven, and angels came down and ministered to me.

verses.text: And upon the wings of his Spirit hath my body been carried away upon exceedingly high mountains. And mine eyes have beheld great things, yea, even too great for man; therefore I was bidden that I should not write them.
verses.plainText: On the wings of his Spirit, my body has been carried away to extremely high mountains. My eyes have seen great things, even too great for people to understand; so I was commanded not to write them.

verses.text: O then, if I have seen so great things, if the Lord in his condescension unto the children of men hath visited men in so much mercy, why should my heart weep and my soul linger in the valley of sorrow, and my flesh waste away, and my strength slacken, because of mine afflictions?
verses.plainText: O then, if I have seen such great things, if the Lord in his condescension to the children of men has visited people with so much mercy, why should my heart weep and my soul remain in the valley of sorrow, and my body waste away, and my strength weaken because of my afflictions?

verses.text: And why should I yield to sin, because of my flesh? Yea, why should I give way to temptations, that the evil one have place in my heart to destroy my peace and afflict my soul? Why am I angry because of mine enemy?
verses.plainText: And why should I give in to sin because of my physical desires? Why should I allow temptations, letting the evil one have a place in my heart to destroy my peace and trouble my soul? Why am I angry because of my enemy?

verses.text: Awake, my soul! No longer droop in sin. Rejoice, O my heart, and give place no more for the enemy of my soul.
verses.plainText: Wake up, my soul! Don’t be weighed down by sin anymore. Rejoice, my heart, and don’t give any more room to the enemy of my soul.

verses.text: Do not anger again because of mine enemies. Do not slacken my strength because of mine afflictions.
verses.plainText: Don’t get angry again because of my enemies. Don’t let my strength weaken because of my afflictions.

verses.text: Rejoice, O my heart, and cry unto the Lord, and say: O Lord, I will praise thee forever; yea, my soul will rejoice in thee, my God, and the rock of my salvation.
verses.plainText: Rejoice, my heart, and pray to the Lord, saying: O Lord, I will praise you forever; my soul will rejoice in you, my God, and the rock of my salvation.

verses.text: O Lord, wilt thou redeem my soul? Wilt thou deliver me out of the hands of mine enemies? Wilt thou make me that I may shake at the appearance of sin?
verses.plainText: O Lord, will you redeem my soul? Will you deliver me from the hands of my enemies? Will you help me to tremble at the sight of sin?

verses.text: May the gates of hell be shut continually before me, because that my heart is broken and my spirit is contrite! O Lord, wilt thou not shut the gates of thy righteousness before me, that I may walk in the path of the low valley, that I may be strict in the plain road!
verses.plainText: Please keep the gates of hell closed to me, because my heart is broken and my spirit is humble. Lord, don’t close the gates of your righteousness to me, so I can walk in the path of humility and stay true to the straight and narrow way.

verses.text: O Lord, wilt thou encircle me around in the robe of thy righteousness! O Lord, wilt thou make a way for mine escape before mine enemies! Wilt thou make my path straight before me! Wilt thou not place a stumbling block in my way—but that thou wouldst clear my way before me, and hedge not up my way, but the ways of mine enemy.
verses.plainText: O Lord, will you surround me with the robe of your righteousness? O Lord, will you make a way for me to escape from my enemies? Will you make my path straight before me? Please do not put a stumbling block in my way, but clear my path before me, and do not block my way, but block the ways of my enemy.

verses.text: O Lord, I have trusted in thee, and I will trust in thee forever. I will not put my trust in the arm of flesh; for I know that cursed is he that putteth his trust in the arm of flesh. Yea, cursed is he that putteth his trust in man or maketh flesh his arm.
verses.plainText: O Lord, I have trusted in you, and I will trust in you forever. I will not put my trust in human strength, because I know that anyone who trusts in human strength is cursed. Anyone who puts their trust in people or relies on human power is cursed.

verses.text: Yea, I know that God will give liberally to him that asketh. Yea, my God will give me, if I ask not amiss; therefore I will lift up my voice unto thee; yea, I will cry unto thee, my God, the rock of my righteousness. Behold, my voice shall forever ascend up unto thee, my rock and mine everlasting God. Amen.
verses.plainText: I know that God will give generously to those who ask. My God will give to me if I don’t ask for the wrong things; so I will lift my voice to you, I will call out to you, my God, the rock of my righteousness. My voice will always rise up to you, my rock and my everlasting God. Amen.

verses.text: Behold, it came to pass that I, Nephi, did cry much unto the Lord my God, because of the anger of my brethren.
verses.plainText: I, Nephi, prayed earnestly to the Lord my God because my brothers were angry with me.

verses.text: But behold, their anger did increase against me, insomuch that they did seek to take away my life.
verses.plainText: Their anger toward me grew so much that they tried to take my life.

verses.text: Yea, they did murmur against me, saying: Our younger brother thinks to rule over us; and we have had much trial because of him; wherefore, now let us slay him, that we may not be afflicted more because of his words. For behold, we will not have him to be our ruler; for it belongs unto us, who are the elder brethren, to rule over this people.
verses.plainText: They complained about me, saying, “Our younger brother thinks he can rule over us, and we’ve had many problems because of him. Now let’s kill him so we won’t have to suffer more because of what he says. We won’t let him be our leader, because we, as the older brothers, should be the ones to lead this people. ”

verses.text: Now I do not write upon these plates all the words which they murmured against me. But it sufficeth me to say, that they did seek to take away my life.
verses.plainText: I’m not writing down everything they complained about me on these plates, but it’s enough to say that they tried to take my life.

verses.text: And it came to pass that the Lord did warn me, that I, Nephi, should depart from them and flee into the wilderness, and all those who would go with me.
verses.plainText: The Lord warned me, Nephi, that I should leave them and escape into the wilderness, along with everyone who wanted to go with me.

verses.text: Wherefore, it came to pass that I, Nephi, did take my family, and also Zoram and his family, and Sam, mine elder brother and his family, and Jacob and Joseph, my younger brethren, and also my sisters, and all those who would go with me. And all those who would go with me were those who believed in the warnings and the revelations of God; wherefore, they did hearken unto my words.
verses.plainText: So I, Nephi, took my family, along with Zoram and his family, Sam, my older brother and his family, Jacob and Joseph, my younger brothers, my sisters, and everyone else who wanted to come with me. All those who chose to go with me were the ones who believed in the warnings and revelations of God, so they listened to what I said.

verses.text: And we did take our tents and whatsoever things were possible for us, and did journey in the wilderness for the space of many days. And after we had journeyed for the space of many days we did pitch our tents.
