verses.text: For behold, the Lord, the Lord of Hosts, doth take away from Jerusalem, and from Judah, the stay and the staff, the whole staff of bread, and the whole stay of water—
verses.plainText: The Lord, the Lord of Hosts, is taking away from Jerusalem and from Judah their support and supply—the entire supply of bread and the entire supply of water—

verses.text: The mighty man, and the man of war, the judge, and the prophet, and the prudent, and the ancient;
verses.plainText: The strong man, the warrior, the judge, the prophet, the wise person, and the elder;

verses.text: The captain of fifty, and the honorable man, and the counselor, and the cunning artificer, and the eloquent orator.
verses.plainText: The captain of fifty, the honorable man, the counselor, the skilled craftsman, and the eloquent speaker.

verses.text: And I will give children unto them to be their princes, and babes shall rule over them.
verses.plainText: I will make children their leaders, and infants will rule over them.

verses.text: And the people shall be oppressed, every one by another, and every one by his neighbor; the child shall behave himself proudly against the ancient, and the base against the honorable.
verses.plainText: People will oppress each other, everyone by their neighbor; children will act arrogantly toward the elderly, and the lowly will act disrespectfully toward the honorable.

verses.text: When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father, and shall say: Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler, and let not this ruin come under thy hand—
verses.plainText: When a man grabs his brother from his father’s house and says, “You have clothing, so be our leader, and don’t let this destruction come upon us”—

verses.text: In that day shall he swear, saying: I will not be a healer; for in my house there is neither bread nor clothing; make me not a ruler of the people.
verses.plainText: At that time he will swear and say, “I will not be a healer, because there is no bread or clothing in my house. Don’t make me a ruler of the people. ”

verses.text: For Jerusalem is ruined, and Judah is fallen, because their tongues and their doings have been against the Lord, to provoke the eyes of his glory.
verses.plainText: Jerusalem is ruined, and Judah has fallen, because their words and actions have been against the Lord, provoking the eyes of his glory.

verses.text: The show of their countenance doth witness against them, and doth declare their sin to be even as Sodom, and they cannot hide it. Wo unto their souls, for they have rewarded evil unto themselves!
verses.plainText: The look on their faces testifies against them and shows that their sin is like that of Sodom, and they can't hide it. Woe to their souls, for they have brought evil upon themselves!

verses.text: Say unto the righteous that it is well with them; for they shall eat the fruit of their doings.
verses.plainText: Tell the righteous that things are well for them, because they will enjoy the results of their actions.

verses.text: Wo unto the wicked, for they shall perish; for the reward of their hands shall be upon them!
verses.plainText: Woe to the wicked, for they will perish; the consequences of their actions will come upon them!

verses.text: And my people, children are their oppressors, and women rule over them. O my people, they who lead thee cause thee to err and destroy the way of thy paths.
verses.plainText: My people are oppressed by children, and women rule over them. My people, your leaders are causing you to go astray and are ruining the way you should follow.

verses.text: The Lord standeth up to plead, and standeth to judge the people.
verses.plainText: The Lord stands up to plead and stands to judge the people.

verses.text: The Lord will enter into judgment with the ancients of his people and the princes thereof; for ye have eaten up the vineyard and the spoil of the poor in your houses.
verses.plainText: The Lord will judge the elders of his people and their leaders, because you have consumed the vineyard and taken what belongs to the poor into your houses.

verses.text: What mean ye? Ye beat my people to pieces, and grind the faces of the poor, saith the Lord God of Hosts.
verses.plainText: What are you doing? You crush my people and grind the faces of the poor, says the Lord God of Hosts.

verses.text: Moreover, the Lord saith: Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and walk with stretched-forth necks and wanton eyes, walking and mincing as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet—
verses.plainText: The Lord says: Because the daughters of Zion are proud and walk with their heads held high and flirtatious eyes, walking with small, dainty steps and making tinkling sounds with their feet—

verses.text: Therefore the Lord will smite with a scab the crown of the head of the daughters of Zion, and the Lord will discover their secret parts.
verses.plainText: So the Lord will strike the heads of the daughters of Zion with sores, and he will expose their hidden parts.

verses.text: In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments, and cauls, and round tires like the moon;
verses.plainText: On that day, the Lord will take away the beauty of their tinkling ornaments, headbands, and crescent-shaped jewelry.

verses.text: The chains and the bracelets, and the mufflers;
verses.plainText: The chains, the bracelets, and the scarves;

verses.text: The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the ear-rings;
verses.plainText: The bonnets, the ornaments for the legs, the headbands, the pendants, and the earrings;

verses.text: The rings, and nose jewels;
verses.plainText: The rings and nose jewelry.

verses.text: The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping-pins;
verses.plainText: The fashionable clothes, the mantles, the shawls, and the purses;

verses.text: The glasses, and the fine linen, and hoods, and the veils.
verses.plainText: The mirrors, fine linen, hoods, and veils.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, instead of sweet smell there shall be stink; and instead of a girdle, a rent; and instead of well set hair, baldness; and instead of a stomacher, a girding of sackcloth; burning instead of beauty.
verses.plainText: Instead of a sweet smell, there will be a bad odor; instead of a belt, a tear; instead of well-styled hair, baldness; instead of fine clothing, the wearing of sackcloth; and branding instead of beauty.

verses.text: Thy men shall fall by the sword and thy mighty in the war.
verses.plainText: Your men will fall by the sword, and your warriors will die in the war.

verses.text: And her gates shall lament and mourn; and she shall be desolate, and shall sit upon the ground.
verses.plainText: Her gates will lament and mourn; she will be desolate and will sit on the ground.

verses.text: And in that day, seven women shall take hold of one man, saying: We will eat our own bread, and wear our own apparel; only let us be called by thy name to take away our reproach.
verses.plainText: At that time, seven women will take hold of one man and say, “We will eat our own food and wear our own clothes; just let us be called by your name to take away our disgrace. ”

verses.text: In that day shall the branch of the Lord be beautiful and glorious; the fruit of the earth excellent and comely to them that are escaped of Israel.
verses.plainText: On that day, the branch of the Lord will be beautiful and glorious, and the fruit of the earth will be excellent and lovely for those who have escaped from Israel.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, they that are left in Zion and remain in Jerusalem shall be called holy, every one that is written among the living in Jerusalem—
verses.plainText: Those who are left in Zion and remain in Jerusalem will be called holy—everyone who is recorded among the living in Jerusalem.

verses.text: When the Lord shall have washed away the filth of the daughters of Zion, and shall have purged the blood of Jerusalem from the midst thereof by the spirit of judgment and by the spirit of burning.
verses.plainText: When the Lord has washed away the filth of the daughters of Zion and has cleansed the blood of Jerusalem from its midst by the spirit of judgment and the spirit of burning.

verses.text: And the Lord will create upon every dwelling-place of mount Zion, and upon her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day and the shining of a flaming fire by night; for upon all the glory of Zion shall be a defence.
verses.plainText: The Lord will create a cloud and smoke by day and the shining of a flaming fire by night over every home on Mount Zion and over her gatherings. The glory of Zion will be protected.

verses.text: And there shall be a tabernacle for a shadow in the daytime from the heat, and for a place of refuge, and a covert from storm and from rain.
verses.plainText: There will be a shelter to provide shade from the heat during the day, a place of refuge, and protection from storms and rain.

verses.text: And then will I sing to my well-beloved a song of my beloved, touching his vineyard. My well-beloved hath a vineyard in a very fruitful hill.
verses.plainText: I will sing to my beloved a song about his vineyard. My beloved has a vineyard on a very fruitful hill.

verses.text: And he fenced it, and gathered out the stones thereof, and planted it with the choicest vine, and built a tower in the midst of it, and also made a wine-press therein; and he looked that it should bring forth grapes, and it brought forth wild grapes.
verses.plainText: He fenced it, cleared out the stones, planted it with the best vine, built a tower in the middle, and made a winepress there. He expected it to produce good grapes, but it produced wild grapes instead.

verses.text: And now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem, and men of Judah, judge, I pray you, betwixt me and my vineyard.
verses.plainText: Now, people of Jerusalem and men of Judah, please judge between me and my vineyard.

verses.text: What could have been done more to my vineyard that I have not done in it? Wherefore, when I looked that it should bring forth grapes it brought forth wild grapes.
verses.plainText: What more could I have done for my vineyard that I haven’t already done? When I expected it to produce good grapes, it produced wild grapes instead.

verses.text: And now go to; I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard—I will take away the hedge thereof, and it shall be eaten up; and I will break down the wall thereof, and it shall be trodden down;
verses.plainText: Now I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard—I will take away its hedge, and it will be eaten; I will break down its wall, and it will be trampled.

verses.text: And I will lay it waste; it shall not be pruned nor digged; but there shall come up briers and thorns; I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it.
verses.plainText: I will make it a wasteland; it won’t be pruned or cultivated, and briers and thorns will grow there. I will also command the clouds not to rain on it.

verses.text: For the vineyard of the Lord of Hosts is the house of Israel, and the men of Judah his pleasant plant; and he looked for judgment, and behold, oppression; for righteousness, but behold, a cry.
verses.plainText: The vineyard of the Lord of Hosts is the house of Israel, and the people of Judah are his pleasant plant. He looked for justice, but found oppression; he expected righteousness, but heard a cry of distress.

verses.text: Wo unto them that join house to house, till there can be no place, that they may be placed alone in the midst of the earth!
verses.plainText: Sorrow awaits those who add house to house until there’s no space left, so they can live alone in the middle of the land.

verses.text: In mine ears, said the Lord of Hosts, of a truth many houses shall be desolate, and great and fair cities without inhabitant.
verses.plainText: The Lord of Hosts has told me that many houses will be left empty, and large, beautiful cities will have no one living in them.

verses.text: Yea, ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath, and the seed of a homer shall yield an ephah.
verses.plainText: Ten acres of vineyard will produce only one bath, and a homer of seed will yield only an ephah.

verses.text: Wo unto them that rise up early in the morning, that they may follow strong drink, that continue until night, and wine inflame them!
verses.plainText: Sorrow awaits those who get up early in the morning to chase after strong drinks, who continue drinking until night, letting wine consume them.

verses.text: And the harp, and the viol, the tabret, and pipe, and wine are in their feasts; but they regard not the work of the Lord, neither consider the operation of his hands.
verses.plainText: They have harps, lyres, tambourines, pipes, and wine at their feasts, but they pay no attention to the work of the Lord and do not consider what he has done.

verses.text: Therefore, my people are gone into captivity, because they have no knowledge; and their honorable men are famished, and their multitude dried up with thirst.
verses.plainText: So my people have gone into captivity because they lack knowledge; their honorable men are starving, and the crowds are parched with thirst.

verses.text: Therefore, hell hath enlarged herself, and opened her mouth without measure; and their glory, and their multitude, and their pomp, and he that rejoiceth, shall descend into it.
verses.plainText: So, hell has expanded and opened its mouth wide; their glory, their crowds, their pride, and those who celebrate will go down into it.

verses.text: And the mean man shall be brought down, and the mighty man shall be humbled, and the eyes of the lofty shall be humbled.
verses.plainText: The common person will be brought down, the powerful person will be humbled, and those who are proud will be humbled.

verses.text: But the Lord of Hosts shall be exalted in judgment, and God that is holy shall be sanctified in righteousness.
verses.plainText: But the Lord of Hosts will be exalted through judgment, and the holy God will be shown holy through righteousness.

verses.text: Then shall the lambs feed after their manner, and the waste places of the fat ones shall strangers eat.
verses.plainText: Lambs will graze as usual, and strangers will eat in the ruins left by the wealthy.

verses.text: Wo unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as it were with a cart rope;
verses.plainText: Disaster awaits those who drag their sins along with lies and pull their wrongdoing like it’s tied to them with a heavy rope.

verses.text: That say: Let him make speed, hasten his work, that we may see it; and let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw nigh and come, that we may know it.
verses.plainText: They say, “Let him hurry and do his work so we can see it; let the plan of the Holy One of Israel come closer and happen so we can know it. ”

verses.text: Wo unto them that call evil good, and good evil, that put darkness for light, and light for darkness, that put bitter for sweet, and sweet for bitter!
verses.plainText: Sorrow awaits those who call evil good and good evil, who substitute darkness for light and light for darkness, who exchange bitter for sweet and sweet for bitter.

verses.text: Wo unto the wise in their own eyes and prudent in their own sight!
verses.plainText: Woe to those who think they are wise and consider themselves clever.

verses.text: Wo unto the mighty to drink wine, and men of strength to mingle strong drink;
verses.plainText: Sorrow awaits those who are heroes at drinking wine and champions at mixing strong drinks.

verses.text: Who justify the wicked for reward, and take away the righteousness of the righteous from him!
verses.plainText: They justify the wicked for a reward and take away the righteousness from those who are righteous.

verses.text: Therefore, as the fire devoureth the stubble, and the flame consumeth the chaff, their root shall be rottenness, and their blossoms shall go up as dust; because they have cast away the law of the Lord of Hosts, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.
verses.plainText: Just as fire burns up stubble and flames consume chaff, their roots will rot and their blossoms will be blown away like dust, because they have rejected the law of the Lord of Hosts and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

verses.text: Therefore, is the anger of the Lord kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them; and the hills did tremble, and their carcasses were torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.plainText: So the Lord’s anger is stirred against his people, and he has stretched out his hand against them and struck them. The hills trembled, and their bodies were scattered in the streets. Even after all this, his anger has not turned away, and his hand is still stretched out.

verses.text: And he will lift up an ensign to the nations from far, and will hiss unto them from the end of the earth; and behold, they shall come with speed swiftly; none shall be weary nor stumble among them.
verses.plainText: He will raise a banner for the distant nations and signal to them from the ends of the earth. They will come quickly and swiftly; none will be tired or stumble among them.

verses.text: None shall slumber nor sleep; neither shall the girdle of their loins be loosed, nor the latchet of their shoes be broken;
verses.plainText: No one will slumber or sleep; their belts will not come loose, and the straps of their shoes will not break.

verses.text: Whose arrows shall be sharp, and all their bows bent, and their horses’ hoofs shall be counted like flint, and their wheels like a whirlwind, their roaring like a lion.
verses.plainText: Their arrows will be sharp, and all their bows ready; their horses’ hooves will be like flint, and their wheels like a whirlwind, their roaring like a lion.

verses.text: They shall roar like young lions; yea, they shall roar, and lay hold of the prey, and shall carry away safe, and none shall deliver.
verses.plainText: They will roar like young lions; they will roar and seize their prey, and they will carry it away safely, and no one will rescue it.

verses.text: And in that day they shall roar against them like the roaring of the sea; and if they look unto the land, behold, darkness and sorrow, and the light is darkened in the heavens thereof.
verses.plainText: On that day, they will roar against them like the roaring of the sea; and if they look to the land, there will be darkness and sorrow, and the light in the heavens will be darkened.

verses.text: In the year that king Uzziah died, I saw also the Lord sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up, and his train filled the temple.
verses.plainText: In the year that King Uzziah died, I saw the Lord sitting on a high and exalted throne, and the train of his robe filled the temple.

verses.text: Above it stood the seraphim; each one had six wings; with twain he covered his face, and with twain he covered his feet, and with twain he did fly.
verses.plainText: Above it stood the seraphim; each one had six wings. With two he covered his face, with two he covered his feet, and with two he flew.

verses.text: And one cried unto another, and said: Holy, holy, holy, is the Lord of Hosts; the whole earth is full of his glory.
verses.plainText: One called out to another and said, “Holy, holy, holy is the Lord of Hosts; the whole earth is filled with his glory. ”

verses.text: And the posts of the door moved at the voice of him that cried, and the house was filled with smoke.
verses.plainText: The doorposts shook at the sound of the one who called out, and the house was filled with smoke.

verses.text: Then said I: Wo is unto me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips; and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips; for mine eyes have seen the King, the Lord of Hosts.
verses.plainText: Then I said, "Woe is me! I am ruined, because I am a man with unclean lips, and I live among a people with unclean lips, for my eyes have seen the King, the Lord of Hosts.

verses.text: Then flew one of the seraphim unto me, having a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar;
verses.plainText: One of the seraphim flew to me, holding a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with tongs from the altar.

verses.text: And he laid it upon my mouth, and said: Lo, this has touched thy lips; and thine iniquity is taken away, and thy sin purged.
verses.plainText: He placed it on my mouth and said, “This has touched your lips; your guilt is taken away and your sin is cleansed. ”

verses.text: Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying: Whom shall I send, and who will go for us? Then I said: Here am I; send me.
verses.plainText: I heard the voice of the Lord say, “Whom should I send, and who will go for us? ” I answered, “Here I am; send me. ”

verses.text: And he said: Go and tell this people—Hear ye indeed, but they understood not; and see ye indeed, but they perceived not.
verses.plainText: And he said, Go and tell this people: You will hear, but you won’t understand; you will see, but you won’t perceive.

verses.text: Make the heart of this people fat, and make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes—lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and be converted and be healed.
verses.plainText: Make the hearts of these people calloused, make their ears hard of hearing, and shut their eyes, so they won’t see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their hearts, and turn and be healed.

verses.text: Then said I: Lord, how long? And he said: Until the cities be wasted without inhabitant, and the houses without man, and the land be utterly desolate;
verses.plainText: Then I said, "Lord, how long? " And he answered, "Until the cities are destroyed with no inhabitants, the houses are empty, and the land is completely desolate.

verses.text: And the Lord have removed men far away, for there shall be a great forsaking in the midst of the land.
verses.plainText: And the Lord has removed people far away, and there will be a great abandonment in the middle of the land.

verses.text: But yet there shall be a tenth, and they shall return, and shall be eaten, as a teil-tree, and as an oak whose substance is in them when they cast their leaves; so the holy seed shall be the substance thereof.
verses.plainText: But a tenth will remain, and they will return and be consumed, like a terebinth or an oak whose stump remains when they lose their leaves; so the holy seed will be the stump.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, that Rezin, king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up toward Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.
verses.plainText: During the days of Ahaz, the son of Jotham and grandson of Uzziah, king of Judah, Rezin, king of Syria, and Pekah, the son of Remaliah and king of Israel, came up to Jerusalem to fight against it, but they could not defeat it.

verses.text: And it was told the house of David, saying: Syria is confederate with Ephraim. And his heart was moved, and the heart of his people, as the trees of the wood are moved with the wind.
verses.plainText: The house of David was told, “Syria has joined with Ephraim. ” His heart and the hearts of his people were shaken, like trees in the forest swaying in the wind.

verses.text: Then said the Lord unto Isaiah: Go forth now to meet Ahaz, thou and Shearjashub thy son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the fuller’s field;
verses.plainText: The Lord said to Isaiah, “Go now to meet Ahaz, you and your son Shearjashub, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool on the road to the launderer’s field. ”

verses.text: And say unto him: Take heed, and be quiet; fear not, neither be faint-hearted for the two tails of these smoking firebrands, for the fierce anger of Rezin with Syria, and of the son of Remaliah.
verses.plainText: Tell him, “Be careful, stay calm, don’t be afraid, and don’t lose heart because of these two smoldering sticks—because of the fierce anger of Rezin with Syria, and the son of Remaliah. ”

verses.text: Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah, have taken evil counsel against thee, saying:
verses.plainText: Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah have plotted evil against you, saying:

verses.text: Let us go up against Judah and vex it, and let us make a breach therein for us, and set a king in the midst of it, yea, the son of Tabeal.
verses.plainText: Let’s attack Judah and trouble it; let’s break through its defenses for ourselves and set up a king there—the son of Tabeal.

verses.text: Thus saith the Lord God: It shall not stand, neither shall it come to pass.
verses.plainText: The Lord God says: It will not happen, and it will not succeed.

verses.text: For the head of Syria is Damascus, and the head of Damascus, Rezin; and within three score and five years shall Ephraim be broken that it be not a people.
verses.plainText: The capital of Syria is Damascus, and the leader of Damascus is Rezin. Within sixty-five years, Ephraim will be destroyed and will no longer be a people.

verses.text: And the head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is Remaliah’s son. If ye will not believe surely ye shall not be established.
verses.plainText: The leader of Ephraim is Samaria, and the leader of Samaria is Remaliah’s son. If you do not believe, you will not be established.

verses.text: Moreover, the Lord spake again unto Ahaz, saying:
verses.plainText: The Lord spoke again to Ahaz, saying:

verses.text: Ask thee a sign of the Lord thy God; ask it either in the depths, or in the heights above.
verses.plainText: Ask the Lord your God for a sign; ask for it either in the depths or in the heights above.

verses.text: But Ahaz said: I will not ask, neither will I tempt the Lord.
verses.plainText: But Ahaz said, "I will not ask, and I will not test the Lord.

verses.text: And he said: Hear ye now, O house of David; is it a small thing for you to weary men, but will ye weary my God also?
verses.plainText: He said, “Listen now, house of David. Is it a small thing for you to tire out people, but will you also tire out my God? ”

verses.text: Therefore, the Lord himself shall give you a sign—Behold, a virgin shall conceive, and shall bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.
verses.plainText: So the Lord himself will give you a sign: a virgin will conceive and give birth to a son, and she will call his name Immanuel.

verses.text: Butter and honey shall he eat, that he may know to refuse the evil and to choose the good.
verses.plainText: He will eat butter and honey so that he will know how to reject evil and choose good.

verses.text: For before the child shall know to refuse the evil and choose the good, the land that thou abhorrest shall be forsaken of both her kings.
verses.plainText: Before the child knows to refuse evil and choose good, the land you hate will be abandoned by both her kings.

verses.text: The Lord shall bring upon thee, and upon thy people, and upon thy father’s house, days that have not come from the day that Ephraim departed from Judah, the king of Assyria.
verses.plainText: The Lord will bring on you, your people, and your father’s house a time unlike any since Ephraim separated from Judah—he will bring the king of Assyria.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass in that day that the Lord shall hiss for the fly that is in the uttermost part of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.
verses.plainText: On that day, the Lord will whistle for the fly that is in the farthest part of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.

verses.text: And they shall come, and shall rest all of them in the desolate valleys, and in the holes of the rocks, and upon all thorns, and upon all bushes.
verses.plainText: They will come and settle in the deserted valleys, in the holes of the rocks, and on all the thorns and bushes.

verses.text: In the same day shall the Lord shave with a razor that is hired, by them beyond the river, by the king of Assyria, the head, and the hair of the feet; and it shall also consume the beard.
verses.plainText: On that same day, the Lord will use a hired razor from beyond the river—the king of Assyria—to shave your head, the hair on your legs, and your beard.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass in that day, a man shall nourish a young cow and two sheep;
verses.plainText: On that day, a man will take care of a young cow and two sheep.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, for the abundance of milk they shall give he shall eat butter; for butter and honey shall every one eat that is left in the land.
verses.plainText: Because of the abundance of milk they produce, he will eat butter; and everyone who is left in the land will eat butter and honey.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass in that day, every place shall be, where there were a thousand vines at a thousand silverlings, which shall be for briers and thorns.
verses.plainText: On that day, every place that once had a thousand vines worth a thousand pieces of silver will be overgrown with briers and thorns.

verses.text: With arrows and with bows shall men come thither, because all the land shall become briers and thorns.
verses.plainText: Men will come there with arrows and bows, because the whole land will become covered with briers and thorns.

verses.text: And all hills that shall be digged with the mattock, there shall not come thither the fear of briers and thorns; but it shall be for the sending forth of oxen, and the treading of lesser cattle.
verses.plainText: All the hills that are dug with a mattock will no longer be threatened by briers and thorns; instead, they will be used for oxen and for sheep to graze.

verses.text: Moreover, the word of the Lord said unto me: Take thee a great roll, and write in it with a man’s pen, concerning Maher-shalal-hash-baz.
verses.plainText: The word of the Lord said to me: Take a large scroll and write on it clearly about Maher-shalal-hash-baz.

verses.text: And I took unto me faithful witnesses to record, Uriah the priest, and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah.
verses.plainText: I took faithful witnesses to record this—Uriah the priest and Zechariah, the son of Jeberechiah.

verses.text: And I went unto the prophetess; and she conceived and bare a son. Then said the Lord to me: Call his name, Maher-shalal-hash-baz.
verses.plainText: I went to the prophetess, and she became pregnant and gave birth to a son. Then the Lord said to me, “Name him Maher-shalal-hash-baz. ”

verses.text: For behold, the child shall not have knowledge to cry, My father, and my mother, before the riches of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria shall be taken away before the king of Assyria.
verses.plainText: The child will not be old enough to say, “My father” and “my mother, ” before the wealth of Damascus and the plunder of Samaria are taken away by the king of Assyria.

verses.text: The Lord spake also unto me again, saying:
verses.plainText: The Lord also spoke to me again, saying:

verses.text: Forasmuch as this people refuseth the waters of Shiloah that go softly, and rejoice in Rezin and Remaliah’s son;
verses.plainText: Because this people rejects the gentle waters of Shiloah and takes joy in Rezin and Remaliah’s son;

verses.text: Now therefore, behold, the Lord bringeth up upon them the waters of the river, strong and many, even the king of Assyria and all his glory; and he shall come up over all his channels, and go over all his banks.
verses.plainText: So now the Lord is bringing against them the powerful and abundant waters of the river—the king of Assyria and all his glory. He will rise over all his channels and overflow all his banks.

verses.text: And he shall pass through Judah; he shall overflow and go over, he shall reach even to the neck; and the stretching out of his wings shall fill the breadth of thy land, O Immanuel.
verses.plainText: He will pass through Judah, overflowing and sweeping over it. He will reach up to the neck, and the spread of his wings will cover the entire width of your land, O Immanuel.

verses.text: Associate yourselves, O ye people, and ye shall be broken in pieces; and give ear all ye of far countries; gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces; gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces.
verses.plainText: Join together, people, and you will be broken apart; listen, all you from distant countries. Prepare yourselves, but you will be broken apart; prepare yourselves, but you will be broken apart.

verses.text: Take counsel together, and it shall come to naught; speak the word, and it shall not stand; for God is with us.
verses.plainText: Make your plans together, but they will come to nothing; speak your words, but they will not succeed, because God is with us.

verses.text: For the Lord spake thus to me with a strong hand, and instructed me that I should not walk in the way of this people, saying:
verses.plainText: The Lord spoke to me with a strong hand and instructed me not to follow the ways of these people, saying:

verses.text: Say ye not, A confederacy, to all to whom this people shall say, A confederacy; neither fear ye their fear, nor be afraid.
verses.plainText: Do not call everything a conspiracy that these people call a conspiracy; do not fear what they fear or be afraid.

verses.text: Sanctify the Lord of Hosts himself, and let him be your fear, and let him be your dread.
verses.plainText: Honor the Lord of Hosts, and let him be your fear and your awe.

verses.text: And he shall be for a sanctuary; but for a stone of stumbling, and for a rock of offense to both the houses of Israel, for a gin and a snare to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.plainText: He will be a sanctuary, but also a stone that people stumble over and a rock that offends both houses of Israel, a trap and a snare for the people living in Jerusalem.

verses.text: And many among them shall stumble and fall, and be broken, and be snared, and be taken.
verses.plainText: Many among them will stumble and fall, be broken, be trapped, and be captured.

verses.text: Bind up the testimony, seal the law among my disciples.
verses.plainText: Bind up the testimony and seal the law among my disciples.

verses.text: And I will wait upon the Lord, that hideth his face from the house of Jacob, and I will look for him.
verses.plainText: I will wait for the Lord, who is hiding his face from the house of Jacob, and I will look for him.

verses.text: Behold, I and the children whom the Lord hath given me are for signs and for wonders in Israel from the Lord of Hosts, which dwelleth in Mount Zion.
verses.plainText: I and the children the Lord has given me are signs and wonders in Israel from the Lord of Hosts, who lives in Mount Zion.

verses.text: And when they shall say unto you: Seek unto them that have familiar spirits, and unto wizards that peep and mutter—should not a people seek unto their God for the living to hear from the dead?
verses.plainText: When they tell you, “Consult those who have familiar spirits and wizards who whisper and mutter, ” shouldn’t people seek their God? Should the living try to get answers from the dead?

verses.text: To the law and to the testimony; and if they speak not according to this word, it is because there is no light in them.
verses.plainText: Go to the law and to the testimony; if they do not speak according to this word, it is because they have no light in them.

verses.text: And they shall pass through it hardly bestead and hungry; and it shall come to pass that when they shall be hungry, they shall fret themselves, and curse their king and their God, and look upward.
verses.plainText: They will pass through the land hard-pressed and hungry; and when they are hungry, they will become angry and curse their king and their God, and look upward.

verses.text: And they shall look unto the earth and behold trouble, and darkness, dimness of anguish, and shall be driven to darkness.
verses.plainText: They will look to the earth and see trouble, darkness, and distress, and they will be driven into even deeper darkness.

verses.text: Nevertheless, the dimness shall not be such as was in her vexation, when at first he lightly afflicted the land of Zebulun, and the land of Naphtali, and afterwards did more grievously afflict by the way of the Red Sea beyond Jordan in Galilee of the nations.
verses.plainText: However, the darkness will not be as great as it was when she was troubled before, when he first lightly afflicted the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, and later brought greater affliction along the way of the Red Sea, beyond the Jordan, in Galilee of the nations.

verses.text: The people that walked in darkness have seen a great light; they that dwell in the land of the shadow of death, upon them hath the light shined.
verses.plainText: The people who walked in darkness have seen a great light; those who live in the land of the shadow of death, a light has shined on them.

verses.text: Thou hast multiplied the nation, and increased the joy—they joy before thee according to the joy in harvest, and as men rejoice when they divide the spoil.
verses.plainText: You have multiplied the nation and increased their joy. They rejoice before you like people celebrating a harvest, like those who are happy when they divide the plunder.

verses.text: For thou hast broken the yoke of his burden, and the staff of his shoulder, the rod of his oppressor.
verses.plainText: You have broken the yoke of his burden, the staff on his shoulder, and the rod of his oppressor.

verses.text: For every battle of the warrior is with confused noise, and garments rolled in blood; but this shall be with burning and fuel of fire.
verses.plainText: Every battle of the warrior is fought with chaos and blood-stained clothing, but this one will be with burning and fuel for fire.

verses.text: For unto us a child is born, unto us a son is given; and the government shall be upon his shoulder; and his name shall be called, Wonderful, Counselor, The Mighty God, The Everlasting Father, The Prince of Peace.
verses.plainText: A child is born to us, a son is given to us; the government will rest on his shoulders, and he will be called Wonderful, Counselor, The Mighty God, The Everlasting Father, The Prince of Peace.

verses.text: Of the increase of government and peace there is no end, upon the throne of David, and upon his kingdom to order it, and to establish it with judgment and with justice from henceforth, even forever. The zeal of the Lord of Hosts will perform this.
verses.plainText: There will be no end to the growth of his government and peace, as he rules on the throne of David and over his kingdom, establishing it and upholding it with justice and righteousness from now on and forever. The zeal of the Lord of Hosts will accomplish this.

verses.text: The Lord sent his word unto Jacob and it hath lighted upon Israel.
verses.plainText: The Lord sent his word to Jacob, and it has come upon Israel.

verses.text: And all the people shall know, even Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria, that say in the pride and stoutness of heart:
verses.plainText: All the people will know—Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria—who say with pride and arrogance of heart:

verses.text: The bricks are fallen down, but we will build with hewn stones; the sycamores are cut down, but we will change them into cedars.
verses.plainText: The bricks have fallen down, but we will rebuild with cut stones; the sycamore trees have been cut down, but we will replace them with cedars.

verses.text: Therefore the Lord shall set up the adversaries of Rezin against him, and join his enemies together;
verses.plainText: So the Lord will bring Rezin’s enemies against him and unite his opponents.

verses.text: The Syrians before and the Philistines behind; and they shall devour Israel with open mouth. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.plainText: The Syrians are in front and the Philistines are behind, and they will consume Israel openly. Even after all this, his anger has not turned away, and his hand is still stretched out.

verses.text: For the people turneth not unto him that smiteth them, neither do they seek the Lord of Hosts.
verses.plainText: The people do not turn to the one who strikes them, and they do not seek the Lord of Hosts.

verses.text: Therefore will the Lord cut off from Israel head and tail, branch and rush in one day.
verses.plainText: So the Lord will remove both the head and the tail, the branch and the reed from Israel in a single day.

verses.text: The ancient, he is the head; and the prophet that teacheth lies, he is the tail.
verses.plainText: The elder is the head, and the prophet who teaches lies is the tail.

verses.text: For the leaders of this people cause them to err; and they that are led of them are destroyed.
verses.plainText: The leaders of this people lead them astray, and those who follow them are destroyed.

verses.text: Therefore the Lord shall have no joy in their young men, neither shall have mercy on their fatherless and widows; for every one of them is a hypocrite and an evildoer, and every mouth speaketh folly. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.plainText: So the Lord will not take pleasure in their young men, nor show mercy to their orphans and widows, because everyone is a hypocrite and does evil, and every mouth speaks foolishness. Even with all this, his anger is not turned away, and his hand is still stretched out.

verses.text: For wickedness burneth as the fire; it shall devour the briers and thorns, and shall kindle in the thickets of the forests, and they shall mount up like the lifting up of smoke.
verses.plainText: Wickedness burns like fire; it will consume the briers and thorns, and ignite the thickets of the forests, and they will rise up like smoke.

verses.text: Through the wrath of the Lord of Hosts is the land darkened, and the people shall be as the fuel of the fire; no man shall spare his brother.
verses.plainText: Because of the anger of the Lord of Hosts, the land is darkened, and the people will be like fuel for the fire; no one will have mercy on his brother.

verses.text: And he shall snatch on the right hand and be hungry; and he shall eat on the left hand and they shall not be satisfied; they shall eat every man the flesh of his own arm—
verses.plainText: He will grab with his right hand and still be hungry; he will eat with his left hand and not be satisfied; each person will eat the flesh of his own arm—

verses.text: Manasseh, Ephraim; and Ephraim, Manasseh; they together shall be against Judah. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.plainText: Manasseh will be against Ephraim, and Ephraim against Manasseh; together they will be against Judah. Even with all this, his anger is not turned away, and his hand is still stretched out.

verses.text: Wo unto them that decree unrighteous decrees, and that write grievousness which they have prescribed;
verses.plainText: Woe to those who make unjust laws and write oppressive rules they have created;

verses.text: To turn away the needy from judgment, and to take away the right from the poor of my people, that widows may be their prey, and that they may rob the fatherless!
verses.plainText: They turn away the needy from justice and take away the rights of the poor among my people, so that widows become their prey and they rob the fatherless.

verses.text: And what will ye do in the day of visitation, and in the desolation which shall come from far? to whom will ye flee for help? and where will ye leave your glory?
verses.plainText: What will you do when you are visited with judgment, and when destruction comes from far away? Who will you run to for help, and where will you leave your glory?

verses.text: Without me they shall bow down under the prisoners, and they shall fall under the slain. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.plainText: Without me, they will bow down among the prisoners and fall among the slain. Even with all this, his anger is not turned away, and his hand is still stretched out.

verses.text: O Assyrian, the rod of mine anger, and the staff in their hand is their indignation.
verses.plainText: O Assyrian, you are the rod of my anger, and the staff in your hand is my indignation.

verses.text: I will send him against a hypocritical nation, and against the people of my wrath will I give him a charge to take the spoil, and to take the prey, and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.
verses.plainText: I will send him against a hypocritical nation, and I will command him to attack the people of my anger, to take their goods and possessions, and to trample them down like mud in the streets.

verses.text: Howbeit he meaneth not so, neither doth his heart think so; but in his heart it is to destroy and cut off nations not a few.
verses.plainText: He doesn’t mean it that way, and his heart doesn’t think that way; but in his heart, he wants to destroy and wipe out many nations.

verses.text: For he saith: Are not my princes altogether kings?
verses.plainText: He says, “Aren’t all my princes actually kings? ”

verses.text: Is not Calno as Carchemish? Is not Hamath as Arpad? Is not Samaria as Damascus?
verses.plainText: Isn’t Calno like Carchemish? Isn’t Hamath like Arpad? Isn’t Samaria like Damascus?

verses.text: As my hand hath founded the kingdoms of the idols, and whose graven images did excel them of Jerusalem and of Samaria;
verses.plainText: Just as my hand has established the kingdoms of the idols, and their carved images were greater than those of Jerusalem and Samaria;

verses.text: Shall I not, as I have done unto Samaria and her idols, so do to Jerusalem and to her idols?
verses.plainText: Won’t I do to Jerusalem and her idols the same thing I did to Samaria and her idols?

verses.text: Wherefore it shall come to pass that when the Lord hath performed his whole work upon Mount Zion and upon Jerusalem, I will punish the fruit of the stout heart of the king of Assyria, and the glory of his high looks.
verses.plainText: When the Lord has finished all his work on Mount Zion and Jerusalem, I will punish the pride of the king of Assyria and the arrogance of his haughty looks.

verses.text: For he saith: By the strength of my hand and by my wisdom I have done these things; for I am prudent; and I have moved the borders of the people, and have robbed their treasures, and I have put down the inhabitants like a valiant man;
verses.plainText: He says: By the strength of my hand and by my wisdom I have done these things, for I am wise. I have moved the borders of the people, taken their treasures, and brought down the inhabitants like a strong man.

verses.text: And my hand hath found as a nest the riches of the people; and as one gathereth eggs that are left have I gathered all the earth; and there was none that moved the wing, or opened the mouth, or peeped.
verses.plainText: My hand has found the riches of the people like a nest, and just as someone gathers abandoned eggs, I have gathered all the earth. No one moved a wing, opened their mouth, or made a sound.

verses.text: Shall the ax boast itself against him that heweth therewith? Shall the saw magnify itself against him that shaketh it? As if the rod should shake itself against them that lift it up, or as if the staff should lift up itself as if it were no wood!
verses.plainText: Can the ax brag against the one who uses it? Can the saw make itself greater than the person who moves it? That would be like a rod trying to shake itself against those who lift it, or a staff trying to lift itself as if it weren’t made of wood.

verses.text: Therefore shall the Lord, the Lord of Hosts, send among his fat ones, leanness; and under his glory he shall kindle a burning like the burning of a fire.
verses.plainText: So the Lord, the Lord of Hosts, will send leanness among his prosperous people, and under his glory he will start a fire burning like the burning of a flame.

verses.text: And the light of Israel shall be for a fire, and his Holy One for a flame, and shall burn and shall devour his thorns and his briers in one day;
verses.plainText: The light of Israel will become a fire, and his Holy One a flame, burning and consuming his thorns and briers in a single day.

verses.text: And shall consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body; and they shall be as when a standard-bearer fainteth.
verses.plainText: It will destroy the beauty of his forest and his fertile field, both soul and body; and they will be like a flag bearer who collapses.

verses.text: And the rest of the trees of his forest shall be few, that a child may write them.
verses.plainText: And the remaining trees in his forest will be so few that a child could count them.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the remnant of Israel, and such as are escaped of the house of Jacob, shall no more again stay upon him that smote them, but shall stay upon the Lord, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.
verses.plainText: On that day, the remnant of Israel and those who have escaped from the house of Jacob will no longer rely on the one who struck them, but will rely on the Lord, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.

verses.text: The remnant shall return, yea, even the remnant of Jacob, unto the mighty God.
verses.plainText: The remnant will return, even the remnant of Jacob, to the mighty God.

verses.text: For though thy people Israel be as the sand of the sea, yet a remnant of them shall return; the consumption decreed shall overflow with righteousness.
verses.plainText: Even though your people Israel are as numerous as the sand of the sea, only a remnant of them will return; the destruction that has been determined will be filled with righteousness.

verses.text: For the Lord God of Hosts shall make a consumption, even determined in all the land.
verses.plainText: The Lord God of Hosts will bring about a complete destruction, as determined, throughout the entire land.

verses.text: Therefore, thus saith the Lord God of Hosts: O my people that dwellest in Zion, be not afraid of the Assyrian; he shall smite thee with a rod, and shall lift up his staff against thee, after the manner of Egypt.
verses.plainText: So the Lord God of Hosts says: My people who live in Zion, do not be afraid of the Assyrian; he will strike you with a rod and lift up his staff against you, just like he did in Egypt.

verses.text: For yet a very little while, and the indignation shall cease, and mine anger in their destruction.
verses.plainText: In just a little while, my anger will end, and my wrath will be finished with their destruction.

verses.text: And the Lord of Hosts shall stir up a scourge for him according to the slaughter of Midian at the rock of Oreb; and as his rod was upon the sea so shall he lift it up after the manner of Egypt.
verses.plainText: The Lord of Hosts will bring a punishment on him like the slaughter of Midian at the rock of Oreb. Just as His rod was over the sea, He will raise it again as He did in Egypt.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass in that day that his burden shall be taken away from off thy shoulder, and his yoke from off thy neck, and the yoke shall be destroyed because of the anointing.
verses.plainText: On that day, his burden will be taken off your shoulder, and his yoke will be removed from your neck; the yoke will be destroyed because of the anointing.

verses.text: He is come to Aiath, he is passed to Migron; at Michmash he hath laid up his carriages.
verses.plainText: He has come to Aiath and passed through Migron; at Michmash he has stored his supplies.

verses.text: They are gone over the passage; they have taken up their lodging at Geba; Ramath is afraid; Gibeah of Saul is fled.
verses.plainText: They have crossed the pass; they are staying at Geba. Ramah is afraid, and Gibeah of Saul has fled.

verses.text: Lift up the voice, O daughter of Gallim; cause it to be heard unto Laish, O poor Anathoth.
verses.plainText: Raise your voice, daughter of Gallim; let it be heard in Laish, poor Anathoth.

verses.text: Madmenah is removed; the inhabitants of Gebim gather themselves to flee.
verses.plainText: Madmenah has been moved; the people of Gebim are gathering to escape.

verses.text: As yet shall he remain at Nob that day; he shall shake his hand against the mount of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.
verses.plainText: He will still be at Nob that day; he will shake his hand at the mountain of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.

verses.text: Behold, the Lord, the Lord of Hosts shall lop the bough with terror; and the high ones of stature shall be hewn down; and the haughty shall be humbled.
verses.plainText: The Lord, the Lord of Hosts, will cut off the bough with terror; those who are tall will be cut down, and the proud will be humbled.

verses.text: And he shall cut down the thickets of the forests with iron, and Lebanon shall fall by a mighty one.
verses.plainText: He will cut down the thickets of the forests with iron, and Lebanon will fall by a mighty one.

verses.text: And there shall come forth a rod out of the stem of Jesse, and a branch shall grow out of his roots.
verses.plainText: A shoot will come from the stump of Jesse, and a branch will grow from his roots.

verses.text: And the Spirit of the Lord shall rest upon him, the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the Lord;
verses.plainText: The Spirit of the Lord will rest on him—the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and strength, the spirit of knowledge and reverence for the Lord.

verses.text: And shall make him of quick understanding in the fear of the Lord; and he shall not judge after the sight of his eyes, neither reprove after the hearing of his ears.
verses.plainText: He will give him quick understanding in reverence for the Lord. He will not judge by what he sees, nor make decisions based only on what he hears.

verses.text: But with righteousness shall he judge the poor, and reprove with equity for the meek of the earth; and he shall smite the earth with the rod of his mouth, and with the breath of his lips shall he slay the wicked.
verses.plainText: He will judge the poor with righteousness and correct the meek of the earth with fairness. He will strike the earth with the rod of his mouth, and with the breath of his lips he will kill the wicked.

verses.text: And righteousness shall be the girdle of his loins, and faithfulness the girdle of his reins.
verses.plainText: Righteousness will be the belt around his waist, and faithfulness will be the belt around his hips.

verses.text: The wolf also shall dwell with the lamb, and the leopard shall lie down with the kid, and the calf and the young lion and fatling together; and a little child shall lead them.
verses.plainText: The wolf will live with the lamb, the leopard will lie down with the young goat, the calf, the young lion, and the fattened calf will be together, and a little child will lead them.

verses.text: And the cow and the bear shall feed; their young ones shall lie down together; and the lion shall eat straw like the ox.
verses.plainText: The cow and the bear will graze together; their young will lie down side by side, and the lion will eat straw like the ox.

verses.text: And the suckling child shall play on the hole of the asp, and the weaned child shall put his hand on the cockatrice’s den.
verses.plainText: The nursing child will play near the hole of the asp, and the weaned child will put his hand into the den of the cockatrice.

verses.text: They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain, for the earth shall be full of the knowledge of the Lord, as the waters cover the sea.
verses.plainText: They will not harm or destroy anywhere on my holy mountain, because the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the Lord, just as the waters cover the sea.

verses.text: And in that day there shall be a root of Jesse, which shall stand for an ensign of the people; to it shall the Gentiles seek; and his rest shall be glorious.
verses.plainText: On that day, a descendant of Jesse will stand as a sign for the people. The Gentiles will seek him, and his rest will be glorious.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass in that day that the Lord shall set his hand again the second time to recover the remnant of his people which shall be left, from Assyria, and from Egypt, and from Pathros, and from Cush, and from Elam, and from Shinar, and from Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.
verses.plainText: On that day, the Lord will once again reach out to bring back the remnant of his people who are left, from Assyria, Egypt, Pathros, Cush, Elam, Shinar, Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.

verses.text: And he shall set up an ensign for the nations, and shall assemble the outcasts of Israel, and gather together the dispersed of Judah from the four corners of the earth.
verses.plainText: He will raise a banner for the nations, assemble the outcasts of Israel, and gather together the dispersed people of Judah from the four corners of the earth.

verses.text: The envy of Ephraim also shall depart, and the adversaries of Judah shall be cut off; Ephraim shall not envy Judah, and Judah shall not vex Ephraim.
verses.plainText: The envy of Ephraim will go away, and Judah’s enemies will be destroyed; Ephraim will not be jealous of Judah, and Judah will not bother Ephraim.

verses.text: But they shall fly upon the shoulders of the Philistines towards the west; they shall spoil them of the east together; they shall lay their hand upon Edom and Moab; and the children of Ammon shall obey them.
verses.plainText: They will swoop down on the shoulders of the Philistines to the west; together they will take the people of the east as plunder; they will lay their hand on Edom and Moab, and the people of Ammon will obey them.

verses.text: And the Lord shall utterly destroy the tongue of the Egyptian sea; and with his mighty wind he shall shake his hand over the river, and shall smite it in the seven streams, and make men go over dry shod.
verses.plainText: The Lord will completely destroy the tongue of the Egyptian sea. With his powerful wind, he will wave his hand over the river, strike it into seven streams, and make it so people can cross over on dry ground.

verses.text: And there shall be a highway for the remnant of his people which shall be left, from Assyria, like as it was to Israel in the day that he came up out of the land of Egypt.
verses.plainText: There will be a highway for the remnant of his people who are left from Assyria, just as there was for Israel when they came up out of the land of Egypt.

verses.text: And in that day thou shalt say: O Lord, I will praise thee; though thou wast angry with me thine anger is turned away, and thou comfortedst me.
verses.plainText: On that day you will say, “O Lord, I will praise you; even though you were angry with me, your anger has turned away, and you have comforted me. ”

verses.text: Behold, God is my salvation; I will trust, and not be afraid; for the Lord JEHOVAH is my strength and my song; he also has become my salvation.
verses.plainText: God is my salvation; I will trust and not be afraid, for the Lord Jehovah is my strength and my song; he has also become my salvation.

verses.text: Therefore, with joy shall ye draw water out of the wells of salvation.
verses.plainText: So with joy you will draw water from the wells of salvation.

verses.text: And in that day shall ye say: Praise the Lord, call upon his name, declare his doings among the people, make mention that his name is exalted.
verses.plainText: On that day you will say: Praise the Lord, call on his name, tell everyone what he has done, and let people know that his name is exalted.

verses.text: Sing unto the Lord; for he hath done excellent things; this is known in all the earth.
verses.plainText: Sing to the Lord, for he has done excellent things; this is known throughout all the earth.

verses.text: Cry out and shout, thou inhabitant of Zion; for great is the Holy One of Israel in the midst of thee.
verses.plainText: Cry out and shout, you who live in Zion, for the Holy One of Israel is great among you.

verses.text: The burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz did see.
verses.plainText: This is the prophecy about Babylon that Isaiah, the son of Amoz, saw.

verses.text: Lift ye up a banner upon the high mountain, exalt the voice unto them, shake the hand, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.
verses.plainText: Raise a banner on the high mountain, call out to them, wave your hand so they may enter the gates of the nobles.

verses.text: I have commanded my sanctified ones, I have also called my mighty ones, for mine anger is not upon them that rejoice in my highness.
verses.plainText: I have commanded my holy ones; I have also called my mighty ones, because my anger is not directed at those who rejoice in my greatness.

verses.text: The noise of the multitude in the mountains like as of a great people, a tumultuous noise of the kingdoms of nations gathered together, the Lord of Hosts mustereth the hosts of the battle.
verses.plainText: The sound of the crowd in the mountains is like that of a great people, a loud commotion as kingdoms and nations gather together. The Lord of Hosts is assembling the armies for battle.

verses.text: They come from a far country, from the end of heaven, yea, the Lord, and the weapons of his indignation, to destroy the whole land.
verses.plainText: They come from a distant country, from the ends of heaven—the Lord and the weapons of his anger—to destroy the entire land.

verses.text: Howl ye, for the day of the Lord is at hand; it shall come as a destruction from the Almighty.
verses.plainText: Cry out, for the day of the Lord is near; it will come as destruction from the Almighty.

verses.text: Therefore shall all hands be faint, every man’s heart shall melt;
verses.plainText: So everyone’s hands will grow weak, and each person’s heart will lose courage.

verses.text: And they shall be afraid; pangs and sorrows shall take hold of them; they shall be amazed one at another; their faces shall be as flames.
verses.plainText: They will be afraid; pain and sorrow will grip them; they will look at each other in astonishment; their faces will be like flames.

verses.text: Behold, the day of the Lord cometh, cruel both with wrath and fierce anger, to lay the land desolate; and he shall destroy the sinners thereof out of it.
verses.plainText: The day of the Lord is coming, cruel with wrath and fierce anger, to make the land desolate; and he will destroy the sinners from it.

verses.text: For the stars of heaven and the constellations thereof shall not give their light; the sun shall be darkened in his going forth, and the moon shall not cause her light to shine.
verses.plainText: The stars of heaven and their constellations will not give their light; the sun will be darkened as it rises, and the moon will not shine.

verses.text: And I will punish the world for evil, and the wicked for their iniquity; I will cause the arrogancy of the proud to cease, and will lay down the haughtiness of the terrible.
verses.plainText: I will punish the world for evil and the wicked for their sins; I will put an end to the arrogance of the proud and bring down the haughtiness of the ruthless.

verses.text: I will make a man more precious than fine gold; even a man than the golden wedge of Ophir.
verses.plainText: I will make a person more valuable than fine gold, more rare than the pure gold of Ophir.

verses.text: Therefore, I will shake the heavens, and the earth shall remove out of her place, in the wrath of the Lord of Hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.
verses.plainText: I will shake the heavens, and the earth will move out of its place, in the wrath of the Lord of Hosts and on the day of his fierce anger.

verses.text: And it shall be as the chased roe, and as a sheep that no man taketh up; and they shall every man turn to his own people, and flee every one into his own land.
verses.plainText: It will be like a hunted deer, and like a sheep that no one gathers; everyone will return to his own people, and each person will flee to his own land.

verses.text: Every one that is proud shall be thrust through; yea, and every one that is joined to the wicked shall fall by the sword.
verses.plainText: Everyone who is proud will be pierced through, and everyone who joins with the wicked will be killed by the sword.

verses.text: Their children, also shall be dashed to pieces before their eyes; their houses shall be spoiled and their wives ravished.
verses.plainText: Their children will be smashed to pieces in front of them; their houses will be looted and their wives assaulted.

verses.text: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, which shall not regard silver and gold, nor shall they delight in it.
verses.plainText: I will stir up the Medes against them, who will not care about silver and gold, and will not take pleasure in it.

verses.text: Their bows shall also dash the young men to pieces, and they shall have no pity on the fruit of the womb; their eyes shall not spare children.
verses.plainText: Their bows will shatter young men, and they will have no pity on unborn children; they will not spare children.

verses.text: And Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldees’ excellency, shall be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.
verses.plainText: Babylon, the glory of kingdoms and the pride of the Chaldeans, will be like Sodom and Gomorrah when God destroyed them.

verses.text: It shall never be inhabited, neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation: neither shall the Arabian pitch tent there; neither shall the shepherds make their fold there.
verses.plainText: It will never be inhabited or lived in from generation to generation. The Arabian will not set up his tent there, and shepherds will not make their sheepfolds there.

verses.text: But wild beasts of the desert shall lie there; and their houses shall be full of doleful creatures; and owls shall dwell there, and satyrs shall dance there.
verses.plainText: Wild animals of the desert will live there, and their houses will be filled with sorrowful creatures. Owls will make their home there, and satyrs will dance there.

verses.text: And the wild beasts of the islands shall cry in their desolate houses, and dragons in their pleasant palaces; and her time is near to come, and her day shall not be prolonged. For I will destroy her speedily; yea, for I will be merciful unto my people, but the wicked shall perish.
verses.plainText: Wild animals will cry out in their deserted houses, and dragons will be in their once-beautiful palaces. Her time is almost here, and her day will not be delayed. I will destroy her quickly, for I will show mercy to my people, but the wicked will be destroyed.

verses.text: For the Lord will have mercy on Jacob, and will yet choose Israel, and set them in their own land; and the strangers shall be joined with them, and they shall cleave to the house of Jacob.
verses.plainText: The Lord will have mercy on Jacob and will again choose Israel, setting them in their own land. Strangers will join with them and will be united with the house of Jacob.

verses.text: And the people shall take them and bring them to their place; yea, from far unto the ends of the earth; and they shall return to their lands of promise. And the house of Israel shall possess them, and the land of the Lord shall be for servants and handmaids; and they shall take them captives unto whom they were captives; and they shall rule over their oppressors.
verses.plainText: The people will take them and bring them to their place, from distant lands to the ends of the earth, and they will return to their promised lands. The house of Israel will possess them, and the land of the Lord will have servants and handmaids. They will take captive those who once held them captive, and they will rule over their oppressors.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass in that day that the Lord shall give thee rest, from thy sorrow, and from thy fear, and from the hard bondage wherein thou wast made to serve.
verses.plainText: On that day, the Lord will give you rest from your sorrow, from your fear, and from the hard bondage you were forced to serve.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass in that day, that thou shalt take up this proverb against the king of Babylon, and say: How hath the oppressor ceased, the golden city ceased!
verses.plainText: On that day, you will speak this proverb against the king of Babylon and say: How the oppressor has ended, the golden city has come to an end!

verses.text: The Lord hath broken the staff of the wicked, the scepters of the rulers.
verses.plainText: The Lord has broken the staff of the wicked and the scepters of the rulers.

verses.text: He who smote the people in wrath with a continual stroke, he that ruled the nations in anger, is persecuted, and none hindereth.
verses.plainText: The one who struck the people in anger with constant blows, who ruled the nations with fury, is now persecuted, and no one stops it.

verses.text: The whole earth is at rest, and is quiet; they break forth into singing.
verses.plainText: The whole earth is at rest and quiet; people burst into song.

verses.text: Yea, the fir-trees rejoice at thee, and also the cedars of Lebanon, saying: Since thou art laid down no feller is come up against us.
verses.plainText: The fir trees rejoice over you, and the cedars of Lebanon say, “Since you have been brought down, no one has come to cut us down. ”

verses.text: Hell from beneath is moved for thee to meet thee at thy coming; it stirreth up the dead for thee, even all the chief ones of the earth; it hath raised up from their thrones all the kings of the nations.
verses.plainText: Hell below is stirred up to meet you when you arrive; it wakes the dead for you, including all the leaders of the earth; it has raised all the kings of the nations from their thrones.

verses.text: All they shall speak and say unto thee: Art thou also become weak as we? Art thou become like unto us?
verses.plainText: Everyone will speak and say to you, "Have you also become as weak as we are? Have you become like us?

verses.text: Thy pomp is brought down to the grave; the noise of thy viols is not heard; the worm is spread under thee, and the worms cover thee.
verses.plainText: Your pride has been brought down to the grave; the sound of your harps is no longer heard. Maggots are spread beneath you, and worms cover you.

verses.text: How art thou fallen from heaven, O Lucifer, son of the morning! Art thou cut down to the ground, which did weaken the nations!
verses.plainText: How you have fallen from heaven, O Lucifer, son of the morning! You have been cut down to the ground, you who weakened the nations!

verses.text: For thou hast said in thy heart: I will ascend into heaven, I will exalt my throne above the stars of God; I will sit also upon the mount of the congregation, in the sides of the north;
verses.plainText: You have said in your heart: I will ascend into heaven, I will raise my throne above the stars of God; I will also sit on the mount of the congregation, on the farthest sides of the north;

verses.text: I will ascend above the heights of the clouds; I will be like the Most High.
verses.plainText: I will rise above the heights of the clouds; I will make myself like the Most High.

verses.text: Yet thou shalt be brought down to hell, to the sides of the pit.
verses.plainText: But you will be brought down to hell, to the depths of the pit.

verses.text: They that see thee shall narrowly look upon thee, and shall consider thee, and shall say: Is this the man that made the earth to tremble, that did shake kingdoms?
verses.plainText: Those who see you will look closely at you and think about you, saying, “Is this the man who made the earth tremble and shook kingdoms? ”

verses.text: And made the world as a wilderness, and destroyed the cities thereof, and opened not the house of his prisoners?
verses.plainText: He made the world like a wilderness, destroyed its cities, and did not release his prisoners.

verses.text: All the kings of the nations, yea, all of them, lie in glory, every one of them in his own house.
verses.plainText: All the kings of the nations lie in glory, each one in his own house.

verses.text: But thou art cast out of thy grave like an abominable branch, and the remnant of those that are slain, thrust through with a sword, that go down to the stones of the pit; as a carcass trodden under feet.
verses.plainText: But you are thrown out of your grave like a disgusting branch, like the remains of those who were killed and stabbed with a sword, who go down among the stones of the pit; like a corpse trampled underfoot.

verses.text: Thou shalt not be joined with them in burial, because thou hast destroyed thy land and slain thy people; the seed of evil-doers shall never be renowned.
verses.plainText: You will not be buried with them, because you have destroyed your land and killed your people. The descendants of evildoers will never be famous.

verses.text: Prepare slaughter for his children for the iniquities of their fathers, that they do not rise, nor possess the land, nor fill the face of the world with cities.
verses.plainText: Prepare to destroy his children because of their fathers’ sins, so they won’t rise up, take possession of the land, or fill the earth with cities.

verses.text: For I will rise up against them, saith the Lord of Hosts, and cut off from Babylon the name, and remnant, and son, and nephew, saith the Lord.
verses.plainText: I will rise up against them, says the Lord of Hosts, and cut off from Babylon the name, the remnant, the son, and the nephew, says the Lord.

verses.text: I will also make it a possession for the bittern, and pools of water; and I will sweep it with the besom of destruction, saith the Lord of Hosts.
verses.plainText: I will make it a home for the bittern and pools of water, and I will sweep it away with the broom of destruction, says the Lord of Hosts.

verses.text: The Lord of Hosts hath sworn, saying: Surely as I have thought, so shall it come to pass; and as I have purposed, so shall it stand—
verses.plainText: The Lord of Hosts has sworn, saying: Just as I have planned, so it will happen; and just as I have intended, so it will stand—

verses.text: That I will bring the Assyrian in my land, and upon my mountains tread him under foot; then shall his yoke depart from off them, and his burden depart from off their shoulders.
verses.plainText: I will bring the Assyrian into my land, and on my mountains I will trample him underfoot; then his yoke will be removed from my people, and his burden will be taken off their shoulders.

verses.text: This is the purpose that is purposed upon the whole earth; and this is the hand that is stretched out upon all nations.
verses.plainText: This is the purpose planned for the whole earth, and this is the hand stretched out over all nations.

verses.text: For the Lord of Hosts hath purposed, and who shall disannul? And his hand is stretched out, and who shall turn it back?
verses.plainText: The Lord of Hosts has planned it, and who can cancel it? His hand is stretched out, and who can turn it back?

verses.text: In the year that king Ahaz died was this burden.
verses.plainText: This message came in the year that King Ahaz died.

verses.text: Rejoice not thou, whole Palestina, because the rod of him that smote thee is broken; for out of the serpent’s root shall come forth a cockatrice, and his fruit shall be a fiery flying serpent.
verses.plainText: Do not rejoice, all of Philistia, because the rod of the one who struck you is broken; for out of the serpent’s root will come a viper, and its offspring will be a fiery flying serpent.

verses.text: And the first-born of the poor shall feed, and the needy shall lie down in safety; and I will kill thy root with famine, and he shall slay thy remnant.
verses.plainText: The firstborn of the poor will have food, and the needy will rest in safety. I will destroy your root with famine, and he will kill your remnant.

verses.text: Howl, O gate; cry, O city; thou, whole Palestina, art dissolved; for there shall come from the north a smoke, and none shall be alone in his appointed times.
verses.plainText: Howl, gate; cry out, city; all of Palestina, you are destroyed. Smoke will come from the north, and no one will be alone at the time appointed.

verses.text: What shall then answer the messengers of the nations? That the Lord hath founded Zion, and the poor of his people shall trust in it.
verses.plainText: What will they say to the messengers of the nations? The Lord has established Zion, and the poor among his people will trust in it.

verses.text: Now I, Nephi, do speak somewhat concerning the words which I have written, which have been spoken by the mouth of Isaiah. For behold, Isaiah spake many things which were hard for many of my people to understand; for they know not concerning the manner of prophesying among the Jews.
verses.plainText: Now I, Nephi, want to talk a little about the words I have written, which were spoken by Isaiah. Isaiah said many things that are hard for many of my people to understand because they do not know the way the Jews prophesy.

verses.text: For I, Nephi, have not taught them many things concerning the manner of the Jews; for their works were works of darkness, and their doings were doings of abominations.
verses.plainText: I, Nephi, have not taught them much about the ways of the Jews, because their actions were works of darkness and their deeds were abominations.

verses.text: Wherefore, I write unto my people, unto all those that shall receive hereafter these things which I write, that they may know the judgments of God, that they come upon all nations, according to the word which he hath spoken.
verses.plainText: I am writing to my people, to all those who will receive these things I write in the future, so they may know the judgments of God that come upon all nations, according to the word he has spoken.

verses.text: Wherefore, hearken, O my people, which are of the house of Israel, and give ear unto my words; for because the words of Isaiah are not plain unto you, nevertheless they are plain unto all those that are filled with the spirit of prophecy. But I give unto you a prophecy, according to the spirit which is in me; wherefore I shall prophesy according to the plainness which hath been with me from the time that I came out from Jerusalem with my father; for behold, my soul delighteth in plainness unto my people, that they may learn.
verses.plainText: Listen, my people of the house of Israel, and pay attention to my words. The words of Isaiah aren’t clear to you, but they are clear to all who are filled with the spirit of prophecy. I’m giving you a prophecy, according to the spirit within me, and I will prophesy with the same plainness I’ve used since I left Jerusalem with my father.
