verses.text: And it came to pass that Moroni took a small number of men, according to the desire of Pahoran, and gave Lehi and Teancum command over the remainder of his army, and took his march towards the land of Gideon.
verses.plainText: Moroni took a small number of men, as Pahoran wanted, and put Lehi and Teancum in charge of the rest of his army, then marched toward the land of Gideon.

verses.text: And he did raise the standard of liberty in whatsoever place he did enter, and gained whatsoever force he could in all his march towards the land of Gideon.
verses.plainText: He raised the standard of liberty everywhere he went and gathered whatever forces he could as he marched toward the land of Gideon.

verses.text: And it came to pass that thousands did flock unto his standard, and did take up their swords in the defence of their freedom, that they might not come into bondage.
verses.plainText: Thousands gathered to his banner and took up their swords to defend their freedom, so they would not be brought into bondage.

verses.text: And thus, when Moroni had gathered together whatsoever men he could in all his march, he came to the land of Gideon; and uniting his forces with those of Pahoran they became exceedingly strong, even stronger than the men of Pachus, who was the king of those dissenters who had driven the freemen out of the land of Zarahemla and had taken possession of the land.
verses.plainText: When Moroni had gathered all the men he could during his march, he came to the land of Gideon. He joined his forces with Pahoran’s, and together they became extremely strong—stronger than the men of Pachus, who was the king of the dissenters that had driven the freemen out of Zarahemla and taken control of the land.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Moroni and Pahoran went down with their armies into the land of Zarahemla, and went forth against the city, and did meet the men of Pachus, insomuch that they did come to battle.
verses.plainText: Moroni and Pahoran went with their armies into the land of Zarahemla and marched against the city, where they met the men of Pachus and engaged in battle.

verses.text: And behold, Pachus was slain and his men were taken prisoners, and Pahoran was restored to his judgment-seat.
verses.plainText: Pachus was killed, his men were taken as prisoners, and Pahoran was restored to his judgment seat.

verses.text: And the men of Pachus received their trial, according to the law, and also those king-men who had been taken and cast into prison; and they were executed according to the law; yea, those men of Pachus and those king-men, whosoever would not take up arms in the defence of their country, but would fight against it, were put to death.
verses.plainText: The men of Pachus were put on trial according to the law, along with the king-men who had been captured and imprisoned. They were executed according to the law. Anyone from the men of Pachus or the king-men who refused to take up arms to defend their country, and instead fought against it, was put to death.

verses.text: And thus it became expedient that this law should be strictly observed for the safety of their country; yea, and whosoever was found denying their freedom was speedily executed according to the law.
verses.plainText: So it was necessary for this law to be strictly followed for the safety of their country, and anyone who was found denying their freedom was quickly executed according to the law.

verses.text: And thus ended the thirtieth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi; Moroni and Pahoran having restored peace to the land of Zarahemla, among their own people, having inflicted death upon all those who were not true to the cause of freedom.
verses.plainText: This is how the thirtieth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi ended. Moroni and Pahoran restored peace to the land of Zarahemla among their own people, putting to death all those who were not loyal to the cause of freedom.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the commencement of the thirty and first year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi, Moroni immediately caused that provisions should be sent, and also an army of six thousand men should be sent unto Helaman, to assist him in preserving that part of the land.
verses.plainText: At the beginning of the thirty-first year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi, Moroni immediately arranged for provisions and an army of six thousand men to be sent to Helaman to help him protect that part of the land.

verses.text: And he also caused that an army of six thousand men, with a sufficient quantity of food, should be sent to the armies of Lehi and Teancum. And it came to pass that this was done to fortify the land against the Lamanites.
verses.plainText: He also ordered that an army of six thousand men, with enough food, be sent to support the armies of Lehi and Teancum. This was done to strengthen the land against the Lamanites.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Moroni and Pahoran, leaving a large body of men in the land of Zarahemla, took their march with a large body of men towards the land of Nephihah, being determined to overthrow the Lamanites in that city.
verses.plainText: Moroni and Pahoran, leaving a large group of men in the land of Zarahemla, marched with another large group toward the land of Nephihah, determined to defeat the Lamanites in that city.

verses.text: And it came to pass that as they were marching towards the land, they took a large body of men of the Lamanites, and slew many of them, and took their provisions and their weapons of war.
verses.plainText: As they were marching toward the land, they captured a large group of Lamanite men, killed many of them, and took their supplies and weapons of war.

verses.text: And it came to pass after they had taken them, they caused them to enter into a covenant that they would no more take up their weapons of war against the Nephites.
verses.plainText: After they captured them, they made them promise that they would never again take up weapons of war against the Nephites.

verses.text: And when they had entered into this covenant they sent them to dwell with the people of Ammon, and they were in number about four thousand who had not been slain.
verses.plainText: After they made this covenant, they sent them to live with the people of Ammon. There were about four thousand of them who had not been killed.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when they had sent them away they pursued their march towards the land of Nephihah. And it came to pass that when they had come to the city of Nephihah, they did pitch their tents in the plains of Nephihah, which is near the city of Nephihah.
verses.plainText: After they sent them away, they continued their march toward the land of Nephihah. When they arrived at the city of Nephihah, they set up their tents in the plains of Nephihah, which are near the city.

verses.text: Now Moroni was desirous that the Lamanites should come out to battle against them, upon the plains; but the Lamanites, knowing of their exceedingly great courage, and beholding the greatness of their numbers, therefore they durst not come out against them; therefore they did not come to battle in that day.
verses.plainText: Moroni wanted the Lamanites to come out and fight them on the plains, but the Lamanites, seeing how courageous they were and how many there were, didn’t dare come out to fight. So they didn’t go to battle that day.

verses.text: And when the night came, Moroni went forth in the darkness of the night, and came upon the top of the wall to spy out in what part of the city the Lamanites did camp with their army.
verses.plainText: When night came, Moroni went out in the darkness and climbed to the top of the wall to find out where in the city the Lamanites had set up camp with their army.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they were on the east, by the entrance; and they were all asleep. And now Moroni returned to his army, and caused that they should prepare in haste strong cords and ladders, to be let down from the top of the wall into the inner part of the wall.
verses.plainText: They were on the east, by the entrance, and all of them were asleep. Moroni returned to his army and had them quickly prepare strong cords and ladders to be lowered from the top of the wall into the inner part of the wall.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Moroni caused that his men should march forth and come upon the top of the wall, and let themselves down into that part of the city, yea, even on the west, where the Lamanites did not camp with their armies.
verses.plainText: Moroni ordered his men to march forward, climb to the top of the wall, and lower themselves into that part of the city on the west, where the Lamanites had not set up their armies.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they were all let down into the city by night, by the means of their strong cords and their ladders; thus when the morning came they were all within the walls of the city.
verses.plainText: They were all let down into the city at night using their strong cords and ladders. When morning came, they were all inside the city walls.

verses.text: And now, when the Lamanites awoke and saw that the armies of Moroni were within the walls, they were affrighted exceedingly, insomuch that they did flee out by the pass.
verses.plainText: When the Lamanites woke up and saw that Moroni’s armies were inside the walls, they were extremely frightened and fled out through the pass.

verses.text: And now when Moroni saw that they were fleeing before him, he did cause that his men should march forth against them, and slew many, and surrounded many others, and took them prisoners; and the remainder of them fled into the land of Moroni, which was in the borders by the seashore.
verses.plainText: When Moroni saw that they were running away from him, he had his men march against them. They killed many, surrounded many others, and took them as prisoners. The rest fled into the land of Moroni, which was on the borders by the seashore.

verses.text: Thus had Moroni and Pahoran obtained the possession of the city of Nephihah without the loss of one soul; and there were many of the Lamanites who were slain.
verses.plainText: Moroni and Pahoran regained control of the city of Nephihah without losing a single person, while many of the Lamanites were killed.

verses.text: Now it came to pass that many of the Lamanites that were prisoners were desirous to join the people of Ammon and become a free people.
verses.plainText: Many of the Lamanites who were prisoners wanted to join the people of Ammon and become a free people.

verses.text: And it came to pass that as many as were desirous, unto them it was granted according to their desires.
verses.plainText: Everyone who wanted it was given according to their desires.

verses.text: Therefore, all the prisoners of the Lamanites did join the people of Ammon, and did begin to labor exceedingly, tilling the ground, raising all manner of grain, and flocks and herds of every kind; and thus were the Nephites relieved from a great burden; yea, insomuch that they were relieved from all the prisoners of the Lamanites.
verses.plainText: All the Lamanite prisoners joined the people of Ammon and began working hard, farming the land, growing all kinds of crops, and raising flocks and herds of every kind. In this way, the Nephites were freed from a great burden, so much so that they no longer had any Lamanite prisoners.

verses.text: Now it came to pass that Moroni, after he had obtained possession of the city of Nephihah, having taken many prisoners, which did reduce the armies of the Lamanites exceedingly, and having regained many of the Nephites who had been taken prisoners, which did strengthen the army of Moroni exceedingly; therefore Moroni went forth from the land of Nephihah to the land of Lehi.
verses.plainText: After Moroni gained control of the city of Nephihah and took many prisoners, which greatly reduced the Lamanite armies, and after he recovered many Nephites who had been taken prisoner, which greatly strengthened his army, Moroni left the land of Nephihah and went to the land of Lehi.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when the Lamanites saw that Moroni was coming against them, they were again frightened and fled before the army of Moroni.
verses.plainText: When the Lamanites saw that Moroni was coming against them, they were frightened again and fled from Moroni’s army.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Moroni and his army did pursue them from city to city, until they were met by Lehi and Teancum; and the Lamanites fled from Lehi and Teancum, even down upon the borders by the seashore, until they came to the land of Moroni.
verses.plainText: Moroni and his army pursued them from city to city until they were met by Lehi and Teancum. The Lamanites fled from Lehi and Teancum, down to the borders by the seashore, until they came to the land of Moroni.

verses.text: And the armies of the Lamanites were all gathered together, insomuch that they were all in one body in the land of Moroni. Now, Ammoron, the king of the Lamanites, was also with them.
verses.plainText: The armies of the Lamanites were all gathered together in one group in the land of Moroni. Ammoron, the king of the Lamanites, was there with them.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Moroni and Lehi and Teancum did encamp with their armies round about in the borders of the land of Moroni, insomuch that the Lamanites were encircled about in the borders by the wilderness on the south, and in the borders by the wilderness on the east.
verses.plainText: Moroni, Lehi, and Teancum camped with their armies around the borders of the land of Moroni, so that the Lamanites were surrounded by wilderness on the south and on the east.

verses.text: And thus they did encamp for the night. For behold, the Nephites and the Lamanites also were weary because of the greatness of the march; therefore they did not resolve upon any stratagem in the night-time, save it were Teancum; for he was exceedingly angry with Ammoron, insomuch that he considered that Ammoron, and Amalickiah his brother, had been the cause of this great and lasting war between them and the Lamanites, which had been the cause of so much war and bloodshed, yea, and so much famine.
verses.plainText: So they camped for the night. The Nephites and the Lamanites were both exhausted from the long march, so they didn’t plan any strategies during the night, except for Teancum. He was extremely angry with Ammoron, because he believed that Ammoron and his brother Amalickiah were responsible for this long and terrible war between them and the Lamanites, which had caused so much fighting, bloodshed, and even famine.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Teancum in his anger did go forth into the camp of the Lamanites, and did let himself down over the walls of the city. And he went forth with a cord, from place to place, insomuch that he did find the king; and he did cast a javelin at him, which did pierce him near the heart. But behold, the king did awaken his servants before he died, insomuch that they did pursue Teancum, and slew him.
verses.plainText: Teancum, angry, went into the Lamanite camp and lowered himself over the city walls. He moved around with a cord until he found the king and threw a javelin at him, piercing him near the heart. But the king woke his servants before he died, and they chased Teancum and killed him.

verses.text: Now it came to pass that when Lehi and Moroni knew that Teancum was dead they were exceedingly sorrowful; for behold, he had been a man who had fought valiantly for his country, yea, a true friend to liberty; and he had suffered very many exceedingly sore afflictions. But behold, he was dead, and had gone the way of all the earth.
verses.plainText: When Lehi and Moroni learned that Teancum was dead, they were extremely sorrowful, for he had been a man who fought bravely for his country, a true friend to liberty, and he had suffered many severe afflictions. But he was dead, and had passed on like everyone eventually does.

verses.text: Now it came to pass that Moroni marched forth on the morrow, and came upon the Lamanites, insomuch that they did slay them with a great slaughter; and they did drive them out of the land; and they did flee, even that they did not return at that time against the Nephites.
verses.plainText: The next day, Moroni marched out and attacked the Lamanites, killing many of them. They drove the Lamanites out of the land, and the Lamanites fled and did not return to fight the Nephites at that time.

verses.text: And thus ended the thirty and first year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi; and thus they had had wars, and bloodsheds, and famine, and affliction, for the space of many years.
verses.plainText: That was the end of the thirty-first year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi. They had experienced wars, bloodshed, famine, and affliction for many years.

verses.text: And there had been murders, and contentions, and dissensions, and all manner of iniquity among the people of Nephi; nevertheless for the righteous’ sake, yea, because of the prayers of the righteous, they were spared.
verses.plainText: There were murders, arguments, divisions, and all kinds of wickedness among the people of Nephi; but for the sake of the righteous, and because of their prayers, they were spared.

verses.text: But behold, because of the exceedingly great length of the war between the Nephites and the Lamanites many had become hardened, because of the exceedingly great length of the war; and many were softened because of their afflictions, insomuch that they did humble themselves before God, even in the depth of humility.
verses.plainText: Because the war between the Nephites and the Lamanites lasted so long, many people became hardened, but many others were softened by their afflictions and humbled themselves before God in deep humility.

verses.text: And it came to pass that after Moroni had fortified those parts of the land which were most exposed to the Lamanites, until they were sufficiently strong, he returned to the city of Zarahemla; and also Helaman returned to the place of his inheritance; and there was once more peace established among the people of Nephi.
verses.plainText: After Moroni had fortified the parts of the land most exposed to the Lamanites until they were strong enough, he returned to the city of Zarahemla. Helaman also returned to his homeland, and peace was once again established among the people of Nephi.

verses.text: And Moroni yielded up the command of his armies into the hands of his son, whose name was Moronihah; and he retired to his own house that he might spend the remainder of his days in peace.
verses.plainText: Moroni gave command of his armies to his son, Moronihah, and he went home to spend the rest of his life in peace.

verses.text: And Pahoran did return to his judgment-seat; and Helaman did take upon him again to preach unto the people the word of God; for because of so many wars and contentions it had become expedient that a regulation should be made again in the church.
verses.plainText: Pahoran returned to his judgment seat, and Helaman began preaching the word of God to the people again. Because there had been so many wars and conflicts, it was necessary to make new regulations in the church.

verses.text: Therefore, Helaman and his brethren went forth, and did declare the word of God with much power unto the convincing of many people of their wickedness, which did cause them to repent of their sins and to be baptized unto the Lord their God.
verses.plainText: So Helaman and his brothers went out and taught the word of God with great power, convincing many people of their wickedness, which led them to repent of their sins and be baptized to the Lord their God.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they did establish again the church of God, throughout all the land.
verses.plainText: They reestablished the church of God throughout all the land.

verses.text: Yea, and regulations were made concerning the law. And their judges, and their chief judges were chosen.
verses.plainText: Regulations were made concerning the law, and their judges and chief judges were chosen.

verses.text: And the people of Nephi began to prosper again in the land, and began to multiply and to wax exceedingly strong again in the land. And they began to grow exceedingly rich.
verses.plainText: The people of Nephi began to prosper again in the land, multiplying and becoming very strong once more. They also started to grow extremely rich.

verses.text: But notwithstanding their riches, or their strength, or their prosperity, they were not lifted up in the pride of their eyes; neither were they slow to remember the Lord their God; but they did humble themselves exceedingly before him.
verses.plainText: But despite their riches, strength, and prosperity, they were not prideful; they quickly remembered the Lord their God and humbled themselves deeply before him.

verses.text: Yea, they did remember how great things the Lord had done for them, that he had delivered them from death, and from bonds, and from prisons, and from all manner of afflictions and he had delivered them out of the hands of their enemies.
verses.plainText: They remembered the great things the Lord had done for them—how he had saved them from death, from captivity, from prisons, from all kinds of hardships, and how he had delivered them from their enemies.

verses.text: And they did pray unto the Lord their God continually, insomuch that the Lord did bless them, according to his word, so that they did wax strong and prosper in the land.
verses.plainText: They prayed to the Lord their God continually, and the Lord blessed them according to his word, so they became strong and prospered in the land.

verses.text: And it came to pass that all these things were done. And Helaman died, in the thirty and fifth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.
verses.plainText: All these things were accomplished. Helaman died in the thirty-fifth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the commencement of the thirty and sixth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi, that Shiblon took possession of those sacred things which had been delivered unto Helaman by Alma.
verses.plainText: At the beginning of the thirty-sixth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi, Shiblon took possession of the sacred things that had been given to Helaman by Alma.

verses.text: And he was a just man, and he did walk uprightly before God; and he did observe to do good continually, to keep the commandments of the Lord his God; and also did his brother.
verses.plainText: He was a just man who lived uprightly before God. He continually did good and kept the commandments of the Lord his God, and so did his brother.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Moroni died also. And thus ended the thirty and sixth year of the reign of the judges.
verses.plainText: Moroni also died, and that was the end of the thirty-sixth year of the reign of the judges.

verses.text: And it came to pass that in the thirty and seventh year of the reign of the judges, there was a large company of men, even to the amount of five thousand and four hundred men, with their wives and their children, departed out of the land of Zarahemla into the land which was northward.
verses.plainText: In the thirty-seventh year of the reign of the judges, a large group of five thousand four hundred men, along with their wives and children, left the land of Zarahemla and went into the land to the north.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Hagoth, he being an exceedingly curious man, therefore he went forth and built him an exceedingly large ship, on the borders of the land Bountiful, by the land Desolation, and launched it forth into the west sea, by the narrow neck which led into the land northward.
verses.plainText: Hagoth, who was an extremely curious man, went out and built a very large ship on the borders of the land Bountiful, near the land Desolation, and launched it into the west sea by the narrow neck that led to the land northward.

verses.text: And behold, there were many of the Nephites who did enter therein and did sail forth with much provisions, and also many women and children; and they took their course northward. And thus ended the thirty and seventh year.
verses.plainText: Many of the Nephites entered there and sailed with plenty of provisions, along with many women and children. They traveled north. That was the end of the thirty-seventh year.

verses.text: And in the thirty and eighth year, this man built other ships. And the first ship did also return, and many more people did enter into it; and they also took much provisions, and set out again to the land northward.
verses.plainText: In the thirty-eighth year, this man built more ships. The first ship also returned, and many more people boarded it. They took plenty of provisions and set out again toward the land northward.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they were never heard of more. And we suppose that they were drowned in the depths of the sea. And it came to pass that one other ship also did sail forth; and whither she did go we know not.
verses.plainText: They were never heard from again. We believe they drowned in the depths of the sea. Another ship also set sail, but we don't know where it went.

verses.text: And it came to pass that in this year there were many people who went forth into the land northward. And thus ended the thirty and eighth year.
verses.plainText: That year, many people traveled to the land northward. That was the end of the thirty-eighth year.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the thirty and ninth year of the reign of the judges, Shiblon died also, and Corianton had gone forth to the land northward in a ship, to carry forth provisions unto the people who had gone forth into that land.
verses.plainText: In the thirty-ninth year of the reign of the judges, Shiblon also died, and Corianton had traveled by ship to the land northward to deliver provisions to the people who had settled there.

verses.text: Therefore it became expedient for Shiblon to confer those sacred things, before his death, upon the son of Helaman, who was called Helaman, being called after the name of his father.
verses.plainText: So Shiblon needed to give those sacred things, before he died, to Helaman’s son, who was also named Helaman after his father.

verses.text: Now behold, all those engravings which were in the possession of Helaman were written and sent forth among the children of men throughout all the land, save it were those parts which had been commanded by Alma should not go forth.
verses.plainText: All the engravings that Helaman had were written down and sent out among the people throughout the land, except for the parts that Alma had commanded should not be shared.

verses.text: Nevertheless, these things were to be kept sacred, and handed down from one generation to another; therefore, in this year, they had been conferred upon Helaman, before the death of Shiblon.
verses.plainText: These things were to be kept sacred and passed down from one generation to another. So, in this year, they were given to Helaman before Shiblon died.

verses.text: And it came to pass also in this year that there were some dissenters who had gone forth unto the Lamanites; and they were stirred up again to anger against the Nephites.
verses.plainText: Also in this year, some dissenters went over to the Lamanites, and they were stirred up again to anger against the Nephites.

verses.text: And also in this same year they came down with a numerous army to war against the people of Moronihah, or against the army of Moronihah, in the which they were beaten and driven back again to their own lands, suffering great loss.
verses.plainText: Also in that same year, they came down with a large army to fight against the people of Moronihah, or against Moronihah’s army, but they were defeated and driven back to their own lands, suffering heavy losses.

verses.text: And thus ended the thirty and ninth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.
verses.plainText: That was the end of the thirty-ninth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.

verses.text: And thus ended the account of Alma, and Helaman his son, and also Shiblon, who was his son.
verses.plainText: This is the end of the account of Alma, his son Helaman, and also Shiblon, who was his son.

verses.text: And now behold, it came to pass in the commencement of the fortieth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi, there began to be a serious difficulty among the people of the Nephites.
verses.plainText: At the beginning of the fortieth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi, a serious difficulty began among the Nephites.

verses.text: For behold, Pahoran had died, and gone the way of all the earth; therefore there began to be a serious contention concerning who should have the judgment-seat among the brethren, who were the sons of Pahoran.
verses.plainText: Pahoran had died and passed away like everyone else, so a serious disagreement began among his sons about who should have the judgment-seat.

verses.text: Now these are their names who did contend for the judgment-seat, who did also cause the people to contend: Pahoran, Paanchi, and Pacumeni.
verses.plainText: Their names, who competed for the judgment-seat and caused the people to argue, were Pahoran, Paanchi, and Pacumeni.

verses.text: Now these are not all the sons of Pahoran, (for he had many) but these are they who did contend for the judgment-seat; therefore, they did cause three divisions among the people.
verses.plainText: These are not all the sons of Pahoran, because he had many, but these are the ones who competed for the judgment-seat. As a result, they caused three divisions among the people.

verses.text: Nevertheless, it came to pass that Pahoran was appointed by the voice of the people to be chief judge and a governor over the people of Nephi.
verses.plainText: However, Pahoran was chosen by the voice of the people to be chief judge and governor over the people of Nephi.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Pacumeni, when he saw that he could not obtain the judgment-seat, he did unite with the voice of the people.
verses.plainText: When Pacumeni saw that he could not obtain the judgment-seat, he joined with the voice of the people.

verses.text: But behold, Paanchi, and that part of the people that were desirous that he should be their governor, was exceedingly wroth; therefore, he was about to flatter away those people to rise up in rebellion against their brethren.
verses.plainText: Paanchi and the group of people who wanted him to be their governor were extremely angry; so he was about to persuade those people to rebel against their brothers.

verses.text: And it came to pass as he was about to do this, behold, he was taken, and was tried according to the voice of the people, and condemned unto death; for he had raised up in rebellion and sought to destroy the liberty of the people.
verses.plainText: As he was about to do this, he was captured, tried according to the voice of the people, and sentenced to death because he had started a rebellion and tried to destroy the people's freedom.

verses.text: Now when those people who were desirous that he should be their governor saw that he was condemned unto death, therefore they were angry, and behold, they sent forth one Kishkumen, even to the judgment-seat of Pahoran, and murdered Pahoran as he sat upon the judgment-seat.
verses.plainText: When the people who wanted him to be their governor saw that he was sentenced to death, they became angry and sent a man named Kishkumen to the judgment seat of Pahoran, and Kishkumen killed Pahoran as he sat on the judgment seat.

verses.text: And he was pursued by the servants of Pahoran; but behold, so speedy was the flight of Kishkumen that no man could overtake him.
verses.plainText: He was chased by the servants of Pahoran, but Kishkumen fled so quickly that no one could catch him.

verses.text: And he went unto those that sent him, and they all entered into a covenant, yea, swearing by their everlasting Maker, that they would tell no man that Kishkumen had murdered Pahoran.
verses.plainText: He went to those who had sent him, and they all made a covenant, swearing by their everlasting Maker that they would not tell anyone that Kishkumen had murdered Pahoran.

verses.text: Therefore, Kishkumen was not known among the people of Nephi, for he was in disguise at the time that he murdered Pahoran. And Kishkumen and his band, who had covenanted with him, did mingle themselves among the people, in a manner that they all could not be found; but as many as were found were condemned unto death.
verses.plainText: So Kishkumen was not recognized among the people of Nephi, because he was in disguise when he killed Pahoran. Kishkumen and his group, who had made a secret agreement with him, mixed in with the people so well that they couldn’t all be found; but everyone who was discovered was sentenced to death.

verses.text: And now behold, Pacumeni was appointed, according to the voice of the people, to be a chief judge and a governor over the people, to reign in the stead of his brother Pahoran; and it was according to his right. And all this was done in the fortieth year of the reign of the judges; and it had an end.
verses.plainText: Pacumeni was appointed, according to the voice of the people, to be chief judge and governor over the people, to rule in place of his brother Pahoran, and it was his right. All this happened in the fortieth year of the reign of the judges, and it came to an end.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the forty and first year of the reign of the judges, that the Lamanites had gathered together an innumerable army of men, and armed them with swords, and with cimeters and with bows, and with arrows, and with head-plates, and with breastplates, and with all manner of shields of every kind.
verses.plainText: In the forty-first year of the reign of the judges, the Lamanites gathered an innumerable army of men and armed them with swords, scimitars, bows, arrows, headplates, breastplates, and all kinds of shields.

verses.text: And they came down again that they might pitch battle against the Nephites. And they were led by a man whose name was Coriantumr; and he was a descendant of Zarahemla; and he was a dissenter from among the Nephites; and he was a large and a mighty man.
verses.plainText: They came down again to fight against the Nephites. They were led by a man named Coriantumr, who was a descendant of Zarahemla and a dissenter from among the Nephites. He was a large and mighty man.

verses.text: Therefore, the king of the Lamanites, whose name was Tubaloth, who was the son of Ammoron, supposing that Coriantumr, being a mighty man, could stand against the Nephites, with his strength and also with his great wisdom, insomuch that by sending him forth he should gain power over the Nephites—
verses.plainText: So the king of the Lamanites, named Tubaloth, who was the son of Ammoron, thought that Coriantumr, being a strong and wise man, could stand against the Nephites, and that by sending him out, he would gain power over the Nephites—

verses.text: Therefore he did stir them up to anger, and he did gather together his armies, and he did appoint Coriantumr to be their leader, and did cause that they should march down to the land of Zarahemla to battle against the Nephites.
verses.plainText: He stirred them up to anger, gathered his armies, appointed Coriantumr as their leader, and sent them to march down to the land of Zarahemla to fight against the Nephites.

verses.text: And it came to pass that because of so much contention and so much difficulty in the government, that they had not kept sufficient guards in the land of Zarahemla; for they had supposed that the Lamanites durst not come into the heart of their lands to attack that great city Zarahemla.
verses.plainText: Because there was so much contention and difficulty in the government, they hadn’t kept enough guards in the land of Zarahemla, since they thought the Lamanites wouldn’t dare come into the center of their lands to attack the great city of Zarahemla.

verses.text: But it came to pass that Coriantumr did march forth at the head of his numerous host, and came upon the inhabitants of the city, and their march was with such exceedingly great speed that there was no time for the Nephites to gather together their armies.
verses.plainText: Coriantumr marched at the front of his large army and attacked the people in the city, moving so quickly that the Nephites had no time to gather their armies.

verses.text: Therefore Coriantumr did cut down the watch by the entrance of the city, and did march forth with his whole army into the city, and they did slay every one who did oppose them, insomuch that they did take possession of the whole city.
verses.plainText: So Coriantumr killed the guards at the entrance of the city, then marched in with his entire army, and they killed everyone who tried to resist them, taking control of the whole city.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Pacumeni, who was the chief judge, did flee before Coriantumr, even to the walls of the city. And it came to pass that Coriantumr did smite him against the wall, insomuch that he died. And thus ended the days of Pacumeni.
verses.plainText: Pacumeni, who was the chief judge, fled from Coriantumr all the way to the city walls. Coriantumr struck him against the wall so hard that he died. That was the end of Pacumeni’s days.

verses.text: And now when Coriantumr saw that he was in possession of the city of Zarahemla, and saw that the Nephites had fled before them, and were slain, and were taken, and were cast into prison, and that he had obtained the possession of the strongest hold in all the land, his heart took courage insomuch that he was about to go forth against all the land.
verses.plainText: When Coriantumr saw that he had control of the city of Zarahemla, saw that the Nephites had fled from them, had been killed, captured, or thrown into prison, and that he had taken possession of the strongest fortress in the whole land, he gained confidence and was about to march against the entire land.

verses.text: And now he did not tarry in the land of Zarahemla, but he did march forth with a large army, even towards the city of Bountiful; for it was his determination to go forth and cut his way through with the sword, that he might obtain the north parts of the land.
verses.plainText: He didn’t stay in the land of Zarahemla, but marched with a large army toward the city of Bountiful, because he was determined to fight his way through with the sword so he could take control of the northern parts of the land.

verses.text: And, supposing that their greatest strength was in the center of the land, therefore he did march forth, giving them no time to assemble themselves together save it were in small bodies; and in this manner they did fall upon them and cut them down to the earth.
verses.plainText: Assuming that their greatest strength was in the center of the land, he marched forward, giving them no time to gather except in small groups; in this way, they attacked them and cut them down.

verses.text: But behold, this march of Coriantumr through the center of the land gave Moronihah great advantage over them, notwithstanding the greatness of the number of the Nephites who were slain.
verses.plainText: Coriantumr’s march through the center of the land gave Moronihah a great advantage over them, even though many Nephites had been killed.

verses.text: For behold, Moronihah had supposed that the Lamanites durst not come into the center of the land, but that they would attack the cities round about in the borders as they had hitherto done; therefore Moronihah had caused that their strong armies should maintain those parts round about by the borders.
verses.plainText: Moronihah had assumed that the Lamanites wouldn’t dare enter the center of the land, but would attack the cities around the borders as they had done before. So Moronihah made sure their strong armies defended those areas along the borders.

verses.text: But behold, the Lamanites were not frightened according to his desire, but they had come into the center of the land, and had taken the capital city which was the city of Zarahemla, and were marching through the most capital parts of the land, slaying the people with a great slaughter, both men, women, and children, taking possession of many cities and of many strongholds.
verses.plainText: However, the Lamanites were not afraid as he wanted. They had entered the center of the land, captured the capital city of Zarahemla, and were moving through the most important parts of the land, killing many people—men, women, and children—and taking control of many cities and strongholds.

verses.text: But when Moronihah had discovered this, he immediately sent forth Lehi with an army round about to head them before they should come to the land Bountiful.
verses.plainText: When Moronihah discovered this, he immediately sent Lehi with an army to intercept them before they could reach the land Bountiful.

verses.text: And thus he did; and he did head them before they came to the land Bountiful, and gave unto them battle, insomuch that they began to retreat back towards the land of Zarahemla.
verses.plainText: He did just that; he confronted them before they reached the land of Bountiful and fought against them, causing them to start retreating back toward the land of Zarahemla.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Moronihah did head them in their retreat, and did give unto them battle, insomuch that it became an exceedingly bloody battle; yea, many were slain, and among the number who were slain Coriantumr was also found.
verses.plainText: Moronihah intercepted them as they retreated and fought against them, resulting in an extremely bloody battle. Many were killed, and among those who died was Coriantumr.

verses.text: And now, behold, the Lamanites could not retreat either way, neither on the north, nor on the south, nor on the east, nor on the west, for they were surrounded on every hand by the Nephites.
verses.plainText: The Lamanites could not retreat in any direction—north, south, east, or west—because the Nephites had surrounded them on all sides.

verses.text: And thus had Coriantumr plunged the Lamanites into the midst of the Nephites, insomuch that they were in the power of the Nephites, and he himself was slain, and the Lamanites did yield themselves into the hands of the Nephites.
verses.plainText: In this way, Coriantumr led the Lamanites deep into the Nephite territory, so they ended up under the Nephites’ control. Coriantumr was killed, and the Lamanites surrendered to the Nephites.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Moronihah took possession of the city of Zarahemla again, and caused that the Lamanites who had been taken prisoners should depart out of the land in peace.
verses.plainText: Moronihah took control of the city of Zarahemla again and made sure that the Lamanites who had been taken as prisoners left the land peacefully.

verses.text: And thus ended the forty and first year of the reign of the judges.
verses.plainText: That is how the forty-first year of the reign of the judges ended.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the forty and second year of the reign of the judges, after Moronihah had established again peace between the Nephites and the Lamanites, behold there was no one to fill the judgment-seat; therefore there began to be a contention again among the people concerning who should fill the judgment-seat.
verses.plainText: In the forty-second year of the reign of the judges, after Moronihah had restored peace between the Nephites and the Lamanites, there was no one to fill the judgment-seat. Because of this, the people began to argue again about who should take that position.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Helaman, who was the son of Helaman, was appointed to fill the judgment-seat, by the voice of the people.
verses.plainText: Helaman, the son of Helaman, was chosen by the people to fill the judgment-seat.

verses.text: But behold, Kishkumen, who had murdered Pahoran, did lay wait to destroy Helaman also; and he was upheld by his band, who had entered into a covenant that no one should know his wickedness.
verses.plainText: Kishkumen, who had murdered Pahoran, waited in secret to kill Helaman as well; and he was supported by his group, who had made a covenant that no one would discover his wickedness.

verses.text: For there was one Gadianton, who was exceedingly expert in many words, and also in his craft, to carry on the secret work of murder and of robbery; therefore he became the leader of the band of Kishkumen.
verses.plainText: There was a man named Gadianton who was very skilled with words and also in his craft, using them to carry out secret acts of murder and robbery. Because of this, he became the leader of Kishkumen’s group.

verses.text: Therefore he did flatter them, and also Kishkumen, that if they would place him in the judgment-seat he would grant unto those who belonged to his band that they should be placed in power and authority among the people; therefore Kishkumen sought to destroy Helaman.
verses.plainText: He flattered them, including Kishkumen, promising that if they made him the judge, he would give power and authority to those in his group; so Kishkumen tried to kill Helaman.

verses.text: And it came to pass as he went forth towards the judgment-seat to destroy Helaman, behold one of the servants of Helaman, having been out by night, and having obtained, through disguise, a knowledge of those plans which had been laid by this band to destroy Helaman—
verses.plainText: As he went toward the judgment seat to kill Helaman, one of Helaman’s servants, who had been out at night and had learned about the plans this group had made to kill Helaman by using a disguise,

verses.text: And it came to pass that he met Kishkumen, and he gave unto him a sign; therefore Kishkumen made known unto him the object of his desire, desiring that he would conduct him to the judgment-seat that he might murder Helaman.
verses.plainText: He met Kishkumen and gave him a sign. Kishkumen then told him what he wanted, asking him to lead him to the judgment seat so he could kill Helaman.

verses.text: And when the servant of Helaman had known all the heart of Kishkumen, and how that it was his object to murder, and also that it was the object of all those who belonged to his band to murder, and to rob, and to gain power, (and this was their secret plan, and their combination) the servant of Helaman said unto Kishkumen: Let us go forth unto the judgment-seat.
verses.plainText: When Helaman’s servant understood everything Kishkumen intended in his heart—that his goal was to murder, and that everyone in his group wanted to murder, rob, and gain power as part of their secret plan—the servant said to Kishkumen, “Let’s go to the judgment-seat. ”

verses.text: Now this did please Kishkumen exceedingly, for he did suppose that he should accomplish his design; but behold, the servant of Helaman, as they were going forth unto the judgment-seat, did stab Kishkumen even to the heart, that he fell dead without a groan. And he ran and told Helaman all the things which he had seen, and heard, and done.
verses.plainText: This made Kishkumen very happy, because he thought he would succeed in his plan. But as they were on their way to the judgment seat, Helaman’s servant stabbed Kishkumen in the heart, and he died instantly without making a sound. The servant then ran and told Helaman everything he had seen, heard, and done.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Helaman did send forth to take this band of robbers and secret murderers, that they might be executed according to the law.
verses.plainText: Helaman sent out orders to capture this group of robbers and secret murderers, so they could be executed according to the law.

verses.text: But behold, when Gadianton had found that Kishkumen did not return he feared lest that he should be destroyed; therefore he caused that his band should follow him. And they took their flight out of the land, by a secret way, into the wilderness; and thus when Helaman sent forth to take them they could nowhere be found.
verses.plainText: When Gadianton realized that Kishkumen didn’t return, he was afraid he would be destroyed. So he had his group follow him, and they escaped from the land by a secret route into the wilderness. When Helaman sent people to capture them, they couldn’t be found anywhere.

verses.text: And more of this Gadianton shall be spoken hereafter. And thus ended the forty and second year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.
verses.plainText: More will be said about this Gadianton later. This is how the forty-second year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi ended.

verses.text: And behold, in the end of this book ye shall see that this Gadianton did prove the overthrow, yea, almost the entire destruction of the people of Nephi.
verses.plainText: At the end of this book, you will see that this Gadianton was responsible for the overthrow and almost the complete destruction of the people of Nephi.

verses.text: Behold I do not mean the end of the book of Helaman, but I mean the end of the book of Nephi, from which I have taken all the account which I have written.
verses.plainText: I don’t mean the end of the book of Helaman, but the end of the book of Nephi, from which I have taken all the account I have written.

verses.text: And now it came to pass in the forty and third year of the reign of the judges, there was no contention among the people of Nephi save it were a little pride which was in the church, which did cause some little dissensions among the people, which affairs were settled in the ending of the forty and third year.
verses.plainText: In the forty-third year of the reign of the judges, there was no conflict among the people of Nephi except for a little pride within the church, which caused some minor disagreements among the people. These issues were resolved by the end of the forty-third year.

verses.text: And there was no contention among the people in the forty and fourth year; neither was there much contention in the forty and fifth year.
verses.plainText: There was no contention among the people in the forty-fourth year, and there was not much contention in the forty-fifth year either.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the forty and sixth, yea, there was much contention and many dissensions; in the which there were an exceedingly great many who departed out of the land of Zarahemla, and went forth unto the land northward to inherit the land.
verses.plainText: In the forty-sixth year, there was a lot of contention and many disagreements; many people left the land of Zarahemla and traveled north to inherit the land.

verses.text: And they did travel to an exceedingly great distance, insomuch that they came to large bodies of water and many rivers.
verses.plainText: They traveled a very long distance, until they reached large bodies of water and many rivers.

verses.text: Yea, and even they did spread forth into all parts of the land, into whatever parts it had not been rendered desolate and without timber, because of the many inhabitants who had before inherited the land.
verses.plainText: They spread out into all parts of the land, into any areas that hadn’t been made desolate and without timber by the many people who had previously lived there.

verses.text: And now no part of the land was desolate, save it were for timber; but because of the greatness of the destruction of the people who had before inhabited the land it was called desolate.
verses.plainText: Now no part of the land was uninhabited, except where there was no timber; but because so many of the people who had previously lived there had been destroyed, it was called desolate.

verses.text: And there being but little timber upon the face of the land, nevertheless the people who went forth became exceedingly expert in the working of cement; therefore they did build houses of cement, in the which they did dwell.
verses.plainText: Since there was very little timber in the land, the people who moved there became very skilled at working with cement. So they built houses out of cement, and lived in them.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they did multiply and spread, and did go forth from the land southward to the land northward, and did spread insomuch that they began to cover the face of the whole earth, from the sea south to the sea north, from the sea west to the sea east.
verses.plainText: They multiplied and spread, moving from the land in the south to the land in the north, until they began to cover the entire land, from the southern sea to the northern sea, and from the western sea to the eastern sea.

verses.text: And the people who were in the land northward did dwell in tents, and in houses of cement, and they did suffer whatsoever tree should spring up upon the face of the land that it should grow up, that in time they might have timber to build their houses, yea, their cities, and their temples, and their synagogues, and their sanctuaries, and all manner of their buildings.
verses.plainText: The people in the land northward lived in tents and in houses made of cement, and they allowed any tree that grew on the land to keep growing so that, over time, they would have timber to build their houses, cities, temples, synagogues, sanctuaries, and all kinds of other buildings.

verses.text: And it came to pass as timber was exceedingly scarce in the land northward, they did send forth much by the way of shipping.
verses.plainText: Because timber was very scarce in the land northward, they sent a lot of it there by ship.

verses.text: And thus they did enable the people in the land northward that they might build many cities, both of wood and of cement.
verses.plainText: In this way, they helped the people in the land northward so they could build many cities, made of both wood and cement.

verses.text: And it came to pass that there were many of the people of Ammon, who were Lamanites by birth, did also go forth into this land.
verses.plainText: Many of the people of Ammon, who were Lamanites by birth, also went into this land.

verses.text: And now there are many records kept of the proceedings of this people, by many of this people, which are particular and very large, concerning them.
verses.plainText: There are many records kept about what these people have done, written by many of them, and these records are detailed and extensive.

verses.text: But behold, a hundredth part of the proceedings of this people, yea, the account of the Lamanites and of the Nephites, and their wars, and contentions, and dissensions, and their preaching, and their prophecies, and their shipping and their building of ships, and their building of temples, and of synagogues and their sanctuaries, and their righteousness, and their wickedness, and their murders, and their robbings, and their plundering, and all manner of abominations and whoredoms, cannot be contained in this work.
verses.plainText: Not even a hundredth part of the history of this people—the account of the Lamanites and the Nephites, their wars, conflicts, divisions, preaching, prophecies, shipbuilding, construction of temples, synagogues, and sanctuaries, their righteousness and wickedness, murders, robberies, plundering, and all kinds of abominations and immoral acts—can be included in this record.

verses.text: But behold, there are many books and many records of every kind, and they have been kept chiefly by the Nephites.
verses.plainText: There are many books and many records of every kind, and they have been kept mainly by the Nephites.

verses.text: And they have been handed down from one generation to another by the Nephites, even until they have fallen into transgression and have been murdered, plundered, and hunted, and driven forth, and slain, and scattered upon the face of the earth, and mixed with the Lamanites until they are no more called the Nephites, becoming wicked, and wild, and ferocious, yea, even becoming Lamanites.
verses.plainText: These records have been passed down from one generation to another by the Nephites, until they fell into sin and were murdered, plundered, hunted, driven out, killed, and scattered across the earth, mixing with the Lamanites until they were no longer called Nephites, becoming wicked, wild, and fierce, even becoming Lamanites.

verses.text: And now I return again to mine account; therefore, what I have spoken had passed after there had been great contentions, and disturbances, and wars, and dissensions, among the people of Nephi.
verses.plainText: Now I return to my account; what I have spoken happened after there had been great arguments, disturbances, wars, and disagreements among the people of Nephi.

verses.text: The forty and sixth year of the reign of the judges ended;
verses.plainText: The forty-sixth year of the reign of the judges ended.

verses.text: And it came to pass that there was still great contention in the land, yea, even in the forty and seventh year, and also in the forty and eighth year.
verses.plainText: There was still great contention in the land during the forty-seventh year, and also in the forty-eighth year.

verses.text: Nevertheless Helaman did fill the judgment-seat with justice and equity; yea, he did observe to keep the statutes, and the judgments, and the commandments of God; and he did do that which was right in the sight of God continually; and he did walk after the ways of his father, insomuch that he did prosper in the land.
verses.plainText: However, Helaman filled the judgment-seat with justice and fairness; he made sure to keep the statutes, judgments, and commandments of God, and he did what was right in God’s sight at all times. He followed the ways of his father so that he prospered in the land.

verses.text: And it came to pass that he had two sons. He gave unto the eldest the name of Nephi, and unto the youngest, the name of Lehi. And they began to grow up unto the Lord.
verses.plainText: He had two sons. He gave the oldest the name Nephi, and the youngest the name Lehi. They began to grow up in the ways of the Lord.

verses.text: And it came to pass that the wars and contentions began to cease, in a small degree, among the people of the Nephites, in the latter end of the forty and eighth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.
verses.plainText: The wars and conflicts began to decrease somewhat among the Nephite people toward the end of the forty-eighth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the forty and ninth year of the reign of the judges, there was continual peace established in the land, all save it were the secret combinations which Gadianton the robber had established in the more settled parts of the land, which at that time were not known unto those who were at the head of government; therefore they were not destroyed out of the land.
verses.plainText: In the forty-ninth year of the reign of the judges, there was continual peace in the land, except for the secret combinations that Gadianton the robber had set up in the more settled areas. At that time, those in charge of the government didn’t know about them, so they weren’t removed from the land.

verses.text: And it came to pass that in this same year there was exceedingly great prosperity in the church, insomuch that there were thousands who did join themselves unto the church and were baptized unto repentance.
verses.plainText: During that same year, the church experienced tremendous prosperity, and thousands of people joined the church and were baptized in repentance.

verses.text: And so great was the prosperity of the church, and so many the blessings which were poured out upon the people, that even the high priests and the teachers were themselves astonished beyond measure.
verses.plainText: The church prospered so much, and so many blessings were given to the people, that even the high priests and teachers were amazed.

verses.text: And it came to pass that the work of the Lord did prosper unto the baptizing and uniting to the church of God, many souls, yea, even tens of thousands.
verses.plainText: The work of the Lord prospered, leading to the baptism and uniting of many souls—tens of thousands—into the church of God.

verses.text: Thus we may see that the Lord is merciful unto all who will, in the sincerity of their hearts, call upon his holy name.
verses.plainText: This shows that the Lord is merciful to everyone who sincerely calls on his holy name.

verses.text: Yea, thus we see that the gate of heaven is open unto all, even to those who will believe on the name of Jesus Christ, who is the Son of God.
verses.plainText: This shows that the gate of heaven is open to everyone, including all who believe in the name of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

verses.text: Yea, we see that whosoever will may lay hold upon the word of God, which is quick and powerful, which shall divide asunder all the cunning and the snares and the wiles of the devil, and lead the man of Christ in a strait and narrow course across that everlasting gulf of misery which is prepared to engulf the wicked—
verses.plainText: We see that anyone who wants to can hold onto the word of God, which is living and powerful. It will cut through all the tricks, traps, and schemes of the devil, and guide the follower of Christ along a straight and narrow path across the endless gulf of misery prepared to swallow the wicked.

verses.text: And land their souls, yea, their immortal souls, at the right hand of God in the kingdom of heaven, to sit down with Abraham, and Isaac, and with Jacob, and with all our holy fathers, to go no more out.
verses.plainText: And bring their souls, their immortal souls, to the right hand of God in the kingdom of heaven, to sit with Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all our holy fathers, never to leave again.

verses.text: And in this year there was continual rejoicing in the land of Zarahemla, and in all the regions round about, even in all the land which was possessed by the Nephites.
verses.plainText: During this year, there was continual rejoicing in the land of Zarahemla and in all the surrounding regions, throughout all the land possessed by the Nephites.

verses.text: And it came to pass that there was peace and exceedingly great joy in the remainder of the forty and ninth year; yea, and also there was continual peace and great joy in the fiftieth year of the reign of the judges.
verses.plainText: There was peace and extremely great joy during the rest of the forty-ninth year, and there was also continual peace and great joy in the fiftieth year of the reign of the judges.

verses.text: And in the fifty and first year of the reign of the judges there was peace also, save it were the pride which began to enter into the church—not into the church of God, but into the hearts of the people who professed to belong to the church of God—
verses.plainText: In the fifty-first year of the reign of the judges, there was peace, except for the pride that began to enter the church—not into the church of God itself, but into the hearts of the people who claimed to belong to the church of God.

verses.text: And they were lifted up in pride, even to the persecution of many of their brethren. Now this was a great evil, which did cause the more humble part of the people to suffer great persecutions, and to wade through much affliction.
verses.plainText: They became prideful, even to the point of persecuting many of their brothers and sisters. This was a great evil, which caused the more humble people to suffer intense persecution and go through much hardship.

verses.text: Nevertheless they did fast and pray oft, and did wax stronger and stronger in their humility, and firmer and firmer in the faith of Christ, unto the filling their souls with joy and consolation, yea, even to the purifying and the sanctification of their hearts, which sanctification cometh because of their yielding their hearts unto God.
verses.plainText: However, they fasted and prayed often, and grew stronger and stronger in their humility, and firmer and firmer in their faith in Christ, filling their souls with joy and comfort, even to the purification and sanctification of their hearts, which sanctification comes because they yielded their hearts to God.

verses.text: And it came to pass that the fifty and second year ended in peace also, save it were the exceedingly great pride which had gotten into the hearts of the people; and it was because of their exceedingly great riches and their prosperity in the land; and it did grow upon them from day to day.
verses.plainText: The fifty-second year also ended in peace, except for the extremely great pride that had entered the hearts of the people. This was because of their great riches and prosperity in the land, and their pride grew day by day.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the fifty and third year of the reign of the judges, Helaman died, and his eldest son Nephi began to reign in his stead. And it came to pass that he did fill the judgment-seat with justice and equity; yea, he did keep the commandments of God, and did walk in the ways of his father.
verses.plainText: In the fifty-third year of the reign of the judges, Helaman died, and his oldest son Nephi became the leader in his place. Nephi judged with justice and fairness; he kept God's commandments and followed the ways of his father.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the fifty and fourth year there were many dissensions in the church, and there was also a contention among the people, insomuch that there was much bloodshed.
verses.plainText: In the fifty-fourth year, there were many disagreements in the church, and there was also conflict among the people, resulting in much bloodshed.

verses.text: And the rebellious part were slain and driven out of the land, and they did go unto the king of the Lamanites.
verses.plainText: The rebellious group were killed or driven out of the land, and they went to the king of the Lamanites.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they did endeavor to stir up the Lamanites to war against the Nephites; but behold, the Lamanites were exceedingly afraid, insomuch that they would not hearken to the words of those dissenters.
verses.plainText: They tried to persuade the Lamanites to go to war against the Nephites, but the Lamanites were extremely afraid and refused to listen to the dissenters.

verses.text: But it came to pass in the fifty and sixth year of the reign of the judges, there were dissenters who went up from the Nephites unto the Lamanites; and they succeeded with those others in stirring them up to anger against the Nephites; and they were all that year preparing for war.
verses.plainText: In the fifty-sixth year of the reign of the judges, some dissenters left the Nephites and joined the Lamanites. Together with others, they stirred up the Lamanites to anger against the Nephites, and they spent the entire year preparing for war.

verses.text: And in the fifty and seventh year they did come down against the Nephites to battle, and they did commence the work of death; yea, insomuch that in the fifty and eighth year of the reign of the judges they succeeded in obtaining possession of the land of Zarahemla; yea, and also all the lands, even unto the land which was near the land Bountiful.
verses.plainText: In the fifty-seventh year, they came down against the Nephites to battle and began the work of death, so much that in the fifty-eighth year of the reign of the judges, they succeeded in taking possession of the land of Zarahemla and also all the lands, even up to the land near Bountiful.

verses.text: And the Nephites and the armies of Moronihah were driven even into the land of Bountiful;
verses.plainText: The Nephites and Moronihah’s armies were driven all the way into the land of Bountiful.

verses.text: And there they did fortify against the Lamanites, from the west sea, even unto the east; it being a day’s journey for a Nephite, on the line which they had fortified and stationed their armies to defend their north country.
verses.plainText: There they fortified themselves against the Lamanites, from the west sea all the way to the east. It was a day's journey for a Nephite along the line they had fortified, where they stationed their armies to defend their northern country.

verses.text: And thus those dissenters of the Nephites, with the help of a numerous army of the Lamanites, had obtained all the possession of the Nephites which was in the land southward. And all this was done in the fifty and eighth and ninth years of the reign of the judges.
verses.plainText: So the Nephite dissenters, with the help of a large Lamanite army, took control of all the Nephite lands in the southern region. All of this happened during the fifty-eighth and fifty-ninth years of the reign of the judges.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the sixtieth year of the reign of the judges, Moronihah did succeed with his armies in obtaining many parts of the land; yea, they regained many cities which had fallen into the hands of the Lamanites.
verses.plainText: In the sixtieth year of the reign of the judges, Moronihah and his armies succeeded in taking back many parts of the land; they regained many cities that had fallen into the hands of the Lamanites.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the sixty and first year of the reign of the judges they succeeded in regaining even the half of all their possessions.
verses.plainText: In the sixty-first year of the reign of the judges, they succeeded in regaining even half of all their possessions.

verses.text: Now this great loss of the Nephites, and the great slaughter which was among them, would not have happened had it not been for their wickedness and their abomination which was among them; yea, and it was among those also who professed to belong to the church of God.
verses.plainText: This great loss of the Nephites, and the terrible slaughter among them, would not have happened if it weren’t for their wickedness and the abominations among them; and this was also true of those who claimed to belong to the church of God.

verses.text: And it was because of the pride of their hearts, because of their exceeding riches, yea, it was because of their oppression to the poor, withholding their food from the hungry, withholding their clothing from the naked, and smiting their humble brethren upon the cheek, making a mock of that which was sacred, denying the spirit of prophecy and of revelation, murdering, plundering, lying, stealing, committing adultery, rising up in great contentions, and deserting away into the land of Nephi, among the Lamanites—
verses.plainText: It was because of the pride in their hearts and their great wealth. They oppressed the poor, withheld food from the hungry, withheld clothing from the naked, struck their humble brothers on the cheek, mocked what was sacred, denied the spirit of prophecy and revelation, committed murder, plundering, lying, stealing, adultery, stirred up great contentions, and deserted to the land of Nephi among the Lamanites.

verses.text: And because of this their great wickedness, and their boastings in their own strength, they were left in their own strength; therefore they did not prosper, but were afflicted and smitten, and driven before the Lamanites, until they had lost possession of almost all their lands.
verses.plainText: Because of their great wickedness and their boasting in their own strength, they were left to their own strength. As a result, they did not prosper, but were afflicted, beaten, and driven by the Lamanites until they had lost possession of almost all their lands.

verses.text: But behold, Moronihah did preach many things unto the people because of their iniquity, and also Nephi and Lehi, who were the sons of Helaman, did preach many things unto the people, yea, and did prophesy many things unto them concerning their iniquities, and what should come unto them if they did not repent of their sins.
verses.plainText: Moronihah preached many things to the people because of their sin, and Nephi and Lehi, the sons of Helaman, also preached and prophesied to the people about their sins and what would happen to them if they did not repent.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they did repent, and inasmuch as they did repent they did begin to prosper.
verses.plainText: They repented, and as they repented, they began to prosper.

verses.text: For when Moronihah saw that they did repent he did venture to lead them forth from place to place, and from city to city, even until they had regained the one-half of their property and the one-half of all their lands.
verses.plainText: When Moronihah saw that they had repented, he took the risk to lead them from place to place and from city to city, until they had regained half of their property and half of all their lands.

verses.text: And thus ended the sixty and first year of the reign of the judges.
verses.plainText: That was the end of the sixty-first year of the reign of the judges.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the sixty and second year of the reign of the judges, that Moronihah could obtain no more possessions over the Lamanites.
verses.plainText: In the sixty-second year of the reign of the judges, Moronihah was unable to gain any more territory from the Lamanites.

verses.text: Therefore they did abandon their design to obtain the remainder of their lands, for so numerous were the Lamanites that it became impossible for the Nephites to obtain more power over them; therefore Moronihah did employ all his armies in maintaining those parts which he had taken.
verses.plainText: So they gave up their plan to take back the rest of their lands, because there were so many Lamanites that it was impossible for the Nephites to gain more power over them. Moronihah used all his armies to hold on to the areas he had already taken.

verses.text: And it came to pass, because of the greatness of the number of the Lamanites the Nephites were in great fear, lest they should be overpowered, and trodden down, and slain, and destroyed.
verses.plainText: Because there were so many Lamanites, the Nephites were very afraid that they would be overpowered, trampled, killed, and destroyed.

verses.text: Yea, they began to remember the prophecies of Alma, and also the words of Mosiah; and they saw that they had been a stiffnecked people, and that they had set at naught the commandments of God.
verses.plainText: They began to remember the prophecies of Alma and the words of Mosiah, and they realized they had been a stubborn people and had ignored the commandments of God.

verses.text: And that they had altered and trampled under their feet the laws of Mosiah, or that which the Lord commanded him to give unto the people; and they saw that their laws had become corrupted, and that they had become a wicked people, insomuch that they were wicked even like unto the Lamanites.
verses.plainText: They had changed and disregarded the laws of Mosiah, or what the Lord commanded him to give to the people. They saw that their laws had become corrupted and that they had become a wicked people, just as wicked as the Lamanites.

verses.text: And because of their iniquity the church had begun to dwindle; and they began to disbelieve in the spirit of prophecy and in the spirit of revelation; and the judgments of God did stare them in the face.
verses.plainText: Because of their sin, the church started to shrink, and people began to doubt the spirit of prophecy and the spirit of revelation. God's judgments were clearly before them.

verses.text: And they saw that they had become weak, like unto their brethren, the Lamanites, and that the Spirit of the Lord did no more preserve them; yea, it had withdrawn from them because the Spirit of the Lord doth not dwell in unholy temples—
verses.plainText: They saw that they had become weak, like their brothers, the Lamanites, and that the Spirit of the Lord no longer preserved them; it had withdrawn from them because the Spirit of the Lord does not dwell in unholy temples—

verses.text: Therefore the Lord did cease to preserve them by his miraculous and matchless power, for they had fallen into a state of unbelief and awful wickedness; and they saw that the Lamanites were exceedingly more numerous than they, and except they should cleave unto the Lord their God, they must unavoidably perish.
verses.plainText: So the Lord stopped preserving them by his miraculous and unmatched power, because they had fallen into unbelief and terrible wickedness; and they saw that the Lamanites were far more numerous than they were, and unless they held firmly to the Lord their God, they would surely be destroyed.

verses.text: For behold, they saw that the strength of the Lamanites was as great as their strength, even man for man. And thus had they fallen into this great transgression; yea, thus had they become weak, because of their transgression, in the space of not many years.
verses.plainText: They saw that the strength of the Lamanites was equal to their own, matching them man for man. They had fallen into this great transgression and had become weak because of it, in just a few years.

verses.text: And it came to pass that in this same year, behold, Nephi delivered up the judgment-seat to a man whose name was Cezoram.
verses.plainText: In that same year, Nephi gave up the judgment-seat to a man named Cezoram.

verses.text: For as their laws and their governments were established by the voice of the people, and they who chose evil were more numerous than they who chose good, therefore they were ripening for destruction, for the laws had become corrupted.
verses.plainText: Since their laws and governments were established by the voice of the people, and those who chose evil outnumbered those who chose good, they were becoming ready for destruction, because the laws had become corrupted.

verses.text: Yea, and this was not all; they were a stiffnecked people, insomuch that they could not be governed by the law nor justice, save it were to their destruction.
verses.plainText: And this was not all; they were a stubborn people, so much that they could not be governed by law or justice, except it led to their destruction.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Nephi had become weary because of their iniquity; and he yielded up the judgment-seat, and took it upon him to preach the word of God all the remainder of his days, and his brother Lehi also, all the remainder of his days;
verses.plainText: Nephi became weary because of their wickedness, so he gave up the judgment seat and dedicated himself to preaching the word of God for the rest of his life, and his brother Lehi did the same for the rest of his life.

verses.text: For they remembered the words which their father Helaman spake unto them. And these are the words which he spake:
verses.plainText: They remembered the words their father Helaman spoke to them. These are the words he said:
