verses.text: Behold, my sons, I desire that ye should remember to keep the commandments of God; and I would that ye should declare unto the people these words. Behold, I have given unto you the names of our first parents who came out of the land of Jerusalem; and this I have done that when you remember your names ye may remember them; and when ye remember them ye may remember their works; and when ye remember their works ye may know how that it is said, and also written, that they were good.
verses.plainText: My sons, I want you to remember to keep the commandments of God, and I want you to share these words with the people. I have given you the names of our first parents who came out of the land of Jerusalem, and I did this so that when you remember your names, you will remember them; and when you remember them, you will remember their works; and when you remember their works, you will know that it is said and written that they were good.

verses.text: Therefore, my sons, I would that ye should do that which is good, that it may be said of you, and also written, even as it has been said and written of them.
verses.plainText: So, my sons, I want you to do what is good, so that it can be said of you, and also written about you, just as it has been said and written about them.

verses.text: And now my sons, behold I have somewhat more to desire of you, which desire is, that ye may not do these things that ye may boast, but that ye may do these things to lay up for yourselves a treasure in heaven, yea, which is eternal, and which fadeth not away; yea, that ye may have that precious gift of eternal life, which we have reason to suppose hath been given to our fathers.
verses.plainText: And now, my sons, I have something more to ask of you. I want you to do these things not to boast, but to lay up for yourselves a treasure in heaven—one that is eternal and never fades away—so you may have that precious gift of eternal life, which we have reason to believe was given to our fathers.

verses.text: O remember, remember, my sons, the words which king Benjamin spake unto his people; yea, remember that there is no other way nor means whereby man can be saved, only through the atoning blood of Jesus Christ, who shall come, yea, remember that he cometh to redeem the world.
verses.plainText: Remember, my sons, the words King Benjamin spoke to his people. Remember that there is no other way or means for anyone to be saved except through the atoning blood of Jesus Christ, who will come. Remember that he is coming to redeem the world.

verses.text: And remember also the words which Amulek spake unto Zeezrom, in the city of Ammonihah; for he said unto him that the Lord surely should come to redeem his people, but that he should not come to redeem them in their sins, but to redeem them from their sins.
verses.plainText: Also remember the words Amulek spoke to Zeezrom in the city of Ammonihah. He told him that the Lord would surely come to redeem his people, but not to redeem them in their sins—rather, to redeem them from their sins.

verses.text: And he hath power given unto him from the Father to redeem them from their sins because of repentance; therefore he hath sent his angels to declare the tidings of the conditions of repentance, which bringeth unto the power of the Redeemer, unto the salvation of their souls.
verses.plainText: He has been given power from the Father to redeem them from their sins because of repentance. He has sent his angels to announce the message about the conditions of repentance, which lead to the power of the Redeemer and the salvation of their souls.

verses.text: And now, my sons, remember, remember that it is upon the rock of our Redeemer, who is Christ, the Son of God, that ye must build your foundation; that when the devil shall send forth his mighty winds, yea, his shafts in the whirlwind, yea, when all his hail and his mighty storm shall beat upon you, it shall have no power over you to drag you down to the gulf of misery and endless wo, because of the rock upon which ye are built, which is a sure foundation, a foundation whereon if men build they cannot fall.
verses.plainText: Now, my sons, remember that you must build your foundation on the rock of our Redeemer, who is Christ, the Son of God. Then, when the devil sends his powerful winds, his arrows in the whirlwind, and all his hail and mighty storm beat upon you, they will have no power to drag you down to misery and endless sorrow, because of the rock you are built on—a sure foundation, where if people build, they cannot fall.

verses.text: And it came to pass that these were the words which Helaman taught to his sons; yea, he did teach them many things which are not written, and also many things which are written.
verses.plainText: These were the words Helaman taught to his sons; he taught them many things that aren't written, as well as many things that are written.

verses.text: And they did remember his words; and therefore they went forth, keeping the commandments of God, to teach the word of God among all the people of Nephi, beginning at the city Bountiful;
verses.plainText: They remembered his words, so they went out, keeping God's commandments, to teach God's word to all the people of Nephi, starting in the city of Bountiful.

verses.text: And from thenceforth to the city of Gid; and from the city of Gid to the city of Mulek;
verses.plainText: And from there to the city of Gid; and from the city of Gid to the city of Mulek;

verses.text: And even from one city to another, until they had gone forth among all the people of Nephi who were in the land southward; and from thence into the land of Zarahemla, among the Lamanites.
verses.plainText: They traveled from one city to another, until they had visited all the people of Nephi who were in the southern land, and then went into the land of Zarahemla, among the Lamanites.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they did preach with great power, insomuch that they did confound many of those dissenters who had gone over from the Nephites, insomuch that they came forth and did confess their sins and were baptized unto repentance, and immediately returned to the Nephites to endeavor to repair unto them the wrongs which they had done.
verses.plainText: They preached with great power, so much that they confused many of the dissenters who had left the Nephites. These people came forward, confessed their sins, were baptized in repentance, and immediately returned to the Nephites to try to make right the wrongs they had done.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Nephi and Lehi did preach unto the Lamanites with such great power and authority, for they had power and authority, given unto them that they might speak, and they also had what they should speak given unto them—
verses.plainText: Nephi and Lehi preached to the Lamanites with great power and authority, because power and authority had been given to them so they could speak, and they were also given the words they should say—

verses.text: Therefore they did speak unto the great astonishment of the Lamanites, to the convincing them, insomuch that there were eight thousand of the Lamanites who were in the land of Zarahemla and round about baptized unto repentance, and were convinced of the wickedness of the traditions of their fathers.
verses.plainText: They spoke and greatly astonished the Lamanites, convincing them so much that eight thousand Lamanites in the land of Zarahemla and the surrounding area were baptized in repentance and realized the wickedness of their fathers’ traditions.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Nephi and Lehi did proceed from thence to go to the land of Nephi.
verses.plainText: Nephi and Lehi left from there to go to the land of Nephi.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they were taken by an army of the Lamanites and cast into prison; yea, even in that same prison in which Ammon and his brethren were cast by the servants of Limhi.
verses.plainText: They were captured by a Lamanite army and thrown into prison, the same prison where Ammon and his brothers had been put by Limhi’s servants.

verses.text: And after they had been cast into prison many days without food, behold, they went forth into the prison to take them that they might slay them.
verses.plainText: After they had been kept in prison for many days without food, the people went into the prison to take them so they could kill them.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Nephi and Lehi were encircled about as if by fire, even insomuch that they durst not lay their hands upon them for fear lest they should be burned. Nevertheless, Nephi and Lehi were not burned; and they were as standing in the midst of fire and were not burned.
verses.plainText: Nephi and Lehi were surrounded as if by fire, so much so that the others were afraid to touch them, fearing they might be burned. However, Nephi and Lehi were not burned; they stood in the middle of the fire and were not harmed.

verses.text: And when they saw that they were encircled about with a pillar of fire, and that it burned them not, their hearts did take courage.
verses.plainText: When they saw that they were surrounded by a pillar of fire and that it did not burn them, their hearts were filled with courage.

verses.text: For they saw that the Lamanites durst not lay their hands upon them; neither durst they come near unto them, but stood as if they were struck dumb with amazement.
verses.plainText: They saw that the Lamanites didn’t dare touch them or even come near them, but just stood there as if they were struck dumb with amazement.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Nephi and Lehi did stand forth and began to speak unto them, saying: Fear not, for behold, it is God that has shown unto you this marvelous thing, in the which is shown unto you that ye cannot lay your hands on us to slay us.
verses.plainText: Nephi and Lehi stood up and began to speak to them, saying, "Do not be afraid, for it is God who has shown you this marvelous thing, which shows you that you cannot lay your hands on us to kill us.

verses.text: And behold, when they had said these words, the earth shook exceedingly, and the walls of the prison did shake as if they were about to tumble to the earth; but behold, they did not fall. And behold, they that were in the prison were Lamanites and Nephites who were dissenters.
verses.plainText: When they said these words, the earth shook violently, and the walls of the prison shook as if they were about to collapse, but they did not fall. The people in the prison were Lamanites and Nephites who had become dissenters.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they were overshadowed with a cloud of darkness, and an awful solemn fear came upon them.
verses.plainText: They were covered by a cloud of darkness, and a terrible, solemn fear came over them.

verses.text: And it came to pass that there came a voice as if it were above the cloud of darkness, saying: Repent ye, repent ye, and seek no more to destroy my servants whom I have sent unto you to declare good tidings.
verses.plainText: A voice came from above the cloud of darkness, saying: Repent, repent, and stop trying to destroy my servants whom I have sent to declare good news to you.

verses.text: And it came to pass when they heard this voice, and beheld that it was not a voice of thunder, neither was it a voice of a great tumultuous noise, but behold, it was a still voice of perfect mildness, as if it had been a whisper, and it did pierce even to the very soul—
verses.plainText: When they heard this voice, they saw that it was not a voice of thunder or a loud, chaotic noise, but a quiet voice of perfect gentleness, like a whisper, and it pierced to the very soul—

verses.text: And notwithstanding the mildness of the voice, behold the earth shook exceedingly, and the walls of the prison trembled again, as if it were about to tumble to the earth; and behold the cloud of darkness, which had overshadowed them, did not disperse—
verses.plainText: Even though the voice was gentle, the earth shook violently, and the walls of the prison trembled again, as if they were about to collapse; and the cloud of darkness that had covered them did not go away—

verses.text: And behold the voice came again, saying: Repent ye, repent ye, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand; and seek no more to destroy my servants. And it came to pass that the earth shook again, and the walls trembled.
verses.plainText: The voice came again, saying: Repent, repent, for the kingdom of heaven is near; and stop trying to destroy my servants. The earth shook again, and the walls trembled.

verses.text: And also again the third time the voice came, and did speak unto them marvelous words which cannot be uttered by man; and the walls did tremble again, and the earth shook as if it were about to divide asunder.
verses.plainText: A third time the voice spoke to them, saying marvelous words that no human can express. The walls trembled again, and the earth shook as if it were about to split apart.

verses.text: And it came to pass that the Lamanites could not flee because of the cloud of darkness which did overshadow them; yea, and also they were immovable because of the fear which did come upon them.
verses.plainText: The Lamanites couldn’t run away because the cloud of darkness was covering them, and they were also unable to move because they were so afraid.

verses.text: Now there was one among them who was a Nephite by birth, who had once belonged to the church of God but had dissented from them.
verses.plainText: One of them was a Nephite by birth who had once been a member of the church of God but had left it.

verses.text: And it came to pass that he turned him about, and behold, he saw through the cloud of darkness the faces of Nephi and Lehi; and behold, they did shine exceedingly, even as the faces of angels. And he beheld that they did lift their eyes to heaven; and they were in the attitude as if talking or lifting their voices to some being whom they beheld.
verses.plainText: He turned around and saw, through the cloud of darkness, the faces of Nephi and Lehi; their faces were shining brightly, like the faces of angels. He saw that they lifted their eyes toward heaven, and they looked as if they were talking or lifting their voices to someone they could see.

verses.text: And it came to pass that this man did cry unto the multitude, that they might turn and look. And behold, there was power given unto them that they did turn and look; and they did behold the faces of Nephi and Lehi.
verses.plainText: The man cried out to the crowd, asking them to turn and look. Power was given to them so they turned and looked, and they saw the faces of Nephi and Lehi.

verses.text: And they said unto the man: Behold, what do all these things mean, and who is it with whom these men do converse?
verses.plainText: They said to the man, "What do all these things mean, and who are these men talking with?

verses.text: Now the man’s name was Aminadab. And Aminadab said unto them: They do converse with the angels of God.
verses.plainText: The man’s name was Aminadab. Aminadab said to them, “They are talking with the angels of God. ”

verses.text: And it came to pass that the Lamanites said unto him: What shall we do, that this cloud of darkness may be removed from overshadowing us?
verses.plainText: The Lamanites said to him, “What should we do so that this cloud of darkness will be removed from overshadowing us? ”

verses.text: And Aminadab said unto them: You must repent, and cry unto the voice, even until ye shall have faith in Christ, who was taught unto you by Alma, and Amulek, and Zeezrom; and when ye shall do this, the cloud of darkness shall be removed from overshadowing you.
verses.plainText: Aminadab said to them, "You need to repent and call out to the voice until you have faith in Christ, who was taught to you by Alma, Amulek, and Zeezrom. When you do this, the cloud of darkness will be removed from over you.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they all did begin to cry unto the voice of him who had shaken the earth; yea, they did cry even until the cloud of darkness was dispersed.
verses.plainText: They all began to cry out to the voice of the one who had shaken the earth; they cried out until the cloud of darkness was dispersed.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when they cast their eyes about, and saw that the cloud of darkness was dispersed from overshadowing them, behold, they saw that they were encircled about, yea every soul, by a pillar of fire.
verses.plainText: When they looked around and saw that the cloud of darkness had disappeared from above them, they saw that they were surrounded—every person—by a pillar of fire.

verses.text: And Nephi and Lehi were in the midst of them; yea, they were encircled about; yea, they were as if in the midst of a flaming fire, yet it did harm them not, neither did it take hold upon the walls of the prison; and they were filled with that joy which is unspeakable and full of glory.
verses.plainText: Nephi and Lehi were in the middle of them, surrounded as if by a flaming fire, but it did not harm them or touch the walls of the prison. They were filled with joy that is indescribable and full of glory.

verses.text: And behold, the Holy Spirit of God did come down from heaven, and did enter into their hearts, and they were filled as if with fire, and they could speak forth marvelous words.
verses.plainText: The Holy Spirit of God came down from heaven and entered into their hearts. They were filled as if with fire, and they were able to speak marvelous words.

verses.text: And it came to pass that there came a voice unto them, yea, a pleasant voice, as if it were a whisper, saying:
verses.plainText: A voice came to them—a pleasant voice, like a whisper—saying:

verses.text: Peace, peace be unto you, because of your faith in my Well Beloved, who was from the foundation of the world.
verses.plainText: Peace be with you because of your faith in my Beloved Son, who existed from the foundation of the world.

verses.text: And now, when they heard this they cast up their eyes as if to behold from whence the voice came; and behold, they saw the heavens open; and angels came down out of heaven and ministered unto them.
verses.plainText: When they heard this, they looked up as if to see where the voice was coming from, and they saw the heavens open. Angels came down from heaven and ministered to them.

verses.text: And there were about three hundred souls who saw and heard these things; and they were bidden to go forth and marvel not, neither should they doubt.
verses.plainText: About three hundred people saw and heard these things, and they were told to go out and not be amazed or doubt.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they did go forth, and did minister unto the people, declaring throughout all the regions round about all the things which they had heard and seen, insomuch that the more part of the Lamanites were convinced of them, because of the greatness of the evidences which they had received.
verses.plainText: They went out and ministered to the people, telling everyone in the surrounding regions about everything they had heard and seen, so much so that most of the Lamanites were convinced because of the overwhelming evidence they had received.

verses.text: And as many as were convinced did lay down their weapons of war, and also their hatred and the tradition of their fathers.
verses.plainText: All those who were convinced gave up their weapons of war, as well as their hatred and the traditions of their fathers.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they did yield up unto the Nephites the lands of their possession.
verses.plainText: They gave the lands they possessed to the Nephites.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when the sixty and second year of the reign of the judges had ended, all these things had happened and the Lamanites had become, the more part of them, a righteous people, insomuch that their righteousness did exceed that of the Nephites because of their firmness and their steadiness in the faith.
verses.plainText: When the sixty-second year of the reign of the judges ended, all these things had happened, and most of the Lamanites had become a righteous people, to the point that their righteousness was greater than that of the Nephites because of their firmness and steadiness in the faith.

verses.text: For behold, there were many of the Nephites who had become hardened and impenitent and grossly wicked, insomuch that they did reject the word of God and all the preaching and prophesying which did come among them.
verses.plainText: Many of the Nephites had become hardened, unrepentant, and extremely wicked, so much that they rejected the word of God and all the preaching and prophesying that came among them.

verses.text: Nevertheless, the people of the church did have great joy because of the conversion of the Lamanites, yea, because of the church of God, which had been established among them. And they did fellowship one with another and did rejoice one with another, and did have great joy.
verses.plainText: However, the people of the church had great joy because of the conversion of the Lamanites, and because the church of God had been established among them. They spent time together, rejoiced together, and felt great happiness.

verses.text: And it came to pass that many of the Lamanites did come down into the land of Zarahemla, and did declare unto the people of the Nephites the manner of their conversion, and did exhort them to faith and repentance.
verses.plainText: Many of the Lamanites went down to the land of Zarahemla and told the Nephite people how they were converted, encouraging them to have faith and repent.

verses.text: Yea, and many did preach with exceedingly great power and authority, unto the bringing down many of them into the depths of humility, to be the humble followers of God and the Lamb.
verses.plainText: Many preached with great power and authority, leading many people to become deeply humble and to follow God and the Lamb with humility.

verses.text: And it came to pass that many of the Lamanites did go into the land northward; and also Nephi and Lehi went into the land northward, to preach unto the people. And thus ended the sixty and third year.
verses.plainText: Many of the Lamanites went into the land northward, and Nephi and Lehi also went into the land northward to preach to the people. That is how the sixty-third year ended.

verses.text: And behold, there was peace in all the land, insomuch that the Nephites did go into whatsoever part of the land they would, whether among the Nephites or the Lamanites.
verses.plainText: There was peace throughout the land, so the Nephites could travel to any part of the land they wanted, whether among the Nephites or the Lamanites.

verses.text: And it came to pass that the Lamanites did also go whithersoever they would, whether it were among the Lamanites or among the Nephites; and thus they did have free intercourse one with another, to buy and to sell, and to get gain, according to their desire.
verses.plainText: The Lamanites also traveled wherever they wanted, whether among the Lamanites or the Nephites, and they freely interacted with each other to buy, sell, and make profit as they wished.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they became exceedingly rich, both the Lamanites and the Nephites; and they did have an exceeding plenty of gold, and of silver, and of all manner of precious metals, both in the land south and in the land north.
verses.plainText: They became extremely rich, both the Lamanites and the Nephites. They had an abundance of gold, silver, and all kinds of precious metals, both in the land south and in the land north.

verses.text: Now the land south was called Lehi and the land north was called Mulek, which was after the son of Zedekiah; for the Lord did bring Mulek into the land north, and Lehi into the land south.
verses.plainText: The land to the south was called Lehi, and the land to the north was called Mulek, named after the son of Zedekiah. The Lord brought Mulek into the northern land and Lehi into the southern land.

verses.text: And behold, there was all manner of gold in both these lands, and of silver, and of precious ore of every kind; and there were also curious workmen, who did work all kinds of ore and did refine it; and thus they did become rich.
verses.plainText: There was every kind of gold in both these lands, as well as silver and all kinds of precious ore. There were also skilled craftsmen who worked with all kinds of ore and refined it, and in this way they became rich.

verses.text: They did raise grain in abundance, both in the north and in the south; and they did flourish exceedingly, both in the north and in the south. And they did multiply and wax exceedingly strong in the land. And they did raise many flocks and herds, yea, many fatlings.
verses.plainText: They raised plenty of grain in both the north and the south, and they prospered greatly in both regions. Their population grew, and they became very strong in the land. They also raised many flocks and herds, including many fattened animals.

verses.text: Behold their women did toil and spin, and did make all manner of cloth, of fine-twined linen and cloth of every kind, to clothe their nakedness. And thus the sixty and fourth year did pass away in peace.
verses.plainText: Their women worked hard, spinning and making all kinds of cloth—fine-twined linen and every type of fabric—to clothe themselves. In this way, the sixty-fourth year passed in peace.

verses.text: And in the sixty and fifth year they did also have great joy and peace, yea, much preaching and many prophecies concerning that which was to come. And thus passed away the sixty and fifth year.
verses.plainText: In the sixty-fifth year they also had great joy and peace, with much preaching and many prophecies about what was to come. That is how the sixty-fifth year ended.

verses.text: And it came to pass that in the sixty and sixth year of the reign of the judges, behold, Cezoram was murdered by an unknown hand as he sat upon the judgment-seat. And it came to pass that in the same year, that his son, who had been appointed by the people in his stead, was also murdered. And thus ended the sixty and sixth year.
verses.plainText: In the sixty-sixth year of the reign of the judges, Cezoram was murdered by an unknown person as he sat on the judgment seat. In that same year, his son, who had been appointed by the people to take his place, was also murdered. That is how the sixty-sixth year ended.

verses.text: And in the commencement of the sixty and seventh year the people began to grow exceedingly wicked again.
verses.plainText: At the beginning of the sixty-seventh year, the people started becoming extremely wicked again.

verses.text: For behold, the Lord had blessed them so long with the riches of the world that they had not been stirred up to anger, to wars, nor to bloodshed; therefore they began to set their hearts upon their riches; yea, they began to seek to get gain that they might be lifted up one above another; therefore they began to commit secret murders, and to rob and to plunder, that they might get gain.
verses.plainText: The Lord had blessed them for so long with worldly riches that they hadn’t been stirred up to anger, wars, or bloodshed. Because of this, they started to set their hearts on their riches and began seeking wealth so they could be lifted above one another. They began to commit secret murders, and to rob and plunder, so they could gain more.

verses.text: And now behold, those murderers and plunderers were a band who had been formed by Kishkumen and Gadianton. And now it had come to pass that there were many, even among the Nephites, of Gadianton’s band. But behold, they were more numerous among the more wicked part of the Lamanites. And they were called Gadianton’s robbers and murderers.
verses.plainText: Those murderers and plunderers were a group formed by Kishkumen and Gadianton. There were many, even among the Nephites, who belonged to Gadianton’s group. However, they were even more numerous among the more wicked part of the Lamanites. They were called Gadianton’s robbers and murderers.

verses.text: And it was they who did murder the chief judge Cezoram, and his son, while in the judgment-seat; and behold, they were not found.
verses.plainText: They were the ones who murdered the chief judge Cezoram and his son while they were in the judgment seat, and they were not found.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that when the Lamanites found that there were robbers among them they were exceedingly sorrowful; and they did use every means in their power to destroy them off the face of the earth.
verses.plainText: When the Lamanites discovered that there were robbers among them, they were extremely sorrowful, and they used every means in their power to destroy them from the face of the earth.

verses.text: But behold, Satan did stir up the hearts of the more part of the Nephites, insomuch that they did unite with those bands of robbers, and did enter into their covenants and their oaths, that they would protect and preserve one another in whatsoever difficult circumstances they should be placed, that they should not suffer for their murders, and their plunderings, and their stealings.
verses.plainText: Satan stirred up the hearts of most of the Nephites, so they joined with those groups of robbers and entered into their covenants and oaths to protect and support each other in whatever difficult situations they faced, so they would not be punished for their murders, plundering, and stealing.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they did have their signs, yea, their secret signs, and their secret words; and this that they might distinguish a brother who had entered into the covenant, that whatsoever wickedness his brother should do he should not be injured by his brother, nor by those who did belong to his band, who had taken this covenant.
verses.plainText: They had their signs, their secret signs, and their secret words so they could recognize a brother who had entered into the covenant. This way, no matter what wickedness his brother did, he would not be harmed by him or by anyone else who belonged to the group and had made this covenant.

verses.text: And thus they might murder, and plunder, and steal, and commit whoredoms and all manner of wickedness, contrary to the laws of their country and also the laws of their God.
verses.plainText: In this way, they could murder, plunder, steal, commit sexual immorality, and do all kinds of wickedness, going against the laws of their country and the laws of their God.

verses.text: And whosoever of those who belonged to their band should reveal unto the world of their wickedness and their abominations, should be tried, not according to the laws of their country, but according to the laws of their wickedness, which had been given by Gadianton and Kishkumen.
verses.plainText: Anyone who belonged to their group and revealed their wickedness and abominations to the world would be judged, not by the laws of their country, but by the laws of their wickedness, which had been given by Gadianton and Kishkumen.

verses.text: Now behold, it is these secret oaths and covenants which Alma commanded his son should not go forth unto the world, lest they should be a means of bringing down the people unto destruction.
verses.plainText: These secret oaths and covenants are the ones that Alma commanded his son not to share with the world, because they could lead the people to destruction.

verses.text: Now behold, those secret oaths and covenants did not come forth unto Gadianton from the records which were delivered unto Helaman; but behold, they were put into the heart of Gadianton by that same being who did entice our first parents to partake of the forbidden fruit—
verses.plainText: Those secret oaths and covenants didn’t come to Gadianton from the records given to Helaman; instead, they were put into Gadianton’s heart by the same being who tempted our first parents to eat the forbidden fruit—

verses.text: Yea, that same being who did plot with Cain, that if he would murder his brother Abel it should not be known unto the world. And he did plot with Cain and his followers from that time forth.
verses.plainText: That same being plotted with Cain, telling him that if he murdered his brother Abel, it would not be known to the world. He continued to plot with Cain and his followers from that time on.

verses.text: And also it is that same being who put it into the hearts of the people to build a tower sufficiently high that they might get to heaven. And it was that same being who led on the people who came from that tower into this land; who spread the works of darkness and abominations over all the face of the land, until he dragged the people down to an entire destruction, and to an everlasting hell.
verses.plainText: It is that same being who inspired the people to build a tower tall enough to reach heaven. He also led the people who came from that tower into this land, spreading evil and abominations everywhere, until he brought the people to complete destruction and everlasting hell.

verses.text: Yea, it is that same being who put it into the heart of Gadianton to still carry on the work of darkness, and of secret murder; and he has brought it forth from the beginning of man even down to this time.
verses.plainText: It is that same being who put it into Gadianton’s heart to continue the work of darkness and secret murder; and he has brought it about from the beginning of man up to now.

verses.text: And behold, it is he who is the author of all sin. And behold, he doth carry on his works of darkness and secret murder, and doth hand down their plots, and their oaths, and their covenants, and their plans of awful wickedness, from generation to generation according as he can get hold upon the hearts of the children of men.
verses.plainText: He is the author of all sin. He continues his works of darkness and secret murder, passing down their plots, oaths, covenants, and plans of terrible wickedness from generation to generation, as much as he can influence the hearts of the children of men.

verses.text: And now behold, he had got great hold upon the hearts of the Nephites; yea, insomuch that they had become exceedingly wicked; yea, the more part of them had turned out of the way of righteousness, and did trample under their feet the commandments of God, and did turn unto their own ways, and did build up unto themselves idols of their gold and their silver.
verses.plainText: He had gained great influence over the hearts of the Nephites, so much that they became extremely wicked. Most of them turned away from righteousness, rejected God's commandments, followed their own desires, and made idols out of their gold and silver.

verses.text: And it came to pass that all these iniquities did come unto them in the space of not many years, insomuch that a more part of it had come unto them in the sixty and seventh year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.
verses.plainText: All these sins came upon them within just a few years, so that most of it had happened by the sixty-seventh year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.

verses.text: And they did grow in their iniquities in the sixty and eighth year also.
verses.plainText: They continued to increase in their wickedness during the sixty-eighth year as well.

verses.text: And thus we see that the Nephites did begin to dwindle in unbelief, and grow in wickedness and abominations, while the Lamanites began to grow exceedingly in the knowledge of their God; yea, they did begin to keep his statutes and commandments, and to walk in truth and uprightness before him.
verses.plainText: The Nephites began to lose their faith and become more wicked and corrupt, while the Lamanites started to grow greatly in their knowledge of God. They began to keep his statutes and commandments, and to live in truth and righteousness before him.

verses.text: And thus we see that the Spirit of the Lord began to withdraw from the Nephites, because of the wickedness and the hardness of their hearts.
verses.plainText: We see that the Spirit of the Lord began to withdraw from the Nephites because of their wickedness and the hardness of their hearts.

verses.text: And thus we see that the Lord began to pour out his Spirit upon the Lamanites, because of their easiness and willingness to believe in his words.
verses.plainText: We see that the Lord began to pour out his Spirit on the Lamanites because they were open and willing to believe his words.

verses.text: And it came to pass that the Lamanites did hunt the band of robbers of Gadianton; and they did preach the word of God among the more wicked part of them, insomuch that this band of robbers was utterly destroyed from among the Lamanites.
verses.plainText: The Lamanites hunted the band of Gadianton robbers, and they preached the word of God to the more wicked among them, so that this band of robbers was completely destroyed from among the Lamanites.

verses.text: And it came to pass on the other hand, that the Nephites did build them up and support them, beginning at the more wicked part of them, until they had overspread all the land of the Nephites, and had seduced the more part of the righteous until they had come down to believe in their works and partake of their spoils, and to join with them in their secret murders and combinations.
verses.plainText: On the other hand, the Nephites built them up and supported them, starting with the more wicked among them, until they had spread throughout all the land of the Nephites and had persuaded most of the righteous to believe in their actions, share in their stolen goods, and join them in their secret murders and conspiracies.

verses.text: And thus they did obtain the sole management of the government, insomuch that they did trample under their feet and smite and rend and turn their backs upon the poor and the meek, and the humble followers of God.
verses.plainText: So they took complete control of the government, and they oppressed, attacked, and rejected the poor, the meek, and the humble followers of God.

verses.text: And thus we see that they were in an awful state, and ripening for an everlasting destruction.
verses.plainText: We can see that they were in a terrible condition and becoming ready for eternal destruction.

verses.text: And it came to pass that thus ended the sixty and eighth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi.
verses.plainText: That is how the sixty-eighth year of the reign of the judges over the people of Nephi ended.

verses.text: Behold, now it came to pass in the sixty and ninth year of the reign of the judges over the people of the Nephites, that Nephi, the son of Helaman, returned to the land of Zarahemla from the land northward.
verses.plainText: In the sixty-ninth year of the reign of the judges over the Nephite people, Nephi, the son of Helaman, returned to the land of Zarahemla from the land to the north.

verses.text: For he had been forth among the people who were in the land northward, and did preach the word of God unto them, and did prophesy many things unto them;
verses.plainText: He had been among the people in the land northward, preaching the word of God to them and prophesying many things to them.

verses.text: And they did reject all his words, insomuch that he could not stay among them, but returned again unto the land of his nativity.
verses.plainText: They rejected all his words so completely that he couldn’t stay among them, and he returned to the land where he was born.

verses.text: And seeing the people in a state of such awful wickedness, and those Gadianton robbers filling the judgment-seats—having usurped the power and authority of the land; laying aside the commandments of God, and not in the least aright before him; doing no justice unto the children of men;
verses.plainText: Seeing the people in such terrible wickedness, with the Gadianton robbers filling the judgment seats and taking control and authority over the land, they set aside God's commandments and were not right before him at all, doing no justice to the people.

verses.text: Condemning the righteous because of their righteousness; letting the guilty and the wicked go unpunished because of their money; and moreover to be held in office at the head of government, to rule and do according to their wills, that they might get gain and glory of the world, and, moreover, that they might the more easily commit adultery, and steal, and kill, and do according to their own wills—
verses.plainText: They condemned the righteous because of their righteousness, let the guilty and wicked go unpunished because of their money, and held office at the head of government to rule and do whatever they wanted so they could gain wealth and worldly glory, and make it easier for themselves to commit adultery, steal, kill, and do whatever they pleased.

verses.text: Now this great iniquity had come upon the Nephites, in the space of not many years; and when Nephi saw it, his heart was swollen with sorrow within his breast; and he did exclaim in the agony of his soul:
verses.plainText: This great wickedness had come upon the Nephites in just a few years. When Nephi saw it, his heart was filled with sorrow, and he cried out in agony.

verses.text: Oh, that I could have had my days in the days when my father Nephi first came out of the land of Jerusalem, that I could have joyed with him in the promised land; then were his people easy to be entreated, firm to keep the commandments of God, and slow to be led to do iniquity; and they were quick to hearken unto the words of the Lord—
verses.plainText: I wish I could have lived in the days when my father Nephi first left Jerusalem, so I could have rejoiced with him in the promised land. Back then, his people were willing to listen, committed to keeping God's commandments, slow to do wrong, and quick to obey the words of the Lord.

verses.text: Yea, if my days could have been in those days, then would my soul have had joy in the righteousness of my brethren.
verses.plainText: If I had lived in those days, my soul would have found joy in the righteousness of my brothers.

verses.text: But behold, I am consigned that these are my days, and that my soul shall be filled with sorrow because of this the wickedness of my brethren.
verses.plainText: But I accept that these are my days, and my soul will be filled with sorrow because of the wickedness of my brothers.

verses.text: And behold, now it came to pass that it was upon a tower, which was in the garden of Nephi, which was by the highway which led to the chief market, which was in the city of Zarahemla; therefore, Nephi had bowed himself upon the tower which was in his garden, which tower was also near unto the garden gate by which led the highway.
verses.plainText: Nephi was on a tower in his garden, which was by the highway that led to the main market in the city of Zarahemla. He had bowed himself on the tower in his garden, and the tower was also near the garden gate by the highway.

verses.text: And it came to pass that there were certain men passing by and saw Nephi as he was pouring out his soul unto God upon the tower; and they ran and told the people what they had seen, and the people came together in multitudes that they might know the cause of so great mourning for the wickedness of the people.
verses.plainText: Some men were passing by and saw Nephi as he was pouring out his soul to God on the tower. They ran and told others what they had seen, and people gathered in large numbers to find out why there was such great mourning over the wickedness of the people.

verses.text: And now, when Nephi arose he beheld the multitudes of people who had gathered together.
verses.plainText: Now, when Nephi stood up, he saw the crowds of people who had gathered together.

verses.text: And it came to pass that he opened his mouth and said unto them: Behold, why have ye gathered yourselves together? That I may tell you of your iniquities?
verses.plainText: He opened his mouth and said to them, “Why have you gathered together? Is it so I can tell you about your sins? ”

verses.text: Yea, because I have got upon my tower that I might pour out my soul unto my God, because of the exceeding sorrow of my heart, which is because of your iniquities!
verses.plainText: Because I have gone up on my tower to pour out my soul to God, because my heart is filled with sorrow over your sins!

verses.text: And because of my mourning and lamentation ye have gathered yourselves together, and do marvel; yea, and ye have great need to marvel; yea, ye ought to marvel because ye are given away that the devil has got so great hold upon your hearts.
verses.plainText: Because of my mourning and lamentation, you have gathered together and are amazed; and you have good reason to be amazed. You should be amazed that you have allowed the devil to gain such a strong hold on your hearts.

verses.text: Yea, how could you have given way to the enticing of him who is seeking to hurl away your souls down to everlasting misery and endless wo?
verses.plainText: How could you have given in to the temptations of the one who is trying to throw your souls into everlasting misery and endless sorrow?

verses.text: O repent ye, repent ye! Why will ye die? Turn ye, turn ye unto the Lord your God. Why has he forsaken you?
verses.plainText: Repent, repent! Why will you die? Turn to the Lord your God. Why has he forsaken you?

verses.text: It is because you have hardened your hearts; yea, ye will not hearken unto the voice of the good shepherd; yea, ye have provoked him to anger against you.
verses.plainText: It is because you have hardened your hearts; you will not listen to the voice of the good shepherd; you have provoked him to anger against you.

verses.text: And behold, instead of gathering you, except ye will repent, behold, he shall scatter you forth that ye shall become meat for dogs and wild beasts.
verses.plainText: Instead of gathering you, unless you repent, he will scatter you so that you become food for dogs and wild animals.

verses.text: O, how could you have forgotten your God in the very day that he has delivered you?
verses.plainText: Oh, how could you have forgotten your God on the very day that he has delivered you?

verses.text: But behold, it is to get gain, to be praised of men, yea, and that ye might get gold and silver. And ye have set your hearts upon the riches and the vain things of this world, for the which ye do murder, and plunder, and steal, and bear false witness against your neighbor, and do all manner of iniquity.
verses.plainText: It is to gain wealth, to be praised by others, and so you can get gold and silver. You have set your hearts on the riches and empty things of this world, and because of this you murder, plunder, steal, lie about your neighbor, and commit all kinds of wickedness.

verses.text: And for this cause wo shall come unto you except ye shall repent. For if ye will not repent, behold, this great city, and also all those great cities which are round about, which are in the land of our possession, shall be taken away that ye shall have no place in them; for behold, the Lord will not grant unto you strength, as he has hitherto done, to withstand against your enemies.
verses.plainText: Because of this, sorrow will come to you unless you repent. If you do not repent, this great city and all the other great cities around it, which are in our land, will be taken from you so that you will have no place in them. The Lord will not give you strength, as he has before, to stand against your enemies.

verses.text: For behold, thus saith the Lord: I will not show unto the wicked of my strength, to one more than the other, save it be unto those that repent of their sins, and hearken unto my words. Now therefore, I would that ye should behold, my brethren, that it shall be better for the Lamanites than for you except ye shall repent.
verses.plainText: This is what the Lord says: I will not show my strength to the wicked, giving more to one than another, except to those who repent of their sins and listen to my words. So, my brothers, I want you to understand that it will be better for the Lamanites than for you unless you repent.

verses.text: For behold, they are more righteous than you, for they have not sinned against that great knowledge which ye have received; therefore the Lord will be merciful unto them; yea, he will lengthen out their days and increase their seed, even when thou shalt be utterly destroyed except thou shalt repent.
verses.plainText: They are more righteous than you, because they have not sinned against the great knowledge you have received. Therefore, the Lord will be merciful to them; he will extend their days and increase their descendants, even when you will be completely destroyed unless you repent.

verses.text: Yea, wo be unto you because of that great abomination which has come among you; and ye have united yourselves unto it, yea, to that secret band which was established by Gadianton!
verses.plainText: You will be cursed because of that great abomination that has come among you, and you have joined yourselves to it—to that secret group established by Gadianton!

verses.text: Yea, wo shall come unto you because of that pride which ye have suffered to enter your hearts, which has lifted you up beyond that which is good because of your exceedingly great riches!
verses.plainText: You will face sorrow because of the pride you have allowed into your hearts, which has made you think you are better than you should because of your extremely great riches.

verses.text: Yea, wo be unto you because of your wickedness and abominations!
verses.plainText: How terrible it will be for you because of your wickedness and abominations!

verses.text: And except ye repent ye shall perish; yea, even your lands shall be taken from you, and ye shall be destroyed from off the face of the earth.
verses.plainText: If you don’t repent, you will be destroyed; even your lands will be taken from you, and you will be wiped off the face of the earth.

verses.text: Behold now, I do not say that these things shall be, of myself, because it is not of myself that I know these things; but behold, I know that these things are true because the Lord God has made them known unto me, therefore I testify that they shall be.
verses.plainText: I’m not saying these things on my own, because I don’t know them by myself; but I know they are true because the Lord God has revealed them to me, so I testify that they will happen.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that when Nephi had said these words, behold, there were men who were judges, who also belonged to the secret band of Gadianton, and they were angry, and they cried out against him, saying unto the people: Why do ye not seize upon this man and bring him forth, that he may be condemned according to the crime which he has done?
verses.plainText: When Nephi finished speaking, some of the judges—who were also members of the secret band of Gadianton—became angry and shouted against him, saying to the people, "Why don’t you seize this man and bring him forward so he can be condemned for the crime he has committed?

verses.text: Why seest thou this man, and hearest him revile against this people and against our law?
verses.plainText: Why do you watch this man and listen to him speak against this people and against our law?

verses.text: For behold, Nephi had spoken unto them concerning the corruptness of their law; yea, many things did Nephi speak which cannot be written; and nothing did he speak which was contrary to the commandments of God.
verses.plainText: Nephi had spoken to them about the corruption of their law. Nephi said many things that cannot be written, and nothing he said was contrary to the commandments of God.

verses.text: And those judges were angry with him because he spake plainly unto them concerning their secret works of darkness; nevertheless, they durst not lay their own hands upon him, for they feared the people lest they should cry out against them.
verses.plainText: The judges were angry with him because he spoke plainly to them about their secret works of darkness; however, they didn’t dare lay their own hands on him, because they were afraid the people would cry out against them.

verses.text: Therefore they did cry unto the people, saying: Why do you suffer this man to revile against us? For behold he doth condemn all this people, even unto destruction; yea, and also that these our great cities shall be taken from us, that we shall have no place in them.
verses.plainText: So they called out to the people, saying, “Why do you let this man speak against us? He condemns all these people, even to destruction, and says that our great cities will be taken from us so we will have no place in them. ”

verses.text: And now we know that this is impossible, for behold, we are powerful, and our cities great, therefore our enemies can have no power over us.
verses.plainText: And now we know that this is impossible, because we are powerful and our cities are great, so our enemies cannot have any power over us.

verses.text: And it came to pass that thus they did stir up the people to anger against Nephi, and raised contentions among them; for there were some who did cry out: Let this man alone, for he is a good man, and those things which he saith will surely come to pass except we repent;
verses.plainText: They stirred up the people to anger against Nephi and caused arguments among them. Some people spoke out, saying, “Leave this man alone, for he is a good man, and the things he says will surely happen unless we repent. ”

verses.text: Yea, behold, all the judgments will come upon us which he has testified unto us; for we know that he has testified aright unto us concerning our iniquities. And behold they are many, and he knoweth as well all things which shall befall us as he knoweth of our iniquities;
verses.plainText: All the judgments he has testified about will come upon us, because we know he has spoken the truth about our sins. Our sins are many, and he knows everything that will happen to us just as well as he knows about our sins.

verses.text: Yea, and behold, if he had not been a prophet he could not have testified concerning those things.
verses.plainText: If he had not been a prophet, he could not have testified about those things.

verses.text: And it came to pass that those people who sought to destroy Nephi were compelled because of their fear, that they did not lay their hands on him; therefore he began again to speak unto them, seeing that he had gained favor in the eyes of some, insomuch that the remainder of them did fear.
verses.plainText: The people who wanted to destroy Nephi were forced, because they were afraid, not to touch him. So he began to speak to them again, seeing that he had gained favor with some of them, which made the rest of them afraid.

verses.text: Therefore he was constrained to speak more unto them saying: Behold, my brethren, have ye not read that God gave power unto one man, even Moses, to smite upon the waters of the Red Sea, and they parted hither and thither, insomuch that the Israelites, who were our fathers, came through upon dry ground, and the waters closed upon the armies of the Egyptians and swallowed them up?
verses.plainText: So he had to speak more to them, saying: My brothers, haven’t you read that God gave power to one man, Moses, to strike the waters of the Red Sea, and they parted so that the Israelites, our ancestors, crossed on dry ground, and then the waters closed over the Egyptian armies and swallowed them up?

verses.text: And now behold, if God gave unto this man such power, then why should ye dispute among yourselves, and say that he hath given unto me no power whereby I may know concerning the judgments that shall come upon you except ye repent?
verses.plainText: If God gave this man such power, then why do you argue among yourselves and say that He hasn’t given me any power to know about the judgments that will come upon you unless you repent?

verses.text: But, behold, ye not only deny my words, but ye also deny all the words which have been spoken by our fathers, and also the words which were spoken by this man, Moses, who had such great power given unto him, yea, the words which he hath spoken concerning the coming of the Messiah.
verses.plainText: You not only deny my words, but you also deny all the words spoken by our fathers, and the words spoken by Moses, who was given such great power—the words he spoke about the coming of the Messiah.

verses.text: Yea, did he not bear record that the Son of God should come? And as he lifted up the brazen serpent in the wilderness, even so shall he be lifted up who should come.
verses.plainText: Did he not testify that the Son of God would come? And just as he lifted up the bronze serpent in the wilderness, so will the one who is to come be lifted up.

verses.text: And as many as should look upon that serpent should live, even so as many as should look upon the Son of God with faith, having a contrite spirit, might live, even unto that life which is eternal.
verses.plainText: Anyone who looked at that serpent would live; in the same way, anyone who looks to the Son of God with faith and a humble heart can live, even to eternal life.

verses.text: And now behold, Moses did not only testify of these things, but also all the holy prophets, from his days even to the days of Abraham.
verses.plainText: Moses not only testified of these things, but so did all the holy prophets from his time back to the days of Abraham.

verses.text: Yea, and behold, Abraham saw of his coming, and was filled with gladness and did rejoice.
verses.plainText: Abraham saw that he would come, and was filled with gladness and rejoiced.

verses.text: Yea, and behold I say unto you, that Abraham not only knew of these things, but there were many before the days of Abraham who were called by the order of God; yea, even after the order of his Son; and this that it should be shown unto the people, a great many thousand years before his coming, that even redemption should come unto them.
verses.plainText: Abraham not only knew about these things, but there were many people before Abraham who were called by the order of God, even after the order of his Son. This was done to show the people, thousands of years before his coming, that redemption would come to them.

verses.text: And now I would that ye should know, that even since the days of Abraham there have been many prophets that have testified these things; yea, behold, the prophet Zenos did testify boldly; for the which he was slain.
verses.plainText: I want you to know that ever since the days of Abraham, many prophets have testified of these things. The prophet Zenos testified boldly about them, and because of this, he was killed.

verses.text: And behold, also Zenock, and also Ezias, and also Isaiah, and Jeremiah, (Jeremiah being that same prophet who testified of the destruction of Jerusalem) and now we know that Jerusalem was destroyed according to the words of Jeremiah. O then why not the Son of God come, according to his prophecy?
verses.plainText: Zenock, Ezias, Isaiah, and Jeremiah—Jeremiah being the prophet who testified about the destruction of Jerusalem—and now we know that Jerusalem was destroyed just as Jeremiah said. So why couldn’t the Son of God come, just as he prophesied?

verses.text: And now will you dispute that Jerusalem was destroyed? Will ye say that the sons of Zedekiah were not slain, all except it were Mulek? Yea, and do ye not behold that the seed of Zedekiah are with us, and they were driven out of the land of Jerusalem? But behold, this is not all—
verses.plainText: Now, will you argue that Jerusalem was not destroyed? Will you say that the sons of Zedekiah were not killed, all except Mulek? And don’t you see that the descendants of Zedekiah are with us, and they were driven out of the land of Jerusalem? But this isn’t all—

verses.text: Our father Lehi was driven out of Jerusalem because he testified of these things. Nephi also testified of these things, and also almost all of our fathers, even down to this time; yea, they have testified of the coming of Christ, and have looked forward, and have rejoiced in his day which is to come.
verses.plainText: Our father Lehi was driven out of Jerusalem because he testified of these things. Nephi also testified of these things, and almost all of our fathers, even down to this time; they have testified of the coming of Christ, have looked forward to it, and have rejoiced in his day which is to come.

verses.text: And behold, he is God, and he is with them, and he did manifest himself unto them, that they were redeemed by him; and they gave unto him glory, because of that which is to come.
verses.plainText: He is God, and he is with them, and he showed himself to them so they were redeemed by him; and they gave him glory because of what was to come.

verses.text: And now, seeing ye know these things and cannot deny them except ye shall lie, therefore in this ye have sinned, for ye have rejected all these things, notwithstanding so many evidences which ye have received; yea, even ye have received all things, both things in heaven, and all things which are in the earth, as a witness that they are true.
verses.plainText: Now, since you know these things and can’t deny them unless you lie, you have sinned in this, because you have rejected all these things, even though you have received so much evidence. You have received everything—things in heaven and things on earth—as witnesses that they are true.

verses.text: But behold, ye have rejected the truth, and rebelled against your holy God; and even at this time, instead of laying up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where nothing doth corrupt, and where nothing can come which is unclean, ye are heaping up for yourselves wrath against the day of judgment.
verses.plainText: You have rejected the truth and rebelled against your holy God. Even now, instead of storing up treasures in heaven, where nothing is corrupted and nothing unclean can enter, you are piling up wrath for yourselves against the day of judgment.

verses.text: Yea, even at this time ye are ripening, because of your murders and your fornication and wickedness, for everlasting destruction; yea, and except ye repent it will come unto you soon.
verses.plainText: Right now you are becoming ready for everlasting destruction because of your murders, your sexual immorality, and your wickedness; and unless you repent, it will come to you soon.

verses.text: Yea, behold it is now even at your doors; yea, go ye in unto the judgment-seat, and search; and behold, your judge is murdered, and he lieth in his blood; and he hath been murdered by his brother, who seeketh to sit in the judgment-seat.
verses.plainText: It is now right at your doors; go into the judgment-seat and look, and you will see that your judge has been murdered and is lying in his blood. He has been murdered by his brother, who wants to take his place on the judgment-seat.

verses.text: And behold, they both belong to your secret band, whose author is Gadianton and the evil one who seeketh to destroy the souls of men.
verses.plainText: They both belong to your secret group, whose founder is Gadianton and the evil one who seeks to destroy the souls of men.

verses.text: Behold, now it came to pass that when Nephi had spoken these words, certain men who were among them ran to the judgment-seat; yea, even there were five who went, and they said among themselves, as they went:
verses.plainText: When Nephi finished speaking, some of the men there ran to the judgment seat; five of them went, and as they went, they talked among themselves:

verses.text: Behold, now we will know of a surety whether this man be a prophet and God hath commanded him to prophesy such marvelous things unto us. Behold, we do not believe that he hath; yea, we do not believe that he is a prophet; nevertheless, if this thing which he has said concerning the chief judge be true, that he be dead, then will we believe that the other words which he has spoken are true.
verses.plainText: Now we will know for sure whether this man is a prophet and if God has commanded him to prophesy such marvelous things to us. We do not believe that he has; we do not believe that he is a prophet. However, if what he said about the chief judge is true—that he is dead—then we will believe that the other things he has spoken are true.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they ran in their might, and came in unto the judgment-seat; and behold, the chief judge had fallen to the earth, and did lie in his blood.
verses.plainText: They ran with all their strength and entered the judgment seat, and saw that the chief judge had fallen to the ground and was lying in his own blood.

verses.text: And now behold, when they saw this they were astonished exceedingly, insomuch that they fell to the earth; for they had not believed the words which Nephi had spoken concerning the chief judge.
verses.plainText: When they saw this, they were extremely astonished and fell to the ground, because they had not believed what Nephi had said about the chief judge.

verses.text: But now, when they saw they believed, and fear came upon them lest all the judgments which Nephi had spoken should come upon the people; therefore they did quake, and had fallen to the earth.
verses.plainText: When they saw, they believed, and fear came over them that all the judgments Nephi had spoken might come upon the people. They trembled and fell to the ground.

verses.text: Now, immediately when the judge had been murdered—he being stabbed by his brother by a garb of secrecy, and he fled, and the servants ran and told the people, raising the cry of murder among them;
verses.plainText: As soon as the judge was murdered—stabbed by his brother in secret—his brother fled, and the servants ran to tell the people, raising the alarm of murder among them.

verses.text: And behold the people did gather themselves together unto the place of the judgment-seat—and behold, to their astonishment they saw those five men who had fallen to the earth.
verses.plainText: The people gathered together at the place of the judgment seat, and to their astonishment, they saw the five men who had fallen to the ground.

verses.text: And now behold, the people knew nothing concerning the multitude who had gathered together at the garden of Nephi; therefore they said among themselves: These men are they who have murdered the judge, and God has smitten them that they could not flee from us.
verses.plainText: The people didn’t know anything about the crowd that had gathered at the garden of Nephi, so they said to each other, “These men are the ones who have murdered the judge, and God has struck them so they couldn’t escape from us. ”

verses.text: And it came to pass that they laid hold on them, and bound them and cast them into prison. And there was a proclamation sent abroad that the judge was slain, and that the murderers had been taken and were cast into prison.
verses.plainText: They seized them, tied them up, and threw them into prison. A proclamation was sent out that the judge had been killed, and that the murderers had been caught and put in prison.

verses.text: And it came to pass that on the morrow the people did assemble themselves together to mourn and to fast, at the burial of the great chief judge who had been slain.
verses.plainText: The next day, the people gathered together to mourn and fast at the burial of the great chief judge who had been killed.

verses.text: And thus also those judges who were at the garden of Nephi, and heard his words, were also gathered together at the burial.
verses.plainText: In the same way, the judges who were at the garden of Nephi and heard his words were also gathered together at the burial.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they inquired among the people, saying: Where are the five who were sent to inquire concerning the chief judge whether he was dead? And they answered and said: Concerning this five whom ye say ye have sent, we know not; but there are five who are the murderers, whom we have cast into prison.
verses.plainText: They asked the people, “Where are the five who were sent to find out if the chief judge was dead? ” The people answered, “About these five you say you sent, we don’t know; but there are five who are the murderers, and we have put them in prison. ”

verses.text: And it came to pass that the judges desired that they should be brought; and they were brought, and behold they were the five who were sent; and behold the judges inquired of them to know, concerning the matter, and they told them all that they had done, saying:
verses.plainText: The judges wanted them to be brought in, and they were brought in—it was the five who had been sent. The judges questioned them about the situation, and they told the judges everything they had done, saying:

verses.text: We ran and came to the place of the judgment-seat, and when we saw all things even as Nephi had testified, we were astonished insomuch that we fell to the earth; and when we were recovered from our astonishment, behold they cast us into prison.
verses.plainText: We ran to the judgment seat, and when we saw everything just as Nephi had said, we were so astonished that we fell to the ground. When we recovered from our shock, they threw us into prison.

verses.text: Now, as for the murder of this man, we know not who has done it; and only this much we know, we ran and came according as ye desired, and behold he was dead, according to the words of Nephi.
verses.plainText: As for the murder of this man, we don’t know who did it; all we know is that we ran and came just as you asked, and he was dead, just as Nephi said.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that the judges did expound the matter unto the people, and did cry out against Nephi, saying: Behold, we know that this Nephi must have agreed with some one to slay the judge, and then he might declare it unto us, that he might convert us unto his faith, that he might raise himself to be a great man, chosen of God, and a prophet.
verses.plainText: The judges explained the situation to the people and accused Nephi, saying, “We know that Nephi must have conspired with someone to kill the judge, so that he could reveal it to us, convert us to his beliefs, and make himself out to be a great man, chosen by God and a prophet. ”

verses.text: And now behold, we will detect this man, and he shall confess his fault and make known unto us the true murderer of this judge.
verses.plainText: Now we will catch this man, and he will admit his guilt and reveal to us who the real murderer of this judge is.

verses.text: And it came to pass that the five were liberated on the day of the burial. Nevertheless, they did rebuke the judges in the words which they had spoken against Nephi, and did contend with them one by one, insomuch that they did confound them.
verses.plainText: The five were released on the day of the burial. However, they rebuked the judges for what they had said against Nephi and argued with them one by one, until the judges were left confused.

verses.text: Nevertheless, they caused that Nephi should be taken and bound and brought before the multitude, and they began to question him in divers ways that they might cross him, that they might accuse him to death—
verses.plainText: However, they had Nephi taken, tied up, and brought before the crowd, and they started questioning him in different ways, trying to trap him so they could accuse him and have him put to death.

verses.text: Saying unto him: Thou art confederate; who is this man that hath done this murder? Now tell us, and acknowledge thy fault; saying, Behold here is money; and also we will grant unto thee thy life if thou wilt tell us, and acknowledge the agreement which thou hast made with him.
verses.plainText: They said to him, “You’re an accomplice; who is the man that committed this murder? Now tell us and admit your guilt. Here is money, and we’ll also spare your life if you’ll tell us and admit the agreement you made with him. ”

verses.text: But Nephi said unto them: O ye fools, ye uncircumcised of heart, ye blind, and ye stiffnecked people, do ye know how long the Lord your God will suffer you that ye shall go on in this your way of sin?
verses.plainText: But Nephi said to them, "You fools, you who are stubborn in your hearts, blind, and stubborn people, do you know how long the Lord your God will allow you to continue in this sinful way?

verses.text: O ye ought to begin to howl and mourn, because of the great destruction which at this time doth await you, except ye shall repent.
verses.plainText: You should start to cry out and mourn because great destruction is waiting for you right now, unless you repent.

verses.text: Behold ye say that I have agreed with a man that he should murder Seezoram, our chief judge. But behold, I say unto you, that this is because I have testified unto you that ye might know concerning this thing; yea, even for a witness unto you, that I did know of the wickedness and abominations which are among you.
verses.plainText: You say that I made an agreement with someone to murder Seezoram, our chief judge. But I tell you, the reason I have testified to you about this is so that you would know about it; it is a witness to you that I was aware of the wickedness and abominations among you.

verses.text: And because I have done this, ye say that I have agreed with a man that he should do this thing; yea, because I showed unto you this sign ye are angry with me, and seek to destroy my life.
verses.plainText: And because I have done this, you say that I made an agreement with a man to do it; because I showed you this sign, you are angry with me and want to take my life.

verses.text: And now behold, I will show unto you another sign, and see if ye will in this thing seek to destroy me.
verses.plainText: Now I will show you another sign, and see if you will try to destroy me because of this.

verses.text: Behold I say unto you: Go to the house of Seantum, who is the brother of Seezoram, and say unto him—
verses.plainText: I say to you: Go to the house of Seantum, who is the brother of Seezoram, and say to him—

verses.text: Has Nephi, the pretended prophet, who doth prophesy so much evil concerning this people, agreed with thee, in the which ye have murdered Seezoram, who is your brother?
verses.plainText: Has Nephi, the so-called prophet who prophesies so much evil about this people, made an agreement with you, in which you have murdered Seezoram, who is your brother?

verses.text: And behold, he shall say unto you, Nay.
verses.plainText: He will say to you, “No. ”

verses.text: And ye shall say unto him: Have ye murdered your brother?
verses.plainText: And you will say to him, "Have you murdered your brother?

verses.text: And he shall stand with fear, and wist not what to say. And behold, he shall deny unto you; and he shall make as if he were astonished; nevertheless, he shall declare unto you that he is innocent.
verses.plainText: He will stand in fear and won’t know what to say. He will deny it to you and pretend to be astonished; however, he will tell you that he is innocent.

verses.text: But behold, ye shall examine him, and ye shall find blood upon the skirts of his cloak.
verses.plainText: You will examine him, and you will find blood on the edges of his cloak.

verses.text: And when ye have seen this, ye shall say: From whence cometh this blood? Do we not know that it is the blood of your brother?
verses.plainText: And when you see this, you will say, "Where did this blood come from? Don’t we know that it’s the blood of your brother?

verses.text: And then shall he tremble, and shall look pale, even as if death had come upon him.
verses.plainText: And then he will tremble and look pale, as if death has come upon him.

verses.text: And then shall ye say: Because of this fear and this paleness which has come upon your face, behold, we know that thou art guilty.
verses.plainText: And then you will say, “Because of this fear and the paleness that has come over your face, we know that you are guilty. ”

verses.text: And then shall greater fear come upon him; and then shall he confess unto you, and deny no more that he has done this murder.
verses.plainText: Then he will become even more afraid, and he will admit to you that he committed this murder and will deny it no longer.

verses.text: And then shall he say unto you, that I, Nephi, know nothing concerning the matter save it were given unto me by the power of God. And then shall ye know that I am an honest man, and that I am sent unto you from God.
verses.plainText: He will tell you that I, Nephi, know nothing about the matter except what was given to me by the power of God. Then you will know that I am an honest man and that I am sent to you from God.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they went and did, even according as Nephi had said unto them. And behold, the words which he had said were true; for according to the words he did deny; and also according to the words he did confess.
verses.plainText: They went and did exactly as Nephi had told them. The words he spoke were true; just as he said, the man denied it at first, and then, just as Nephi said, he confessed.

verses.text: And he was brought to prove that he himself was the very murderer, insomuch that the five were set at liberty, and also was Nephi.
verses.plainText: He was brought forward and proven to be the murderer, so the five men were released, as well as Nephi.

verses.text: And there were some of the Nephites who believed on the words of Nephi; and there were some also, who believed because of the testimony of the five, for they had been converted while they were in prison.
verses.plainText: Some of the Nephites believed Nephi’s words, and others believed because of the testimony of the five, since they had been converted while they were in prison.

verses.text: And now there were some among the people, who said that Nephi was a prophet.
verses.plainText: Some of the people said that Nephi was a prophet.

verses.text: And there were others who said: Behold, he is a god, for except he was a god he could not know of all things. For behold, he has told us the thoughts of our hearts, and also has told us things; and even he has brought unto our knowledge the true murderer of our chief judge.
verses.plainText: Some people said, “He is a god, because unless he were a god, he couldn’t know everything. He has told us the thoughts in our hearts and has revealed things to us. He has even shown us who really killed our chief judge. ”

verses.text: And it came to pass that there arose a division among the people, insomuch that they divided hither and thither and went their ways, leaving Nephi alone, as he was standing in the midst of them.
verses.plainText: A division arose among the people, and they separated and went their own ways, leaving Nephi alone as he stood among them.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Nephi went his way towards his own house, pondering upon the things which the Lord had shown unto him.
verses.plainText: Nephi went on his way toward his own house, thinking about the things the Lord had shown him.
