verses.plainText: Each tribe appointed a chief or leader, and in this way they became tribes with their own leaders.

verses.text: Now behold, there was no man among them save he had much family and many kindreds and friends; therefore their tribes became exceedingly great.
verses.plainText: There was no one among them who didn’t have a large family, many relatives, and friends; so their tribes grew very large.

verses.text: Now all this was done, and there were no wars as yet among them; and all this iniquity had come upon the people because they did yield themselves unto the power of Satan.
verses.plainText: All of this happened, and there were no wars yet among them; all this wickedness came upon the people because they gave themselves over to the power of Satan.

verses.text: And the regulations of the government were destroyed, because of the secret combination of the friends and kindreds of those who murdered the prophets.
verses.plainText: The laws of the government were destroyed because of the secret alliance among the friends and relatives of those who killed the prophets.

verses.text: And they did cause a great contention in the land, insomuch that the more righteous part of the people had nearly all become wicked; yea, there were but few righteous men among them.
verses.plainText: They caused a great conflict in the land, so much so that almost all of the more righteous people had become wicked; there were only a few righteous people left among them.

verses.text: And thus six years had not passed away since the more part of the people had turned from their righteousness, like the dog to his vomit, or like the sow to her wallowing in the mire.
verses.plainText: So less than six years had passed since most of the people had turned away from their righteousness, like a dog returning to its vomit or a pig going back to wallow in the mud.

verses.text: Now this secret combination, which had brought so great iniquity upon the people, did gather themselves together, and did place at their head a man whom they did call Jacob;
verses.plainText: This secret combination, which had brought such great wickedness upon the people, gathered themselves together and chose a man named Jacob as their leader.

verses.text: And they did call him their king; therefore he became a king over this wicked band; and he was one of the chiefest who had given his voice against the prophets who testified of Jesus.
verses.plainText: They called him their king, so he became the king over this wicked group. He was one of the main leaders who had spoken out against the prophets who testified of Jesus.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they were not so strong in number as the tribes of the people, who were united together save it were their leaders did establish their laws, every one according to his tribe; nevertheless they were enemies; notwithstanding they were not a righteous people, yet they were united in the hatred of those who had entered into a covenant to destroy the government.
verses.plainText: They weren’t as numerous as the tribes of the people, who were united together except that their leaders set up their own laws, each according to his tribe. Even though they were enemies and not a righteous people, they were united in their hatred of those who had made a covenant to destroy the government.

verses.text: Therefore, Jacob seeing that their enemies were more numerous than they, he being the king of the band, therefore he commanded his people that they should take their flight into the northernmost part of the land, and there build up unto themselves a kingdom, until they were joined by dissenters, (for he flattered them that there would be many dissenters) and they become sufficiently strong to contend with the tribes of the people; and they did so.
verses.plainText: Jacob saw that their enemies outnumbered them, and since he was the leader of the group, he told his people to flee to the northernmost part of the land and build a kingdom there. He convinced them that many others would join them, and that they would become strong enough to fight against the other tribes. They did as he commanded.

verses.text: And so speedy was their march that it could not be impeded until they had gone forth out of the reach of the people. And thus ended the thirtieth year; and thus were the affairs of the people of Nephi.
verses.plainText: Their march was so quick that no one could stop them until they were out of reach of the people. That is how the thirtieth year ended, and that is how things stood for the people of Nephi.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the thirty and first year that they were divided into tribes, every man according to his family, kindred and friends; nevertheless they had come to an agreement that they would not go to war one with another; but they were not united as to their laws, and their manner of government, for they were established according to the minds of those who were their chiefs and their leaders. But they did establish very strict laws that one tribe should not trespass against another, insomuch that in some degree they had peace in the land; nevertheless, their hearts were turned from the Lord their God, and they did stone the prophets and did cast them out from among them.
verses.plainText: In the thirty-first year, they divided into tribes, each person joining with their family, relatives, and friends. They agreed not to go to war with each other, but they weren’t united in their laws or their governments, since each group followed the decisions of their own leaders and chiefs. They did set up very strict laws to prevent one tribe from wronging another, so there was some peace in the land. However, their hearts had turned away from the Lord their God, and they stoned the prophets and cast them out from among them.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Nephi—having been visited by angels and also the voice of the Lord, therefore having seen angels, and being eye-witness, and having had power given unto him that he might know concerning the ministry of Christ, and also being eye-witness to their quick return from righteousness unto their wickedness and abominations;
verses.plainText: Nephi had been visited by angels and also heard the voice of the Lord. He had seen angels and was an eyewitness. He had been given power to understand the ministry of Christ, and he was also an eyewitness to how quickly the people returned from righteousness to wickedness and abominations.

verses.text: Therefore, being grieved for the hardness of their hearts and the blindness of their minds—went forth among them in that same year, and began to testify, boldly, repentance and remission of sins through faith on the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.plainText: Grieved by the hardness of their hearts and the blindness of their minds, he went among them that same year and began to boldly testify about repentance and forgiveness of sins through faith in the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.text: And he did minister many things unto them; and all of them cannot be written, and a part of them would not suffice, therefore they are not written in this book. And Nephi did minister with power and with great authority.
verses.plainText: He taught them many things, but not everything he said can be written, and only part of it wouldn’t be enough, so those things aren’t included in this book. Nephi taught with power and great authority.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they were angry with him, even because he had greater power than they, for it were not possible that they could disbelieve his words, for so great was his faith on the Lord Jesus Christ that angels did minister unto him daily.
verses.plainText: They were angry with him because he had greater power than they did. It was not possible for them to disbelieve his words, because his faith in the Lord Jesus Christ was so great that angels ministered to him every day.

verses.text: And in the name of Jesus did he cast out devils and unclean spirits; and even his brother did he raise from the dead, after he had been stoned and suffered death by the people.
verses.plainText: In the name of Jesus, he cast out devils and unclean spirits, and he even raised his brother from the dead after his brother had been stoned and killed by the people.

verses.text: And the people saw it, and did witness of it, and were angry with him because of his power; and he did also do many more miracles, in the sight of the people, in the name of Jesus.
verses.plainText: The people saw it and witnessed it, and they were angry with him because of his power. He also performed many more miracles in front of the people in the name of Jesus.

verses.text: And it came to pass that the thirty and first year did pass away, and there were but few who were converted unto the Lord; but as many as were converted did truly signify unto the people that they had been visited by the power and Spirit of God, which was in Jesus Christ, in whom they believed.
verses.plainText: The thirty-first year passed, and only a few people were converted to the Lord. But those who were converted clearly showed to others that they had been visited by the power and Spirit of God, which is in Jesus Christ, whom they believed in.

verses.text: And as many as had devils cast out from them, and were healed of their sicknesses and their infirmities, did truly manifest unto the people that they had been wrought upon by the Spirit of God, and had been healed; and they did show forth signs also and did do some miracles among the people.
verses.plainText: All those who had devils cast out of them and were healed of their sicknesses and infirmities clearly showed the people that they had been changed by the Spirit of God and had been healed; they also showed signs and performed some miracles among the people.

verses.text: Thus passed away the thirty and second year also. And Nephi did cry unto the people in the commencement of the thirty and third year; and he did preach unto them repentance and remission of sins.
verses.plainText: The thirty-second year ended, and at the beginning of the thirty-third year, Nephi called out to the people and preached to them about repentance and the forgiveness of sins.

verses.text: Now I would have you to remember also, that there were none who were brought unto repentance who were not baptized with water.
verses.plainText: I want you to remember that everyone who was brought to repentance was also baptized with water.

verses.text: Therefore, there were ordained of Nephi, men unto this ministry, that all such as should come unto them should be baptized with water, and this as a witness and a testimony before God, and unto the people, that they had repented and received a remission of their sins.
verses.plainText: Nephi ordained men to this ministry so that everyone who came to them would be baptized with water as a witness and testimony before God and the people that they had repented and received forgiveness of their sins.

verses.text: And there were many in the commencement of this year that were baptized unto repentance; and thus the more part of the year did pass away.
verses.plainText: Many people were baptized in the beginning of this year as a sign of their repentance, and most of the year passed in this way.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that according to our record, and we know our record to be true, for behold, it was a just man who did keep the record—for he truly did many miracles in the name of Jesus; and there was not any man who could do a miracle in the name of Jesus save he were cleansed every whit from his iniquity—
verses.plainText: According to our record, which we know is true because it was kept by a righteous man—for he truly performed many miracles in the name of Jesus; and no one could perform a miracle in the name of Jesus unless he was completely cleansed from his sins—

verses.text: And now it came to pass, if there was no mistake made by this man in the reckoning of our time, the thirty and third year had passed away;
verses.plainText: If this man made no mistake in counting our time, the thirty-third year had ended.

verses.text: And the people began to look with great earnestness for the sign which had been given by the prophet Samuel, the Lamanite, yea, for the time that there should be darkness for the space of three days over the face of the land.
verses.plainText: The people began to watch eagerly for the sign that the prophet Samuel the Lamanite had given—for the time when there would be darkness for three days over the land.

verses.text: And there began to be great doubtings and disputations among the people, notwithstanding so many signs had been given.
verses.plainText: People started to have serious doubts and arguments among themselves, even though so many signs had been given.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the thirty and fourth year, in the first month, on the fourth day of the month, there arose a great storm, such an one as never had been known in all the land.
verses.plainText: In the thirty-fourth year, in the first month, on the fourth day of the month, a great storm arose—one unlike any that had ever been known in all the land.

verses.text: And there was also a great and terrible tempest; and there was terrible thunder, insomuch that it did shake the whole earth as if it was about to divide asunder.
verses.plainText: There was a great and terrible storm, with thunder so intense that it shook the entire earth as if it were about to split apart.

verses.text: And there were exceedingly sharp lightnings, such as never had been known in all the land.
verses.plainText: There were extremely intense lightning storms, unlike anything ever seen before in the land.

verses.text: And the city of Zarahemla did take fire.
verses.plainText: The city of Zarahemla caught fire.

verses.text: And the city of Moroni did sink into the depths of the sea, and the inhabitants thereof were drowned.
verses.plainText: The city of Moroni sank into the depths of the sea, and its inhabitants drowned.

verses.text: And the earth was carried up upon the city of Moronihah that in the place of the city there became a great mountain.
verses.plainText: The earth was piled up over the city of Moronihah, and a great mountain formed where the city had been.

verses.text: And there was a great and terrible destruction in the land southward.
verses.plainText: There was a great and terrible destruction in the land to the south.

verses.text: But behold, there was a more great and terrible destruction in the land northward; for behold, the whole face of the land was changed, because of the tempest and the whirlwinds and the thunderings and the lightnings, and the exceedingly great quaking of the whole earth;
verses.plainText: But there was an even greater and more terrible destruction in the land northward, for the entire face of the land was changed because of the storm, the whirlwinds, the thunder, the lightning, and the extremely great shaking of the whole earth.

verses.text: And the highways were broken up, and the level roads were spoiled, and many smooth places became rough.
verses.plainText: The highways were destroyed, the level roads were ruined, and many smooth places became rough.

verses.text: And many great and notable cities were sunk, and many were burned, and many were shaken till the buildings thereof had fallen to the earth, and the inhabitants thereof were slain, and the places were left desolate.
verses.plainText: Many great and notable cities sank, many were burned, and many were shaken until their buildings collapsed, their inhabitants were killed, and the places were left desolate.

verses.text: And there were some cities which remained; but the damage thereof was exceedingly great, and there were many of them who were slain.
verses.plainText: Some cities remained, but the damage was extremely severe, and many people were killed.

verses.text: And there were some who were carried away in the whirlwind; and whither they went no man knoweth, save they know that they were carried away.
verses.plainText: Some people were carried away in the whirlwind, and no one knows where they went, except that they know they were carried away.

verses.text: And thus the face of the whole earth became deformed, because of the tempests, and the thunderings, and the lightnings, and the quaking of the earth.
verses.plainText: In this way, the entire surface of the earth was changed because of the storms, the thunder, the lightning, and the earthquakes.

verses.text: And behold, the rocks were rent in twain; they were broken up upon the face of the whole earth, insomuch that they were found in broken fragments, and in seams and in cracks, upon all the face of the land.
verses.plainText: The rocks were split in two; they were broken up across the whole earth, so that they were found in broken fragments, and in seams and cracks, all over the land.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when the thunderings, and the lightnings, and the storm, and the tempest, and the quakings of the earth did cease—for behold, they did last for about the space of three hours; and it was said by some that the time was greater; nevertheless, all these great and terrible things were done in about the space of three hours—and then behold, there was darkness upon the face of the land.
verses.plainText: When the thunder, lightning, storm, tempest, and earthquakes stopped—for they lasted for about three hours, though some said it was longer; still, all these great and terrible things happened in about three hours—there was darkness over the land.

verses.text: And it came to pass that there was thick darkness upon all the face of the land, insomuch that the inhabitants thereof who had not fallen could feel the vapor of darkness;
verses.plainText: There was thick darkness over the entire land, so much that the people who had not fallen could feel the vapor of darkness.

verses.text: And there could be no light, because of the darkness, neither candles, neither torches; neither could there be fire kindled with their fine and exceedingly dry wood, so that there could not be any light at all;
verses.plainText: There was no light because of the darkness—not from candles, torches, or even fires made with their fine, extremely dry wood—so there was no light at all.

verses.text: And there was not any light seen, neither fire, nor glimmer, neither the sun, nor the moon, nor the stars, for so great were the mists of darkness which were upon the face of the land.
verses.plainText: No light could be seen—no fire, no glimmer, not the sun, the moon, or the stars—because the mists of darkness covering the land were so thick.

verses.text: And it came to pass that it did last for the space of three days that there was no light seen; and there was great mourning and howling and weeping among all the people continually; yea, great were the groanings of the people, because of the darkness and the great destruction which had come upon them.
verses.plainText: For three days there was no light at all, and all the people mourned, howled, and wept continually. The people groaned deeply because of the darkness and the great destruction that had come upon them.

verses.text: And in one place they were heard to cry, saying: O that we had repented before this great and terrible day, and then would our brethren have been spared, and they would not have been burned in that great city Zarahemla.
verses.plainText: In one place, people were heard crying out, “If only we had repented before this great and terrible day, then our brothers and sisters would have been spared, and they would not have been burned in that great city Zarahemla. ”

verses.text: And in another place they were heard to cry and mourn, saying: O that we had repented before this great and terrible day, and had not killed and stoned the prophets, and cast them out; then would our mothers and our fair daughters, and our children have been spared, and not have been buried up in that great city Moronihah. And thus were the howlings of the people great and terrible.
verses.plainText: In another place, people were heard crying and mourning, saying, "If only we had repented before this great and terrible day, and had not killed and stoned the prophets, and cast them out. Then our mothers, our beautiful daughters, and our children would have been spared, and would not have been buried in that great city Moronihah. " The people's cries were great and terrible.

verses.text: And it came to pass that there was a voice heard among all the inhabitants of the earth, upon all the face of this land, crying:
verses.plainText: A voice was heard among all the people throughout the land, calling out:

verses.text: Wo, wo, wo unto this people; wo unto the inhabitants of the whole earth except they shall repent; for the devil laugheth, and his angels rejoice, because of the slain of the fair sons and daughters of my people; and it is because of their iniquity and abominations that they are fallen!
verses.plainText: Woe to this people; woe to the inhabitants of the whole earth unless they repent. The devil laughs, and his angels rejoice because of the deaths of the righteous sons and daughters of my people, and they have fallen because of their sins and abominations.

verses.text: Behold, that great city Zarahemla have I burned with fire, and the inhabitants thereof.
verses.plainText: I have burned the great city Zarahemla with fire, along with its inhabitants.

verses.text: And behold, that great city Moroni have I caused to be sunk in the depths of the sea, and the inhabitants thereof to be drowned.
verses.plainText: I caused the great city Moroni to sink into the depths of the sea, and its inhabitants drowned.

verses.text: And behold, that great city Moronihah have I covered with earth, and the inhabitants thereof, to hide their iniquities and their abominations from before my face, that the blood of the prophets and the saints shall not come any more unto me against them.
verses.plainText: I have covered the great city Moronihah with earth, along with its inhabitants, to hide their sins and abominations from my sight, so that the blood of the prophets and the saints will no longer come before me as a witness against them.

verses.text: And behold, the city of Gilgal have I caused to be sunk, and the inhabitants thereof to be buried up in the depths of the earth;
verses.plainText: I caused the city of Gilgal to sink, and its inhabitants to be buried in the depths of the earth;

verses.text: Yea, and the city of Onihah and the inhabitants thereof, and the city of Mocum and the inhabitants thereof, and the city of Jerusalem and the inhabitants thereof; and waters have I caused to come up in the stead thereof, to hide their wickedness and abominations from before my face, that the blood of the prophets and the saints shall not come up any more unto me against them.
verses.plainText: The city of Onihah and its inhabitants, the city of Mocum and its inhabitants, and the city of Jerusalem and its inhabitants—I have caused waters to rise in their place to cover their wickedness and abominations, so that the blood of the prophets and the saints will no longer come up to me against them.

verses.text: And behold, the city of Gadiandi, and the city of Gadiomnah, and the city of Jacob, and the city of Gimgimno, all these have I caused to be sunk, and made hills and valleys in the places thereof; and the inhabitants thereof have I buried up in the depths of the earth, to hide their wickedness and abominations from before my face, that the blood of the prophets and the saints should not come up any more unto me against them.
verses.plainText: The city of Gadiandi, the city of Gadiomnah, the city of Jacob, and the city of Gimgimno—I have caused all these to sink, creating hills and valleys in their place. I have buried their inhabitants deep in the earth to hide their wickedness and abominations from my presence, so that the blood of the prophets and the saints will not cry out to me against them anymore.

verses.text: And behold, that great city Jacobugath, which was inhabited by the people of king Jacob, have I caused to be burned with fire because of their sins and their wickedness, which was above all the wickedness of the whole earth, because of their secret murders and combinations; for it was they that did destroy the peace of my people and the government of the land; therefore I did cause them to be burned, to destroy them from before my face, that the blood of the prophets and the saints should not come up unto me any more against them.
verses.plainText: That great city Jacobugath, which was inhabited by the people of king Jacob, I caused to be burned with fire because of their sins and their wickedness, which was greater than all the wickedness on the whole earth, because of their secret murders and conspiracies. They destroyed the peace of my people and the government of the land, so I caused them to be burned and destroyed from before me, so the blood of the prophets and the saints would not come up to me against them anymore.

verses.text: And behold, the city of Laman, and the city of Josh, and the city of Gad, and the city of Kishkumen, have I caused to be burned with fire, and the inhabitants thereof, because of their wickedness in casting out the prophets, and stoning those whom I did send to declare unto them concerning their wickedness and their abominations.
verses.plainText: I caused the city of Laman, the city of Josh, the city of Gad, and the city of Kishkumen to be burned with fire, along with their inhabitants, because of their wickedness in casting out the prophets and stoning those I sent to tell them about their wickedness and their abominations.

verses.text: And because they did cast them all out, that there were none righteous among them, I did send down fire and destroy them, that their wickedness and abominations might be hid from before my face, that the blood of the prophets and the saints whom I sent among them might not cry unto me from the ground against them.
verses.plainText: Because they cast them all out so that there were no righteous people among them, I sent down fire and destroyed them, so their wickedness and abominations would be hidden from my sight, and so the blood of the prophets and saints I sent among them would not cry to me from the ground against them.

verses.text: And many great destructions have I caused to come upon this land, and upon this people, because of their wickedness and their abominations.
verses.plainText: I have brought many great destructions upon this land and upon this people because of their wickedness and their abominations.

verses.text: O all ye that are spared because ye were more righteous than they, will ye not now return unto me, and repent of your sins, and be converted, that I may heal you?
verses.plainText: All of you who were spared because you were more righteous than the others, will you not now return to me, repent of your sins, and be converted so that I can heal you?

verses.text: Yea, verily I say unto you, if ye will come unto me ye shall have eternal life. Behold, mine arm of mercy is extended towards you, and whosoever will come, him will I receive; and blessed are those who come unto me.
verses.plainText: Truly I say to you, if you come to me you will have eternal life. My arm of mercy is extended toward you, and whoever comes, I will receive; and those who come to me are blessed.

verses.text: Behold, I am Jesus Christ the Son of God. I created the heavens and the earth, and all things that in them are. I was with the Father from the beginning. I am in the Father, and the Father in me; and in me hath the Father glorified his name.
verses.plainText: I am Jesus Christ, the Son of God. I created the heavens and the earth, and everything in them. I was with the Father from the beginning. I am in the Father, and the Father is in me; and through me the Father has glorified his name.

verses.text: I came unto my own, and my own received me not. And the scriptures concerning my coming are fulfilled.
verses.plainText: I came to my own people, and they did not accept me. The scriptures about my coming are now fulfilled.

verses.text: And as many as have received me, to them have I given to become the sons of God; and even so will I to as many as shall believe on my name, for behold, by me redemption cometh, and in me is the law of Moses fulfilled.
verses.plainText: And everyone who has received me, I have given the opportunity to become the children of God; and I will do the same for all who believe in my name, for through me redemption comes, and in me the law of Moses is fulfilled.

verses.text: I am the light and the life of the world. I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end.
verses.plainText: I am the light and the life of the world. I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end.

verses.text: And ye shall offer up unto me no more the shedding of blood; yea, your sacrifices and your burnt offerings shall be done away, for I will accept none of your sacrifices and your burnt offerings.
verses.plainText: You will no longer offer the shedding of blood to me; your sacrifices and burnt offerings are finished, for I will not accept any of your sacrifices or burnt offerings.

verses.text: And ye shall offer for a sacrifice unto me a broken heart and a contrite spirit. And whoso cometh unto me with a broken heart and a contrite spirit, him will I baptize with fire and with the Holy Ghost, even as the Lamanites, because of their faith in me at the time of their conversion, were baptized with fire and with the Holy Ghost, and they knew it not.
verses.plainText: You should offer me a broken heart and a repentant spirit as your sacrifice. Anyone who comes to me with a broken heart and a repentant spirit, I will baptize with fire and with the Holy Ghost, just as the Lamanites were baptized with fire and with the Holy Ghost because of their faith in me at the time of their conversion, even though they didn’t realize it.

verses.text: Behold, I have come unto the world to bring redemption unto the world, to save the world from sin.
verses.plainText: I have come into the world to bring redemption, to save the world from sin.

verses.text: Therefore, whoso repenteth and cometh unto me as a little child, him will I receive, for of such is the kingdom of God. Behold, for such I have laid down my life, and have taken it up again; therefore repent, and come unto me ye ends of the earth, and be saved.
verses.plainText: So anyone who repents and comes to me like a little child, I will receive, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these. For them I have laid down my life and taken it up again; so repent and come to me, all the ends of the earth, and be saved.

verses.text: And now behold, it came to pass that all the people of the land did hear these sayings, and did witness of it. And after these sayings there was silence in the land for the space of many hours;
verses.plainText: All the people of the land heard these words and witnessed them. After these words, there was silence in the land for many hours.

verses.text: For so great was the astonishment of the people that they did cease lamenting and howling for the loss of their kindred which had been slain; therefore there was silence in all the land for the space of many hours.
verses.plainText: The people were so astonished that they stopped mourning and crying over the loss of their loved ones who had been killed, and there was silence throughout the land for many hours.

verses.text: And it came to pass that there came a voice again unto the people, and all the people did hear, and did witness of it, saying:
verses.plainText: A voice spoke again to the people, and everyone heard it and witnessed it, saying:

verses.text: O ye people of these great cities which have fallen, who are descendants of Jacob, yea, who are of the house of Israel, how oft have I gathered you as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings, and have nourished you.
verses.plainText: People of these great cities that have fallen, descendants of Jacob, who are of the house of Israel, how often I have gathered you as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and have nourished you.

verses.text: And again, how oft would I have gathered you as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings, yea, O ye people of the house of Israel, who have fallen; yea, O ye people of the house of Israel, ye that dwell at Jerusalem, as ye that have fallen; yea, how oft would I have gathered you as a hen gathereth her chickens, and ye would not.
verses.plainText: And again, how often would I have gathered you like a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, O people of the house of Israel who have fallen; O people of the house of Israel, you who live at Jerusalem and have fallen; how often would I have gathered you like a hen gathers her chicks, and you would not allow it.

verses.text: O ye house of Israel whom I have spared, how oft will I gather you as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings, if ye will repent and return unto me with full purpose of heart.
verses.plainText: O house of Israel whom I have spared, how often I will gather you as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, if you will repent and return to me with full purpose of heart.

verses.text: But if not, O house of Israel, the places of your dwellings shall become desolate until the time of the fulfilling of the covenant to your fathers.
verses.plainText: But if not, O house of Israel, your homes will become desolate until the covenant made with your fathers is fulfilled.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that after the people had heard these words, behold, they began to weep and howl again because of the loss of their kindred and friends.
verses.plainText: After the people heard these words, they began to weep and cry again because they had lost their family and friends.

verses.text: And it came to pass that thus did the three days pass away. And it was in the morning, and the darkness dispersed from off the face of the land, and the earth did cease to tremble, and the rocks did cease to rend, and the dreadful groanings did cease, and all the tumultuous noises did pass away.
verses.plainText: The three days passed. In the morning, the darkness disappeared from the land, the earth stopped shaking, the rocks stopped breaking apart, the terrible groanings ended, and all the loud noises faded away.

verses.text: And the earth did cleave together again, that it stood; and the mourning, and the weeping, and the wailing of the people who were spared alive did cease; and their mourning was turned into joy, and their lamentations into the praise and thanksgiving unto the Lord Jesus Christ, their Redeemer.
verses.plainText: The earth came back together so that it stood firm, and the mourning, weeping, and wailing of the people who survived stopped. Their sorrow turned into joy, and their cries became praise and thanksgiving to the Lord Jesus Christ, their Redeemer.

verses.text: And thus far were the scriptures fulfilled which had been spoken by the prophets.
verses.plainText: Up to this point, the scriptures that the prophets had spoken were fulfilled.

verses.text: And it was the more righteous part of the people who were saved, and it was they who received the prophets and stoned them not; and it was they who had not shed the blood of the saints, who were spared—
verses.plainText: The more righteous part of the people were saved; they were the ones who accepted the prophets and did not stone them, and they had not shed the blood of the saints—they were spared.

verses.text: And they were spared and were not sunk and buried up in the earth; and they were not drowned in the depths of the sea; and they were not burned by fire, neither were they fallen upon and crushed to death; and they were not carried away in the whirlwind; neither were they overpowered by the vapor of smoke and of darkness.
verses.plainText: They were spared and were not sunk or buried in the earth; they were not drowned in the depths of the sea; they were not burned by fire, nor were they crushed to death; they were not carried away by the whirlwind, nor were they overcome by the vapor of smoke and darkness.

verses.text: And now, whoso readeth, let him understand; he that hath the scriptures, let him search them, and see and behold if all these deaths and destructions by fire, and by smoke, and by tempests, and by whirlwinds, and by the opening of the earth to receive them, and all these things are not unto the fulfilling of the prophecies of many of the holy prophets.
verses.plainText: Now, whoever reads this, let them understand; whoever has the scriptures, let them search them and see if all these deaths and destructions by fire, smoke, tempests, whirlwinds, and the opening of the earth to receive them are not the fulfillment of the prophecies of many of the holy prophets.

verses.text: Behold, I say unto you, Yea, many have testified of these things at the coming of Christ, and were slain because they testified of these things.
verses.plainText: I tell you, many have testified of these things at the coming of Christ, and were killed because they testified of them.

verses.text: Yea, the prophet Zenos did testify of these things, and also Zenock spake concerning these things, because they testified particularly concerning us, who are the remnant of their seed.
verses.plainText: The prophet Zenos testified of these things, and Zenock also spoke about them, because they specifically testified about us, who are the remnant of their descendants.

verses.text: Behold, our father Jacob also testified concerning a remnant of the seed of Joseph. And behold, are not we a remnant of the seed of Joseph? And these things which testify of us, are they not written upon the plates of brass which our father Lehi brought out of Jerusalem?
verses.plainText: Our father Jacob also testified about a remnant of Joseph’s descendants. Aren’t we a remnant of Joseph’s descendants? And aren’t these things that testify about us written on the brass plates that our father Lehi brought from Jerusalem?

verses.text: And it came to pass that in the ending of the thirty and fourth year, behold, I will show unto you that the people of Nephi who were spared, and also those who had been called Lamanites, who had been spared, did have great favors shown unto them, and great blessings poured out upon their heads, insomuch that soon after the ascension of Christ into heaven he did truly manifest himself unto them—
verses.plainText: At the end of the thirty-fourth year, I will show you that the people of Nephi who were spared, and also those who had been called Lamanites who were spared, received great kindness and many blessings, so much that soon after Christ ascended into heaven, he truly appeared to them—

verses.text: Showing his body unto them, and ministering unto them; and an account of his ministry shall be given hereafter. Therefore for this time I make an end of my sayings.
verses.plainText: He showed his body to them and ministered to them; an account of his ministry will be given later. For now, I will end my words.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that there were a great multitude gathered together, of the people of Nephi, round about the temple which was in the land Bountiful; and they were marveling and wondering one with another, and were showing one to another the great and marvelous change which had taken place. 3 Nephi 11:2 And they were also conversing about this Jesus Christ, of whom the sign had been given concerning his death.
verses.plainText: A large crowd of Nephi’s people had gathered around the temple in the land of Bountiful. They were amazed and talking with each other, showing one another the great and marvelous change that had happened. They were also discussing Jesus Christ, about whom the sign had been given concerning his death.

verses.text: And it came to pass that while they were thus conversing one with another, they heard a voice as if it came out of heaven; and they cast their eyes round about, for they understood not the voice which they heard; and it was not a harsh voice, neither was it a loud voice; nevertheless, and notwithstanding it being a small voice it did pierce them that did hear to the center, insomuch that there was no part of their frame that it did not cause to quake; yea, it did pierce them to the very soul, and did cause their hearts to burn.
verses.plainText: While they were talking with each other, they heard a voice as if it came from heaven. They looked around because they didn’t understand the voice they heard. It wasn’t a harsh voice or a loud voice, but even though it was a quiet voice, it pierced everyone who heard it to the center, so much that every part of their bodies trembled. It pierced them to the very soul and caused their hearts to burn.

verses.text: And it came to pass that again they heard the voice, and they understood it not.
verses.plainText: Again, they heard the voice, but they didn’t understand it.

verses.text: And again the third time they did hear the voice, and did open their ears to hear it; and their eyes were towards the sound thereof; and they did look steadfastly towards heaven, from whence the sound came.
verses.plainText: A third time they heard the voice and listened carefully; they looked toward the direction of the sound and kept their eyes fixed on heaven, where the sound was coming from.

verses.text: And behold, the third time they did understand the voice which they heard; and it said unto them:
verses.plainText: The third time, they understood the voice they heard, and it said to them:

verses.text: Behold my Beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased, in whom I have glorified my name—hear ye him.
verses.plainText: This is my Beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased, in whom I have glorified my name—listen to him.

verses.text: And it came to pass, as they understood they cast their eyes up again towards heaven; and behold, they saw a Man descending out of heaven; and he was clothed in a white robe; and he came down and stood in the midst of them; and the eyes of the whole multitude were turned upon him, and they durst not open their mouths, even one to another, and wist not what it meant, for they thought it was an angel that had appeared unto them.
verses.plainText: As they understood, they looked up again toward heaven and saw a Man coming down from heaven, dressed in a white robe. He came down and stood among them, and everyone in the crowd looked at him. They were so amazed that none of them dared to speak to each other, and they didn’t know what it meant, because they thought an angel had appeared to them.

verses.text: And it came to pass that he stretched forth his hand and spake unto the people, saying:
verses.plainText: He stretched out his hand and spoke to the people, saying:

verses.text: Behold, I am Jesus Christ, whom the prophets testified shall come into the world.
verses.plainText: I am Jesus Christ, whom the prophets testified would come into the world.

verses.text: And behold, I am the light and the life of the world; and I have drunk out of that bitter cup which the Father hath given me, and have glorified the Father in taking upon me the sins of the world, in the which I have suffered the will of the Father in all things from the beginning.
verses.plainText: I am the light and the life of the world; I have drunk from that bitter cup the Father has given me, and I have glorified the Father by taking upon myself the sins of the world, and I have suffered the will of the Father in all things from the beginning.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words the whole multitude fell to the earth; for they remembered that it had been prophesied among them that Christ should show himself unto them after his ascension into heaven.
verses.plainText: When Jesus finished speaking, the entire crowd fell to the ground, because they remembered that it had been prophesied among them that Christ would show himself to them after his ascension into heaven.

verses.text: And it came to pass that the Lord spake unto them saying:
verses.plainText: The Lord spoke to them, saying:

verses.text: Arise and come forth unto me, that ye may thrust your hands into my side, and also that ye may feel the prints of the nails in my hands and in my feet, that ye may know that I am the God of Israel, and the God of the whole earth, and have been slain for the sins of the world.
verses.plainText: Get up and come to me, so you can put your hands into my side, and also feel the marks of the nails in my hands and my feet, so you will know that I am the God of Israel, and the God of the whole earth, and that I have been killed for the sins of the world.

verses.text: And it came to pass that the multitude went forth, and thrust their hands into his side, and did feel the prints of the nails in his hands and in his feet; and this they did do, going forth one by one until they had all gone forth, and did see with their eyes and did feel with their hands, and did know of a surety and did bear record, that it was he, of whom it was written by the prophets, that should come.
verses.plainText: The crowd stepped forward and put their hands into his side, and felt the prints of the nails in his hands and feet. They did this, going forward one by one until everyone had done so, and they saw with their eyes and felt with their hands, and knew for sure and testified that he was the one the prophets had written would come.

verses.text: And when they had all gone forth and had witnessed for themselves, they did cry out with one accord, saying:
verses.plainText: After they had all come forward and seen for themselves, they all cried out together, saying:

verses.text: Hosanna! Blessed be the name of the Most High God! And they did fall down at the feet of Jesus, and did worship him.
verses.plainText: Hosanna! Blessed is the name of the Most High God! They fell down at the feet of Jesus and worshiped him.

verses.text: And it came to pass that he spake unto Nephi (for Nephi was among the multitude) and he commanded him that he should come forth.
verses.plainText: He spoke to Nephi (since Nephi was among the crowd) and told him to come forward.

verses.text: And Nephi arose and went forth, and bowed himself before the Lord and did kiss his feet.
verses.plainText: Nephi stood up, walked forward, bowed before the Lord, and kissed his feet.

verses.text: And the Lord commanded him that he should arise. And he arose and stood before him.
verses.plainText: The Lord told him to get up, so he got up and stood in front of him.

verses.text: And the Lord said unto him: I give unto you power that ye shall baptize this people when I am again ascended into heaven.
verses.plainText: And the Lord said to him, "I give you authority to baptize these people when I have ascended into heaven again.

verses.text: And again the Lord called others, and said unto them likewise; and he gave unto them power to baptize. And he said unto them: On this wise shall ye baptize; and there shall be no disputations among you.
verses.plainText: The Lord called others and said the same thing to them, giving them authority to baptize. He told them, "This is how you should baptize, and there should be no arguments among you.

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, that whoso repenteth of his sins through your words and desireth to be baptized in my name, on this wise shall ye baptize them—Behold, ye shall go down and stand in the water, and in my name shall ye baptize them.
verses.plainText: I tell you the truth, anyone who repents of their sins because of your words and wants to be baptized in my name, you should baptize them in this way—you will go down and stand in the water, and you will baptize them in my name.

verses.text: And now behold, these are the words which ye shall say, calling them by name, saying:
verses.plainText: These are the words you should say, calling them by name, saying:

verses.text: Having authority given me of Jesus Christ, I baptize you in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost. Amen.
verses.plainText: With the authority given to me by Jesus Christ, I baptize you in the name of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Ghost. Amen.

verses.text: And then shall ye immerse them in the water, and come forth again out of the water.
verses.plainText: Then you will immerse them in the water, and they will come up again out of the water.

verses.text: And after this manner shall ye baptize in my name; for behold, verily I say unto you, that the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Ghost are one; and I am in the Father, and the Father in me, and the Father and I are one.
verses.plainText: This is how you should baptize in my name; I truly tell you, the Father, the Son, and the Holy Ghost are one; I am in the Father, and the Father is in me, and the Father and I are one.

verses.text: And according as I have commanded you thus shall ye baptize. And there shall be no disputations among you, as there have hitherto been; neither shall there be disputations among you concerning the points of my doctrine, as there have hitherto been.
verses.plainText: Do as I have commanded you when you baptize. There should be no arguments among you, as there have been before; and there should be no arguments among you about the points of my doctrine, as there have been before.

verses.text: For verily, verily I say unto you, he that hath the spirit of contention is not of me, but is of the devil, who is the father of contention, and he stirreth up the hearts of men to contend with anger, one with another.
verses.plainText: Truly, truly I say to you, anyone who has the spirit of contention is not from me, but from the devil, who is the father of contention. He stirs up people's hearts to argue with anger against each other.

verses.text: Behold, this is not my doctrine, to stir up the hearts of men with anger, one against another; but this is my doctrine, that such things should be done away.
verses.plainText: This is not my doctrine, to stir up people's hearts with anger against each other; my doctrine is that such things should be done away.

verses.text: Behold, verily, verily, I say unto you, I will declare unto you my doctrine.
verses.plainText: Truly, I say to you, I will tell you my doctrine.

verses.text: And this is my doctrine, and it is the doctrine which the Father hath given unto me; and I bear record of the Father, and the Father beareth record of me, and the Holy Ghost beareth record of the Father and me; and I bear record that the Father commandeth all men, everywhere, to repent and believe in me.
verses.plainText: This is my doctrine, the doctrine the Father has given me. I testify of the Father, and the Father testifies of me, and the Holy Ghost testifies of the Father and me. I testify that the Father commands everyone, everywhere, to repent and believe in me.

verses.text: And whoso believeth in me, and is baptized, the same shall be saved; and they are they who shall inherit the kingdom of God.
verses.plainText: Anyone who believes in me and is baptized will be saved; they are the ones who will inherit the kingdom of God.

verses.text: And whoso believeth not in me, and is not baptized, shall be damned.
verses.plainText: Anyone who does not believe in me and is not baptized will be condemned.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, that this is my doctrine, and I bear record of it from the Father; and whoso believeth in me believeth in the Father also; and unto him will the Father bear record of me, for he will visit him with fire and with the Holy Ghost.
verses.plainText: Truly, truly, I tell you, this is my doctrine, and I testify of it from the Father. Whoever believes in me also believes in the Father, and the Father will testify of me to that person, for he will visit them with fire and with the Holy Ghost.

verses.text: And thus will the Father bear record of me, and the Holy Ghost will bear record unto him of the Father and me; for the Father, and I, and the Holy Ghost are one.
verses.plainText: In this way, the Father will testify of me, and the Holy Ghost will testify to him of the Father and me; because the Father, I, and the Holy Ghost are one.

verses.text: And again I say unto you, ye must repent, and become as a little child, and be baptized in my name, or ye can in nowise receive these things.
verses.plainText: I tell you again, you must repent, become like a little child, and be baptized in my name, or you cannot receive these things.

verses.text: And again I say unto you, ye must repent, and be baptized in my name, and become as a little child, or ye can in nowise inherit the kingdom of God.
verses.plainText: I tell you again, you must repent, be baptized in my name, and become like a little child, or you cannot inherit the kingdom of God.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, that this is my doctrine, and whoso buildeth upon this buildeth upon my rock, and the gates of hell shall not prevail against them.
verses.plainText: Truly, truly, I say to you, this is my doctrine, and whoever builds on this builds on my rock, and the gates of hell will not overcome them.

verses.text: And whoso shall declare more or less than this, and establish it for my doctrine, the same cometh of evil, and is not built upon my rock; but he buildeth upon a sandy foundation, and the gates of hell stand open to receive such when the floods come and the winds beat upon them.
verses.plainText: And whoever teaches more or less than this and claims it as my doctrine comes from evil and is not built on my rock; instead, he builds on a sandy foundation, and the gates of hell are open to receive such people when the floods come and the winds beat against them.

verses.text: Therefore, go forth unto this people, and declare the words which I have spoken, unto the ends of the earth.
verses.plainText: So go to these people and share the words I have spoken, to the ends of the earth.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words unto Nephi, and to those who had been called, (now the number of them who had been called, and received power and authority to baptize, was twelve) and behold, he stretched forth his hand unto the multitude, and cried unto them, saying: Blessed are ye if ye shall give heed unto the words of these twelve whom I have chosen from among you to minister unto you, and to be your servants; and unto them I have given power that they may baptize you with water; and after that ye are baptized with water, behold, I will baptize you with fire and with the Holy Ghost; therefore blessed are ye if ye shall believe in me and be baptized, after that ye have seen me and know that I am.
verses.plainText: After Jesus finished speaking to Nephi and the others who had been called—there were twelve in total who had received power and authority to baptize—he stretched out his hand to the crowd and said, "You are blessed if you listen to the words of these twelve I have chosen from among you to serve and minister to you. I have given them power to baptize you with water. After you are baptized with water, I will baptize you with fire and the Holy Ghost. You are blessed if you believe in me and are baptized after you have seen me and know that I am.

verses.text: And again, more blessed are they who shall believe in your words because that ye shall testify that ye have seen me, and that ye know that I am. Yea, blessed are they who shall believe in your words, and come down into the depths of humility and be baptized, for they shall be visited with fire and with the Holy Ghost, and shall receive a remission of their sins.
verses.plainText: Those who believe your words because you testify that you have seen me and know that I exist are even more blessed. Blessed are those who believe your words, humble themselves deeply, and are baptized, for they will be visited with fire and with the Holy Ghost and will receive forgiveness of their sins.

verses.text: Yea, blessed are the poor in spirit who come unto me, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
verses.plainText: Blessed are those who are poor in spirit who come to me, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

verses.text: And again, blessed are all they that mourn, for they shall be comforted.
verses.plainText: Blessed are all who mourn, for they will be comforted.

verses.text: And blessed are the meek, for they shall inherit the earth.
verses.plainText: Blessed are the meek, for they will inherit the earth.

verses.text: And blessed are all they who do hunger and thirst after righteousness, for they shall be filled with the Holy Ghost.
verses.plainText: Blessed are all who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they will be filled with the Holy Ghost.

verses.text: And blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy.
verses.plainText: Blessed are those who are merciful, for they will receive mercy.

verses.text: And blessed are all the pure in heart, for they shall see God.
verses.plainText: Blessed are all who are pure in heart, for they will see God.

verses.text: And blessed are all the peacemakers, for they shall be called the children of God.
verses.plainText: Blessed are all the peacemakers, for they will be called the children of God.

verses.text: And blessed are all they who are persecuted for my name’s sake, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
verses.plainText: Blessed are all who are persecuted because of me, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to them.

verses.text: And blessed are ye when men shall revile you and persecute, and shall say all manner of evil against you falsely, for my sake;
verses.plainText: You are blessed when people insult you, persecute you, and falsely say all kinds of evil against you because of me.

verses.text: For ye shall have great joy and be exceedingly glad, for great shall be your reward in heaven; for so persecuted they the prophets who were before you.
verses.plainText: You will have great joy and be extremely glad, because your reward in heaven will be great. They persecuted the prophets who came before you in the same way.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, I give unto you to be the salt of the earth; but if the salt shall lose its savor wherewith shall the earth be salted? The salt shall be thenceforth good for nothing, but to be cast out and to be trodden under foot of men.
verses.plainText: Truly, I tell you, I have made you the salt of the earth; but if the salt loses its flavor, how will the earth be salted? The salt will be good for nothing, except to be thrown out and trampled underfoot by people.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, I give unto you to be the light of this people. A city that is set on a hill cannot be hid.
verses.plainText: I tell you the truth, I have made you to be the light for these people. A city built on a hill cannot be hidden.

verses.text: Behold, do men light a candle and put it under a bushel? Nay, but on a candlestick, and it giveth light to all that are in the house;
verses.plainText: Do people light a candle and put it under a basket? No, they put it on a candlestick, and it gives light to everyone in the house.

verses.text: Therefore let your light so shine before this people, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father who is in heaven.
verses.plainText: Let your light shine before these people so they can see your good works and give glory to your Father in heaven.

verses.text: Think not that I am come to destroy the law or the prophets. I am not come to destroy but to fulfil;
verses.plainText: Do not think that I have come to destroy the law or the prophets. I have not come to destroy, but to fulfill.

verses.text: For verily I say unto you, one jot nor tittle hath not passed away from the law, but in me it hath all been fulfilled.
verses.plainText: Truly I tell you, not one jot or tittle has passed away from the law, but in me it has all been fulfilled.

verses.text: And behold, I have given you the law and the commandments of my Father, that ye shall believe in me, and that ye shall repent of your sins, and come unto me with a broken heart and a contrite spirit. Behold, ye have the commandments before you, and the law is fulfilled.
verses.plainText: I have given you the law and the commandments of my Father, so that you will believe in me, repent of your sins, and come to me with a broken heart and a contrite spirit. You have the commandments before you, and the law is fulfilled.

verses.text: Therefore come unto me and be ye saved; for verily I say unto you, that except ye shall keep my commandments, which I have commanded you at this time, ye shall in no case enter into the kingdom of heaven.
verses.plainText: So come to me and be saved; because I tell you the truth, unless you keep the commandments I have given you now, you will not enter the kingdom of heaven.

verses.text: Ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old time, and it is also written before you, that thou shalt not kill, and whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment of God;
verses.plainText: You have heard that it was said by those in ancient times, and it is also written before you, that you should not kill, and whoever kills will be in danger of God's judgment.

verses.text: But I say unto you, that whosoever is angry with his brother shall be in danger of his judgment. And whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council; and whosoever shall say, Thou fool, shall be in danger of hell fire.
verses.plainText: But I tell you, whoever is angry with his brother will be in danger of judgment. Whoever says to his brother, "Raca, " will be in danger of the council, and whoever says, "You fool, " will be in danger of hell fire.

verses.text: Therefore, if ye shall come unto me, or shall desire to come unto me, and rememberest that thy brother hast aught against thee—
verses.plainText: So if you come to me, or want to come to me, and remember that your brother has something against you—

verses.text: Go thy way unto thy brother, and first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come unto me with full purpose of heart, and I will receive you.
verses.plainText: Go to your brother and be reconciled with him first. Then come to me with full purpose of heart, and I will receive you.

verses.text: Agree with thine adversary quickly while thou art in the way with him, lest at any time he shall get thee, and thou shalt be cast into prison.
verses.plainText: Settle matters quickly with your adversary while you are with him on the way, so he doesn't turn you over and you end up being thrown into prison.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, thou shalt by no means come out thence until thou hast paid the uttermost senine. And while ye are in prison can ye pay even one senine? Verily, verily, I say unto you, Nay.
verses.plainText: Truly, I tell you, you will not come out of there until you have paid the last senine. And while you are in prison, can you pay even one senine? Truly, I tell you, no.

verses.text: Behold, it is written by them of old time, that thou shalt not commit adultery;
verses.plainText: It is written by those in ancient times that you shall not commit adultery.

verses.text: But I say unto you, that whosoever looketh on a woman, to lust after her, hath committed adultery already in his heart.
verses.plainText: But I tell you, anyone who looks at a woman with lust has already committed adultery with her in his heart.

verses.text: Behold, I give unto you a commandment, that ye suffer none of these things to enter into your heart;
verses.plainText: I give you a commandment that you allow none of these things to enter into your heart.

verses.text: For it is better that ye should deny yourselves of these things, wherein ye will take up your cross, than that ye should be cast into hell.
verses.plainText: It is better for you to deny yourselves these things and take up your cross than to be cast into hell.

verses.text: It hath been written, that whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorcement.
verses.plainText: It has been written that whoever divorces his wife should give her a certificate of divorce.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, that whosoever shall put away his wife, saving for the cause of fornication, causeth her to commit adultery; and whoso shall marry her who is divorced committeth adultery.
verses.plainText: Truly, I tell you, whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, causes her to commit adultery; and whoever marries a divorced woman commits adultery.

verses.text: And again it is written, thou shalt not forswear thyself, but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths;
verses.plainText: It is also written: Do not swear falsely, but keep the oaths you make to the Lord.

verses.text: But verily, verily, I say unto you, swear not at all; neither by heaven, for it is God’s throne;
verses.plainText: Truly, I tell you, do not swear at all—not by heaven, because it is God’s throne.

verses.text: Nor by the earth, for it is his footstool;
verses.plainText: Don’t swear by the earth, because it is his footstool.

verses.text: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head, because thou canst not make one hair black or white;
verses.plainText: And you should not swear by your head, because you cannot make a single hair white or black.

verses.text: But let your communication be Yea, yea; Nay, nay; for whatsoever cometh of more than these is evil.
verses.plainText: Just let your words be “yes” or “no”; anything more than this comes from evil.

verses.text: And behold, it is written, an eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth;
verses.plainText: It is written: an eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.

verses.text: But I say unto you, that ye shall not resist evil, but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also;
verses.plainText: But I say to you, do not resist evil. If anyone hits you on your right cheek, offer them the other one as well.

verses.text: And if any man will sue thee at the law and take away thy coat, let him have thy cloak also;
verses.plainText: If anyone sues you in court to take your coat, let them have your cloak as well.

verses.text: And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile, go with him twain.
verses.plainText: If anyone forces you to go one mile, go with him two.

verses.text: Give to him that asketh thee, and from him that would borrow of thee turn not away.
verses.plainText: Give to anyone who asks you, and don't turn away from someone who wants to borrow from you.

verses.text: And behold it is written also, that thou shalt love thy neighbor and hate thine enemy;
verses.plainText: It is also written that you should love your neighbor and hate your enemy.

verses.text: But I say unto you, love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them who despitefully use you and persecute you;
verses.plainText: But I tell you, love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who mistreat and persecute you.

verses.text: That ye may be the children of your Father who is in heaven; for he maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good.
verses.plainText: So you can be children of your Father in heaven, because he makes his sun rise on both the evil and the good.

verses.text: Therefore those things which were of old time, which were under the law, in me are all fulfilled.
verses.plainText: So the things from ancient times, which were under the law, are all fulfilled in me.

verses.text: Old things are done away, and all things have become new.
verses.plainText: Old things are gone, and everything has become new.

verses.text: Therefore I would that ye should be perfect even as I, or your Father who is in heaven is perfect.
verses.plainText: So I want you to be perfect, just as I am, or as your Father in heaven is perfect.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say that I would that ye should do alms unto the poor; but take heed that ye do not your alms before men to be seen of them; otherwise ye have no reward of your Father who is in heaven.
verses.plainText: Truly, I tell you that I want you to give to the poor; but be careful not to do your giving in front of others just to be seen by them; otherwise you will have no reward from your Father in heaven.

verses.text: Therefore, when ye shall do your alms do not sound a trumpet before you, as will hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, they have their reward.
verses.plainText: So when you give to the poor, don’t announce it with trumpets like the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, trying to be honored by others. I tell you the truth, they have already received their reward.

verses.text: But when thou doest alms let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth;
verses.plainText: But when you give to the poor, don’t let your left hand know what your right hand is doing.

verses.text: That thine alms may be in secret; and thy Father who seeth in secret, himself shall reward thee openly.
verses.plainText: So your giving may be done in secret, and your Father who sees what is done in secret will reward you openly.

verses.text: And when thou prayest thou shalt not do as the hypocrites, for they love to pray, standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, they have their reward.
verses.plainText: And when you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, because they love to pray standing in the synagogues and on the street corners so they can be seen by others. I tell you the truth, they have their reward.

verses.text: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father who is in secret; and thy Father, who seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.
verses.plainText: But when you pray, go into your room, and after you have shut your door, pray to your Father who is in secret; and your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you openly.

verses.text: But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen, for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.
verses.plainText: When you pray, don’t use meaningless repetitions like the unbelievers do, because they think they will be heard for saying a lot of words.

verses.text: Be not ye therefore like unto them, for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of before ye ask him.
verses.plainText: So don’t be like them, because your Father knows what you need before you ask Him.

verses.text: After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father who art in heaven, hallowed be thy name.
verses.plainText: Pray like this: Our Father in heaven, your name is holy.

verses.text: Thy will be done on earth as it is in heaven.
verses.plainText: Let your will be done on earth as it is in heaven.

verses.text: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.
verses.plainText: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive those who owe us.

verses.text: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.
verses.plainText: And do not lead us into temptation, but deliver us from evil.

verses.text: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, forever. Amen.
verses.plainText: For yours is the kingdom, the power, and the glory, forever. Amen.

verses.text: For, if ye forgive men their trespasses your heavenly Father will also forgive you;
verses.plainText: If you forgive others their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.

verses.text: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
verses.plainText: But if you do not forgive others their trespasses, your Father will not forgive your trespasses.

verses.text: Moreover, when ye fast be not as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance, for they disfigure their faces that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, they have their reward.
verses.plainText: Also, when you fast, don’t be like the hypocrites with sad expressions. They make their faces look gloomy so others will see that they are fasting. I tell you the truth, they have already received their reward.

verses.text: But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thy head, and wash thy face;
verses.plainText: But when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face;

verses.text: That thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father, who is in secret; and thy Father, who seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.
verses.plainText: Don’t make it obvious to others that you are fasting, but do it for your Father, who is in secret; and your Father, who sees what is done in secret, will reward you openly.

verses.text: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and thieves break through and steal;
verses.plainText: Do not store up treasures for yourselves on earth, where moth and rust destroy, and where thieves break in and steal.

verses.text: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal.
verses.plainText: Instead, store up treasures for yourselves in heaven, where neither moth nor rust destroys, and where thieves do not break in or steal.

verses.text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
verses.plainText: Your heart will be where your treasure is.

verses.text: The light of the body is the eye; if, therefore, thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.
verses.plainText: The eye is the light of the body; so if your eye is clear, your whole body will be full of light.

verses.text: But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If, therefore, the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is that darkness!
verses.plainText: But if your eye is bad, your whole body will be full of darkness. If the light within you is actually darkness, how great that darkness is!

verses.text: No man can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will hold to the one and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and Mammon.
verses.plainText: No one can serve two masters; either they will hate one and love the other, or they will be loyal to one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and wealth.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words he looked upon the twelve whom he had chosen, and said unto them: Remember the words which I have spoken. For behold, ye are they whom I have chosen to minister unto this people. Therefore I say unto you, take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the body than raiment?
verses.plainText: After Jesus finished speaking, he looked at the twelve he had chosen and said to them, "Remember the words I have spoken. You are the ones I have chosen to serve this people. So I tell you, do not worry about your life—what you will eat or drink—or about your body, what you will wear. Isn’t life more than food, and the body more than clothing?

verses.text: Behold the fowls of the air, for they sow not, neither do they reap nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?
verses.plainText: Look at the birds in the sky—they don’t plant, harvest, or store food in barns, but your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren’t you much more valuable than they are?

verses.text: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?
verses.plainText: Who among you can add a single cubit to your height just by worrying?

verses.text: And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin;
verses.plainText: And why do you worry about clothing? Think about the lilies of the field, how they grow; they don’t work or make their own clothing;

verses.text: And yet I say unto you, that even Solomon, in all his glory, was not arrayed like one of these.
verses.plainText: I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not dressed like one of these.

verses.text: Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which today is, and tomorrow is cast into the oven, even so will he clothe you, if ye are not of little faith.
verses.plainText: If God clothes the grass of the field, which is here today and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, he will also clothe you, if you are not lacking in faith.

verses.text: Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?
verses.plainText: So don’t worry, asking, “What will we eat? ” or “What will we drink? ” or “What will we wear? ”

verses.text: For your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.
verses.plainText: Your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.

verses.text: But seek ye first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things shall be added unto you.
verses.plainText: But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you.

verses.text: Take therefore no thought for the morrow, for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient is the day unto the evil thereof.
verses.plainText: So don’t worry about tomorrow, because tomorrow will take care of itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words he turned again to the multitude, and did open his mouth unto them again, saying: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Judge not, that ye be not judged.
verses.plainText: After Jesus finished speaking, he turned again to the crowd and said, "Truly, I tell you, do not judge, so that you will not be judged.

verses.text: For with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged; and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you again.
verses.plainText: The way you judge others is how you will be judged, and the measure you use for others will be used for you.

verses.text: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother’s eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?
verses.plainText: Why do you notice the speck in your brother’s eye, but don’t pay attention to the beam in your own eye?

verses.text: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother: Let me pull the mote out of thine eye—and behold, a beam is in thine own eye?
verses.plainText: How can you say to your brother, “Let me take the speck out of your eye, ” when there is a beam in your own eye?

verses.text: Thou hypocrite, first cast the beam out of thine own eye; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast the mote out of thy brother’s eye.
verses.plainText: You hypocrite, first remove the beam from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye.

verses.text: Give not that which is holy unto the dogs, neither cast ye your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn again and rend you.
verses.plainText: Do not give what is holy to dogs, and do not throw your pearls before pigs, or they may trample them under their feet and then turn and attack you.

verses.text: Ask, and it shall be given unto you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.
verses.plainText: Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.
