verses.text: For every one that asketh, receiveth; and he that seeketh, findeth; and to him that knocketh, it shall be opened.
verses.plainText: Everyone who asks receives; whoever seeks finds; and to whoever knocks, it will be opened.

verses.text: Or what man is there of you, who, if his son ask bread, will give him a stone?
verses.plainText: Which one of you, if his son asks for bread, would give him a stone?

verses.text: Or if he ask a fish, will he give him a serpent?
verses.plainText: Or if he asks for a fish, will he give him a snake?

verses.text: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father who is in heaven give good things to them that ask him?
verses.plainText: If you, who are imperfect, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who ask him?

verses.text: Therefore, all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them, for this is the law and the prophets.
verses.plainText: So, whatever you want others to do for you, do the same for them. This sums up the law and the prophets.

verses.text: Enter ye in at the strait gate; for wide is the gate, and broad is the way, which leadeth to destruction, and many there be who go in thereat;
verses.plainText: Enter through the narrow gate, because the gate is wide and the path is broad that leads to destruction, and many people go that way.

verses.text: Because strait is the gate, and narrow is the way, which leadeth unto life, and few there be that find it.
verses.plainText: The gate is narrow and the path is difficult that leads to life, and few people find it.

verses.text: Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.
verses.plainText: Watch out for false prophets who come to you disguised as harmless sheep, but inside they are vicious wolves.

verses.text: Ye shall know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes of thorns, or figs of thistles?
verses.plainText: You will recognize them by their actions. Do people pick grapes from thorn bushes, or figs from thistles?

verses.text: Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.
verses.plainText: In the same way, every good tree produces good fruit, but a corrupt tree produces bad fruit.

verses.text: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.
verses.plainText: A good tree cannot produce bad fruit, and a corrupt tree cannot produce good fruit.

verses.text: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
verses.plainText: Every tree that doesn’t produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.

verses.text: Wherefore, by their fruits ye shall know them.
verses.plainText: So you will recognize them by their actions.

verses.text: Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my Father who is in heaven.
verses.plainText: Not everyone who says to me, "Lord, Lord, " will enter the kingdom of heaven, but only those who do the will of my Father who is in heaven.

verses.text: Many will say to me in that day: Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in thy name, and in thy name have cast out devils, and in thy name done many wonderful works?
verses.plainText: Many will say to me on that day, “Lord, Lord, didn’t we prophesy in your name, and in your name cast out demons, and in your name do many wonderful works? ”

verses.text: And then will I profess unto them: I never knew you; depart from me, ye that work iniquity.
verses.plainText: Then I will tell them, “I never knew you; leave me, you who do evil. ”

verses.text: Therefore, whoso heareth these sayings of mine and doeth them, I will liken him unto a wise man, who built his house upon a rock—
verses.plainText: So anyone who hears my teachings and follows them is like a wise man who built his house on a rock—

verses.text: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell not, for it was founded upon a rock.
verses.plainText: The rain fell, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat against that house, but it did not fall because it was built on a rock.

verses.text: And every one that heareth these sayings of mine and doeth them not shall be likened unto a foolish man, who built his house upon the sand—
verses.plainText: Everyone who hears my teachings and doesn’t follow them will be like a foolish man who built his house on the sand—

verses.text: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell, and great was the fall of it.
verses.plainText: The rain came down, the floods rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house; and it collapsed, and its destruction was great.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that when Jesus had ended these sayings he cast his eyes round about on the multitude, and said unto them: Behold, ye have heard the things which I taught before I ascended to my Father; therefore, whoso remembereth these sayings of mine and doeth them, him will I raise up at the last day.
verses.plainText: When Jesus finished speaking, he looked around at the crowd and said to them, "You have heard the things I taught before I ascended to my Father. Whoever remembers these teachings of mine and follows them, I will raise up at the last day.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when Jesus had said these words he perceived that there were some among them who marveled, and wondered what he would concerning the law of Moses; for they understood not the saying that old things had passed away, and that all things had become new.
verses.plainText: When Jesus had said these words, he noticed that some of them were amazed and wondered what he meant about the law of Moses, because they didn’t understand that old things had passed away and everything had become new.

verses.text: And he said unto them: Marvel not that I said unto you that old things had passed away, and that all things had become new.
verses.plainText: He said to them, “Don’t be surprised that I told you old things have passed away and everything has become new. ”

verses.text: Behold, I say unto you that the law is fulfilled that was given unto Moses.
verses.plainText: I tell you that the law given to Moses is fulfilled.

verses.text: Behold, I am he that gave the law, and I am he who covenanted with my people Israel; therefore, the law in me is fulfilled, for I have come to fulfil the law; therefore it hath an end.
verses.plainText: I am the one who gave the law, and I am the one who made a covenant with my people Israel. The law is fulfilled in me, because I have come to fulfill the law, so it has come to an end.

verses.text: Behold, I do not destroy the prophets, for as many as have not been fulfilled in me, verily I say unto you, shall all be fulfilled.
verses.plainText: I do not destroy the prophets, because everything that has not yet been fulfilled in me will all be fulfilled.

verses.text: And because I said unto you that old things have passed away, I do not destroy that which hath been spoken concerning things which are to come.
verses.plainText: Because I told you that old things have passed away, I am not destroying what has been spoken about things that are still to come.

verses.text: For behold, the covenant which I have made with my people is not all fulfilled; but the law which was given unto Moses hath an end in me.
verses.plainText: The covenant I made with my people isn’t completely fulfilled yet, but the law given to Moses has ended in me.

verses.text: Behold, I am the law, and the light. Look unto me, and endure to the end, and ye shall live; for unto him that endureth to the end will I give eternal life.
verses.plainText: I am the law and the light. Look to me and endure to the end, and you will live; for I will give eternal life to those who endure to the end.

verses.text: Behold, I have given unto you the commandments; therefore keep my commandments. And this is the law and the prophets, for they truly testified of me.
verses.plainText: I have given you the commandments; so keep my commandments. This is the law and the prophets, for they truly testified of me.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words, he said unto those twelve whom he had chosen:
verses.plainText: After Jesus finished speaking, he said to the twelve he had chosen:

verses.text: Ye are my disciples; and ye are a light unto this people, who are a remnant of the house of Joseph.
verses.plainText: You are my disciples, and you are a light to this people, who are a remnant of the house of Joseph.

verses.text: And behold, this is the land of your inheritance; and the Father hath given it unto you.
verses.plainText: This is the land of your inheritance, and the Father has given it to you.

verses.text: And not at any time hath the Father given me commandment that I should tell it unto your brethren at Jerusalem.
verses.plainText: And the Father has never given me a command to tell your brothers at Jerusalem about this.

verses.text: Neither at any time hath the Father given me commandment that I should tell unto them concerning the other tribes of the house of Israel, whom the Father hath led away out of the land.
verses.plainText: At no time has the Father commanded me to tell them about the other tribes of the house of Israel, whom the Father has led away from the land.

verses.text: This much did the Father command me, that I should tell unto them:
verses.plainText: The Father commanded me to tell them this:

verses.text: That other sheep I have which are not of this fold; them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one fold, and one shepherd.
verses.plainText: I have other sheep that are not part of this fold; I must bring them also, and they will hear my voice. There will be one fold and one shepherd.

verses.text: And now, because of stiffneckedness and unbelief they understood not my word; therefore I was commanded to say no more of the Father concerning this thing unto them.
verses.plainText: Because they were stubborn and didn’t believe, they didn’t understand my words. That’s why I was commanded not to say anything more to them about the Father regarding this matter.

verses.text: But, verily, I say unto you that the Father hath commanded me, and I tell it unto you, that ye were separated from among them because of their iniquity; therefore it is because of their iniquity that they know not of you.
verses.plainText: I tell you the truth, the Father has commanded me, and I am telling you that you were separated from them because of their sin; it is because of their sin that they do not know about you.

verses.text: And verily, I say unto you again that the other tribes hath the Father separated from them; and it is because of their iniquity that they know not of them.
verses.plainText: I tell you again, the Father has separated the other tribes from them, and because of their sin, they do not know about them.

verses.text: And verily I say unto you, that ye are they of whom I said: Other sheep I have which are not of this fold; them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one fold, and one shepherd.
verses.plainText: I truly tell you, you are the ones I spoke of when I said: I have other sheep that are not of this fold; I must bring them also, and they will hear my voice, and there will be one fold and one shepherd.

verses.text: And they understood me not, for they supposed it had been the Gentiles; for they understood not that the Gentiles should be converted through their preaching.
verses.plainText: They didn’t understand me, because they thought I was talking about the Gentiles. They didn’t realize that the Gentiles would be converted through their preaching.

verses.text: And they understood me not that I said they shall hear my voice; and they understood me not that the Gentiles should not at any time hear my voice—that I should not manifest myself unto them save it were by the Holy Ghost.
verses.plainText: They didn’t understand when I said they would hear my voice; and they didn’t understand that the Gentiles would never hear my voice directly—that I would not show myself to them except through the Holy Ghost.

verses.text: But behold, ye have both heard my voice, and seen me; and ye are my sheep, and ye are numbered among those whom the Father hath given me.
verses.plainText: You have both heard my voice and seen me; you are my sheep, and you are numbered among those whom the Father has given me.

verses.text: And verily, verily, I say unto you that I have other sheep which are not of this land, neither of the land of Jerusalem, neither in any parts of that land round about whither I have been to minister.
verses.plainText: I tell you truly, I have other sheep that are not from this land, nor from Jerusalem, nor from any of the surrounding areas where I have ministered.

verses.text: For they of whom I speak are they who have not as yet heard my voice; neither have I at any time manifested myself unto them.
verses.plainText: The people I’m talking about are those who haven’t heard my voice yet, and I have never shown myself to them.

verses.text: But I have received a commandment of the Father that I shall go unto them, and that they shall hear my voice, and shall be numbered among my sheep, that there may be one fold and one shepherd; therefore I go to show myself unto them.
verses.plainText: But I have received a commandment from the Father to go to them, so they will hear my voice and be counted among my sheep, so there will be one flock and one shepherd. That is why I am going to show myself to them.

verses.text: And I command you that ye shall write these sayings after I am gone, that if it so be that my people at Jerusalem, they who have seen me and been with me in my ministry, do not ask the Father in my name, that they may receive a knowledge of you by the Holy Ghost, and also of the other tribes whom they know not of, that these sayings which ye shall write shall be kept and shall be manifested unto the Gentiles, that through the fulness of the Gentiles, the remnant of their seed, who shall be scattered forth upon the face of the earth because of their unbelief, may be brought in, or may be brought to a knowledge of me, their Redeemer.
verses.plainText: I command you to write down these teachings after I leave, so that if my people in Jerusalem—those who have seen me and been with me during my ministry—do not ask the Father in my name to receive a knowledge of you through the Holy Ghost, and also of the other tribes they do not know about, then these writings will be preserved and revealed to the Gentiles. Through the fullness of the Gentiles, the remnant of their descendants, who will be scattered across the earth because of their unbelief, may be gathered or brought to a knowledge of me, their Redeemer.

verses.text: And then will I gather them in from the four quarters of the earth; and then will I fulfill the covenant which the Father hath made unto all the people of the house of Israel.
verses.plainText: Then I will gather them from the four corners of the earth, and I will fulfill the covenant that the Father has made with all the people of the house of Israel.

verses.text: And blessed are the Gentiles, because of their belief in me, in and of the Holy Ghost, which witnesses unto them of me and of the Father.
verses.plainText: The Gentiles are blessed because they believe in me through the Holy Ghost, which testifies to them of me and of the Father.

verses.text: Behold, because of their belief in me, saith the Father, and because of the unbelief of you, O house of Israel, in the latter day shall the truth come unto the Gentiles, that the fulness of these things shall be made known unto them.
verses.plainText: Because of their belief in me, says the Father, and because of your unbelief, O house of Israel, in the last days the truth will come to the Gentiles, so that the fullness of these things will be made known to them.

verses.text: But wo, saith the Father, unto the unbelieving of the Gentiles—for notwithstanding they have come forth upon the face of this land, and have scattered my people who are of the house of Israel; and my people who are of the house of Israel have been cast out from among them, and have been trodden under feet by them;
verses.plainText: But sorrow awaits the unbelieving Gentiles, says the Father—for even though they have come to this land and have scattered my people of the house of Israel, my people of the house of Israel have been cast out from among them and have been trampled under their feet.

verses.text: And because of the mercies of the Father unto the Gentiles, and also the judgments of the Father upon my people who are of the house of Israel, verily, verily, I say unto you, that after all this, and I have caused my people who are of the house of Israel to be smitten, and to be afflicted, and to be slain, and to be cast out from among them, and to become hated by them, and to become a hiss and a byword among them—
verses.plainText: Because of the mercies of the Father to the Gentiles, and also the judgments of the Father on my people who are of the house of Israel, I truly tell you, after all this, I have caused my people who are of the house of Israel to be struck, afflicted, killed, cast out from among them, hated by them, and to become a hiss and a byword among them—

verses.text: And thus commandeth the Father that I should say unto you: At that day when the Gentiles shall sin against my gospel, and shall reject the fulness of my gospel, and shall be lifted up in the pride of their hearts above all nations, and above all the people of the whole earth, and shall be filled with all manner of lyings, and of deceits, and of mischiefs, and all manner of hypocrisy, and murders, and priestcrafts, and whoredoms, and of secret abominations; and if they shall do all those things, and shall reject the fulness of my gospel, behold, saith the Father, I will bring the fulness of my gospel from among them.
verses.plainText: The Father commands me to tell you: When the Gentiles sin against my gospel, reject its fullness, become proud above all nations and people on earth, and are filled with all kinds of lies, deceit, mischief, hypocrisy, murders, priestcraft, sexual immorality, and secret abominations—and if they do all these things and reject the fullness of my gospel—the Father says, I will take the fullness of my gospel away from them.

verses.text: And then will I remember my covenant which I have made unto my people, O house of Israel, and I will bring my gospel unto them.
verses.plainText: Then I will remember the covenant I made with my people, O house of Israel, and I will bring my gospel to them.

verses.text: And I will show unto thee, O house of Israel, that the Gentiles shall not have power over you; but I will remember my covenant unto you, O house of Israel, and ye shall come unto the knowledge of the fulness of my gospel.
verses.plainText: I will show you, house of Israel, that the Gentiles will not have power over you. I will remember my covenant with you, house of Israel, and you will come to know the fullness of my gospel.

verses.text: But if the Gentiles will repent and return unto me, saith the Father, behold they shall be numbered among my people, O house of Israel.
verses.plainText: But if the Gentiles repent and return to me, says the Father, they will be counted among my people, O house of Israel.

verses.text: And I will not suffer my people, who are of the house of Israel, to go through among them, and tread them down, saith the Father.
verses.plainText: I will not allow my people, who are of the house of Israel, to go among them and trample them down, says the Father.

verses.text: But if they will not turn unto me, and hearken unto my voice, I will suffer them, yea, I will suffer my people, O house of Israel, that they shall go through among them, and shall tread them down, and they shall be as salt that hath lost its savor, which is thenceforth good for nothing but to be cast out, and to be trodden under foot of my people, O house of Israel.
verses.plainText: But if they will not turn to me and listen to my voice, I will allow my people, O house of Israel, to go among them and trample them down. They will be like salt that has lost its flavor, which is then good for nothing except to be thrown out and trampled underfoot by my people, O house of Israel.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, thus hath the Father commanded me—that I should give unto this people this land for their inheritance.
verses.plainText: Truly, I tell you, the Father has commanded me to give this people this land as their inheritance.

verses.text: And then the words of the prophet Isaiah shall be fulfilled, which say:
verses.plainText: Then the words of the prophet Isaiah will be fulfilled, which say:

verses.text: Thy watchmen shall lift up the voice; with the voice together shall they sing, for they shall see eye to eye when the Lord shall bring again Zion.
verses.plainText: Your watchmen will raise their voices; together they will sing, because they will see eye to eye when the Lord restores Zion.

verses.text: Break forth into joy, sing together, ye waste places of Jerusalem; for the Lord hath comforted his people, he hath redeemed Jerusalem.
verses.plainText: Break out in joy and sing together, you ruined places of Jerusalem; for the Lord has comforted his people and has redeemed Jerusalem.

verses.text: The Lord hath made bare his holy arm in the eye of all the nations; and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of God.
verses.plainText: The Lord has revealed his holy power to all the nations, and everyone on earth will see the salvation of God.

verses.text: Behold, now it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words he looked round about again on the multitude, and he said unto them: Behold, my time is at hand.
verses.plainText: After Jesus finished speaking, he looked around at the crowd and said to them, "My time is near.

verses.text: I perceive that ye are weak, that ye cannot understand all my words which I am commanded of the Father to speak unto you at this time.
verses.plainText: I see that you are weak and cannot understand all the words the Father has commanded me to speak to you right now.

verses.text: Therefore, go ye unto your homes, and ponder upon the things which I have said, and ask of the Father, in my name, that ye may understand, and prepare your minds for the morrow, and I come unto you again.
verses.plainText: So go to your homes, think about the things I have said, and ask the Father in my name to help you understand. Prepare your minds for tomorrow, and I will come to you again.

verses.text: But now I go unto the Father, and also to show myself unto the lost tribes of Israel, for they are not lost unto the Father, for he knoweth whither he hath taken them.
verses.plainText: But now I am going to the Father, and also to show myself to the lost tribes of Israel, because they are not lost to the Father, for he knows where he has taken them.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when Jesus had thus spoken, he cast his eyes round about again on the multitude, and beheld they were in tears, and did look steadfastly upon him as if they would ask him to tarry a little longer with them.
verses.plainText: When Jesus had finished speaking, he looked around at the crowd and saw that they were in tears, gazing intently at him as if they wanted to ask him to stay with them a little longer.

verses.text: And he said unto them: Behold, my bowels are filled with compassion towards you.
verses.plainText: He said to them, "I am filled with compassion for you.

verses.text: Have ye any that are sick among you? Bring them hither. Have ye any that are lame, or blind, or halt, or maimed, or leprous, or that are withered, or that are deaf, or that are afflicted in any manner? Bring them hither and I will heal them, for I have compassion upon you; my bowels are filled with mercy.
verses.plainText: Do you have anyone among you who is sick? Bring them here. Do you have anyone who is lame, blind, crippled, maimed, has leprosy, withered, deaf, or afflicted in any way? Bring them here and I will heal them, because I have compassion for you; my heart is filled with mercy.

verses.text: For I perceive that ye desire that I should show unto you what I have done unto your brethren at Jerusalem, for I see that your faith is sufficient that I should heal you.
verses.plainText: I can see that you want me to show you what I did for your brothers and sisters in Jerusalem, and I see that your faith is strong enough for me to heal you.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when he had thus spoken, all the multitude, with one accord, did go forth with their sick and their afflicted, and their lame, and with their blind, and with their dumb, and with all them that were afflicted in any manner; and he did heal them every one as they were brought forth unto him.
verses.plainText: After he finished speaking, the entire crowd, together, brought their sick, their afflicted, their lame, their blind, their mute, and everyone who was suffering in any way; and he healed each one as they were brought to him.

verses.text: And they did all, both they who had been healed and they who were whole, bow down at his feet, and did worship him; and as many as could come for the multitude did kiss his feet, insomuch that they did bathe his feet with their tears.
verses.plainText: Everyone, both those who had been healed and those who were already well, bowed down at his feet and worshiped him. As many as could reach him because of the crowd kissed his feet, and they bathed his feet with their tears.

verses.text: And it came to pass that he commanded that their little children should be brought.
verses.plainText: He commanded that their little children be brought to him.

verses.text: So they brought their little children and set them down upon the ground round about him, and Jesus stood in the midst; and the multitude gave way till they had all been brought unto him.
verses.plainText: They brought their little children and set them on the ground around him, and Jesus stood in the middle; the crowd moved aside until all the children had been brought to him.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when they had all been brought, and Jesus stood in the midst, he commanded the multitude that they should kneel down upon the ground.
verses.plainText: When they had all been brought and Jesus stood in the middle, he told the crowd to kneel down on the ground.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when they had knelt upon the ground, Jesus groaned within himself, and said: Father, I am troubled because of the wickedness of the people of the house of Israel.
verses.plainText: When they had knelt on the ground, Jesus groaned within himself and said, "Father, I am troubled because of the wickedness of the people of the house of Israel.

verses.text: And when he had said these words, he himself also knelt upon the earth; and behold he prayed unto the Father, and the things which he prayed cannot be written, and the multitude did bear record who heard him.
verses.plainText: After he said these words, he knelt on the ground and prayed to the Father. The things he prayed for cannot be written, but the crowd who heard him testified of it.

verses.text: And after this manner do they bear record: The eye hath never seen, neither hath the ear heard, before, so great and marvelous things as we saw and heard Jesus speak unto the Father;
verses.plainText: They testify in this way: No one has ever seen or heard such great and marvelous things as we saw and heard Jesus say to the Father.

verses.text: And no tongue can speak, neither can there be written by any man, neither can the hearts of men conceive so great and marvelous things as we both saw and heard Jesus speak; and no one can conceive of the joy which filled our souls at the time we heard him pray for us unto the Father.
verses.plainText: No one can express, write, or even imagine such great and marvelous things as we saw and heard Jesus say; and no one can understand the joy that filled our hearts when we heard him pray for us to the Father.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when Jesus had made an end of praying unto the Father, he arose; but so great was the joy of the multitude that they were overcome.
verses.plainText: When Jesus finished praying to the Father, he stood up; but the joy of the crowd was so great that they were overcome.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Jesus spake unto them, and bade them arise.
verses.plainText: Jesus spoke to them and told them to stand up.

verses.text: And they arose from the earth, and he said unto them: Blessed are ye because of your faith. And now behold, my joy is full.
verses.plainText: They got up from the ground, and he said to them, "You are blessed because of your faith. Now my joy is complete.

verses.text: And when he had said these words, he wept, and the multitude bare record of it, and he took their little children, one by one, and blessed them, and prayed unto the Father for them.
verses.plainText: After he said these words, he wept, and the crowd witnessed it. He took their little children one by one, blessed them, and prayed to the Father for them.

verses.text: And when he had done this he wept again;
verses.plainText: When he finished this, he wept again.

verses.text: And he spake unto the multitude, and said unto them: Behold your little ones.
verses.plainText: He spoke to the crowd and said to them, "Look at your little ones.

verses.text: And as they looked to behold they cast their eyes towards heaven, and they saw the heavens open, and they saw angels descending out of heaven as it were in the midst of fire; and they came down and encircled those little ones about, and they were encircled about with fire; and the angels did minister unto them.
verses.plainText: As they looked up, they saw the heavens open and angels coming down from heaven surrounded by fire. The angels came down and surrounded the little ones, and they were encircled with fire, and the angels ministered to them.

verses.text: And the multitude did see and hear and bear record; and they know that their record is true for they all of them did see and hear, every man for himself; and they were in number about two thousand and five hundred souls; and they did consist of men, women, and children.
verses.plainText: The crowd saw and heard and testified; they know their testimony is true because each of them saw and heard for themselves. There were about two thousand five hundred people, including men, women, and children.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Jesus commanded his disciples that they should bring forth some bread and wine unto him.
verses.plainText: Jesus commanded his disciples to bring him some bread and wine.

verses.text: And while they were gone for bread and wine, he commanded the multitude that they should sit themselves down upon the earth.
verses.plainText: While they went to get bread and wine, he told the crowd to sit down on the ground.

verses.text: And when the disciples had come with bread and wine, he took of the bread and brake and blessed it; and he gave unto the disciples and commanded that they should eat.
verses.plainText: When the disciples brought bread and wine, he took the bread, broke it, blessed it, and gave it to the disciples, commanding them to eat.

verses.text: And when they had eaten and were filled, he commanded that they should give unto the multitude.
verses.plainText: After they had eaten and were full, he told them to give to the crowd.

verses.text: And when the multitude had eaten and were filled, he said unto the disciples: Behold there shall one be ordained among you, and to him will I give power that he shall break bread and bless it and give it unto the people of my church, unto all those who shall believe and be baptized in my name.
verses.plainText: After the crowd had eaten and were full, he said to the disciples: One among you will be ordained, and I will give him power to break bread, bless it, and give it to the people of my church—to all those who believe and are baptized in my name.

verses.text: And this shall ye always observe to do, even as I have done, even as I have broken bread and blessed it and given it unto you.
verses.plainText: You should always do this, just as I have done—breaking bread, blessing it, and giving it to you.

verses.text: And this shall ye do in remembrance of my body, which I have shown unto you. And it shall be a testimony unto the Father that ye do always remember me. And if ye do always remember me ye shall have my Spirit to be with you.
verses.plainText: Do this in remembrance of my body, which I have shown to you. It will be a testimony to the Father that you always remember me. If you always remember me, you will have my Spirit with you.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when he said these words, he commanded his disciples that they should take of the wine of the cup and drink of it, and that they should also give unto the multitude that they might drink of it.
verses.plainText: After he said these words, he told his disciples to take the wine from the cup and drink it, and to also give it to the crowd so they could drink as well.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they did so, and did drink of it and were filled; and they gave unto the multitude, and they did drink, and they were filled.
verses.plainText: They did as instructed, drank from it and were filled; then they gave it to the crowd, and they drank and were filled.

verses.text: And when the disciples had done this, Jesus said unto them: Blessed are ye for this thing which ye have done, for this is fulfilling my commandments, and this doth witness unto the Father that ye are willing to do that which I have commanded you.
verses.plainText: When the disciples had done this, Jesus said to them: You are blessed for what you have done, because this fulfills my commandments and shows the Father that you are willing to do what I have commanded you.

verses.text: And this shall ye always do to those who repent and are baptized in my name; and ye shall do it in remembrance of my blood, which I have shed for you, that ye may witness unto the Father that ye do always remember me. And if ye do always remember me ye shall have my Spirit to be with you.
verses.plainText: You should always do this for those who repent and are baptized in my name. Do it to remember my blood, which I have shed for you, so you can show the Father that you always remember me. If you always remember me, you will have my Spirit with you.

verses.text: And I give unto you a commandment that ye shall do these things. And if ye shall always do these things blessed are ye, for ye are built upon my rock.
verses.plainText: I give you a commandment to do these things. If you always do them, you are blessed, for you are built upon my rock.

verses.text: But whoso among you shall do more or less than these are not built upon my rock, but are built upon a sandy foundation; and when the rain descends, and the floods come, and the winds blow, and beat upon them, they shall fall, and the gates of hell are ready open to receive them.
verses.plainText: But anyone among you who does more or less than these things is not built on my rock, but on a sandy foundation; and when the rain falls, the floods come, and the winds blow and beat against them, they will fall, and the gates of hell are open to receive them.

verses.text: Therefore blessed are ye if ye shall keep my commandments, which the Father hath commanded me that I should give unto you.
verses.plainText: You are blessed if you keep my commandments, which the Father has commanded me to give to you.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, ye must watch and pray always, lest ye be tempted by the devil, and ye be led away captive by him.
verses.plainText: Truly, I tell you, you must always watch and pray, so you won't be tempted by the devil and led away captive by him.

verses.text: And as I have prayed among you even so shall ye pray in my church, among my people who do repent and are baptized in my name. Behold I am the light; I have set an example for you.
verses.plainText: Just as I have prayed among you, you should also pray in my church, among my people who repent and are baptized in my name. I am the light; I have set an example for you.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words unto his disciples, he turned again unto the multitude and said unto them:
verses.plainText: After Jesus finished speaking these words to his disciples, he turned again to the crowd and said to them:

verses.text: Behold, verily, verily, I say unto you, ye must watch and pray always lest ye enter into temptation; for Satan desireth to have you, that he may sift you as wheat.
verses.plainText: Truly, truly, I tell you, you must always watch and pray so you don't fall into temptation; for Satan wants to have you, so he can sift you like wheat.

verses.text: Therefore ye must always pray unto the Father in my name;
verses.plainText: So you must always pray to the Father in my name.

verses.text: And whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my name, which is right, believing that ye shall receive, behold it shall be given unto you.
verses.plainText: Whatever you ask the Father in my name, if it is right and you believe you will receive it, it will be given to you.

verses.text: Pray in your families unto the Father, always in my name, that your wives and your children may be blessed.
verses.plainText: Pray together as families to the Father, always in my name, so that your wives and your children may be blessed.

verses.text: And behold, ye shall meet together oft; and ye shall not forbid any man from coming unto you when ye shall meet together, but suffer them that they may come unto you and forbid them not;
verses.plainText: You should meet together often, and you should not forbid anyone from coming to you when you meet. Let them come to you and do not stop them.

verses.text: But ye shall pray for them, and shall not cast them out; and if it so be that they come unto you oft ye shall pray for them unto the Father, in my name.
verses.plainText: You should pray for them and not cast them out. If they come to you often, you should pray for them to the Father in my name.

verses.text: Therefore, hold up your light that it may shine unto the world. Behold I am the light which ye shall hold up—that which ye have seen me do. Behold ye see that I have prayed unto the Father, and ye all have witnessed.
verses.plainText: So let your light shine for the world. I am the light you should hold up—do what you have seen me do. You have seen that I have prayed to the Father, and you have all witnessed it.

verses.text: And ye see that I have commanded that none of you should go away, but rather have commanded that ye should come unto me, that ye might feel and see; even so shall ye do unto the world; and whosoever breaketh this commandment suffereth himself to be led into temptation.
verses.plainText: You see that I have commanded that none of you should leave, but instead I have commanded that you should come to me, so that you can feel and see; in the same way, you should do this for the world. Whoever breaks this commandment allows themselves to be led into temptation.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words, he turned his eyes again upon the disciples whom he had chosen, and said unto them:
verses.plainText: After Jesus finished speaking, he looked again at the disciples he had chosen and said to them:

verses.text: Behold verily, verily, I say unto you, I give unto you another commandment, and then I must go unto my Father that I may fulfil other commandments which he hath given me.
verses.plainText: Truly, I tell you, I am giving you another commandment, and then I must go to my Father so I can fulfill other commandments he has given me.

verses.text: And now behold, this is the commandment which I give unto you, that ye shall not suffer any one knowingly to partake of my flesh and blood unworthily, when ye shall minister it;
verses.plainText: This is the commandment I give you: do not allow anyone to knowingly take part in my flesh and blood unworthily when you administer it.

verses.text: For whoso eateth and drinketh my flesh and blood unworthily eateth and drinketh damnation to his soul; therefore if ye know that a man is unworthy to eat and drink of my flesh and blood ye shall forbid him.
verses.plainText: Anyone who eats and drinks my flesh and blood unworthily brings condemnation to their soul. So if you know that someone is unworthy to eat and drink of my flesh and blood, you must not allow them.

verses.text: Nevertheless, ye shall not cast him out from among you, but ye shall minister unto him and shall pray for him unto the Father, in my name; and if it so be that he repenteth and is baptized in my name, then shall ye receive him, and shall minister unto him of my flesh and blood.
verses.plainText: However, you should not cast him out from among you, but you should minister to him and pray for him to the Father in my name. If he repents and is baptized in my name, then you should receive him and minister to him with my flesh and blood.

verses.text: But if he repent not he shall not be numbered among my people, that he may not destroy my people, for behold I know my sheep, and they are numbered.
verses.plainText: But if he does not repent, he will not be counted among my people, so that he does not destroy them. I know my sheep, and they are numbered.

verses.text: Nevertheless, ye shall not cast him out of your synagogues, or your places of worship, for unto such shall ye continue to minister; for ye know not but what they will return and repent, and come unto me with full purpose of heart, and I shall heal them; and ye shall be the means of bringing salvation unto them.
verses.plainText: However, you should not cast them out of your synagogues or places of worship, but continue to minister to them, because you do not know if they will return, repent, and come to me with full purpose of heart, and I will heal them; and you will help bring salvation to them.

verses.text: Therefore, keep these sayings which I have commanded you that ye come not under condemnation; for wo unto him whom the Father condemneth.
verses.plainText: So, follow these teachings I have given you so that you won't come under condemnation, because sorrow awaits anyone whom the Father condemns.

verses.text: And I give you these commandments because of the disputations which have been among you. And blessed are ye if ye have no disputations among you.
verses.plainText: I am giving you these commandments because of the arguments that have been among you. You are blessed if you have no arguments among you.

verses.text: And now I go unto the Father, because it is expedient that I should go unto the Father for your sakes.
verses.plainText: Now I am going to the Father, because it is necessary for your sake that I go to Him.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when Jesus had made an end of these sayings, he touched with his hand the disciples whom he had chosen, one by one, even until he had touched them all, and spake unto them as he touched them.
verses.plainText: When Jesus finished saying these things, he touched each of the disciples he had chosen, one by one, until he had touched them all, and spoke to them as he touched them.

verses.text: And the multitude heard not the words which he spake, therefore they did not bear record; but the disciples bare record that he gave them power to give the Holy Ghost. And I will show unto you hereafter that this record is true.
verses.plainText: The crowd didn’t hear the words he spoke, so they didn’t testify of them; but the disciples testified that he gave them power to give the Holy Ghost. I will show you later that this record is true.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when Jesus had touched them all, there came a cloud and overshadowed the multitude that they could not see Jesus.
verses.plainText: When Jesus had touched them all, a cloud came and covered the crowd so they could not see Jesus.

verses.text: And while they were overshadowed he departed from them, and ascended into heaven. And the disciples saw and did bear record that he ascended again into heaven.
verses.plainText: While they were overshadowed, he left them and ascended into heaven. The disciples saw this and testified that he ascended again into heaven.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that when Jesus had ascended into heaven, the multitude did disperse, and every man did take his wife and his children and did return to his own home.
verses.plainText: After Jesus ascended into heaven, the crowd dispersed, and everyone took his wife and children and returned to his own home.

verses.text: And it was noised abroad among the people immediately, before it was yet dark, that the multitude had seen Jesus, and that he had ministered unto them, and that he would also show himself on the morrow unto the multitude.
verses.plainText: News spread quickly among the people, even before it got dark, that the crowd had seen Jesus, that he had ministered to them, and that he would also appear to the crowd again the next day.

verses.text: Yea, and even all the night it was noised abroad concerning Jesus; and insomuch did they send forth unto the people that there were many, yea, an exceedingly great number, did labor exceedingly all that night, that they might be on the morrow in the place where Jesus should show himself unto the multitude.
verses.plainText: All night long news about Jesus spread among the people, and so many, an extremely large number, worked hard throughout the night so they could be at the place the next day where Jesus would appear to the crowd.

verses.text: And it came to pass that on the morrow, when the multitude was gathered together, behold, Nephi and his brother whom he had raised from the dead, whose name was Timothy, and also his son, whose name was Jonas, and also Mathoni, and Mathonihah, his brother, and Kumen, and Kumenonhi, and Jeremiah, and Shemnon, and Jonas, and Zedekiah, and Isaiah—now these were the names of the disciples whom Jesus had chosen—and it came to pass that they went forth and stood in the midst of the multitude.
verses.plainText: The next day, when the crowd was gathered together, Nephi and his brother whom he had raised from the dead, whose name was Timothy, and also his son, Jonas, as well as Mathoni, Mathonihah his brother, Kumen, Kumenonhi, Jeremiah, Shemnon, Jonas, Zedekiah, and Isaiah—these were the names of the disciples Jesus had chosen—went out and stood in the middle of the crowd.

verses.text: And behold, the multitude was so great that they did cause that they should be separated into twelve bodies.
verses.plainText: The crowd was so large that they divided themselves into twelve groups.

verses.text: And the twelve did teach the multitude; and behold, they did cause that the multitude should kneel down upon the face of the earth, and should pray unto the Father in the name of Jesus.
verses.plainText: The twelve taught the crowd and had them kneel on the ground and pray to the Father in the name of Jesus.

verses.text: And the disciples did pray unto the Father also in the name of Jesus. And it came to pass that they arose and ministered unto the people.
verses.plainText: The disciples also prayed to the Father in the name of Jesus. Then they stood up and served the people.

verses.text: And when they had ministered those same words which Jesus had spoken—nothing varying from the words which Jesus had spoken—behold, they knelt again and prayed to the Father in the name of Jesus.
verses.plainText: After they shared the same words Jesus had spoken—without changing anything— they knelt again and prayed to the Father in the name of Jesus.

verses.text: And they did pray for that which they most desired; and they desired that the Holy Ghost should be given unto them.
verses.plainText: They prayed for what they wanted most, and they wanted to receive the Holy Ghost.

verses.text: And when they had thus prayed they went down unto the water’s edge, and the multitude followed them.
verses.plainText: After they finished praying, they went down to the water’s edge, and the crowd followed them.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Nephi went down into the water and was baptized.
verses.plainText: Nephi went down into the water and was baptized.

verses.text: And he came up out of the water and began to baptize. And he baptized all those whom Jesus had chosen.
verses.plainText: He came up out of the water and started to baptize. He baptized everyone Jesus had chosen.

verses.text: And it came to pass when they were all baptized and had come up out of the water, the Holy Ghost did fall upon them, and they were filled with the Holy Ghost and with fire.
verses.plainText: When they were all baptized and came up out of the water, the Holy Ghost came upon them, and they were filled with the Holy Ghost and with fire.

verses.text: And behold, they were encircled about as if it were by fire; and it came down from heaven, and the multitude did witness it, and did bear record; and angels did come down out of heaven and did minister unto them.
verses.plainText: They were surrounded as if by fire, which came down from heaven, and the crowd saw it and testified of it. Angels also came down from heaven and ministered to them.

verses.text: And it came to pass that while the angels were ministering unto the disciples, behold, Jesus came and stood in the midst and ministered unto them.
verses.plainText: While the angels were ministering to the disciples, Jesus came and stood among them and ministered to them.

verses.text: And it came to pass that he spake unto the multitude, and commanded them that they should kneel down again upon the earth, and also that his disciples should kneel down upon the earth.
verses.plainText: He spoke to the crowd and told them to kneel down again on the ground, and he also told his disciples to kneel down on the ground.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when they had all knelt down upon the earth, he commanded his disciples that they should pray.
verses.plainText: When they had all knelt down on the ground, he told his disciples to pray.

verses.text: And behold, they began to pray; and they did pray unto Jesus, calling him their Lord and their God.
verses.plainText: They began to pray, and they prayed to Jesus, calling him their Lord and their God.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Jesus departed out of the midst of them, and went a little way off from them and bowed himself to the earth, and he said:
verses.plainText: Jesus left their midst, walked a short distance away, bowed down to the ground, and said:

verses.text: Father, I thank thee that thou hast given the Holy Ghost unto these whom I have chosen; and it is because of their belief in me that I have chosen them out of the world.
verses.plainText: Father, I thank you for giving the Holy Ghost to those I have chosen; and I have chosen them out of the world because they believe in me.

verses.text: Father, I pray thee that thou wilt give the Holy Ghost unto all them that shall believe in their words.
verses.plainText: Father, I pray that you will give the Holy Ghost to all those who believe in their words.

verses.text: Father, thou hast given them the Holy Ghost because they believe in me; and thou seest that they believe in me because thou hearest them, and they pray unto me; and they pray unto me because I am with them.
verses.plainText: Father, you have given them the Holy Ghost because they believe in me; and you see that they believe in me because you hear them, and they pray to me; and they pray to me because I am with them.

verses.text: And now Father, I pray unto thee for them, and also for all those who shall believe on their words, that they may believe in me, that I may be in them as thou, Father, art in me, that we may be one.
verses.plainText: Now Father, I pray to you for them, and also for all those who will believe their words, that they may believe in me, so that I may be in them as you, Father, are in me, that we may be one.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when Jesus had thus prayed unto the Father, he came unto his disciples, and behold, they did still continue, without ceasing, to pray unto him; and they did not multiply many words, for it was given unto them what they should pray, and they were filled with desire.
verses.plainText: When Jesus finished praying to the Father, he came to his disciples. They continued to pray to him without stopping, and they didn’t use many words, because they were given what they should pray for, and they were filled with desire.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Jesus blessed them as they did pray unto him; and his countenance did smile upon them, and the light of his countenance did shine upon them, and behold they were as white as the countenance and also the garments of Jesus; and behold the whiteness thereof did exceed all the whiteness, yea, even there could be nothing upon earth so white as the whiteness thereof.
verses.plainText: Jesus blessed them as they prayed to him; his face smiled upon them, and the light of his face shone on them. They became as white as his face and his garments, and their whiteness was greater than anything else—there could be nothing on earth as white as they were.

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them: Pray on; nevertheless they did not cease to pray.
verses.plainText: Jesus said to them, “Keep praying, ” and they continued to pray without stopping.

verses.text: And he turned from them again, and went a little way off and bowed himself to the earth; and he prayed again unto the Father, saying:
verses.plainText: He turned away from them again, went a short distance, knelt down on the ground, and prayed to the Father, saying:

verses.text: Father, I thank thee that thou hast purified those whom I have chosen, because of their faith, and I pray for them, and also for them who shall believe on their words, that they may be purified in me, through faith on their words, even as they are purified in me.
verses.plainText: Father, I thank you that you have purified those I have chosen because of their faith. I pray for them, and also for those who will believe their words, that they may be purified in me through faith in their words, just as they are purified in me.

verses.text: Father, I pray not for the world, but for those whom thou hast given me out of the world, because of their faith, that they may be purified in me, that I may be in them as thou, Father, art in me, that we may be one, that I may be glorified in them.
verses.plainText: Father, I’m not praying for the world, but for those you have given me from the world, because of their faith, that they may be purified in me, that I may be in them as you, Father, are in me, so that we may be one, and that I may be glorified in them.

verses.text: And when Jesus had spoken these words he came again unto his disciples; and behold they did pray steadfastly, without ceasing, unto him; and he did smile upon them again; and behold they were white, even as Jesus.
verses.plainText: After Jesus finished speaking, he returned to his disciples. They prayed to him with unwavering faith, without stopping. He smiled at them again, and they became as white as Jesus.

verses.text: And it came to pass that he went again a little way off and prayed unto the Father;
verses.plainText: He went a little farther away again and prayed to the Father.

verses.text: And tongue cannot speak the words which he prayed, neither can be written by man the words which he prayed.
verses.plainText: No one can express in words the things he prayed, and no one can write down the words he prayed.

verses.text: And the multitude did hear and do bear record; and their hearts were open and they did understand in their hearts the words which he prayed.
verses.plainText: The crowd heard and bore witness, and their hearts were open, and they understood in their hearts the words he prayed.

verses.text: Nevertheless, so great and marvelous were the words which he prayed that they cannot be written, neither can they be uttered by man.
verses.plainText: The words he prayed were so great and marvelous that they cannot be written down or spoken by anyone.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when Jesus had made an end of praying he came again to the disciples, and said unto them: So great faith have I never seen among all the Jews; wherefore I could not show unto them so great miracles, because of their unbelief.
verses.plainText: When Jesus finished praying, he came back to the disciples and said to them, "I have never seen such great faith among all the Jews; because of their unbelief, I could not show them such great miracles.

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, there are none of them that have seen so great things as ye have seen; neither have they heard so great things as ye have heard.
verses.plainText: I tell you the truth, none of them have seen such great things as you have seen, nor have they heard such great things as you have heard.

verses.text: And it came to pass that he commanded the multitude that they should cease to pray, and also his disciples. And he commanded them that they should not cease to pray in their hearts.
verses.plainText: He told the crowd and his disciples to stop praying out loud, but he instructed them to keep praying in their hearts.

verses.text: And he commanded them that they should arise and stand up upon their feet. And they arose up and stood upon their feet.
verses.plainText: He told them to get up and stand on their feet, and they got up and stood on their feet.

verses.text: And it came to pass that he brake bread again and blessed it, and gave to the disciples to eat.
verses.plainText: He broke bread again, blessed it, and gave it to the disciples to eat.

verses.text: And when they had eaten he commanded them that they should break bread, and give unto the multitude.
verses.plainText: After they had eaten, he told them to break bread and give it to the crowd.

verses.text: And when they had given unto the multitude he also gave them wine to drink, and commanded them that they should give unto the multitude.
verses.plainText: After they had given to the crowd, he also gave them wine to drink and told them to give it to the crowd.

verses.text: Now, there had been no bread, neither wine, brought by the disciples, neither by the multitude;
verses.plainText: There was no bread or wine brought by the disciples or by the crowd.

verses.text: But he truly gave unto them bread to eat, and also wine to drink.
verses.plainText: He truly gave them bread to eat and wine to drink.

verses.text: And he said unto them: He that eateth this bread eateth of my body to his soul; and he that drinketh of this wine drinketh of my blood to his soul; and his soul shall never hunger nor thirst, but shall be filled.
verses.plainText: He said to them, “Whoever eats this bread is eating my body for their soul; and whoever drinks this wine is drinking my blood for their soul; and their soul will never hunger or thirst, but will be filled. ”

verses.text: Now, when the multitude had all eaten and drunk, behold, they were filled with the Spirit; and they did cry out with one voice, and gave glory to Jesus, whom they both saw and heard.
verses.plainText: After everyone in the crowd had eaten and drunk, they were filled with the Spirit. They all cried out together and gave glory to Jesus, whom they both saw and heard.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when they had all given glory unto Jesus, he said unto them: Behold now I finish the commandment which the Father hath commanded me concerning this people, who are a remnant of the house of Israel.
verses.plainText: When they had all given glory to Jesus, he said to them, “Now I am finishing the commandment the Father has given me concerning this people, who are a remnant of the house of Israel. ”

verses.text: Ye remember that I spake unto you, and said that when the words of Isaiah should be fulfilled—behold they are written, ye have them before you, therefore search them—
verses.plainText: You remember that I told you, when the words of Isaiah are fulfilled—and they are written, you have them in front of you—so study them.

verses.text: And verily, verily, I say unto you, that when they shall be fulfilled then is the fulfilling of the covenant which the Father hath made unto his people, O house of Israel.
verses.plainText: I tell you truly, when these things are fulfilled, that is the fulfillment of the covenant the Father has made with his people, O house of Israel.

verses.text: And then shall the remnants, which shall be scattered abroad upon the face of the earth, be gathered in from the east and from the west, and from the south and from the north; and they shall be brought to the knowledge of the Lord their God, who hath redeemed them.
verses.plainText: Then the remnants, who have been scattered across the earth, will be gathered from the east, west, south, and north; and they will be brought to the knowledge of the Lord their God, who has redeemed them.

verses.text: And the Father hath commanded me that I should give unto you this land, for your inheritance.
verses.plainText: And the Father has commanded me to give you this land for your inheritance.

verses.text: And I say unto you, that if the Gentiles do not repent after the blessing which they shall receive, after they have scattered my people—
verses.plainText: I tell you, if the Gentiles do not repent after the blessing they receive, after they have scattered my people—

verses.text: Then shall ye, who are a remnant of the house of Jacob, go forth among them; and ye shall be in the midst of them who shall be many; and ye shall be among them as a lion among the beasts of the forest, and as a young lion among the flocks of sheep, who, if he goeth through both treadeth down and teareth in pieces, and none can deliver.
verses.plainText: You, who are a remnant of the house of Jacob, will go among them; you will be in the midst of many people. You will be like a lion among the animals of the forest, and like a young lion among flocks of sheep, who, when he passes through, tramples down and tears apart, and no one can rescue them.

verses.text: Thy hand shall be lifted up upon thine adversaries, and all thine enemies shall be cut off.
verses.plainText: Your hand will be raised against your adversaries, and all your enemies will be cut off.

verses.text: And I will gather my people together as a man gathereth his sheaves into the floor.
verses.plainText: And I will gather my people together as a man gathers his sheaves onto the threshing floor.

verses.text: For I will make my people with whom the Father hath covenanted, yea, I will make thy horn iron, and I will make thy hoofs brass. And thou shalt beat in pieces many people; and I will consecrate their gain unto the Lord, and their substance unto the Lord of the whole earth. And behold, I am he who doeth it.
verses.plainText: I will make my people, with whom the Father has made a covenant, strong; I will make your horn like iron and your hooves like brass. You will break many people in pieces, and I will dedicate their wealth to the Lord, and their possessions to the Lord of all the earth. I am the one who does this.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, saith the Father, that the sword of my justice shall hang over them at that day; and except they repent it shall fall upon them, saith the Father, yea, even upon all the nations of the Gentiles.
verses.plainText: The Father says that the sword of my justice will hang over them on that day, and unless they repent, it will fall on them, the Father says—even on all the nations of the Gentiles.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass that I will establish my people, O house of Israel.
verses.plainText: I will establish my people, O house of Israel.

verses.text: And behold, this people will I establish in this land, unto the fulfilling of the covenant which I made with your father Jacob; and it shall be a New Jerusalem. And the powers of heaven shall be in the midst of this people; yea, even I will be in the midst of you.
verses.plainText: I will establish this people in this land to fulfill the covenant I made with your father Jacob, and it will be a New Jerusalem. The powers of heaven will be among this people; even I will be among you.

verses.text: Behold, I am he of whom Moses spake, saying: A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you. And it shall come to pass that every soul who will not hear that prophet shall be cut off from among the people.
verses.plainText: I am the one Moses spoke about when he said, “The Lord your God will raise up a prophet for you from among your own people, like me; you must listen to everything he tells you. Anyone who does not listen to that prophet will be cut off from among the people. ”

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, yea, and all the prophets from Samuel and those that follow after, as many as have spoken, have testified of me.
verses.plainText: I tell you the truth, all the prophets from Samuel and those who came after him—everyone who has spoken—has testified of me.

verses.text: And behold, ye are the children of the prophets; and ye are of the house of Israel; and ye are of the covenant which the Father made with your fathers, saying unto Abraham: And in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.
verses.plainText: You are the children of the prophets; you are of the house of Israel; you are part of the covenant that the Father made with your ancestors, saying to Abraham: In your descendants all the families of the earth will be blessed.

verses.text: The Father having raised me up unto you first, and sent me to bless you in turning away every one of you from his iniquities; and this because ye are the children of the covenant—
verses.plainText: The Father has raised me up for you first and sent me to bless you by turning each of you away from your sins, and this is because you are the children of the covenant.

verses.text: And after that ye were blessed then fulfilleth the Father the covenant which he made with Abraham, saying: In thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed—unto the pouring out of the Holy Ghost through me upon the Gentiles, which blessing upon the Gentiles shall make them mighty above all, unto the scattering of my people, O house of Israel.
verses.plainText: After you were blessed, the Father fulfilled the covenant he made with Abraham, saying: Through your descendants all the families of the earth will be blessed—by pouring out the Holy Ghost through me upon the Gentiles. This blessing on the Gentiles will make them mighty above all, leading to the scattering of my people, O house of Israel.

verses.text: And they shall be a scourge unto the people of this land. Nevertheless, when they shall have received the fulness of my gospel, then if they shall harden their hearts against me I will return their iniquities upon their own heads, saith the Father.
verses.plainText: They will be a scourge to the people of this land. However, when they have received the fullness of my gospel, if they harden their hearts against me, I will bring their sins back upon their own heads, says the Father.

verses.text: And I will remember the covenant which I have made with my people; and I have covenanted with them that I would gather them together in mine own due time, that I would give unto them again the land of their fathers for their inheritance, which is the land of Jerusalem, which is the promised land unto them forever, saith the Father.
verses.plainText: I will remember the covenant I have made with my people. I have promised them that I will gather them together at the right time and give them back the land of their ancestors for their inheritance—the land of Jerusalem, which is the promised land for them forever, says the Father.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass that the time cometh, when the fulness of my gospel shall be preached unto them;
verses.plainText: The time will come when the fullness of my gospel will be preached to them.

verses.text: And they shall believe in me, that I am Jesus Christ, the Son of God, and shall pray unto the Father in my name.
verses.plainText: They will believe in me, that I am Jesus Christ, the Son of God, and they will pray to the Father in my name.

verses.text: Then shall their watchmen lift up their voice, and with the voice together shall they sing; for they shall see eye to eye.
verses.plainText: Then their watchmen will raise their voices, and together they will sing, for they will see eye to eye.

verses.text: Then will the Father gather them together again, and give unto them Jerusalem for the land of their inheritance.
verses.plainText: Then the Father will gather them together again and give them Jerusalem as their land of inheritance.

verses.text: Then shall they break forth into joy—Sing together, ye waste places of Jerusalem; for the Father hath comforted his people, he hath redeemed Jerusalem.
verses.plainText: Then they will break out in joy—Sing together, you ruined places of Jerusalem, for the Father has comforted his people; he has redeemed Jerusalem.

verses.text: The Father hath made bare his holy arm in the eyes of all the nations; and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of the Father; and the Father and I are one.
verses.plainText: The Father has shown his holy power to all nations, and everyone on earth will see the salvation of the Father. The Father and I are one.

verses.text: And then shall be brought to pass that which is written: Awake, awake again, and put on thy strength, O Zion; put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city, for henceforth there shall no more come into thee the uncircumcised and the unclean.
verses.plainText: Then what is written will happen: Awake again and put on your strength, O Zion; put on your beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city, for from now on the uncircumcised and the unclean will no longer enter you.

verses.text: Shake thyself from the dust; arise, sit down, O Jerusalem; loose thyself from the bands of thy neck, O captive daughter of Zion.
verses.plainText: Shake off the dust; get up and sit down, Jerusalem. Free yourself from the chains around your neck, captive daughter of Zion.

verses.text: For thus saith the Lord: Ye have sold yourselves for naught, and ye shall be redeemed without money.
verses.plainText: The Lord says: You have sold yourselves for nothing, and you will be redeemed without money.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, that my people shall know my name; yea, in that day they shall know that I am he that doth speak.
verses.plainText: Truly, truly, I tell you, my people will know my name; in that day they will know that I am the one who speaks.

verses.text: And then shall they say: How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him that bringeth good tidings unto them, that publisheth peace; that bringeth good tidings unto them of good, that publisheth salvation; that saith unto Zion: Thy God reigneth!
verses.plainText: And then they will say: How beautiful on the mountains are the feet of the one who brings good news to them, who proclaims peace; who brings good news of good things, who proclaims salvation; who says to Zion: Your God reigns!

verses.text: And then shall a cry go forth: Depart ye, depart ye, go ye out from thence, touch not that which is unclean; go ye out of the midst of her; be ye clean that bear the vessels of the Lord.
verses.plainText: Then a call will go out: Leave, leave, go out from there; do not touch anything unclean. Go out from her midst; be clean, you who carry the vessels of the Lord.

verses.text: For ye shall not go out with haste nor go by flight; for the Lord will go before you, and the God of Israel shall be your rearward.
verses.plainText: You will not leave in a hurry or run away, because the Lord will go ahead of you, and the God of Israel will protect you from behind.

verses.text: Behold, my servant shall deal prudently; he shall be exalted and extolled and be very high.
verses.plainText: My servant will act wisely; he will be exalted, honored, and lifted very high.

verses.text: As many were astonished at thee—his visage was so marred, more than any man, and his form more than the sons of men—
verses.plainText: Many were amazed at you—his appearance was more disfigured than any other man, and his form more than any of the sons of men—

verses.text: So shall he sprinkle many nations; the kings shall shut their mouths at him, for that which had not been told them shall they see; and that which they had not heard shall they consider.
verses.plainText: He will sprinkle many nations; kings will be silent before him, because they will see things they were never told and think about things they had never heard.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, all these things shall surely come, even as the Father hath commanded me. Then shall this covenant which the Father hath covenanted with his people be fulfilled; and then shall Jerusalem be inhabited again with my people, and it shall be the land of their inheritance.
verses.plainText: Truly, I tell you, all these things will definitely happen, just as the Father has commanded me. Then the covenant that the Father has made with his people will be fulfilled; and Jerusalem will be inhabited again by my people, and it will be the land of their inheritance.

verses.text: And verily I say unto you, I give unto you a sign, that ye may know the time when these things shall be about to take place—that I shall gather in, from their long dispersion, my people, O house of Israel, and shall establish again among them my Zion;
verses.plainText: I truly tell you, I am giving you a sign so you will know when these things are about to happen—that I will gather my people, O house of Israel, from their long dispersion and will once again establish my Zion among them.

verses.text: And behold, this is the thing which I will give unto you for a sign—for verily I say unto you that when these things which I declare unto you, and which I shall declare unto you hereafter of myself, and by the power of the Holy Ghost which shall be given unto you of the Father, shall be made known unto the Gentiles that they may know concerning this people who are a remnant of the house of Jacob, and concerning this my people who shall be scattered by them;
verses.plainText: This is the sign I will give you: I truly tell you that when the things I am telling you now, and the things I will tell you later by myself and by the power of the Holy Ghost given to you by the Father, are made known to the Gentiles so they can learn about this people, who are a remnant of the house of Jacob, and about my people who will be scattered by them;

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, when these things shall be made known unto them of the Father, and shall come forth of the Father, from them unto you;
verses.plainText: Truly, truly, I tell you, when these things are made known to them by the Father, and come from the Father, from them to you;

verses.text: For it is wisdom in the Father that they should be established in this land, and be set up as a free people by the power of the Father, that these things might come forth from them unto a remnant of your seed, that the covenant of the Father may be fulfilled which he hath covenanted with his people, O house of Israel;
verses.plainText: It is the Father's wisdom that they should be established in this land and set up as a free people by His power, so that these things can come from them to a remnant of your descendants, fulfilling the covenant the Father has made with His people, O house of Israel.

verses.text: Therefore, when these works and the works which shall be wrought among you hereafter shall come forth from the Gentiles, unto your seed which shall dwindle in unbelief because of iniquity;
verses.plainText: So, when these works and the works that will be done among you in the future come from the Gentiles to your descendants, who will fall into unbelief because of sin;

verses.text: For thus it behooveth the Father that it should come forth from the Gentiles, that he may show forth his power unto the Gentiles, for this cause that the Gentiles, if they will not harden their hearts, that they may repent and come unto me and be baptized in my name and know of the true points of my doctrine, that they may be numbered among my people, O house of Israel;
verses.plainText: The Father wants it to come from the Gentiles so he can show his power to them. If the Gentiles do not harden their hearts, they can repent, come to me, be baptized in my name, and learn the true points of my doctrine, so they can be counted among my people, O house of Israel.

verses.text: And when these things come to pass that thy seed shall begin to know these things—it shall be a sign unto them, that they may know that the work of the Father hath already commenced unto the fulfilling of the covenant which he hath made unto the people who are of the house of Israel.
verses.plainText: When your descendants begin to learn these things, it will be a sign to them that the work of the Father has already started to fulfill the covenant he made with the people of the house of Israel.

verses.text: And when that day shall come, it shall come to pass that kings shall shut their mouths; for that which had not been told them shall they see; and that which they had not heard shall they consider.
verses.plainText: When that day comes, kings will be silent, because they will see things they were never told about, and they will think about things they had never heard.

verses.text: For in that day, for my sake shall the Father work a work, which shall be a great and a marvelous work among them; and there shall be among them those who will not believe it, although a man shall declare it unto them.
verses.plainText: On that day, for my sake, the Father will do a great and marvelous work among them; and there will be some among them who will not believe it, even though someone tells them about it.

verses.text: But behold, the life of my servant shall be in my hand; therefore they shall not hurt him, although he shall be marred because of them. Yet I will heal him, for I will show unto them that my wisdom is greater than the cunning of the devil.
verses.plainText: The life of my servant will be in my hands; so they will not harm him, even though he will be damaged because of them. But I will heal him, to show them that my wisdom is greater than the cunning of the devil.

verses.text: Therefore it shall come to pass that whosoever will not believe in my words, who am Jesus Christ, which the Father shall cause him to bring forth unto the Gentiles, and shall give unto him power that he shall bring them forth unto the Gentiles, (it shall be done even as Moses said) they shall be cut off from among my people who are of the covenant.
