verses.plainText: So anyone who does not believe my words—I am Jesus Christ—which the Father will cause him to bring to the Gentiles, and will give him power to deliver them to the Gentiles, will be cut off from among my covenant people, just as Moses said.

verses.text: And my people who are a remnant of Jacob shall be among the Gentiles, yea, in the midst of them as a lion among the beasts of the forest, as a young lion among the flocks of sheep, who, if he go through both treadeth down and teareth in pieces, and none can deliver.
verses.plainText: And my people, who are a remnant of Jacob, will be among the Gentiles, in the middle of them like a lion among the beasts of the forest, like a young lion among the flocks of sheep, who, if he goes through, tramples down and tears in pieces, and no one can rescue.

verses.text: Their hand shall be lifted up upon their adversaries, and all their enemies shall be cut off.
verses.plainText: Their hand will be raised against their adversaries, and all their enemies will be destroyed.

verses.text: Yea, wo be unto the Gentiles except they repent; for it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Father, that I will cut off thy horses out of the midst of thee, and I will destroy thy chariots;
verses.plainText: Woe to the Gentiles unless they repent; for in that day, says the Father, I will remove your horses from among you, and I will destroy your chariots.

verses.text: And I will cut off the cities of thy land, and throw down all thy strongholds;
verses.plainText: I will destroy the cities in your land and tear down all your strongholds.

verses.text: And I will cut off witchcrafts out of thy land, and thou shalt have no more soothsayers;
verses.plainText: I will remove witchcraft from your land, and you will have no more soothsayers.

verses.text: Thy graven images I will also cut off, and thy standing images out of the midst of thee, and thou shalt no more worship the works of thy hands;
verses.plainText: I will also cut off your carved images and your standing images from among you, and you will no longer worship what your hands have made.

verses.text: And I will pluck up thy groves out of the midst of thee; so will I destroy thy cities.
verses.plainText: I will remove your groves from among you, and I will destroy your cities.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass that all lyings, and deceivings, and envyings, and strifes, and priestcrafts, and whoredoms, shall be done away.
verses.plainText: All lies, deceptions, envy, strife, priestcraft, and sexual immorality will be done away with.

verses.text: For it shall come to pass, saith the Father, that at that day whosoever will not repent and come unto my Beloved Son, them will I cut off from among my people, O house of Israel;
verses.plainText: The Father says that at that time, anyone who does not repent and come to my Beloved Son will be cut off from among my people, O house of Israel.

verses.text: And I will execute vengeance and fury upon them, even as upon the heathen, such as they have not heard.
verses.plainText: I will carry out vengeance and fury on them, just as I have on the nations, in a way they have never experienced before.

verses.text: But if they will repent and hearken unto my words, and harden not their hearts, I will establish my church among them, and they shall come in unto the covenant and be numbered among this the remnant of Jacob, unto whom I have given this land for their inheritance;
verses.plainText: But if they will repent and listen to my words, and do not harden their hearts, I will establish my church among them, and they will enter into the covenant and be counted among the remnant of Jacob, to whom I have given this land for their inheritance.

verses.text: And they shall assist my people, the remnant of Jacob, and also as many of the house of Israel as shall come, that they may build a city, which shall be called the New Jerusalem.
verses.plainText: They will help my people, the remnant of Jacob, and everyone from the house of Israel who comes, so they can build a city called the New Jerusalem.

verses.text: And then shall they assist my people that they may be gathered in, who are scattered upon all the face of the land, in unto the New Jerusalem.
verses.plainText: At that time, they will help my people, who are scattered across the land, to be gathered into the New Jerusalem.

verses.text: And then shall the power of heaven come down among them; and I also will be in the midst.
verses.plainText: Then the power of heaven will come down among them, and I will also be in their midst.

verses.text: And then shall the work of the Father commence at that day, even when this gospel shall be preached among the remnant of this people. Verily I say unto you, at that day shall the work of the Father commence among all the dispersed of my people, yea, even the tribes which have been lost, which the Father hath led away out of Jerusalem.
verses.plainText: At that time, the work of the Father will begin, when this gospel is preached among the remnant of this people. Truly, I tell you, on that day the work of the Father will begin among all the scattered people, even the tribes that have been lost, whom the Father has led away from Jerusalem.

verses.text: Yea, the work shall commence among all the dispersed of my people, with the Father to prepare the way whereby they may come unto me, that they may call on the Father in my name.
verses.plainText: The work will begin among all the scattered people of mine, with the Father preparing the way for them to come to me, so they can call on the Father in my name.

verses.text: Yea, and then shall the work commence, with the Father among all nations in preparing the way whereby his people may be gathered home to the land of their inheritance.
verses.plainText: Then the work will begin, with the Father among all nations, to prepare the way for his people to be gathered home to the land of their inheritance.

verses.text: And they shall go out from all nations; and they shall not go out in haste, nor go by flight, for I will go before them, saith the Father, and I will be their rearward.
verses.plainText: They will go out from all nations, but they won’t leave in a hurry or flee in fear, because I will go before them, says the Father, and I will be their protection behind them.

verses.text: And then shall that which is written come to pass: Sing, O barren, thou that didst not bear; break forth into singing, and cry aloud, thou that didst not travail with child; for more are the children of the desolate than the children of the married wife, saith the Lord.
verses.plainText: Then what is written will happen: Sing, O barren woman, you who did not give birth; break out in singing and shout for joy, you who did not go through labor, for the children of the desolate woman are more than those of the married wife, says the Lord.

verses.text: Enlarge the place of thy tent, and let them stretch forth the curtains of thy habitations; spare not, lengthen thy cords and strengthen thy stakes;
verses.plainText: Expand the space for your tent, and let them stretch out the curtains of your homes; don’t hold back—make your cords longer and strengthen your stakes.

verses.text: For thou shalt break forth on the right hand and on the left, and thy seed shall inherit the Gentiles and make the desolate cities to be inhabited.
verses.plainText: You will spread out to the right and to the left, and your descendants will inherit the Gentiles and make the deserted cities inhabited.

verses.text: Fear not, for thou shalt not be ashamed; neither be thou confounded, for thou shalt not be put to shame; for thou shalt forget the shame of thy youth, and shalt not remember the reproach of thy youth, and shalt not remember the reproach of thy widowhood any more.
verses.plainText: Do not be afraid, for you will not be ashamed; do not be discouraged, for you will not be put to shame. You will forget the shame of your youth and will no longer remember the disgrace of your widowhood.

verses.text: For thy maker, thy husband, the Lord of Hosts is his name; and thy Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel—the God of the whole earth shall he be called.
verses.plainText: Your maker, your husband, the Lord of Hosts is his name; and your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel—he will be called the God of the whole earth.

verses.text: For the Lord hath called thee as a woman forsaken and grieved in spirit, and a wife of youth, when thou wast refused, saith thy God.
verses.plainText: The Lord has called you like a woman who has been abandoned and is grieving in spirit, like a wife married young who was rejected, says your God.

verses.text: For a small moment have I forsaken thee, but with great mercies will I gather thee.
verses.plainText: I have left you for a short time, but with great mercy I will gather you back.

verses.text: In a little wrath I hid my face from thee for a moment, but with everlasting kindness will I have mercy on thee, saith the Lord thy Redeemer.
verses.plainText: For a short time, in my anger, I hid my face from you, but with everlasting kindness I will have mercy on you, says the Lord, your Redeemer.

verses.text: For this, the waters of Noah unto me, for as I have sworn that the waters of Noah should no more go over the earth, so have I sworn that I would not be wroth with thee.
verses.plainText: This is like the waters of Noah to me; just as I have sworn that the waters of Noah will never again cover the earth, so I have sworn that I will not be angry with you.

verses.text: For the mountains shall depart and the hills be removed, but my kindness shall not depart from thee, neither shall the covenant of my peace be removed, saith the Lord that hath mercy on thee.
verses.plainText: Even if the mountains leave and the hills disappear, my kindness will not leave you, and my covenant of peace will not be taken away, says the Lord who has mercy on you.

verses.text: O thou afflicted, tossed with tempest, and not comforted! Behold, I will lay thy stones with fair colors, and lay thy foundations with sapphires.
verses.plainText: You who are afflicted, tossed by storms, and not comforted—I will set your stones with beautiful colors and lay your foundations with sapphires.

verses.text: And I will make thy windows of agates, and thy gates of carbuncles, and all thy borders of pleasant stones.
verses.plainText: I will make your windows of agate, your gates of carbuncle, and all your borders of beautiful stones.

verses.text: And all thy children shall be taught of the Lord; and great shall be the peace of thy children.
verses.plainText: All your children will be taught by the Lord, and your children will have great peace.

verses.text: In righteousness shalt thou be established; thou shalt be far from oppression for thou shalt not fear, and from terror for it shall not come near thee.
verses.plainText: You will be established in righteousness; you will be far from oppression because you will not be afraid, and far from terror because it will not come near you.

verses.text: Behold, they shall surely gather together against thee, not by me; whosoever shall gather together against thee shall fall for thy sake.
verses.plainText: They will definitely gather together against you, but not because of me; whoever gathers against you will fall for your sake.

verses.text: Behold, I have created the smith that bloweth the coals in the fire, and that bringeth forth an instrument for his work; and I have created the waster to destroy.
verses.plainText: I have created the smith who blows the coals in the fire and makes an instrument for his work; and I have created the destroyer to bring destruction.

verses.text: No weapon that is formed against thee shall prosper; and every tongue that shall revile against thee in judgment thou shalt condemn. This is the heritage of the servants of the Lord, and their righteousness is of me, saith the Lord.
verses.plainText: No weapon formed against you will succeed, and you will condemn every tongue that accuses you in judgment. This is the heritage of the Lord’s servants, and their righteousness comes from me, says the Lord.

verses.text: And now, behold, I say unto you, that ye ought to search these things. Yea, a commandment I give unto you that ye search these things diligently; for great are the words of Isaiah.
verses.plainText: Now I say to you that you should study these things. I give you a commandment to search these things diligently, because the words of Isaiah are great.

verses.text: For surely he spake as touching all things concerning my people which are of the house of Israel; therefore it must needs be that he must speak also to the Gentiles.
verses.plainText: He truly spoke about everything concerning my people, who are of the house of Israel; so he must also speak to the Gentiles.

verses.text: And all things that he spake have been and shall be, even according to the words which he spake.
verses.plainText: Everything he said has happened and will happen, just as he said.

verses.text: Therefore give heed to my words; write the things which I have told you; and according to the time and the will of the Father they shall go forth unto the Gentiles.
verses.plainText: So pay attention to my words; write down the things I have told you, and at the time and in the way the Father wills, they will be given to the Gentiles.

verses.text: And whosoever will hearken unto my words and repenteth and is baptized, the same shall be saved. Search the prophets, for many there be that testify of these things.
verses.plainText: Anyone who listens to my words, repents, and is baptized will be saved. Study the prophets, because many of them testify of these things.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that when Jesus had said these words he said unto them again, after he had expounded all the scriptures unto them which they had received, he said unto them: Behold, other scriptures I would that ye should write, that ye have not.
verses.plainText: After Jesus finished saying these words and explaining all the scriptures they had received, he said to them again, “There are other scriptures I want you to write that you haven’t yet. ”

verses.text: And it came to pass that he said unto Nephi: Bring forth the record which ye have kept.
verses.plainText: He said to Nephi, "Bring the record you have kept.

verses.text: And when Nephi had brought forth the records, and laid them before him, he cast his eyes upon them and said:
verses.plainText: When Nephi brought the records and placed them in front of him, he looked at them and said:

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, I commanded my servant Samuel, the Lamanite, that he should testify unto this people, that at the day that the Father should glorify his name in me that there were many saints who should arise from the dead, and should appear unto many, and should minister unto them. And he said unto them: Was it not so?
verses.plainText: I tell you the truth, I commanded my servant Samuel, the Lamanite, to testify to this people that when the Father glorified his name in me, many saints would rise from the dead, appear to many, and minister to them. And he said to them, "Wasn't it so?

verses.text: And his disciples answered him and said: Yea, Lord, Samuel did prophesy according to thy words, and they were all fulfilled.
verses.plainText: His disciples answered him and said, "Yes, Lord, Samuel did prophesy according to your words, and they were all fulfilled.

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them: How be it that ye have not written this thing, that many saints did arise and appear unto many and did minister unto them?
verses.plainText: Jesus said to them, “Why haven’t you written down that many saints rose and appeared to many people and ministered to them? ”

verses.text: And it came to pass that Nephi remembered that this thing had not been written.
verses.plainText: Nephi remembered that this event had not been written down.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Jesus commanded that it should be written; therefore it was written according as he commanded.
verses.plainText: Jesus commanded that it be written, so it was recorded just as he instructed.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that when Jesus had expounded all the scriptures in one, which they had written, he commanded them that they should teach the things which he had expounded unto them.
verses.plainText: After Jesus had explained all the scriptures they had written, he commanded them to teach the things he had explained to them.

verses.text: And it came to pass that he commanded them that they should write the words which the Father had given unto Malachi, which he should tell unto them. And it came to pass that after they were written he expounded them. And these are the words which he did tell unto them, saying: Thus said the Father unto Malachi—Behold, I will send my messenger, and he shall prepare the way before me, and the Lord whom ye seek shall suddenly come to his temple, even the messenger of the covenant, whom ye delight in; behold, he shall come, saith the Lord of Hosts.
verses.plainText: He told them to write the words that the Father had given to Malachi, which he would share with them. After they were written, he explained them. These are the words he spoke to them: The Father said to Malachi—"I will send my messenger, and he will prepare the way before me. The Lord whom you seek will suddenly come to his temple, even the messenger of the covenant, whom you delight in. He will come, " says the Lord of Hosts.

verses.text: But who may abide the day of his coming, and who shall stand when he appeareth? For he is like a refiner’s fire, and like fuller’s soap.
verses.plainText: But who can endure the day of his coming, and who can stand when he appears? For he is like a refiner’s fire and like a launderer’s soap.

verses.text: And he shall sit as a refiner and purifier of silver; and he shall purify the sons of Levi, and purge them as gold and silver, that they may offer unto the Lord an offering in righteousness.
verses.plainText: He will sit as a refiner and purifier of silver, and he will purify the sons of Levi and cleanse them like gold and silver, so they can offer a righteous offering to the Lord.

verses.text: Then shall the offering of Judah and Jerusalem be pleasant unto the Lord, as in the days of old, and as in former years.
verses.plainText: Then the offering of Judah and Jerusalem will be pleasing to the Lord, just as it was in ancient times and in years past.

verses.text: And I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers, and against the adulterers, and against false swearers, and against those that oppress the hireling in his wages, the widow and the fatherless, and that turn aside the stranger, and fear not me, saith the Lord of Hosts.
verses.plainText: I will come to you for judgment and will quickly testify against sorcerers, adulterers, liars, those who cheat workers out of their wages, those who oppress widows and orphans, those who turn away strangers, and those who do not fear me, says the Lord of Hosts.

verses.text: For I am the Lord, I change not; therefore ye sons of Jacob are not consumed.
verses.plainText: I am the Lord, I do not change; that is why you sons of Jacob are not destroyed.

verses.text: Even from the days of your fathers ye are gone away from mine ordinances, and have not kept them. Return unto me and I will return unto you, saith the Lord of Hosts. But ye say: Wherein shall we return?
verses.plainText: Since the days of your ancestors, you have turned away from my commandments and have not kept them. Return to me, and I will return to you, says the Lord of Hosts. But you ask, “How should we return? ”

verses.text: Will a man rob God? Yet ye have robbed me. But ye say: Wherein have we robbed thee? In tithes and offerings.
verses.plainText: Will a person rob God? Yet you have robbed me. But you ask, “How have we robbed you? ” In tithes and offerings.

verses.text: Ye are cursed with a curse, for ye have robbed me, even this whole nation.
verses.plainText: You are cursed because you have robbed me—this entire nation.

verses.text: Bring ye all the tithes into the storehouse, that there may be meat in my house; and prove me now herewith, saith the Lord of Hosts, if I will not open you the windows of heaven, and pour you out a blessing that there shall not be room enough to receive it.
verses.plainText: Bring all the tithes into the storehouse so there will be food in my house. Test me in this, says the Lord of Hosts, and see if I will not open the windows of heaven for you and pour out a blessing so great that there will not be enough room to receive it.

verses.text: And I will rebuke the devourer for your sakes, and he shall not destroy the fruits of your ground; neither shall your vine cast her fruit before the time in the fields, saith the Lord of Hosts.
verses.plainText: I will rebuke the devourer for your sake, and he will not destroy the fruits of your land. Your vine will not drop its fruit before it is ripe in the fields, says the Lord of Hosts.

verses.text: And all nations shall call you blessed, for ye shall be a delightsome land, saith the Lord of Hosts.
verses.plainText: All nations will call you blessed, for you will be a delightful land, says the Lord of Hosts.

verses.text: Your words have been stout against me, saith the Lord. Yet ye say: What have we spoken against thee?
verses.plainText: The Lord says, “You have spoken strongly against me. ” But you ask, “What have we said against you? ”

verses.text: Ye have said: It is vain to serve God, and what doth it profit that we have kept his ordinances and that we have walked mournfully before the Lord of Hosts?
verses.plainText: You have said, “It is pointless to serve God, and what benefit is there in keeping his commandments and walking humbly before the Lord of Hosts? ”

verses.text: And now we call the proud happy; yea, they that work wickedness are set up; yea, they that tempt God are even delivered.
verses.plainText: Now we call the proud happy; those who do evil are promoted, and those who test God are even rescued.

verses.text: Then they that feared the Lord spake often one to another, and the Lord hearkened and heard; and a book of remembrance was written before him for them that feared the Lord, and that thought upon his name.
verses.plainText: Then those who feared the Lord often spoke with each other, and the Lord listened and heard them. A book of remembrance was written before him for those who feared the Lord and thought about his name.

verses.text: And they shall be mine, saith the Lord of Hosts, in that day when I make up my jewels; and I will spare them as a man spareth his own son that serveth him.
verses.plainText: They will be mine, says the Lord of Hosts, on the day when I gather my treasured people; and I will spare them as a man spares his own son who serves him.

verses.text: Then shall ye return and discern between the righteous and the wicked, between him that serveth God and him that serveth him not.
verses.plainText: Then you will return and see the difference between the righteous and the wicked, between the one who serves God and the one who does not serve him.

verses.text: For behold, the day cometh that shall burn as an oven; and all the proud, yea, and all that do wickedly, shall be stubble; and the day that cometh shall burn them up, saith the Lord of Hosts, that it shall leave them neither root nor branch.
verses.plainText: The day is coming that will burn like an oven, and all the proud and all who do wickedly will be like stubble. That coming day will burn them up, says the Lord of Hosts, and it will leave them neither root nor branch.

verses.text: But unto you that fear my name, shall the Son of Righteousness arise with healing in his wings; and ye shall go forth and grow up as calves in the stall.
verses.plainText: But for you who respect my name, the Son of Righteousness will rise with healing in his wings, and you will go out and grow up like calves kept in a stall.

verses.text: And ye shall tread down the wicked; for they shall be ashes under the soles of your feet in the day that I shall do this, saith the Lord of Hosts.
verses.plainText: You will trample the wicked, for they will be ashes under the soles of your feet on the day I do this, says the Lord of Hosts.

verses.text: Remember ye the law of Moses, my servant, which I commanded unto him in Horeb for all Israel, with the statutes and judgments.
verses.plainText: Remember the law of Moses, my servant, which I commanded him in Horeb for all Israel, along with the statutes and judgments.

verses.text: Behold, I will send you Elijah the prophet before the coming of the great and dreadful day of the Lord;
verses.plainText: I will send you Elijah the prophet before the coming of the great and dreadful day of the Lord.

verses.text: And he shall turn the heart of the fathers to the children, and the heart of the children to their fathers, lest I come and smite the earth with a curse.
verses.plainText: He will turn the hearts of the fathers to their children, and the hearts of the children to their fathers, so that I do not come and strike the earth with a curse.

verses.text: And now it came to pass that when Jesus had told these things he expounded them unto the multitude; and he did expound all things unto them, both great and small.
verses.plainText: After Jesus finished teaching these things, he explained them to the crowd; he clarified everything for them, both important and simple.

verses.text: And he saith: These scriptures, which ye had not with you, the Father commanded that I should give unto you; for it was wisdom in him that they should be given unto future generations.
verses.plainText: He said, “The Father commanded me to give you these scriptures, which you didn’t have with you, because in His wisdom they should be given to future generations. ”

verses.text: And he did expound all things, even from the beginning until the time that he should come in his glory—yea, even all things which should come upon the face of the earth, even until the elements should melt with fervent heat, and the earth should be wrapt together as a scroll, and the heavens and the earth should pass away;
verses.plainText: He explained everything, from the beginning until the time when he would come in his glory—even everything that would happen on the earth, until the elements would melt with intense heat, and the earth would be rolled together like a scroll, and the heavens and the earth would pass away.

verses.text: And even unto the great and last day, when all people, and all kindreds, and all nations and tongues shall stand before God, to be judged of their works, whether they be good or whether they be evil—
verses.plainText: Even until the great and last day, when all people, all families, all nations, and all languages will stand before God to be judged for their works, whether they are good or evil—

verses.text: If they be good, to the resurrection of everlasting life; and if they be evil, to the resurrection of damnation; being on a parallel, the one on the one hand and the other on the other hand, according to the mercy, and the justice, and the holiness which is in Christ, who was before the world began.
verses.plainText: If they are good, they will be resurrected to everlasting life; and if they are evil, they will be resurrected to damnation. These outcomes are parallel, one on one side and the other on the other, according to the mercy, justice, and holiness found in Christ, who existed before the world began.

verses.text: And now there cannot be written in this book even a hundredth part of the things which Jesus did truly teach unto the people;
verses.plainText: There isn’t enough space in this book to write even a hundredth part of what Jesus truly taught the people.

verses.text: But behold the plates of Nephi do contain the more part of the things which he taught the people.
verses.plainText: But the plates of Nephi contain most of the things he taught the people.

verses.text: And these things have I written, which are a lesser part of the things which he taught the people; and I have written them to the intent that they may be brought again unto this people, from the Gentiles, according to the words which Jesus hath spoken.
verses.plainText: I have written these things, which are only a small part of what he taught the people. I wrote them so they can be brought again to this people from the Gentiles, according to the words Jesus has spoken.

verses.text: And when they shall have received this, which is expedient that they should have first, to try their faith, and if it shall so be that they shall believe these things then shall the greater things be made manifest unto them.
verses.plainText: When they have received this, which they need to have first to test their faith, and if they believe these things, then greater things will be revealed to them.

verses.text: And if it so be that they will not believe these things, then shall the greater things be withheld from them, unto their condemnation.
verses.plainText: If they do not believe these things, the greater things will be withheld from them, to their condemnation.

verses.text: Behold, I was about to write them, all which were engraven upon the plates of Nephi, but the Lord forbade it, saying: I will try the faith of my people.
verses.plainText: I was about to write everything that was engraved on the plates of Nephi, but the Lord forbade it, saying, "I will test the faith of my people.

verses.text: Therefore I, Mormon, do write the things which have been commanded me of the Lord. And now I, Mormon, make an end of my sayings, and proceed to write the things which have been commanded me.
verses.plainText: So I, Mormon, am writing the things the Lord has commanded me. Now I will finish what I have said and continue to write the things I have been commanded.

verses.text: Therefore, I would that ye should behold that the Lord truly did teach the people, for the space of three days; and after that he did show himself unto them oft, and did break bread oft, and bless it, and give it unto them.
verses.plainText: I want you to know that the Lord truly did teach the people for three days; and after that, he showed himself to them often, broke bread often, blessed it, and gave it to them.

verses.text: And it came to pass that he did teach and minister unto the children of the multitude of whom hath been spoken, and he did loose their tongues, and they did speak unto their fathers great and marvelous things, even greater than he had revealed unto the people; and he loosed their tongues that they could utter.
verses.plainText: He taught and ministered to the children of the multitude that had been mentioned, and he loosened their tongues so they spoke to their fathers about great and marvelous things, even greater than what he had revealed to the people; and he loosened their tongues so they could speak.

verses.text: And it came to pass that after he had ascended into heaven—the second time that he showed himself unto them, and had gone unto the Father, after having healed all their sick, and their lame, and opened the eyes of their blind and unstopped the ears of the deaf, and even had done all manner of cures among them, and raised a man from the dead, and had shown forth his power unto them, and had ascended unto the Father—
verses.plainText: After he had ascended into heaven—the second time he showed himself to them—and had gone to the Father, after healing all their sick and lame, opening the eyes of the blind, unstopping the ears of the deaf, doing all kinds of cures among them, raising a man from the dead, and showing his power to them, he ascended to the Father—

verses.text: Behold, it came to pass on the morrow that the multitude gathered themselves together, and they both saw and heard these children; yea, even babes did open their mouths and utter marvelous things; and the things which they did utter were forbidden that there should not any man write them.
verses.plainText: The next day, the crowd gathered together, and they saw and heard these children; even babies opened their mouths and spoke marvelous things. The things they said were forbidden to be written by anyone.

verses.text: And it came to pass that the disciples whom Jesus had chosen began from that time forth to baptize and to teach as many as did come unto them; and as many as were baptized in the name of Jesus were filled with the Holy Ghost.
verses.plainText: The disciples whom Jesus had chosen began from that time to baptize and teach everyone who came to them; and everyone who was baptized in the name of Jesus was filled with the Holy Ghost.

verses.text: And many of them saw and heard unspeakable things, which are not lawful to be written.
verses.plainText: Many of them saw and heard things that cannot be described and are not allowed to be written.

verses.text: And they taught, and did minister one to another; and they had all things common among them, every man dealing justly, one with another.
verses.plainText: They taught and served each other, and they shared everything in common, with each person treating others fairly.

verses.text: And it came to pass that they did do all things even as Jesus had commanded them.
verses.plainText: They did everything just as Jesus had commanded them.

verses.text: And they who were baptized in the name of Jesus were called the church of Christ.
verses.plainText: Those who were baptized in the name of Jesus were called the church of Christ.

verses.text: And it came to pass that as the disciples of Jesus were journeying and were preaching the things which they had both heard and seen, and were baptizing in the name of Jesus, it came to pass that the disciples were gathered together and were united in mighty prayer and fasting.
verses.plainText: As the disciples of Jesus were traveling and preaching about the things they had heard and seen, and baptizing in the name of Jesus, the disciples gathered together and were united in sincere prayer and fasting.

verses.text: And Jesus again showed himself unto them, for they were praying unto the Father in his name; and Jesus came and stood in the midst of them, and said unto them: What will ye that I shall give unto you?
verses.plainText: Jesus appeared to them again while they were praying to the Father in his name. He came and stood among them and said, “What do you want me to give you? ”

verses.text: And they said unto him: Lord, we will that thou wouldst tell us the name whereby we shall call this church; for there are disputations among the people concerning this matter.
verses.plainText: They said to him, “Lord, we want you to tell us the name we should call this church, because there are disagreements among the people about this. ”

verses.text: And the Lord said unto them: Verily, verily, I say unto you, why is it that the people should murmur and dispute because of this thing?
verses.plainText: The Lord said to them, "Truly, I tell you, why are the people complaining and arguing about this?

verses.text: Have they not read the scriptures, which say ye must take upon you the name of Christ, which is my name? For by this name shall ye be called at the last day;
verses.plainText: Haven’t they read the scriptures, which say you must take upon yourselves the name of Christ, which is my name? For by this name you will be called at the last day.

verses.text: And whoso taketh upon him my name, and endureth to the end, the same shall be saved at the last day.
verses.plainText: Anyone who takes upon themselves my name and remains faithful to the end will be saved on the last day.

verses.text: Therefore, whatsoever ye shall do, ye shall do it in my name; therefore ye shall call the church in my name; and ye shall call upon the Father in my name that he will bless the church for my sake.
verses.plainText: So whatever you do, do it in my name; call the church in my name; and pray to the Father in my name so that he will bless the church for my sake.

verses.text: And how be it my church save it be called in my name? For if a church be called in Moses’ name then it be Moses’ church; or if it be called in the name of a man then it be the church of a man; but if it be called in my name then it is my church, if it so be that they are built upon my gospel.
verses.plainText: How can it be my church unless it is called in my name? If a church is called in Moses’ name, then it is Moses’ church; or if it is called in the name of a man, then it is the church of a man. But if it is called in my name, then it is my church, if they are built upon my gospel.

verses.text: Verily I say unto you, that ye are built upon my gospel; therefore ye shall call whatsoever things ye do call, in my name; therefore if ye call upon the Father, for the church, if it be in my name the Father will hear you;
verses.plainText: I tell you the truth, you are built upon my gospel; so whatever you do, do it in my name. If you pray to the Father for the church in my name, the Father will hear you.

verses.text: And if it so be that the church is built upon my gospel then will the Father show forth his own works in it.
verses.plainText: If the church is built on my gospel, then the Father will show his own works in it.

verses.text: But if it be not built upon my gospel, and is built upon the works of men, or upon the works of the devil, verily I say unto you they have joy in their works for a season, and by and by the end cometh, and they are hewn down and cast into the fire, from whence there is no return.
verses.plainText: But if it is not built on my gospel, and is built on the works of men or the works of the devil, I tell you, they have joy in their works for a time, but eventually the end comes, and they are cut down and thrown into the fire, from which there is no return.

verses.text: For their works do follow them, for it is because of their works that they are hewn down; therefore remember the things that I have told you.
verses.plainText: Their works follow them, and it is because of their works that they are cut down. So remember the things I have told you.

verses.text: Behold I have given unto you my gospel, and this is the gospel which I have given unto you—that I came into the world to do the will of my Father, because my Father sent me.
verses.plainText: I have given you my gospel, and this is the gospel I have given you—that I came into the world to do the will of my Father, because my Father sent me.

verses.text: And my Father sent me that I might be lifted up upon the cross; and after that I had been lifted up upon the cross, that I might draw all men unto me, that as I have been lifted up by men even so should men be lifted up by the Father, to stand before me, to be judged of their works, whether they be good or whether they be evil—
verses.plainText: My Father sent me so I could be lifted up on the cross; and after I was lifted up on the cross, I could draw all people to me, so that just as I have been lifted up by people, people will also be lifted up by the Father to stand before me and be judged for their works, whether they are good or evil.

verses.text: And for this cause have I been lifted up; therefore, according to the power of the Father I will draw all men unto me, that they may be judged according to their works.
verses.plainText: This is why I have been lifted up. By the power of the Father, I will draw everyone to me so they can be judged according to their works.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, that whoso repenteth and is baptized in my name shall be filled; and if he endureth to the end, behold, him will I hold guiltless before my Father at that day when I shall stand to judge the world.
verses.plainText: Anyone who repents and is baptized in my name will be filled; and if he endures to the end, I will hold him guiltless before my Father on the day when I stand to judge the world.

verses.text: And he that endureth not unto the end, the same is he that is also hewn down and cast into the fire, from whence they can no more return, because of the justice of the Father.
verses.plainText: Anyone who does not endure to the end will be cut down and cast into the fire, from which they can never return, because of the justice of the Father.

verses.text: And this is the word which he hath given unto the children of men. And for this cause he fulfilleth the words which he hath given, and he lieth not, but fulfilleth all his words.
verses.plainText: This is the word he has given to the children of men. For this reason, he keeps the promises he has made, and he does not lie, but fulfills all his words.

verses.text: And no unclean thing can enter into his kingdom; therefore nothing entereth into his rest save it be those who have washed their garments in my blood, because of their faith, and the repentance of all their sins, and their faithfulness unto the end.
verses.plainText: No unclean thing can enter his kingdom; nothing can enter his rest except those who have washed their garments in my blood because of their faith, their repentance of all their sins, and their faithfulness to the end.

verses.text: Now this is the commandment: Repent, all ye ends of the earth, and come unto me and be baptized in my name, that ye may be sanctified by the reception of the Holy Ghost, that ye may stand spotless before me at the last day.
verses.plainText: This is the commandment: Repent, all you ends of the earth, and come to me and be baptized in my name, so you can be sanctified by receiving the Holy Ghost, so you can stand spotless before me at the last day.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, this is my gospel; and ye know the things that ye must do in my church; for the works which ye have seen me do that shall ye also do; for that which ye have seen me do even that shall ye do;
verses.plainText: Truly, I tell you, this is my gospel; and you know what you must do in my church, because the works you have seen me do, you should also do; you should do exactly what you have seen me do.

verses.text: Therefore, if ye do these things blessed are ye, for ye shall be lifted up at the last day.
verses.plainText: So if you do these things, you are blessed, because you will be lifted up at the last day.

verses.text: Write the things which ye have seen and heard, save it be those which are forbidden.
verses.plainText: Write the things you have seen and heard, except for those which are forbidden.

verses.text: Write the works of this people, which shall be, even as hath been written, of that which hath been.
verses.plainText: Write the works of this people that will happen, just as has been written about what has already happened.

verses.text: For behold, out of the books which have been written, and which shall be written, shall this people be judged, for by them shall their works be known unto men.
verses.plainText: From the books that have been written, and those that will be written, this people will be judged, because through them their works will be made known to others.

verses.text: And behold, all things are written by the Father; therefore out of the books which shall be written shall the world be judged.
verses.plainText: All things are written by the Father; so the world will be judged out of the books that are written.

verses.text: And know ye that ye shall be judges of this people, according to the judgment which I shall give unto you, which shall be just. Therefore, what manner of men ought ye to be? Verily I say unto you, even as I am.
verses.plainText: You will be judges of this people, according to the judgment I give you, which will be just. So, what kind of people should you be? Truly, I tell you, you should be even as I am.

verses.text: And now I go unto the Father. And verily I say unto you, whatsoever things ye shall ask the Father in my name shall be given unto you.
verses.plainText: Now I am going to the Father. I tell you the truth, whatever you ask the Father in my name will be given to you.

verses.text: Therefore, ask, and ye shall receive; knock, and it shall be opened unto you; for he that asketh, receiveth; and unto him that knocketh, it shall be opened.
verses.plainText: So ask, and you will receive; knock, and it will be opened to you. Whoever asks, receives; and to the one who knocks, it will be opened.

verses.text: And now, behold, my joy is great, even unto fulness, because of you, and also this generation; yea, and even the Father rejoiceth, and also all the holy angels, because of you and this generation; for none of them are lost.
verses.plainText: My joy is full because of you and also this generation. Even the Father rejoices, and all the holy angels, because of you and this generation, for none of them are lost.

verses.text: Behold, I would that ye should understand; for I mean them who are now alive of this generation; and none of them are lost; and in them I have fulness of joy.
verses.plainText: I want you to understand that I’m talking about those who are alive in this generation; none of them are lost, and in them I have a fulness of joy.

verses.text: But behold, it sorroweth me because of the fourth generation from this generation, for they are led away captive by him even as was the son of perdition; for they will sell me for silver and for gold, and for that which moth doth corrupt and which thieves can break through and steal. And in that day will I visit them, even in turning their works upon their own heads.
verses.plainText: I am saddened because of the fourth generation from this one, for they will be led away captive by him just like the son of perdition was. They will sell me for silver and gold, and for things that moths destroy and thieves can break in and steal. On that day, I will visit them by turning their own actions back on themselves.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when Jesus had ended these sayings he said unto his disciples: Enter ye in at the strait gate; for strait is the gate, and narrow is the way that leads to life, and few there be that find it; but wide is the gate, and broad the way which leads to death, and many there be that travel therein, until the night cometh, wherein no man can work.
verses.plainText: When Jesus finished speaking, he said to his disciples: Enter through the narrow gate, because the gate is narrow and the way is difficult that leads to life, and few people find it. But the gate is wide and the way is broad that leads to death, and many people travel that path, until night comes, when no one can work.

verses.text: And it came to pass when Jesus had said these words, he spake unto his disciples, one by one, saying unto them: What is it that ye desire of me, after that I am gone to the Father?
verses.plainText: After Jesus finished speaking, he spoke to his disciples one by one and asked them, "What do you want from me after I return to the Father?

verses.text: And they all spake, save it were three, saying: We desire that after we have lived unto the age of man, that our ministry, wherein thou hast called us, may have an end, that we may speedily come unto thee in thy kingdom.
verses.plainText: They all spoke, except for three, saying: We want that after we have lived out our lives, our ministry, to which you have called us, may come to an end, so that we can quickly come to you in your kingdom.

verses.text: And he said unto them: Blessed are ye because ye desired this thing of me; therefore, after that ye are seventy and two years old ye shall come unto me in my kingdom; and with me ye shall find rest.
verses.plainText: He said to them, "You are blessed because you have asked me for this. After you are seventy-two years old, you will come to me in my kingdom, and you will find rest with me.

verses.text: And when he had spoken unto them, he turned himself unto the three, and said unto them: What will ye that I should do unto you, when I am gone unto the Father?
verses.plainText: After he spoke to them, he turned to the three and said to them, "What do you want me to do for you when I go to the Father?

verses.text: And they sorrowed in their hearts, for they durst not speak unto him the things which they desired.
verses.plainText: They were sad in their hearts because they didn’t dare to tell him what they wanted.

verses.text: And he said unto them: Behold, I know your thoughts, and ye have desired the thing which John, my beloved, who was with me in my ministry, before that I was lifted up by the Jews, desired of me.
verses.plainText: He said to them, “I know your thoughts, and you have desired the same thing that John, my beloved, who was with me in my ministry before I was lifted up by the Jews, desired from me. ”

verses.text: Therefore, more blessed are ye, for ye shall never taste of death; but ye shall live to behold all the doings of the Father unto the children of men, even until all things shall be fulfilled according to the will of the Father, when I shall come in my glory with the powers of heaven.
verses.plainText: You are even more blessed, because you will never experience death; instead, you will live to witness everything the Father does for the children of men, until all things are fulfilled according to the Father’s will, when I come in my glory with the powers of heaven.

verses.text: And ye shall never endure the pains of death; but when I shall come in my glory ye shall be changed in the twinkling of an eye from mortality to immortality; and then shall ye be blessed in the kingdom of my Father.
verses.plainText: You will never experience the pains of death; when I come in my glory, you will be changed in an instant from mortality to immortality, and then you will be blessed in the kingdom of my Father.

verses.text: And again, ye shall not have pain while ye shall dwell in the flesh, neither sorrow save it be for the sins of the world; and all this will I do because of the thing which ye have desired of me, for ye have desired that ye might bring the souls of men unto me, while the world shall stand.
verses.plainText: You will not experience pain while you live in the flesh, nor sorrow except for the sins of the world. I will do all this because of what you have asked of me, for you have desired to bring the souls of people to me as long as the world exists.

verses.text: And for this cause ye shall have fulness of joy; and ye shall sit down in the kingdom of my Father; yea, your joy shall be full, even as the Father hath given me fulness of joy; and ye shall be even as I am, and I am even as the Father; and the Father and I are one;
verses.plainText: Because of this, you will have a fullness of joy, and you will sit down in my Father's kingdom. Your joy will be complete, just as the Father has given me a fullness of joy. You will be even as I am, and I am even as the Father; and the Father and I are one.

verses.text: And the Holy Ghost beareth record of the Father and me; and the Father giveth the Holy Ghost unto the children of men, because of me.
verses.plainText: The Holy Ghost testifies of the Father and me, and the Father gives the Holy Ghost to the children of men because of me.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words, he touched every one of them with his finger save it were the three who were to tarry, and then he departed.
verses.plainText: When Jesus finished speaking, he touched each of them with his finger except for the three who were to remain, and then he left.

verses.text: And behold, the heavens were opened, and they were caught up into heaven, and saw and heard unspeakable things.
verses.plainText: The heavens were opened, and they were taken up into heaven, where they saw and heard things that cannot be described.

verses.text: And it was forbidden them that they should utter; neither was it given unto them power that they could utter the things which they saw and heard;
verses.plainText: They were forbidden to speak, and they were not given the power to tell the things they saw and heard.

verses.text: And whether they were in the body or out of the body, they could not tell; for it did seem unto them like a transfiguration of them, that they were changed from this body of flesh into an immortal state, that they could behold the things of God.
verses.plainText: They couldn’t tell whether they were in their bodies or out of them, because it felt to them like a transformation, as if they had been changed from their physical bodies into an immortal state so they could see the things of God.

verses.text: But it came to pass that they did again minister upon the face of the earth; nevertheless they did not minister of the things which they had heard and seen, because of the commandment which was given them in heaven.
verses.plainText: They again ministered on the earth; however, they did not share the things they had heard and seen, because of the commandment given to them in heaven.

verses.text: And now, whether they were mortal or immortal, from the day of their transfiguration, I know not;
verses.plainText: And now, from the day they were changed, I don’t know whether they were mortal or immortal;

verses.text: But this much I know, according to the record which hath been given—they did go forth upon the face of the land, and did minister unto all the people, uniting as many to the church as would believe in their preaching; baptizing them, and as many as were baptized did receive the Holy Ghost.
verses.plainText: But this much I know, according to the record that has been given—they went out across the land and ministered to all the people, bringing as many as would believe in their preaching into the church; baptizing them, and everyone who was baptized received the Holy Ghost.

verses.text: And they were cast into prison by them who did not belong to the church. And the prisons could not hold them, for they were rent in twain.
verses.plainText: They were thrown into prison by people who weren’t part of the church, but the prisons couldn’t hold them because they were torn apart.

verses.text: And they were cast down into the earth; but they did smite the earth with the word of God, insomuch that by his power they were delivered out of the depths of the earth; and therefore they could not dig pits sufficient to hold them.
verses.plainText: They were thrown down into the earth, but they struck the earth with the word of God, and by His power they were delivered from the depths of the earth. Because of this, no one could dig pits deep enough to hold them.

verses.text: And thrice they were cast into a furnace and received no harm.
verses.plainText: They were thrown into a furnace three times and were not harmed.

verses.text: And twice were they cast into a den of wild beasts; and behold they did play with the beasts as a child with a suckling lamb, and received no harm.
verses.plainText: They were thrown into a den of wild beasts twice, and they played with the animals like a child with a young lamb, and were not harmed.

verses.text: And it came to pass that thus they did go forth among all the people of Nephi, and did preach the gospel of Christ unto all people upon the face of the land; and they were converted unto the Lord, and were united unto the church of Christ, and thus the people of that generation were blessed, according to the word of Jesus.
verses.plainText: They went among all the people of Nephi and preached the gospel of Christ to everyone in the land. The people were converted to the Lord and joined the church of Christ, and the people of that generation were blessed, just as Jesus had promised.

verses.text: And now I, Mormon, make an end of speaking concerning these things for a time.
verses.plainText: Now I, Mormon, will stop talking about these things for now.

verses.text: Behold, I was about to write the names of those who were never to taste of death, but the Lord forbade; therefore I write them not, for they are hid from the world.
verses.plainText: I was about to write the names of those who would never die, but the Lord forbade me; so I am not writing them, because they are hidden from the world.

verses.text: But behold, I have seen them, and they have ministered unto me.
verses.plainText: I have seen them, and they have served me.

verses.text: And behold they will be among the Gentiles, and the Gentiles shall know them not.
verses.plainText: They will be among the Gentiles, and the Gentiles will not know them.

verses.text: They will also be among the Jews, and the Jews shall know them not.
verses.plainText: They will also be among the Jews, and the Jews will not recognize them.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, when the Lord seeth fit in his wisdom that they shall minister unto all the scattered tribes of Israel, and unto all nations, kindreds, tongues and people, and shall bring out of them unto Jesus many souls, that their desire may be fulfilled, and also because of the convincing power of God which is in them.
verses.plainText: When the Lord, in his wisdom, decides that they should minister to all the scattered tribes of Israel, and to all nations, families, languages, and people, and bring many souls to Jesus from among them, their desire will be fulfilled because of the convincing power of God that is in them.

verses.text: And they are as the angels of God, and if they shall pray unto the Father in the name of Jesus they can show themselves unto whatsoever man it seemeth them good.
verses.plainText: They are like the angels of God, and if they pray to the Father in the name of Jesus, they can show themselves to anyone they choose.

verses.text: Therefore, great and marvelous works shall be wrought by them, before the great and coming day when all people must surely stand before the judgment-seat of Christ;
verses.plainText: So, great and marvelous works will be done by them before the important day when everyone must stand before the judgment seat of Christ.

verses.text: Yea even among the Gentiles shall there be a great and marvelous work wrought by them, before that judgment day.
verses.plainText: Even among the Gentiles, they will do a great and marvelous work before the day of judgment.

verses.text: And if ye had all the scriptures which give an account of all the marvelous works of Christ, ye would, according to the words of Christ, know that these things must surely come.
verses.plainText: If you had all the scriptures that tell about all the marvelous works of Christ, you would know, according to the words of Christ, that these things must definitely happen.

verses.text: And wo be unto him that will not hearken unto the words of Jesus, and also to them whom he hath chosen and sent among them; for whoso receiveth not the words of Jesus and the words of those whom he hath sent receiveth not him; and therefore he will not receive them at the last day;
verses.plainText: Woe to anyone who will not listen to the words of Jesus, or to those he has chosen and sent among them. Whoever does not accept the words of Jesus and the words of those he has sent does not accept him, and therefore he will not receive them at the last day.

verses.text: And it would be better for them if they had not been born. For do ye suppose that ye can get rid of the justice of an offended God, who hath been trampled under feet of men, that thereby salvation might come?
verses.plainText: It would be better for them if they had never been born. Do you think you can escape the justice of an offended God, who has been trampled under the feet of men so that salvation could come?

verses.text: And now behold, as I spake concerning those whom the Lord hath chosen, yea, even three who were caught up into the heavens, that I knew not whether they were cleansed from mortality to immortality—
verses.plainText: Now, as I was speaking about those whom the Lord has chosen, the three who were taken up into heaven, I did not know whether they were changed from mortality to immortality—

verses.text: But behold, since I wrote, I have inquired of the Lord, and he hath made it manifest unto me that there must needs be a change wrought upon their bodies, or else it needs be that they must taste of death;
verses.plainText: Since I wrote, I have asked the Lord, and he has shown me that there must be a change made to their bodies, or else they would have to experience death.

verses.text: Therefore, that they might not taste of death there was a change wrought upon their bodies, that they might not suffer pain nor sorrow save it were for the sins of the world.
verses.plainText: So, in order for them not to experience death, their bodies were changed so they wouldn't feel pain or sorrow except for the sins of the world.

verses.text: Now this change was not equal to that which shall take place at the last day; but there was a change wrought upon them, insomuch that Satan could have no power over them, that he could not tempt them; and they were sanctified in the flesh, that they were holy, and that the powers of the earth could not hold them. 3 Nephi 28:40 And in this state they were to remain until the judgment day of Christ; and at that day they were to receive a greater change, and to be received into the kingdom of the Father to go no more out, but to dwell eternally in the heavens.
verses.plainText: This change was not the same as the one that will happen at the last day, but there was a change made in them so that Satan had no power over them and could not tempt them. They were made holy in their bodies, and the powers of the earth could not hold them.

verses.text: And now behold, I say unto you that when the Lord shall see fit, in his wisdom, that these sayings shall come unto the Gentiles according to his word, then ye may know that the covenant which the Father hath made with the children of Israel, concerning their restoration to the lands of their inheritance, is already beginning to be fulfilled.
verses.plainText: Now I tell you, when the Lord, in his wisdom, decides that these words will go to the Gentiles as he promised, then you will know that the covenant the Father made with the children of Israel about restoring them to their lands of inheritance is already starting to be fulfilled.

verses.text: And ye may know that the words of the Lord, which have been spoken by the holy prophets, shall all be fulfilled; and ye need not say that the Lord delays his coming unto the children of Israel.
verses.plainText: You can know that the words of the Lord, spoken by the holy prophets, will all be fulfilled; and you should not say that the Lord is delaying his coming to the children of Israel.

verses.text: And ye need not imagine in your hearts that the words which have been spoken are vain, for behold, the Lord will remember his covenant which he hath made unto his people of the house of Israel.
verses.plainText: You don't need to think in your hearts that the words that have been spoken are useless, because the Lord will remember his covenant that he has made with his people of the house of Israel.

verses.text: And when ye shall see these sayings coming forth among you, then ye need not any longer spurn at the doings of the Lord, for the sword of his justice is in his right hand; and behold, at that day, if ye shall spurn at his doings he will cause that it shall soon overtake you.
verses.plainText: When you see these words coming among you, you don’t need to reject the works of the Lord anymore, for the sword of his justice is in his right hand; and on that day, if you reject his works, he will make sure it quickly comes upon you.

verses.text: Wo unto him that spurneth at the doings of the Lord; yea, wo unto him that shall deny the Christ and his works!
verses.plainText: Woe to anyone who mocks the works of the Lord; woe to anyone who denies Christ and his works!

verses.text: Yea, wo unto him that shall deny the revelations of the Lord, and that shall say the Lord no longer worketh by revelation, or by prophecy, or by gifts, or by tongues, or by healings, or by the power of the Holy Ghost!
verses.plainText: Woe to anyone who denies the revelations of the Lord and says that the Lord no longer works by revelation, prophecy, gifts, tongues, healings, or by the power of the Holy Ghost!

verses.text: Yea, and wo unto him that shall say at that day, to get gain, that there can be no miracle wrought by Jesus Christ; for he that doeth this shall become like unto the son of perdition, for whom there was no mercy, according to the word of Christ!
verses.plainText: And sorrow awaits anyone who, for personal gain, claims in that day that Jesus Christ cannot perform miracles; because anyone who does this will become like the son of perdition, for whom there was no mercy, according to the word of Christ.

verses.text: Yea, and ye need not any longer hiss, nor spurn, nor make game of the Jews, nor any of the remnant of the house of Israel; for behold, the Lord remembereth his covenant unto them, and he will do unto them according to that which he hath sworn.
verses.plainText: You don’t need to hiss, reject, or mock the Jews or any of the remnant of the house of Israel anymore, because the Lord remembers his covenant with them and he will do for them what he has promised.

verses.text: Therefore ye need not suppose that ye can turn the right hand of the Lord unto the left, that he may not execute judgment unto the fulfilling of the covenant which he hath made unto the house of Israel.
verses.plainText: So you shouldn’t think that you can change the Lord’s will, or prevent Him from carrying out judgment to fulfill the covenant He has made with the house of Israel.

verses.text: Hearken, O ye Gentiles, and hear the words of Jesus Christ, the Son of the living God, which he hath commanded me that I should speak concerning you, for, behold he commandeth me that I should write, saying:
verses.plainText: Listen, you Gentiles, and hear the words of Jesus Christ, the Son of the living God, which he has commanded me to speak about you, for he commands me to write, saying:

verses.text: Turn, all ye Gentiles, from your wicked ways; and repent of your evil doings, of your lyings and deceivings, and of your whoredoms, and of your secret abominations, and your idolatries, and of your murders, and your priestcrafts, and your envyings, and your strifes, and from all your wickedness and abominations, and come unto me, and be baptized in my name, that ye may receive a remission of your sins, and be filled with the Holy Ghost, that ye may be numbered with my people who are of the house of Israel.
verses.plainText: Turn, all you Gentiles, from your wicked ways; repent of your evil actions, your lies and deceptions, your sexual immorality, your secret abominations, your idolatries, your murders, your priestcrafts, your envy, your conflicts, and from all your wickedness and abominations. Come to me and be baptized in my name, so you can receive forgiveness of your sins and be filled with the Holy Ghost, so you may be counted among my people who are of the house of Israel.

verses.text: And it came to pass that the thirty and fourth year passed away, and also the thirty and fifth, and behold the disciples of Jesus had formed a church of Christ in all the lands round about. And as many as did come unto them, and did truly repent of their sins, were baptized in the name of Jesus; and they did also receive the Holy Ghost.
verses.plainText: The thirty-fourth year passed, and then the thirty-fifth. The disciples of Jesus established the church of Christ throughout all the surrounding lands. Everyone who came to them, truly repented of their sins, and was baptized in the name of Jesus also received the Holy Ghost.

verses.text: And it came to pass in the thirty and sixth year, the people were all converted unto the Lord, upon all the face of the land, both Nephites and Lamanites, and there were no contentions and disputations among them, and every man did deal justly one with another.
verses.plainText: In the thirty-sixth year, all the people throughout the land, both Nephites and Lamanites, were converted to the Lord. There were no arguments or disputes among them, and everyone treated each other fairly.

verses.text: And they had all things common among them; therefore there were not rich and poor, bond and free, but they were all made free, and partakers of the heavenly gift.
verses.plainText: They shared everything in common, so there were no rich or poor, no slaves or free people; everyone was free and shared in the heavenly gift.

verses.text: And it came to pass that the thirty and seventh year passed away also, and there still continued to be peace in the land.
verses.plainText: The thirty-seventh year also passed, and there was still peace in the land.

verses.text: And there were great and marvelous works wrought by the disciples of Jesus, insomuch that they did heal the sick, and raise the dead, and cause the lame to walk, and the blind to receive their sight, and the deaf to hear; and all manner of miracles did they work among the children of men; and in nothing did they work miracles save it were in the name of Jesus.
verses.plainText: The disciples of Jesus performed great and amazing works—they healed the sick, raised the dead, made the lame walk, gave sight to the blind, and helped the deaf hear. They did all kinds of miracles among the people, and they did nothing miraculous except in the name of Jesus.

verses.text: And thus did the thirty and eighth year pass away, and also the thirty and ninth, and forty and first, and the forty and second, yea, even until forty and nine years had passed away, and also the fifty and first, and the fifty and second; yea, and even until fifty and nine years had passed away.
verses.plainText: The thirty-eighth year passed, as did the thirty-ninth, the forty-first, and the forty-second, until forty-nine years had passed, and then the fifty-first and fifty-second years, until fifty-nine years had passed.

verses.text: And the Lord did prosper them exceedingly in the land; yea, insomuch that they did build cities again where there had been cities burned.
verses.plainText: The Lord blessed them greatly in the land, so much that they rebuilt cities where cities had been burned.

verses.text: Yea, even that great city Zarahemla did they cause to be built again.
verses.plainText: They even rebuilt the great city of Zarahemla.

verses.text: But there were many cities which had been sunk, and waters came up in the stead thereof; therefore these cities could not be renewed.
verses.plainText: Many cities had sunk, and water had come up in their place, so these cities could not be restored.

verses.text: And now, behold, it came to pass that the people of Nephi did wax strong, and did multiply exceedingly fast, and became an exceedingly fair and delightsome people.
verses.plainText: The people of Nephi grew strong and multiplied very quickly, becoming an exceptionally beautiful and happy people.

verses.text: And they were married, and given in marriage, and were blessed according to the multitude of the promises which the Lord had made unto them.
verses.plainText: They got married and gave their children in marriage, and they were blessed according to the many promises the Lord had made to them.

verses.text: And they did not walk any more after the performances and ordinances of the law of Moses; but they did walk after the commandments which they had received from their Lord and their God, continuing in fasting and prayer, and in meeting together oft both to pray and to hear the word of the Lord.
verses.plainText: They no longer followed the rituals and ordinances of the law of Moses; instead, they lived according to the commandments they had received from their Lord and their God, continuing in fasting and prayer, and meeting together often to pray and to hear the word of the Lord.

verses.text: And it came to pass that there was no contention among all the people, in all the land; but there were mighty miracles wrought among the disciples of Jesus.
verses.plainText: There was no contention among all the people throughout the land, and powerful miracles were performed by the disciples of Jesus.

verses.text: And it came to pass that the seventy and first year passed away, and also the seventy and second year, yea, and in fine, till the seventy and ninth year had passed away; yea, even an hundred years had passed away, and the disciples of Jesus, whom he had chosen, had all gone to the paradise of God, save it were the three who should tarry; and there were other disciples ordained in their stead; and also many of that generation had passed away.
verses.plainText: The seventy-first year passed, then the seventy-second, and so on until the seventy-ninth year had passed. A hundred years had gone by, and all the disciples of Jesus whom he had chosen had gone to the paradise of God, except for the three who were to remain. Other disciples were ordained in their place, and many people of that generation had also passed away.

verses.text: And it came to pass that there was no contention in the land, because of the love of God which did dwell in the hearts of the people.
verses.plainText: There was no contention in the land because the love of God lived in the hearts of the people.

verses.text: And there were no envyings, nor strifes, nor tumults, nor whoredoms, nor lyings, nor murders, nor any manner of lasciviousness; and surely there could not be a happier people among all the people who had been created by the hand of God.
verses.plainText: There was no envy, no conflict, no chaos, no sexual immorality, no lying, no murder, or any kind of wickedness; and there could not have been a happier people among all those created by the hand of God.

verses.text: There were no robbers, nor murderers, neither were there Lamanites, nor any manner of —ites; but they were in one, the children of Christ, and heirs to the kingdom of God.
verses.plainText: There were no robbers or murderers, and there were no Lamanites or any other -ites; instead, they were united as the children of Christ and heirs to the kingdom of God.

verses.text: And how blessed were they! For the Lord did bless them in all their doings; yea, even they were blessed and prospered until an hundred and ten years had passed away; and the first generation from Christ had passed away, and there was no contention in all the land.
verses.plainText: They were truly blessed, for the Lord blessed everything they did. They were blessed and prospered until one hundred and ten years had passed, and the first generation since Christ had passed away, and there was no contention anywhere in the land.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Nephi, he that kept this last record, (and he kept it upon the plates of Nephi) died, and his son Amos kept it in his stead; and he kept it upon the plates of Nephi also.
verses.plainText: Nephi, who kept this last record on the plates of Nephi, died, and his son Amos took over and kept the record on the plates of Nephi as well.

verses.text: And he kept it eighty and four years, and there was still peace in the land, save it were a small part of the people who had revolted from the church and taken upon them the name of Lamanites; therefore there began to be Lamanites again in the land.
verses.plainText: He kept it for eighty-four years, and there was still peace in the land, except for a small group of people who had left the church and taken on the name of Lamanites. So, there began to be Lamanites again in the land.

verses.text: And it came to pass that Amos died also, (and it was an hundred and ninety and four years from the coming of Christ) and his son Amos kept the record in his stead; and he also kept it upon the plates of Nephi; and it was also written in the book of Nephi, which is this book.
verses.plainText: Amos died as well, in the one hundred and ninety-fourth year after Christ’s coming, and his son Amos took over keeping the record. He also kept it on the plates of Nephi, and it was written in the book of Nephi, which is this book.

verses.text: And it came to pass that two hundred years had passed away; and the second generation had all passed away save it were a few.
verses.plainText: Two hundred years went by, and the second generation had all passed away except for a few.

verses.text: And now I, Mormon, would that ye should know that the people had multiplied, insomuch that they were spread upon all the face of the land, and that they had become exceedingly rich, because of their prosperity in Christ.
verses.plainText: Now I, Mormon, want you to know that the people had multiplied so much that they were spread across the entire land, and they had become extremely rich because of their prosperity in Christ.

verses.text: And now, in this two hundred and first year there began to be among them those who were lifted up in pride, such as the wearing of costly apparel, and all manner of fine pearls, and of the fine things of the world.
verses.plainText: Now, in the two hundred and first year, some people among them began to be prideful, wearing expensive clothing, all kinds of fine pearls, and the luxurious things of the world.

verses.text: And from that time forth they did have their goods and their substance no more common among them.
verses.plainText: From that time on, they no longer shared their goods and possessions in common.

verses.text: And they began to be divided into classes; and they began to build up churches unto themselves to get gain, and began to deny the true church of Christ.
verses.plainText: They started dividing into classes, building churches for themselves to make money, and began to deny the true church of Christ.

verses.text: And it came to pass that when two hundred and ten years had passed away there were many churches in the land; yea, there were many churches which professed to know the Christ, and yet they did deny the more parts of his gospel, insomuch that they did receive all manner of wickedness, and did administer that which was sacred unto him to whom it had been forbidden because of unworthiness.
verses.plainText: When two hundred and ten years had passed, there were many churches in the land. Many churches claimed to know Christ, but they denied much of his gospel, allowing all kinds of wickedness and giving sacred things to those who had been forbidden to receive them because of unworthiness.

verses.text: And this church did multiply exceedingly because of iniquity, and because of the power of Satan who did get hold upon their hearts.
verses.plainText: This church grew rapidly because of wickedness and because Satan gained control over their hearts.

verses.text: And again, there was another church which denied the Christ; and they did persecute the true church of Christ, because of their humility and their belief in Christ; and they did despise them because of the many miracles which were wrought among them.
verses.plainText: There was another church that denied Christ, and they persecuted the true church of Christ because of their humility and their belief in Christ. They also looked down on them because of the many miracles that happened among them.

verses.text: Therefore they did exercise power and authority over the disciples of Jesus who did tarry with them, and they did cast them into prison; but by the power of the word of God, which was in them, the prisons were rent in twain, and they went forth doing mighty miracles among them.
